review: Sleazy Wells Fargo Sells Your Private InformationWithin weeks after I opened an account with them, I started getting promotional mail from other banks that couldn't have gotten my information from anyone other than Wells Fargo.I made the mistake of not reading their privacy policy more thoroughly which states they'll do whatever they want with your information and you cannot do anything about it.Look at it here https://www.wellsfargo.com/privacy-security/privacy/individuals/They also won't tell you about their selling of your information unless you either directly ask or you look it up yourself.Don't bank here if you care about privacy or if you care about banking somewhere with morals.

name: Jake Carlis
review: I would not recommend this card to my worst enemy. I have had to call Wells literally 10 times, and I haven't even had the card for two billing cycles. It took a month for them to get the card to me in the first place, and now it gets periodically declined for no reason. A merchant told me that this happens with thicker cards that banks don't rigorously test before releasing them. Additionally, Wells customer service will hang up on you if you use any kind of 'profanity'. Thats a new one. I literally said "I dont f***ing understand anything you've told me" and he said my language would not be tolerated. Wells is terrible, this card is terrible. It may look enticing, but there are many cards with better rewards and no fees that are attach to institutions of prestige-- unlike Wells Fargo.

name: chillyc_7500
review: I am a Real Estate broker, representing the Seller in a real estate transaction. The buyer elected to use Wells Fargo for their financing. After the contract was submitted to Wells Fargo so that they could begin working on the file, the file sat in limbo (from 7/21 - 8/13) before being sent to processing.The buyer's agent and myself both tried to contact the bank on multiple occasions to get an update, only to NEVER get a response. Finally on 8/7, I received an email from the loan officer stating that she had been out of the office for health reasons. I never got an out of office message and apparently there was no back-up taking care of her workload while she was out.After an additional week of no updates, I reached out to the branch manager and was told that they would escalate the file, but that they couldn't really talk to me about any details, as I wasn't the buyer or their agent. Keep in mind, I was not asking for any specific NPI or buyer details, but only enough information to pass along and set an expectation for my Seller. My Seller was counting on this deal to close on time, as she was taking a new job in Texas and was originally supposed to be there on 8/27. The whole reason she was selling her home to begin with.Finally, Wells Fargo sent the documentation to the closing attorney, stating that closing would be set for 9/13. When pressed to try and escalate, Wells Fargo told the closing attorney that they could possibly move closing up to 9/10, but he never heard back from them.On 9/12, all of the sudden each of the signatures that Wells Fargo had on the documents we provided all "disappeared", at which point they requested the documents be re-signed. After sending and re-sending the same exact documents, FINALLY, they saw the signatures.At 9:15 pm the night before closing, the loan officer sent out an email stating that there had been a "miscommunication" and that the file was still in underwriting, pending approval. Closing could not occur the next day and it would have to be sometime the following week.At this point, I escalated to the Office of the President at Wells Fargo and received a call from Nicholas Franck. Apparently an executive "Resolution Specialist". After being presented with the evidence showing that Wells Fargo had dropped the ball, he essentially washed his hands of the situation and was sure to tell me that, while unfortunate, Wells Fargo doesn't really care about the impact to the Seller because they are not Wells Fargo's customer.He also went as far as stating that he felt Wells Fargo did a great job because all they could see is that the application was started on 8/13 and that they were able to get it clear to close in 30 days. He refused to acknowledge the PROOF I sent him showing that the application was completed on 7/7/18 and that the contract was sent to the LO on 7/21.He did volunteer to coordinate a closing for my Seller, as she could no longer wait to start her new job in Texas. He stated that it would be easy for them to set up a closing for her when she got there. I told him that we would need for him to take care of coordinating her closing, but I had to send two additional emails and leave an additional voicemail for him because he did not respond.When Nicholas finally DID call me back, he volunteered no help at all, simply stating "Wells Fargo only needs one document from your Seller and the closing attorney already has it. Try to get it worked out with them".If you are a home Buyer, steer clear. If you are a home Seller, I urge that you CAREFULLY consider any offers you receive from a buyer who wishes to use Wells Fargo. If you are a real estate broker, I suggest you consider recommending one of your other preferred lenders.After a 14 year career in mortgage and banking and over 45 Real Estate transactions as a RE Broker over the past 2.5 years, this was BY FAR the worst transaction I have ever been a part of. The way way Wells Fargo handled it was embarrassingly poor.

name: bessettemusic
review: Today Wells Fargo essentially did the same to me. I deposited money from Cash app into the account yesterday. The funds were available and transactions were posted to my account. I made a few small purchases for food and gas. As of today, my account was overdrafted and all transactions and records of this deposit are removed from the entire system. They escalated it all the way to the executives office and was told there’s no record of this transaction. Yet out of the 8 people I spoke to today, two of them told me they see that the transaction occurred and then reversed back to Cash app. There is no record of this with Cash app. Essentially, the money was deposited and the transactions all erased (except for the purchases I made and the overdraft fee they’re now charging me.) If I was rich, and this were much more money than it is, I would sue the shit out of Wells Fargo and go to the newspapers with my story. However I’m a recent poor college grad and I now just simply have no money for ramen noodles this week. I’m telling everyone I know about my experience with Wells Fargo. This bank is conducting unethical, illegal, and simply evil business. Do not by any means use this bank a day in your life. PNC is a decent option. I’m heartbroken and hungry. I hate you Wells Fargo.

name: Paul
review: No problems. Their website works fine, I've had no issues with the card. If the account is new and you flag the protection system, you just wait about a minute and you get a text instead of having to call. Don't listen to the politically-charged naysayers. Nothing wrong with any WF products. Great experience.

name: endodson
review: I would love to open one for furniture purchases. My credit score is 648. Do I have a chance to obtain a Dillard’s charge card? I really would like to furnish our new home with a few key peices from Dillard’s

name: Robert Slocum
review: I've had this card now for almost 3 years.  It has been on autopilot the entire time as far as payments - perfect payment history.  I've put somewhere between 3 and 4 hundred thousand in revenue through my associated LLC checking account.  I have decent credit on my personal side - and I have the same whopping 500 dollar credit line on this piece of junk.  Completely useless.  I have never received an offer to upgrade, I have approached Wellsfargo personally about it, and they ran my business credit check and denied me based on my lack of business credit history - (exactly what this card was for the last three years.....)  This is not the proper way to build true business credit.  So let me get this straight,  I gave Wells fargo a loan, allowed them to charge me interest on my own money for the sole purpose of building a credit history, and after years i'm finding it difficult to find any reporting of any credit history at all.  It's certainly not on my SSN, and I can't find evidence of it on my EIN.  Now as I historically understand it, it would look bad on my credit to close the account.  Yet there is an annual fee.  Bad business decision.  In fact, walking in to Wells Fargo is a bad business decision.  Unless it just makes you feel good to have a piece of plastic in your wallet that "looks" like a credit card I suggest you avoid this trap.  Oh!  one thing I have found it useful for.  If I need to make a purchase from a sketchy vendor, or site, where i'm leary of giving my check card associated to my bank account I use this card, because I know Wells Fargo will never ever raise the limit, or extend me any grace on this card.  That vendor has no access to any real money.

name: dmsheldon22
review: This is a secured credit card. If you want to increase your limit, then you need to provide an additional deposit. You obviously only gave them $500 initially. You can give them up to $25,000 and your limit will be increased accordingly.

name: Lee Lee
review: I open this card in November 2017. The thing about this bank is if you don’t have any other affiliation or services with them they have no interest in upgrading you. I have a checking account and a savings account with Wells Fargo and on June 11 2018 just shy of 7 months I was upgraded to unsecured. I logged onto my checking account I noticed a deposit of $300 into the account. The next day Wells Fargo upgraded my visa to an unsecured card. So yes they will upgrade you. Just be patient. It would also help if you had some other type of product from Wells Fargo also just to note you can’t be late or overdrawn not even by a penny. Good luck and be patient!

name: seek_righter
review: I have come to the horrid conclusion that Wells Fargo has employed at least 2 people that are too incompetent to listen to the answers that I gave them regarding my income, for a credit card application.  I don't know how much cocaine it takes for them to reach this level of mental clarity, but it obvious that it needs to stop, like 5 years ago.  One agent asked me the same question about 5 times, after getting 5 clear answers, he was decided to pretend he is deaf and I hung up.  Finding a deaf person to handle online chats seems like a far more productive way to spend the money he is too wasted to earn.  Unfortunately, if he doesn't use it, he won't lose it, but there are far more qualified people available.  I have not seen reason for how Wells Fargo makes any money at all with employees like that, but maybe they are still doing Accounting scandals, like the thousands of fake accounts that they created something like a year or two ago.  6,000 people were fired, but there is clearly a problem here now.  If the customer service is as mind boggling stupid as the application department, then no one will have the patience to keep the card anyway!  Maybe it will take a while for Wells Fargo to come to a crashing halt like Enron did, but it does seem inevitable now!

name: nesiri48
review: Not worth it. I purchased a $300 secure card on the pretense that if I make my payments on time and my credit score rises, I would be upgraded to a regular credit card. I had my car for 2 years. In that time I made every payment on time (usually the full balance) and raised my score almost 200 points. My credit card was never advanced. I finally decided to close the account and was assured that the palace would be transferred into my checking by today. Not only has my money not been released to me but the person I spoke with today say it may take about 60 days. I was never told that before. I would recommend anyone wasting time getting this card.

name: grasseljacqueline41
review: Wells Fargo just lost a very long time customer today. We received a visit from adult protective services. Because I tried to cash a check on my husband's account last week and they couldn't verify it with him over the phone. Seriously? My husband is disabled and isn't able to make it into our local branch to add me to his account. These people really have some nerve. They weren't concerned for his welfare. They were more concerned about me being a criminal than anything.  All over a $300.00 check. They could of cost my husband everything.We will be transferring everything out of his account and closing it today. Horrible horrible horrible.

name: Dimitri Andreenko
review: One of the best banks for SURE! Started out getting the cash wise card for the juicy 200$ cash back offer and got a decent starting limit of 3500 after just a month was browsing their site and came upon a personal line of credit page and decided to apply thinking i will probably be denied because i got 7 new accounts in last few months and i havent even made a single payment on the cash wise card and had run up 700+ already but thought why not try i have nothing negative in my reports other than inquires and accounts and BOOM 15k personal line of credit at 16% I can use it very wisely and conservatively here and there since there is no rewards its just useful as a little cash reserve to cover small things for a month or so but it feels so nice to have it in case i wanna move and need 2-3 or 4k i can just write myself a check and boom next day have the full amount without any fee's! For just a 25$ annual fee its MORE than worth it(2 dollars a MONTH) ill give it to WF with a big smile! Thanks Wells looks like you got a lifelong customer!

name: singinwes
review: Despite being assured my 2 years of history was enough to apply, I was turned down specifically for having too short of a credit history. I have 700+ credit and plenty of income. I guess they don't want my money!

name: seek_righter
review: They have been destroying my credit, when no other banks act that way.  II went to their website and found a link on preventing fraud, but the problem would most easily be solved if Wells Fargo never gets there hands on anyone elses' information again.  If they aren't already going out of business, then they should be soon!

name: Jeff Shilling
review: I have banked for over 10 years and have cash in the bank well is excess of the loan amount I sought.  I even asked to borrow against a secured CD.  Loan officers could not quote any rates but could only take a paper application.  The bank branch (at least this one) is obsolete.  No authority.  No helpfulness.

name: Austin Bear
review: Decent store credit card. I don't expect much from store credit cards. I was talked into applying when I purchased a coat from dillards. Transunion was the bureau pulled. I live in Kansas. I was instantly approved for the amex version with a $4500 limit. Transunion fico score was in high 790s at the time of application.

name: limehelmetcat
review: One star.  Telephoned and reached a rep in another country who asked security questions galore, all of which were answered perfectly.  Made simple inquiries that other credit card companies handle just fine.  Instead of simply being told no, got put on hold for a VERY long time.  After the annoyingly long wait, got transferred to the fraud dept and a guy asked for a full name.  After he received it, he said he needed to look into the account and again customer was put on hold.  While on hold, customer was disconnected.  Customer called back and heard the credit card was blocked.  Customer asked for a supervisor and was transferred to a rep from a foreign country again who said that customer needed to go into a physical branch.  Customer asked to be reconnected to the fraud department but was told he first needed to go into a branch.One star, would give zero if I could.

name: Matt Huffman
review: Thank you for your review, exactly the type of service/treatment that i do not want.

name: Rubi Vera
review: I have this credit card & tried to claim a cellphone warranty that the credit card advertises, after 6 months of going back & forth I provided all the information they needed & at the end they told me I wasn't approved b/ it took too long from the original submission date, when they had already told me the time was not a problem multiple times. Terrible service!

name: Mark Lacouague
review: Odds are you will never "graduate" from this card. That is information I finally got straight from the mouth of a Well Fargo rep. I had a credit score of nearly 800 for most of my adult life. But went thru a hard time that impacted my credit. After starting a new business I signed up for a Wells Fargo Business Secured Credit Card in order to get things rolling again. As far as everything else is concerned this card is just fine. Good terms, etc. However I was told after a year of good standing with the card I would be "graduated" to a unsecured line of credit. Well it's now been over 2 years that I have had the card. I've run right around $250,000 thru this card in that 2 years and NEVER carried a balance let alone EVER been late. At this point I have other lines of credit and don't even need this line anymore. But at this point purely out of principal I called, fighting to have my card graduated. After about an hour on the phone talking with 3 different people, a customer service rep finally told me that it is "very rare" for anyone to "graduate" from this card. Obviously Well Fargo has no interest in moving on from their tactics of trying to open as many accounts as possible, even if it means lying to their good customers. I'm a small business owner with 6 Wells Fargo accounts. ALL have ALWAYS been in perfect standing! No if's and's or but's about it. I'll be closing my secured accounts, the business and personal account I have, and it will probably ding my credit for a while. But I'm not going to continue to let Wells Fargo see any profits from my credit card purchases and I am seriously considering closing all my other Wells Fargo accounts just on principal of them refusing to do the right thing. I played by the rules the Well Fargo put forth when I got the card and they don't hold up their end of the bargain.

name: amymglass3737
review: I was told when i got this secured credit card that my account would be reviewed after 1 year. If i was in good standing and my credit score increased then i could possibly get my deposit back and be moved to an unsecured card.   Its been way over a year and the bank still has yet to review my account. Apparently it is random and no one knows when they could do it.  My credit score did go from 520 to 639. Its not a huge increase but i have done well. I am unhappy that i was told one thing and it never happened.  I am planning to apply for a capital one and if i get approved i will be closing this card.

name: scorpio_vle91
review: I am on the phone with their customer service right now for almost an hour and a half, still being transferring around. I had to call back 4 times during transfer and talked to 9 different people so far. All I want to do is to unlock my online account and dispute a charge that I do not recognize. Any other credit card company would take 10 minutes max and dispute charge online. I have Dillard's card for 8 years now. But I stopped using it this past 6 months after long travel, and everything got reset after they switched bank and my account got locked. The rewards seem no longer worth it because I don't shop at Dillard's online store that often anymore.

name: Wanda O'Brien
review: Beware if you use the rewards!  I ordered an item in mid-November.  It was "not offered" any more so I agreed to the substitute.  Then they sent the wrong product.  Now a month later with Christmas fast approaching they are saying they cannot help me until they hear from their "vendor" who has to send a return label before they can send me what I ordered over a month ago!

name: rottiesworld
review: This card is crap. I have had this. And 3 years and never been over my limit or missed a payment and have not been upgraded. You can go to different sites and people say the same thing never getting upgraded. I called and they don’t care, they say just to keep making payments and it will be upgraded. I told them that I was going to close my account and they said ok that money would be put into my checking, no care in the world. If you need a card try Bank of America or Citibank.

name: Christine Schmidt
review: Zero Stars. I am so dissapointed in Wells Fargo they claim to be there for their clients but they are not! I unfortunatley still have a joint account with the father of our kids. That account was in the negative and I was never informed. Wells Fargo then took it upon themselves to pull over the last of my money to bring his account into the positive. In doing so I now can not buy diapers, wipes formula, oranything else for the next 2 weeks!. When i called to find out why they did this WIthout my permission they said they had the right to do it, and couldn't verify my phone number to get a payment plan in place. They refused to give the money back and said borrow money from family. Some of us out here don't have family. P.S. while on this call they email me that they took the money. REALLY!! THAT WILL NOT COVER YOUR BUTT FOR TAKING IT WITHOUT CONSENT..   I was a loyal customer since 1999 and will be changing to another bank this week!!!

name: acinoma_7
review: I called requesting a quote and thankfully was wise enough to jot down all the information they verbally provided. When it was time to provide a Good Faith Estimate, they were charging me outrageous fees and adding $6,600 on top of my closing fees on top of the actual closing fees. They were asking me to provide a competitor quote to remove all those fees that are irrelevant to begin with. They will also say that you can "take your appraisal with you because you're buying it" and they will keep your appraisal HOSTAGE if they feel like it! total liars and disgusting business practices. Never have banked with them, and after this.. NEVER WILL!

name: oasisranch
review: Have been a Wells Fargo bank customer for 25 years and a WF Visa customer for 22 years. Have over 800 credit score. Disputed a charge for mechanical work on my truck. Repair shop owner was a pathological liar and bonafide crook. Had my truck for 7 months. Told me I needed new heads because it wouldn't start - $3500.00 labor plus $1200.00 for parts. Did not fix problem. Also heads not installed properly. Pouring out oil. Destroyed two Optima batteries. Replaced fuel pump didn't need etc. Supplied WF with detailed info- pictures, texts with false promises of completion week after week, detailed narrative of damage to truck, faulty repair, parts I didn't need ($250.00 part fixed problem) and testimonal from 3 other shops about faulty repair. Wells Fargo screwed up dispute, didn't read all my documents and closed dispute.  Wrote to Sloan (CEO) - nothing done. I have closed my bank accounts and cancelled my credit card. Completely incompetent, no customer service attitude bank. Read about dummy account scandal and Dept. Of Justice.

name: Jaimie
review: I had someone physical go to an ATM and deposit a check into their wells fargo account made out to me for 8k once that cleared they opened another wells fargo account with their name on it and proceeded to deposit 4 more checks some well over 10k all through atm machine and on video. I was in the hospital for a year and was put in Hospice with less then a week to live they said and I left. I did not find out about this until the customer called and I inquired as I wasn't sure I was still going to make it and wanted the money for my child as it was quite a large sum of money with all of the checks. They provided me the info and it i knew the person who did it. Guess they assumed I was going to die so if nobody would know. I did file police report and made a claim with Wells Fargo. They have proof video proof of the person depositing them The person still had accounts at Wells Fargo so they could have easily just reversed the charges give me my money back and charge the person's account and they denied it. I have proof that I was in the hospital incapacitated in isolation with very little chance to live and I also had messages text messages from the person admitting they did it and how they did it and still they denied it The person ended up fleeing to another state because they knew I pressed charges I did not receive my money even though I was in the hospital for you straight and several years in and out and could have used that money. If I tried to deposit a check for $10,000 or how about $5,000 maybe even two into my own account at a branch they are going to require to see not only my debit card but my ID because anytime I deposit a check of a large amount they do this. But a person can deposit a check into the ATM machine for over $10,000 without their name on it and they've never had a check deposited even close to that amount in the history they've ever had their account and they would let it go through.And even after all of this had happened and they're notified they know the person they know they're not supposed to have anything to do with my accounts They allowed that person to open up another account in my daughter's name that happens to have the same initials and very close to my name and I'm sure to you to use for the same intent. And when I found out they would not allow me or even my child to close the account The person opened the account for them and it was noted that they were the parent I had to call and threaten to file additional police reports to have them close the account. I WILL NEVER DO BUSINESS WITH THEM AGAIN. If they can do this to someone who was extremely ill and even if I was not I had the person who took it admit it as well as they were on video, they opened up a second account just to cash my large checks, I can prove without a reasonable doubt and that I in no way could have possibly deposited or signed the checks and then allowed that person to open an account in my child's name as their parent. My child is has basically same name so it was obvious why they would do it. Police reports were filed and the person still had accounts open so all they would have to do is reverse the charges. If that is not the WORST FINANCIAL INSTITUTION BUT DON'T KNOW WHAT IS!! I am going to make sure that anyone who ever mentions their name, wants info on a bank (I do get this often), a mortgage ( I'm a broker), CDs, investments, student loans, anything. I WILL ALWAYS TELL MY STORY AND TELL THEM TO STAY THE FuK AWAY!!! CAPITAL ONE HAS A BETTER CARD, MORE PERKS, WAY BETTER INTEREST RATE, BALANCE TRANSFER, AND CAPITAL ONE WILL GIVE YOU $1,000 MINIMUM WITH LESS OF A FICO SCORE AND BUMPS IT UP EVERY 6 MONTHS. Most of the reviews are my Wells Fargo. The ones that are BAD are from actual individuals. All other reviews with phone numbers and way to much info are all by Wells Fargo. RUN AWAY, THIS COMPANY IS THE WORST BANK THAT EVER HAS EXISTED. PLEASE IF YOU DON'T BELIEVE ME DO YOUR RESEARCH. DONT FALL FOR REVIEWS MADE BY THIS COMPANY FROM HELL.  I know I have cost them more money then if they just would of done the correct thing according to their own guidelines. But they need to cheat up all, open up accounts fraudulently, allow people to make fraudulent transactions, to give criminals the upper hand knowingly. #Findabetterbank #wellsfargosucks #bankforcriminals #wellsfargostoldmymoney

name: no itsok
review: (star ratings explained at the bottom of long rant)I've been a customer of Wells Fargo since 2015. Today was the 3rd time in this month alone where I had to call them/go to a branch to dispute an overdraft fee of $35.00. My issue was, that I was at a positive balance of $33.20 when I was charged the overdraft fee of $35.00. It was this fee that caused my account to go negative. But wait.. there's more! The description for why I was even charged the fee was "$398.99" for my car loan, which is the transaction that made my daily ending balance 11/20/17 $33.20. It was today on 11/21/17 that I was charged the overdraft fee, for going positive $33.20..BUT WAIT. THERE IS MORE: I went in person to the branch in Miami on E Flagler. The WF employee that was assisting me with my request (to remove the $35.00 fee that was making me negative). She saw the problem and was as bothered by it as I was. She contacted "Bank Solutions", where they basically gave her the perfect document to really mess me up: a document that reads "all" the same transactions I brought printed out (with the proof of the bank error) but in a completely different order. In this electronic document, my balance ended up -$7.00, which calls for an overdraft fee.Pause. Here's the thing: if you add up all of the debits and add up all of the credits, the difference will ALWAYS be the same, no matter what damn order they're in.Play.Get this: they were not "permitted" to print this report for me, the one that read -$7.00 being my balance. I work with balances for our tenants as  the accountant for a property management office. It is clear that I was charged an extra charge that would make the end balance a negative #.Done. Third time this month. Closed my account today, and am practically in love with Chase. Byyeeee Felicia Fargo.* Overall: 1 star - very unhappy customer* Customer Service: 3 stars - these ppl are covering their company's butt and they're just doing their job. But I can't take the boojiieeeeness* Website/app: 3 stars - working app* Rates / Fees : 1 star - I would give negative stars if possible. Let them get charged an overdraft for actually going negative.Also, remember that the company just paid out about $2million for messing up already. It's no surprise that they're trying to make as much money as they can through these fees. Butttttt..thats not my problem that they messed up behind the scenes. It's no customer's problem.

name: Myriam Concepcion
review: Yesterday I called 3 different times to see if I can get someone customer service oriented,each one was worst than the previous with the last been the worst. The customer service is not a priority,they aren't there to help.

name: lrooks2
review: I love this card I use it online and for instore purchases. No problems!! I travel a lot the hotels and restaurants I use always honor my card. Sometimes some merchants may say this is a Dillard's card until  they see the Amex logo after that every thing changes for the best. This is the best card in my wallet.

name: 13wangjustin
review: lol it takes three months and 1 billing cycle before they post the rewards to your account... every other major card company will fulfill the bonus once you hit the amount of spend required. Typical Wells Fargo move

name: sataylor100
review: Wells Fargo customer service is the worst. Employees are not empowered to use rational thought or critical thinking skills. When requesting to speak to a "manager" they simply pass the call along to another call center employee. As the credit company for a retailer like Dillards, Wells Fargo doesn't really care about customer service. They act merely as a card processing company for them. I made a payment of $7000 and after 4 days they still had not freed up my available credit even though the payment was made electronically and had been removed from my checking account 4 days prior. The only answer any agent or "manager" was able to give me after numerous calls was "we have to wait for the payment to fully clear". What does that even mean in the age of technology?? The money was extracted from my checking account?! Again since they operate as a credit service provider for Dillard's they really have no interest in customer experience. The only reason I even have the card is that it's the only way to receive the Dillard's employee discount. They know I have no other options so they truly do not care whether a Dillard's employee is satisfied or not.

name: Arthur Himmelman
review: I find it quite disturbing to see 24 one star, the lowest, ratings on the first page of Wallet Hub's most recent reviews of Wells Fargo. Somehow, in its overall summary, Wallet Hub still gives the impression Wells Fargo is a good banking option. What's going on here?

name: betty_gregory
review: I was approved for a Wells Fargo secured,with a deposit of $300.After careful consideration,I decided after2 days,that I didn't want the card,so I called the card dept,to cancel all transactions.I was told your account will not be debited,and the card request is cancelled,which was a lie.These people debited my account for $300, immediately after I requested cancellation.The bank is refusing to return my deposit.I called this office multiple times,with no results.I was told you will have it back into your account within3 days,and then it will sent to you overnight.I am transferred from person to person,everyone has a different tale.I had to obtain legal counsel to recover my money.This bank has caused me stress and hardship.My account is OD,because of their actions,and they charged me overdraft fees.I am hopeful,with litigation,I will receive my money.There is no legal reason,for withholding my deposit.I was also told ,it usually takes 45-60 days to receive a refund,which is outrageous.Wells Fargo is unfair,and has lousy customer service.I was not allowed to speak with a mgr.or supervisor.Their customer care dept.,said,we are the highest in authority.

name: jamesl_480
review: What was your credit score when you applied for the card

name: Anonymous
review: NEVER GET THIS CARD. THEY LIE ABOUT GETTING YOUR DEPOSIT BACK AFTER 6-9  months. We have had the card almost 2 years and it been payed off for 3 months and still no deposit back. Capital one is the best

name: Anonymous
review: Do not waste your time applying for this credit card. You will have to go to a wells fargo bank physical location with id proof and 2 address proofs to get approved. They do not mention about this while applying for credit card. when you submit the application online it just says under processing. You receive a mail mentioning to call a number to get approved. when you call on that number they ask you to go to a bank with your id proof and 2 address proofs. Such a pain in A**. Go with other banks where process is real simple.wish i could give negative star instead of single star.

name: Termain
review: I dont see what the issue is with having to go to the Bank to provide proof of who you are. If anything you should appreciate the added security and how that take new accounts very seriously. I would rather .. which I have gone in person to get all the verification processed as opposed to having to FAX documents over and going back and forth with someone stating they didnt receive it. Be grateful.

name: Anonymous
review: Great credit card I don't have to think about redeeming points or spend hours on the phone going through a phone tree attempting to talk to a representative to get my points paid out. For me easy is good.

name: Jeff Plitt
review: Never graduates you. 2 years ($50.00 in maintenance fees) and 5 phone calls later, I am still waiting on their so-called "periodical review" to upgrade me to an Unsecured Credit Card. 100% payments on time, never gone over 10% of credit utilization, my credit score is 763 and I currently have 2 other unsecured credit cards, and they still won't give me a straight answer. In one word: SCAM!!

name: threegreens
review: I would give it zero stars but that's not an option. My review is don't waste your time with this company. We bought flooring from a local company in my home town. We decided to take advantage of the 12 month no interest offered through Wells Fargo. I did this reluctantly as I have had problems with Wells Fargo in the past but I decided to since I knew we would pay it off quickly. The charge was around $8000, my husband and I decided to pay $7,000 on  the first payment due and then at that point take advantage of paying the remainder 1000 off in 12 months offered, so we could keep a little extra cash. The first bill came in March, we paid the 7000, on the second statement we had 1000 balance with a minimum payment of $286 due. If we paid the minimum, we are forced to pay off this balance is 3 months. We called the customer service number and after an hour of speaking with someone who we couldn't understand easily due to the accent, we felt we finally got her to understand we were wanting to dispute the minimum payment.  It was obvious later she did not understand at all that the minimum payment was too high because she noted on our account that we wanted to dispute the entire claim. The next thing that happened was the owner of the floor company is calling to ask what was wrong with our flooring because we were disputing the claim!!! Now why would we pay $7000  on the balance if we were disputing the claim. After two months and dealing with different people and a supervisor, we have gotten nowhere. I feel we are being penalized for paying a large payment.  Why offer 12 months no interest if you force your customers to pay off a balance in 3 months!! I was very upset when speaking with the Wells Fargo supervisor and at no point in our conversation did he seem concerned or willing to help us. We are paying off the $1000 and never ever using this bank again.

name: Pratik Parekh
review: No rating....Worst experience with Wells Fargo Credit card.We bought the mattress from Mattress Factory through Wells Fargo Credit card for 13 months lease with 0% interest rate. Before completing the 13 months they charge us $400 interests for next year without any information or sending any mail. We called the three time to customer care to waive off the interest if we are ready to paid off the loan remaining amount. But they said you need to paid off the amount with interests or carry on for next year..they said we only $100 waive off interest if you have to paid off loan.. How can i pay the interest $300 just because of 10 days.I unable to understand Wells fargo process...they cheated the customer..Also they said that we will put it on your credit or sending to third party collection...We are very disappointment with Wells Fargo service...I have just pass this message everyone who knows how Wells fargo works..Heads off...hated the Wells Fargo Credit card service....No Wells fargo anymore...

name: Lauren Rolston
review: When I opened this card OVER FOUR YEARS AGO, I was told that, with 6m-12 months of on time payments, it would be converted to a regular credit card. I haver NEVER paid late. After 2 years, I received a letter saying that after 5 more on time payments, this would be converted to a regular credit card. After 6 more on time payments, I called Wells Fargo and they said they did not know where the letter (on their letterhead) came from. I went into a branch and was told they do not have control over the cards, "sorry there is nothing we can do from this end, try calling again." I did to no avail. I have several credit cards now with over $10,000 in credit but still cannot get Wells Fargo to convert my secured card. I will be closing it soon.

name: foxstew
review: Wells Fargo cc only let's you download 2 months worth of transactions to your desktop software (quickbooks) All my other business cards allow up to 18 months. This leaves me with thousands of transactions that have to be manually entered! I will no longer use this card!

name: kdnichole
review: High interest, nearly non existent rewards

name: tula10612
review: I would STRONGLY advise against this card, I have encountered multiple rude customer service agents, I am very unhappy with the way that they handles my situation and I will protest against anyone that is considering getting this card.

name: icdesign760
review: DO NOT GET THIS CREDIT CARD! I would give it a 0 if I could. I feel complete dissatisfaction and betrayal from Wells Fargo. I got this card and they told me I would be getting the 0% APR for 15 months, little did I know once I started using it that I actually did not qualify, they did not tell me that I did not qualify, and once I called about this they told me that I already had a past, inactive credit card with them and that was the reason I did not get the promotion. The original guy told me that I would get the promotion so I was completely lied to and made to look like a fool. Go somewhere else with your business you do not want to deal with these swindelers!

name: Steve Kiebzak
review: Worst bank EVER! Have plenty of money in my account, went to purchase furniture to replace because we lost everything in a flood. The "bank" declined my charges because it was over 2,000.00, left me standing and embarrassed. Spoke with the "I don't have authority to do anything" customer service clown, gave her all of my identifiers, last transactions to verify my identity to see if they will give me a limit increase, she said I didn't "qualify". Really? It's MY money, NOT credit!. When I received an insurance claim check from this so called bank, I took it to deposit it into WELLS FARGO, a check from WELLS FARGO and they said they have to hold the check to make sure it CLEARS! Their insurance claim process is TERRIBLE and you get a different story from different people about the same topic! I have a credit card through them and have had AUTO PAY for EVER, the auto pay fell off (don't know why) I asked them to waive the late fee (never late with them before on cards or mortgage) you know what they said? Yep, "I don't qualify for a fee waiver". I asked If they would set up my auto pay AGAIN, they said, "since the auto pay is NOT paying out of a Wells Fargo Bank, they cannot" them trying to make you have them as their sole bank! When you want to transfer money on line to another bank they want to know why, like it is their money! I am making formal complaint, with documentation to the attorney generals office and I cannot wait until Monday comes fast enough as I am pulling ALL of my money out of this so-called bank and refinancing my home loan with a REAL bank that I have been with for years! Terrible bank, terrible practices, terrible customer service, terrible claim process.

name: Kim Hess
review: Been with them over 2 1/2 years. Charged $25 Annual Fee THREE TIMES ALREADY!  I still have not been converted to a regular card AND they still have my $300 secured deposit.    I got a Capital One UNSECURED card with $300 to start.  In SIX months they increased my limit to $3,300.Do yourself a favor and go with Capital One.  I have been paying my bill IN FULL, ON TIME, EVERY MONTH on both cards.It should not have to take Wells Fargo this long to convert me.  And I have called several times.  Went into the bank several times.  And every time they tell me it is an automatic process and I will just have to wait.  Yeah.  Right.Well Wells Fargo.  In the time that you make me wait, I will continue to bad mouth you and give you a bad review.  AND turn people to your competitors.Go with CAPITAL ONE.

name: Ash Law
review: I had 100% identical case/issue. Wells Fargo continuously refused to provide dated or number of times they reviewed my Secured Card....one rep said there is not a single note on the acct, so, presumption is-WF never even tried....PURE SCAM on WF side!

name: Devon Hughes
review: UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU TAkE THIS CREDIT CARD OUT. The Wells Fargo Home Rebate Card is a SCAM - here's why - what they DO NOT disclose to you is that no matter what you think you're getting into with this home rebate card - they will still sell your mortgage and essentially make the card useless to you. They sold me the card, and two months later sold my mortgage, and changed the card to a basic cash back rewards card. They justify this in saying they will send me a check for my cash back and I can pay that to my mortgage. Reprehensible business, awfully corrupt company. Avoid at all costs.

name: Lorena Galram
review: I traveled with 3 of my major cards, and Dillard's American Express was the only one that was scanned by the information extracted fraud machine and was used in its totality, I called to report the fraud and I was told not to make a payment until I get the new card, but they still got the payment from my bank account before the new card arrival and before knowing the new account number, so I was scared and called my bank to stop payment, I was charged with 35 for stopping payment, plus 45 because the overdraft, I contacted this credit card's customer service to ask an explanation but all I received was "I apologize for not letting you know your new account number was changed and the payment was going to be processed, we cannot give you credit for the expenses this issue has caused" I close the account.  Be aware that this kind of credit card with the special chip to make your life easy, makes all these sneak thieves' life easy too.

name: Hector Guajardo Fernandez
review: Stay away from wells fargo credit card very bad experience they charge me late fee on financial monthly payments even I send check on time. Very disappointed I will never use a credit card or finacial offer from them.. customer service so rude and unprofessional.

name: Lori Phillips
review: My interest rate is 25.9% on this card and it is 10-15% higher than any of my other cards. I have tried to get them to lower the interest rate but they won't budge. I am going to pay a little more off on it and transfer to a better interest rate card.

name: Karen Chagnon
review: I have been a loyal Custer since 2008.  Even though I have always paid my bill on time over the years I have noticed they just keep raising my interest rate and it is now over 20%.  None of my other cards are this high.  I called today to ask for a rate reduction or I would have to transfer my balance and was just told there is nothing they can do.   I was told there was no department I could be transferred to that could do this for me. I explained how loyal I have been and that if it wasn't lowered I would be transferring my balance tomorrow.  They just didn't care.  They would rather lose a client that lower the interest rate.  Well they are losing my business and I am now going to look at other accounts I have with them and see what other options I have.  I am very disappointed that loyalty isn't valued at Wells Fargo

name: Kyle Kovalik
review: Worst Credit card company to deal with! I paid my credit card on time every month for 12 months missed it by one day due to my account numbers being hacked and they wanted me to submit a ton of paperwork and documentation. So much for customer loyalty!

name: Nessa Landeros
review: Today I have made my last payment on the Dillard's American Express let me start off with saying when I first got the card years ago it was great no problems! The sec they changed over to Wells Fargo all types of problems mostly with them never receiving our payments that we make 2 weeks in advance. Prior to changing we paid threw our bank account always got there on time no Hassale. When they changed over to Wells Fargo one we never got notified that any address on payee were changing so threw our bank account everything stayed the same they would never receive our payments and blamed us for wrong information on our part. We changed the address that THEY provided only for it still not to get there now we're getting charged late payments again! It's a on going thing with these people I won't cancel my card only because it affects our credit but I will make sure I will never use this card again! Horrible!!!! Do not get it! Look else where if I could give them zero stars I would!

name: AmyCharles
review: This was one of only a few cards I qualified for when I first started college, and among those few, it had the best terms, the best rate and by far the best rewards. This became my go-to card for my ancillary college expenses, and the cash back rewards were a huge boon. Application process was really easy. I never had any problems with the card, never had to test their fraud protection or anything like that. It really was a great card for my student years and with the controlled limits, it's great for teaching good credit card use practices. I was a very happy customer.

name: thousandarms97
review: I got the card because I never had a credit card before and needed a secured credit card to build my credit score. The $25 annual fee is an outrage though. I would lower the annual fee or do away with it entirely if possible. I would recommend this credit card only to those who are just starting out and need to get a secured credit card to build up your credit score. You need to have a minimum security deposit of $300 for this credit card, and that will serve as your credit limit. Personally, I would recommend looking for the lowest annual fee if you are looking for a secured credit card, and I don't think a $25 annual fee is the lowest you can get.

name: Yancy Lind
review: You know I got this card because my bank suggested it, I had a lot of money in accounts with them, and even though I didn't need a card, I figured why not, the credit limit was a bit higher than any of my others, and the interest rate was lower. It seemed convenient to stop spreading debt around between cards. The problem was that when I got it, it had a fairly long 0% promotional period - 6 months, or 12 months. Since I was selling my home and moving at the time, I had a lot of expenses, and I took advantage of the 0 percent interest, just made minimum payments. I figured they wouldn't have offered it to me if they didn't want me to use it. Imagine my surprise when instead of getting a statement one month, I got a letter saying my account had been closed. I called customer service, and asked why - I hadn't missed any payments, and didn't owe them any money in interest - and they just told me they viewed me as a bad credit risk because I'd only been making minimum payments. They didn't offer to open the line credit again if I paid more, and wouldn't answer my questions beyond that. That was the main thing that left an impression when I was dealing with them, that they gave me interest free credit (without me asking for it), closed my account (for no real reason), and weren't helpful when I tried to get some insight into the process. I'd hesitate before getting another line of credit with them, and hesitate twice as much before taking advantage of any of their 'promotional offers.

name: Forappsonly Notreel
review: What im a bit lost on in a VAST majority of these reviews is that most people are refusing to come to the realization that this card is for people with BAD credit scores. Its for people who CANT get unsecured cards..yet. You are paying an annual fee and high interest because you are paying for your bad credit . They are giving you a way to increase your score over time. this is your so called "last ditch effort" to show future creditors that you can be responsible enough to get credit for that $30,000 car or that $250,000 home. I personally feel the interest rate and reasonably low annual fee is right in line with what this cards target audience IS. And you wont even have to worry about the high interest if you pay your bill early. Use it for getting gas each week and then pay it a few days later. pay your cell phone bill with it... then a few days or a week later, pay it off. .  Dont let it hit the credit cycle and youre getting free points on your credit score when they report you paying on time and using a low % of your available credit which ive learned is a big factor in determining credit. The deposit you place is again, part of the price we are paying to build or rebuild credit rating. If you need money from an ATM.. use your BANK card and then youre not stuck paying the high cash advance fee. Im shopping around before deciding but I dont think WF is off base with their expectations

name: Bethany Lamb
review: Are YOU kidding me receiving a "late fee" for paying to early!

name: Wayne Matthews
review: i can't see where they allow a zero, which in my opinion would be wayyyyy too high. somehow my account got changed from a credit card to a financial card (???????). i don't know why, but neither do they. After menu transfers and waits, I finally found someone who found my account and allowed me to make a payment. But.....I had to sign up again for on-line access. The signup form would not accept my password (even though I followed ll the rules), nor my security question and answer. Getting rather upset, I asked the rep why I had to sign up again since I've been able to get on line, and how and why my account got changed from a "credit" card to a "financial" card. He continued to explain my card was in the financial area....even though i  explained it hadn't been during the previous month or years. Decided I had no more time after 30 minutes. Will pay this card off in full next month and use my other cards in the future.....DONE9

name: Eric Rothman
review: I recently received a Visa Wells Fargo prepaid card,  it was very easy to use.  i used it at a grocery syore and had no issues.  However, there is a $5 monthly fee which is a disgrace.  Fees like this would keep me from ever personally buying a prepaid card.  So I would only recommend cards without fees.

name: Zuleyma  Mayorga Castillo
review: There is no such thing.. that get the fees from ATM or any other way .. but this card is good . and you can link it with your bank account and better if its Wells Fargo..

name: Jenifer Cal-Wil
review: There's really nothing special about this credit card. Based on my credit score, I believe the interest rate is too high, and it takes a long time for me to earn rewards (despite regularly using the card and paying it off). Wells Fargo is always responsive with customer service, has a good fraud protection plan in place, and makes it easy to pay the card off online through my bank account. Overall, it's a fine card, and I am satisfied enough with it that I'm not likely to get a different card with another company.

name: Henry Weisiger
review: In August I made a reservation using rewards for a reservation in November.After I returned from my trip I received a charge to another credit card for the hotel reservation.  I contacted WellsFargo before contacting the hotel to verify there should not have been a charge. After 2 hours 20 minutes (yes, you read that correctly) and being transferred back and forth from Customer Service to Rewards Specialists 13 times ( yes, thirteen) someone finally confirmed : No, your reservation was paid with rewards you should not have been charged. I then proceeded to call the hotel and they informed me that Tourico (travel intermediary for Wellsfargo) charged my credit card.  I called Tourico and they told me to call Connection (this is Wells Fargo Rewards ).  I called the number Tourico gave me but it was the business office for Connection.  She told me to call Wells Fargo rewards and on the 13th try they said they would call the hotel.  Because it has now been 3 hours waiting she said , it may take a few minutes , you can hold or I can call you back. Honestly, it is incredible to get this kind of service and run-around form live persons.  I would understand if this was all automated.  It is really a shame Wells Fargo can not deliver a quality product from beginning to end. They are very good at selling the attributes but not so good when there is a hiccup in the system.

name: Lois Reynolds
review: I redeemed some rewards, but after 3 weeks I still had not received my items. I phoned customer service who told me that they would say have to open my case and get to me in 2 weeks with their results. Too late for Christmas!!!  Not satisfactory !!

name: Loren Barclay
review: Rewards pay better than current interest rates on savings. It is even better than interest on CD.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: I needed a way to help get my credit score up and was the perfect fit for the Wells Fargo Business Secured Credit Card. The low minimum deposit made it possible for me to get on track towards building my credit up. I have had no issues thus far and the fees are very reasonable.

name: Thomas King
review: I've had this card for a long time.  Its safe and secure, has decent stats as a credit card and works perfectly for what I need it for.  Wells fargo gives me good customer service and helps me if something goes wrong with my credit card.

name: alyssab1
review: After recently having moved into the Tucson area, I was in the market for a new bank. On a Saturday morning, I decided to stop in at a local Wells Fargo Branch. I was greeted at the door with a smile, and quickly sat down with one of the account specialists to discuss my options for opening an account with them. I felt that they treated me with the most professionalism, as well as did not discriminate. I think Wells Fargo is a great option for anyone in the area!

name: Jay torres
review: Ive been a Wells Fargo Checking customer for over 7 years.  My fee was waived because I tied a savings account to my checking account so I have zero fee checking account.  The website is great as is the Wells Fargo iPhone app.  I use it all the time.  For faster balance checks I have my text messaging app set to text Wells Fargo with "Bal All" and it returns my balance within a few seconds.  You can even check activity by texting "Act" next.  Its way faster than logging into the app.  Ive used the check deposit via photograph in the app too without problems.  I also love how I can go to any ATM at any hour and deposit money into my checking account and it will show up instantaneous.  For being a checking account, I have to say Ive never used any physical checks but I use my check card all the time.  I even have Apple Pay tied to my Wells Fargo Check Card for paying with my iPhone.  I really don't have anything bad to say about my Wells Fargo Checking account.  I Love it.

name: Jonathan Scovner
review: I've been with Wells Fargo ever since they were Wachovia, and had no trouble initially signing up. Since the switch to WellsFargo, it seems the hold periods for check clearances has really increased. Last week I deposited a check, and the funds weren't available for four full business days, which seems excessive, especially when I really need the money as soon as possible. I can't rely on them to have my money available for me when I need it.

name: Amber Kirkham
review: When I was needing extra cash and my friend offered to wire me some money, we realized that we had different banks. Since the loan was for me, I figured I would make it easy on her to do a bank transfer so I opened a wells fargo account since they had recently taken over our Century bank, and that was who she banked with. The day I set up the checking account, it took over an hour and a half to get through with answering questions and seeing what I was eligible for, but I had a great credit score, and a good history with my credit union. So I was approved for a checking account. They didn't explain anything to me, just handed me a debit card and asked me to order checks, I declined. I didn't have the cash to be ordering checks especially since I never use them. They said there was not a required amount to keep in the account and that if I didn't use the account at least five times a month, I would see a service fee. I thought ok cool. I had a few things I needed to do with the cash I would be getting into the account that day and figured that if I swyped the card for a soda at mcdonald and some diapers at walmart along with the three bills I had to pay would cover me for the month. So my friend sent me the loan, and I paid the bills, and got me a drink and bought the diapers. Everything was fine from what I understood. I deposited my next check into wells fargo and was going to alternate every week, one in wells fargo, one in my credit union. Well, after I deposited my check, I asked the bank to transfer a small amount back to my friend as my first payment, and they did, assuring me there was no charge for it. Then I got a letter in the mail two weeks later. I was overdrafted close to $100 dollars. The check I put into the account had been $138. I sent my friend $25. I spent less than $50 out of the money because I had been using my bigger check which was in my credit union. So I looked online at my statement, I had a $12 service fee, a $14 service fee, a charge for bank checks, and some other fee which was attached to my account transfer which made the check charge overdraft my account, so I had an overdraft fee of $45 bucks and then I had grabbed lunch for like $6 thinking I still had around $70 in the account, but it was already overdrawn, and the bank let it go through and charged me a second overdraft fee. I closed my account the same day. I went to the branch and had a bit of  a fit. The tellers were amazing. Really nice. But I wound up having to pay out of my credit union part of what was owed, even though they did waive one of the overdraft fees and refund my account for the checks I did not order. they made me still pay for the second one from me buying lunch because with my account already overdrafted I shouldn't have been buying lunch. HA. But I didn't realize it was overdrafted. I had used my debit card more than five times that month, so shouldn't have had a service charge, but was told bill payments did not count as debit transactions, so I didn't have it hit 5 times, and then the second service fee was because my account was lower than $100 at the end of the month. They never told me I had to keep a hundred in my account. I still don't see why I had to cover any overdraft when they didn't decline my card which was on an account that had already been overdrafted, and was  only overdrafted because they ordered checks which I declined getting anyway. If they hadn't ordered checks, even with the service fees, I still could have paid for the lunch with no overdraft. Not a good experience. Great customer service. terrible information about what they charge for, and messed up way to deal with a mistake that was THEIR fault. I would NEVER recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Tara
review: I started my checking account back when I was banking with Wachovia, and my checking at that tine was truly free--no minimum balances required to keep from paying monthly fees, lower overdraft charges, etc. When Wells Fargo bought Wachovia, my account was converted, and I haven't been all that happy with it since. They instituted the monthly fee for clients who don't have direct deposit or maintain a (somewhat ridiculous) minimum monthly balance. They raised the fees for overdrafts significantly. They seem determined to take more of my money every month while claiming to be "free" than their predecessor did. But the part I find most irritating is that the completely user-friendly and transparent online account that I like so much when I banked with Wachovia was replaced with a system that makes it really difficult to keep track of your actual balance. Their balance alert system, which I am signed up for via text, is also sometimes delayed nearly twenty-four hours before I receive an alert after my balance changes; someone who had stolen my debit card could have had a field day in that amount of time before I ever received notification. All in all, not recommended and the only reason I haven't sought out a new bank is that moving accounts is a hassle I simply don't have time for at the moment.

name: Christopher
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo ever since they took over Wachovia. I have been very pleased with their service. I use their checking account for all my bill pays and also use it for buying online. I love being able to go online and see instantly charges that are pending and detailed information on purchases I have made so I know exactly what has been processed already. I love having a  checking account with Wells Fargo.

name: Kelsey Turner
review: I have had a regular savings account with Wells Fargo for years, and wanted to add something to help me save a bit more money without thinking much of it.  When I was at a branch location, one of the reps suggested the Way2Save savings account, and I have really enjoyed it.  I have automatic transfers each month from my checking to my savings, so I avoid any monthly fee.  Additionally, with each charge to my checking account, a dollar is transferred from my checking to my savings.  You don’t really notice it, but this does start to add up!  The interest rate isn’t really much to speak of, but that wasn’t my main concern with this account anyways.  I have never had any problems with any of my accounts with Wells Fargo, and I really enjoy having this savings account with them!

name: April Tumlinson
review: I love shopping at department stores like Dillard. The introductory APR is amazing! The rewards system is better than what I would consider industry standard in stores such as Macy's or JCPenney. The point system would encourage me to use their card as opposed to using my lower interest credit cards, debit card, or cash.

name: Bryce Jabanoski
review: You can only redeem your cash back in increments of $25.00.   What a joke

name: Aidner Neves
review: I had a Citi MasterCard for years but I have switched to Wells Fargo Visa just because Citi put a 75,000 cap on my rewards points. As I use a credit card to pay for everything that I can, I would usually reach that limit around August. Wells Fargo Card has no caps and the more you spend the more you earn as it should be. Interest rates makes no difference for me since I always pay the total due every month. My foreign transaction fees have been refunded because of my overall transaction amount with the bank. That means I have no complaints whatsoever and really enjoy using the card. And last but no least, Wells Fargo website and customer service are second to none!

name: gray squirrel
review: Being a customer for fifteen years without an overdraft and having an 810 FICO score does not ensure you will be treated respectfully here.  Their risk analysis includes refusing to cover skimmed card protection.  My ATM card had been skimmed and used twice in two different counties for the tune of eight hundred dollars before I noticed.  I immediately cancelled the card and reported it to Wells Fargo.  Of course I assumed the bank would cover the fraudulent charges.  I was shocked that my "investigation" outcome said they had no reason to believe that it was not me that used the card twice in two different counties while I was working that day.  I was appalled and had the two police reports I had filed where the police had found an ATM at the grocery store had a skimmer on it already.  After calling the bank and speaking to three different people to no avail, I had to go into a branch and get loud to get a resolution in my favor.  So offended that they handled this way when they knew it was fraud.  I still have not cancelled the account because so much of my autopay is caught up with them, but I really should on principle.

name: Tara Basinger
review: I like that the Wells Fargo® Rewards® Credit Card offers a point based system for rewards granting more of an opportunity to spend points for things related to individual needs. I believe the late payment fee of $38 is consistent with other top leading credit cards. The only thing I don't like is the regular APR is a bit steep for the maximum value rated at 25.99% compared to an Bank of America credit card APR maxes out at 22.99% value.

name: John Alvino
review: I have had a business account with Wells Fargo for the past 5 years, and I have always been impressed by the customer service. Even though the bankers that I worked with changed frequently over the years, there were good knowledge transfer practices and I never felt like I had to keep explaining my business and the transactions that I do regularly. Recently I worked with a business specialist to add an authorized person to the account, and the experience was laser focused on our specific needs. Wells Fargo went beyond the call of duty to meet our every request, even though several of the requests were not conventional. Overall it is a great experience for small business customers.

name: Jeannine P
review: BEWARE CONSUMERS WELLS FARGO ARE CORPORATE THIEVES!!!For anyone who is thinking about banking with this establishment DONT DO IT!!!!They steal your hard earned money. I read other reviews and found countless reviews just like mine. They are infamous for incorrectly charging numerous N.F.S. fees @ 35.00 a charge! I am a single, white American woman on Disability,  I live on my Disability checks and cant afford any extras so when I discovered an error at the banks end, I called and spoke to a manager and explained what happened.  He told me "Sorry, we are unable to credit accounts. Of course this is a total lie! Due to this error I will be unable to pay my bills, get my prescriptions for my illnesses,  and am so devestated and upset that I feel sick! Is this what this  corporate bano does to Middle-class American's?  What happened to Customer Service and fixing mistakes? I have contacted the Better Business Bureau and the incident is being investigated.  Till then, I will warn everyone I can, and not stop until I have exhausted every avenue!

name: Erica Swanger
review: This card has a very low anual fee and is a decent card for those who have had credit problems in the past and are trying to rebuild their credit. I have had good experiences so far with contacting their customer service though I have not had to do this much. I always pay my balance off at the end of each billing cycle and I am very careful with my spending on this card. It would be very easy to wreck my credit even further if I'm not careful. Wells fargo is also a very good bank and I had an account with them for many years without ever having any issues from them.

name: Kelsey Turner
review: I have been a checking account customer with Wells Fargo for over 14 years and I have nothing but positive things to say about it.  I have never had any problem with my online banking or in-branch experiences, and the customer service has always been great.  I also have other accounts linked to this one, and everything is seamless.  The fees are better than other banks I have compared to, and I have never had any problems with them.

name: Angelina Mancini
review: I had an account with Wachovia since I was 11 or 12. They were bought out by Wells Fargo. I was informed there would be no changes to my account so I didn't bother to sit down and bug a rep. I later found out that someone tried to convert my account to a new Wells Fargo equivalent without informing me. This account was supposedly as close as you could get to the equivalent of what Wachovia was offering me. But this account required so many hoops: A) So many transactions a month AND mobile banking AND some other service I can't even remember... OR B) a $500.00 min that you can NEVER touch in your checking... OR C) A hefty membership fee. I was in college at the time (hence the STUDENT account) and so I had very little money in the bank. I remember I went to deposit a check at the ATM and realized that BOTH of my accounts (savings & checking) were overdrawn. I tried to keep a 25 dollar min in my checking in case of emergency, but I was charged a membership fee for not having $500... all the money I DID have was gone. When they charged the fee, there wasn't enough money in my checking... so I had set up a safety by having money automatically withdrawal from my savings in the event of an overdraft... but it didn't matter because there still wasn't enough money there to cover the fee in the linked account either. Now both accounts were overdrawn and I was charged again for an overdraft in my savings and for the overdraft in my checking from when the transaction occurred to make that linked pull and the money wasn't there. Three new charges for having no money that summed to a total well over $100. I called and was on the line for over an hour in an attempt to fix this. They forgave the second overdraft on my checking since I was not notified of the new terms to my accounts, but I still owed over $100 in fees. And I didn't find out for two weeks that this had even occurred. No one called. My mail wasn't goint to my temporary apartment's address while I was at college. And I was getting so much junk mail from them once they switched over that the legitimate bank emails started making it into my junk file. This happened to me MONTHS after the big transition to the Wells Fargo flagging and such. And this was NOT the last tragic even that occurred. It was just the first. I had some cards stolen almost year ago in Feb 2014. I called in the claim, and two weeks later I went into a bank location hoping for updates on my account. I was not greeted. I got tired of standing so I found a chair. The offices were glass and I could see people in them, and they could see me.... We even made eye contact a few times.... They had no customers, so I figured they must be on break, but after the better half of an hour I went up to the teller to ask how I could speak to a representative. The teller informed me that they weren't on break and came out and talked the the person I'd been having a staring contest with. The rep was short with me. I figured it was just a bad day, but I have gone to that location several times (since its the closest one to my house) and her presentation always seem to be the same. It took MONTHS for me to figure out what happened to my accounts and it was a disaster. I decided to close my accounts after that. I walked back into the Riverside, Jax location on that day and sat for 20 minutes playing the staring game with that same woman from before. I eventually stood up to leave and go to a different location, but by then I was more than annoyed. I was tempted to stand on a chair and scream "I need an adult!" in the hopes that that same woman would finally become gutsy enough to come out of her office,... but instead I drove 50 minutes instead to my favorite Orange Park, Fl location to make sure I was treated with some dignity when I closed my account....

name: Chaz Hicks
review: I have my Way 2 Save savings account with Wells Fargo and I have been very pleased with Wells Fargo. I enjoy the convenience of transferring money between my savings and checking account. It usually takes no more than a couple of minutes and I can transfer money online. Having had other savings accounts that required a minimum balance, I was attracted to the savings account with Wells Fargo because it was free of any minimum balance requirement. The only problem that I've ever had with this account was from not being familiar with the Way 2 Save Program. I wasn't quite aware that money would be transferred from my checking account to my savings account each time I used my card when I started with the Way 2 Save account and the automatic transfers actually led to my checking account over-drafting on one occasion. Wells Fargo was very helpful and waived the fee as a courtesy. After learning this, I haven't had this issue again. All in all, I've been extremely satisfied with my Wells Fargo savings account.

name: Brittney McDowell
review: I have one of my multiple savings accounts with Wells Fargo (as well as a checking account). I’ve had my account slightly more than a year. I’ve no problems and there really is nothing spectacular to share…. Except the fact that I have NEVER been provided with the exceptional level of customer service and professionalism that I have with Wells Fargo. The only down side, specifically related to my savings, is the minimum balance required to avoid the monthly fee. Now, I have a balance far exceeding the minimum requirement, but my first few months establishing my savings, I kept being charged the fee for not meeting the minimum. I think they should either lower the minimum requirement OR, IMO, the best option, get rid of it all together, for those with a checking, in attempts to promote people saving.

name: Matthew Short
review: I have been using Wells Fargo as my savings account provider for over three years now.  My experience with them thus far has been nothing but positive.  My savings account information is easily accessible and when I have had questions or issues in the past their customer service team is prompt and efficient at addressing my concerns.  Wells Fargo also has a great mobile app so that my savings account balance is easily available if I need to check my balance.  I also appreciate the fact that with the size of Wells Fargo, I am never far from a branch of an ATM that I can access my savings account if needed.  While 'big banks' can definitely get a bad reputation, I feel Wells Fargo does a great job of earning my continued loyalty with the operations of their savings account program.

name: Alice Carmody
review: I currently use Wells Fargo for my personal checking account. I could not be more happy with their friendly bankers at our local branch. They call me by my last name and are always willing to assist me in a timely manner. Online banking is also easy (especially for those who do not like going to your local bank) and I use it on a daily basis. But most of all, I love the fact I can deposit checks from my smartphone. The process is easy. All you have to do is download the application, sign into your account, take a photo of both the front and back of the check, and just like that, the check is instantly deposited. I have used this service maybe thirty times and have never had an issue. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a new bank.

name: Dave B
review: My wife and I were with Wells Fargo for a few years and had the Premier Checking account.  I thought over all the account was mediocre.  The interest they paid on it was lousy.  They do have a ton of locations which is very nice and convenient.  Overall, they were pretty easy to work with once you got through all the up selling and additional items they wanted to tack on to your accounts.  This was the main reason we switched to a credit union as we just needed basic banking as we keep our investments in other places and we were always being contacted for different products.

name: Eric Almly
review: They play games with getting you your deposit back after you close the card. They tell you that it takes 45 to 60 days. I had not used my card once in the month prior to closing it and have no pending charges whatsoever. There is no reason that they need to sit on your money that long after you close it. They just take advantage of the situation.

name: Alen Alen
review: Exactly. What a disgusting company.

name: Al Palm
review: I won a $100 Wells Fargo Visa gift card. I bought $30 of gas with it - no problem. The next day I tried to buy gas for my other car - BIG NO - the attendant said it would not go through. I checked the balance on my computer at home and it showed that the entire $100 had been used. I thought I had been cheated or hacked or something, but I kept the card and a few days later tried it again - it worked. Again the new balance showed that I had used the entire $100. I had only used about $55. After a few business days it will probably be corrected again, but what a bunch of BS. WELLS FARGO GET YOUR STICK TOGETHER! THIS IS 2015!

name: Brittney McDowell
