review: I REALLY love having a Dillards account. Compared to other stores I have cards with, they provide the best incentive, in the form of deals. Matter of fact, I just went to Dillards the other day, bought several new outfits at 65% off with an additional 40% off. The frequency at which you find these types of deals is amazing. The only thing I DON'T like, is the fact that I live in Sacramento, and the nearest one is in Stockton (which I never go). SO I only get to go when I visit my grandmother in Reno. I schedule my trips when they are having deals ;-).

name: Sai Lay Myint
review: This secure card is so stupid, I opened for about 9 months and never unsecured me. Many different credit card companies offered me actual credit cards and, I opened many actual credit cards. Now my credit score become 700. But they never unsecured me. Now I call them to close the account, they close my account. But they hold my money for another 60 days. They will use my money $500 for another 2 months after account closed; I do not get any interest. Very bad cheating people. They do not want to refund you easy.When you close the account, they hold your money for another 60 days for nothing. That so bad, I never see a credit card company like that.

name: Aoron Williams
review: How long did it take you to recieve your card to begin with? After opening acnt?

name: Hy Man
review: We have a Wells Fargo account for my wife's business.  Since we never spend more than we have in the account the Wells Fargo® Secured Credit Card is pointless.  Why pay fees and a high interest rate on essentially what is a debit card.  So we just use the visa debit card that comes with her checking account.

name: Anita B
review: I probably shouldn't respond since this is an old comment but its too stupid to ignore. The point of the secured card it to build credit. Debit cards don't build credit. So what's a person to do if they want to rebuild credit and they can't get a unsecured card. Secured cards are about the only option a person has other than waiting for years for the bad credit to fall off their credit report.

name: tanyaa1
review: I like wells fargo alot, the only downside is that my checking account doesn't allow me to receive transfers from other banks or even internal accounts. I absolutely love the easy access of it and enjoy the mobile banking services. The atm swipe at the counters saves a ton of time and makes it a much more pleasant experience.I am not a big fan of the $10 fee and dont see that it should be necessary for them to charge your account admist all the other fees that are out there.

name: Juan Cardona
review: I've had the Way2Save savings for aprox. 1 year now, I really like it. I know it's not that much of an interest rate but it works like a piggy bank. I've had some difficulty trying to stay above the 300 balance required to avoid the fee because of recurring emergencies, I don't make that much money and we are a low income family. Apart from that, I love how everytime I make a payment with my debit card it transfers money automatically to my savings since I linked my accounts. Very efficient, don't expect to make money from the interest rates but overall I trust this bank so that's why I have it.

name: Suzi Bell
review: The Dillard's Credit Card seems to be more practical than other store based cards in terms of not only it's Reward system in general, but the fact that it rewards for groceries, gas, and other items; not solely those purchased in the store. I've had Walmart and Best Buy credit cards and they definitely did not offer those options. Comparatively: the rest seems similar as far as APR, interest, late fee, grace period; your credit card basics. So it looks like if you have good credit and frequent Dillard's, get on it!

name: Katherine Dewett
review: We have had this checking account for several years.  The monthly fee is waved as long as you have direct deposit.  Every time I go into the branch, they staff is quick, efficient and very friendly.  At times they offer to help you sign up for a credit card or some other account, but a simple no thanks ends any sales pitch.  The website is awesome for all of your online banking needs, including mobile deposit and the smartphone apps, I do most of my deposits from my phone.  Bill Pay is easy to use, and helps me stay organized!  And if you have more than one account with them, they all appear together.  I have my car loan and savings account accessible from one place!

name: Lisa Lovings
review: We've had our account for several years now. I've had generally no problems with it, however, try as we might, we can't keep the balance over the $300 due to emergency needs(car, doctors, vets, etc). I really do wish there was such a thing as a savings account that didn't charge or fault you for needing to go below the minimum for emergencies. We are a lower middle class family, and struggle to live month to month on what we have. Watching what little money is left in our account dwindle away month by month because we simply don't have the extra to put back in is discouraging to me.

name: Lorraine Thiel
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for 10 years now. I've had no problems with the service in various locations from new jersey to Florida.  I had a problem with someone getting my credit card. They called me immediately after it happened and sent out a new debit card over night because I was about to go on vacation.  Good workThere are lots of locations all over the united states. I have no problems with how many withdrawals I can make or deposits. I absolutely love the mobile app they have. This saves me lots of time and gas money!

name: Nicole Hornbaker Langston
review: I've had credit cards in the past that offer rewards and love the points for every dollar spent system that Wells Fargo utilizes, especially the initial 5 points for every $1 spent in the first 6 months. This is a great way to earn gift cards or rack up air miles! I also find the 0% APR for 15 months on transfer incredibly useful. I have used this on similar visa cards and found it's a great way to transfer all your credit debt over to one card so you only have one payment to make per month, rather than multiple payments.  The only drawback is the annual APR, which can be as high as 25%. All the other fees and terms for this card are fair and in line with most major credit cards - so all in all a great card to have.

name: Barbara Verica
review: I went to Wells Fargo Bank where I have several accounts and credit cards.  I was talked into opening a cash back VISA card to use for the purchase of windows. My banker made the process very easy.  The account was opened and a week later I received the usual 14 pages of disclaimers and disclosures that change every month.  Never had a problem in the past.  I was also provided with a 'courtesy' check.  I used the check to pay for the windows thinking that it was a courtesy from the bank to use on a purchase.  A couple of days later I discovered that I had a $237 fee attached to my purchase.  I called the bank and explained.  They contacted Wells Fargo Credit Card Customer Service on my behalf. The banker argued with them (his own bank) for several hours.  He then contacted me to state they would not help me.  I could try to call them myself.  He advised me he did not understand why they refused to rescind the courtesy check and then I would charge the sale on my VISA card.  He did not see a problem with this.So I contacted them to ask the same question.  The answer I received was that they would not refund the fee because the bank 'did nothing wrong.' They referred to it as a balance transfer  and not a purchase. I never received any other explanation as to why they refused to allow me to correct the mistake.  It appears Wells Fargo Credit Card Services is more interested in taking your money than they are in keeping you as a customer.  THAT is not good customer service.

name: nate
review: Hi I’ve had this card for a year and three months...first off if you have stumbled upon this review consider yourself warned and lucky. This credit card is so stressful worth your time money and aggravation. Fist off its a secured credit card which means you need to send in a deposit and that will be your credit line. I’m not going to go through the whole painful process, but ill give you my experience. one it did help me build my credit. Two it takes at least 10 DAYS!!!!!!for them to post a payment. Their WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE WORLD!

name: Diego Canedo
review: I have had this card for over 2 years now. My business requires me to pay constantly for things using my credit card. Consequently, I make several payments a month to the card too, to free up space. For this reason, I have never been late, and I would think they would be happy with me as their customer.Anyhow, one day I made a large payment, because I needed the available credit to pay for a large transaction, and noticed that three days had passed and even though the payment clearly showed in the transactions of my card, the available credit did not change. I went ahead to pay for the transaction, and was notified that my card had been declined. I then called Wells Fargo to understand what was going on, and they told me that because the payment was unusually high, they can at their discretion place payments on hold, or float as they call it for a period of 30 days to verify the payment.What I came to found out was that Wells Fargo has the right to put any payments made to their credit cards coming from a different bank’s checking account on hold, to verify it (ridiculous to say the least). In other words, because I have a checking account with Bank of America, and made the payment from that account, they can decide to not post it, and place it on hold for up to 30 days.Honestly, who can run a business waiting 30 days for payments to clear? Moreover, who pays for someone else’s bills? I can understand holding large transactions, because it could have been a lost or stolen card, but to place holds on payments makes no sense.In the past 3 months, this has now happened more often and for smaller payment amounts. I am sorry but as a business owner, I do not have the time to call every two weeks to make sure the payment I made cleared on my account and help them verify it, so I can use my own credit card, and give them more business. Simply Absurd!

name: Jaimie
review: The reason they do this is because they can make money for 30 days with those funds. They get the wire transfers every night. Now it can even be instantaneous as we all know we can move money around immediately from count to count even if it's not at the same bank. This is not new technology. Banking institutions are always trying to keep your money for an extra day or an hour. If you've ever noticed that they someone will charge you a fee if you want your payment in a day or two days or they'll charge you one or 2% to get it immediately depending on whatever it may be. The reason for this is if they keep those funds for one or two days they use that money to make more money. I understand it seems small but imagine how many customers and how many people are banking with them or student loans or checking and savings CDs any type of transaction just within their banks Now imagine that with all the transactions they do with check deposits from other banks transfers they get that stuff that night but for every day they can hold it they're making more money lending out that money getting interest on that money and so on. 30 days is a ridiculous amount of time I don't care since 2000. So remember they always get your payment immediately They don't give it to you because they want to use your money.

name: Rui Xiang Ge
review: I used to bank at Wells Fargo - was always sold on and loved the fact that Wells Fargo has been in banking for years and knows what they're doing. Their logo, the Wells Fargo wagon, delivering money on the frontier, made me feel comfortable in banking with them. So when getting their Premier Checking Account set up, I though that the value of this account would be similar to other banks, if not significantly better. What I realized though over time is that the whole account is packed with high fees, requirements, and low returns. You need to keep a high minimum balance to avoid a fee, which essentially locks up a significant amount of money. The interest rate is significantly lower than other options - e.g. a money market account with check writing privileges can be found right now with an interest rate of 1%, Wells Fargo pays .01%. And, if you overdraft, there is a $35 fee. Honestly stressed me out too much. Switched to another checking account option.

name: Shelley Leppert
review: I never actually opened a checking account here.  I was a customer of Wachovia, which used to be First Union, and then I think there was another name change in there somewhere, so none of this inspired confidence, as you can imagine.  However, I was pleasantly surprised because I recently was the victim of identify theft.  Someone stole my debit card number and ordered thousands of dollars worth of items from my checking account.  Naturally I was extremely upset, just besides myself with worry and sickness, however, I need not have been so upset because after one phone call with the bank my money was provisionally back in my account and in the end the bank covered all of the expenses.  I made it my business to call the companies involved to make sure that the items fraudulently ordered never made it to the destination they were intended, as well.  I feel the bank should have done this, but they would not, so I did.  All in all, I was satisfied with the outcome.

name: Krysta Sink
review: I switched from my small local bank to Wells Fargo over a year ago and have not been disappointed yet. I love that Wells Fargo offers online banking, as I've now moved to a location where there is not an ATM near by. It is super beneficial and easy to use the check deposit feature on their mobile app. This mobile app is my lifeline, as I frequently need to transfer money between my checking, savings, and credit card accounts. I also love that Wells Fargo will reimburse you for suspicious activity on your account. I recently had money being taken out and the company was not willing to help, Wells Fargo was there to save the day and investigate the fraudulent activity. Additionally, coming out of college I did not have the best credit. Wells Fargo helped to apply for a Secure Card that is backed by money to help me increase my credit score. After a year of having this card the money will be released to me and it will function as a normal credit card. I have no complaints with this company yet!

name: Thomas King
review: I have been using the Way2Save account for about 6 years now.  I love how low the fees are and how well it integrates with my checking account.  If my checking account overdraws then the Way2save will automatically try to transfer funds into my checking account so that i don't have to pay an overdraft fee.  The customer service for Wells fargo is top notch and while the account doesn't have the highest of interest rates, its consistent and very safe.

name: Mark B
review: My favorite features of my Way2Save account are the low fees and ease of use. I have automatic monthly transfers from my Checking account in order to make sure I save for the future. I greatly appreciate the linked account overdraft protection I get with this account. It's the only savings account I've ever had and I plan on keeping it that way for the foreseeable future! Wells Fargo has always been very helpful in resolving any kinds of issues I run into with any of my three accounts. They have quickly cleared up any and all fraud issues I've had over the past 10 years.

name: Jason N Mastros
review: After nearly two years with Wells Fargo checking, I am thoroughly pleased. I like the online banking access, and every time I have had any kind of issue, the Wells Fargo staff (either local or on the help line) have been willing to assist. Even when I brought problems to the Wells Fargo staff that orginated with other institutions, the staff has always gone out of its way to assist. Overall, my experience with Wells Fargo checking has been so positive that I would consider using other financial services they offer.

name: Amanda Pratt
review: I have had Wells Fargo accounts in the past. I really enjoyed the customer service at my local branch. Unfortunately, the monthly fees to me are ridiculous. I live paycheck to paycheck and couldn't keep a certain amount maintained in my account to avoid to the service charges, so in the end it made me search for another branch. I do have to say the customer service is on point at every Wells Fargo I ever visited though!

name: Kim
review: I've been a customer of Wells Fargo since I was 8 years old. It was called "Central Fidelity" back then, switched to Wachovia and then Wells Fargo. Overall, their business practices are pretty standard within the industry. They are a for-profit company and it shows. One of their most frustrating practices though, is that each morning, they put through debits to the account before they put through deposits. This means that if you've setup a transaction to debit knowing you have a deposit to back it up, you could potentially overdraft. I find this to be shady and deceptive. They act like they care about the consumer but their practices say otherwise.

name: Kristan M Hall
review: After needing a quick $2000 loan from my bank I was sick by the advertised APR so they told me about this bank called Wells Fargo and I went to them. After meeting with a young and very eager Associate I was leaving 3 hours later with a car loan for a wonderful New Cobalt.(mind you this was a couple years ago) Well after getting an amazing deal for the below average credit I had at the time, I was able to get a good fee and got the car a couple days later. After a couple months I wanted to change vehicles since it was no longer meeting my needs. The new associate I talked to was even newer and less experienced, he told me they couldn't do that then after talking to someone who has been there, they said bring everything in and they would see what they could do. Well after 3 more hours I was told I was stuck with it and there was nothing that they could do to get me out of this contract but they could make a new contract for another vehicle, even though I couldn't afford it and they saw this on paper. They approved me for it and I ended up defaulting in 3 months because everything was going to a $350 car payment and a  $400 SUV payment and all the other rent and utilities I pay, I wanted to get out of it and they were talking about extending my loan so it would take longer to pay at a lower rate and they would make more. I was definitely not better off after this learning experience.

name: Matthew Williams
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo (and formally Wachovia) since I graduated high school. I have always enjoyed the customer service and warm smiles I get, every time I go inside. I have never had any issues with my account. I wish, instead of letting my account overdraft for $35, that it would simply decline my card. I have really enjoyed using the App, as well. I am able to do mobile banking, including depositing checks straight from my phone and having some of the funds available immediately. Many of my friends, who bank elsewhere, are very jealous of this and are also jealous that I can make cash and check deposits at the ATM.

name: Jesse Figueroa
review: I've had a great experience with my College checking account with Wells Fargo so far. I got this account as my first bank account with Wells Fargo. I have a 20 dollar minimum balance, and I haven't encountered any kind of strange or hidden fees being subtracted from my account. Transferring money from my checking to savings or paying using my debit card has been effortless, and I like their online service that allows you to view your account and set up bill pay, etc.

name: Megan Kimball
review: I like this card and have had it ever since I was a freshman in college. I have payed my bill on time and always tried to pay a good amount back, and because of this my credit limit has been raised. I feel like this is a good starter card for someone who has never had a credit card because it teaches you to be responsible. The cash rewards are easy to use and there are great things you can buy with them. Even more products have been added recently! I definitely recommend this card.

name: Joel Ruiz
review: You pay the money back online. I had a job when I got it, but I told them I was going to college and wouldn't be working for a while. I got approved for $800

name: Carrie Dansby
review: I have really enjoyed my way2save account. The fact that it is linked to my checking account is very efficient for saving money quite well. However, it sometimes makes me tight on money after several uses, since $1.00 comes out of your checking into you savings every time you use your debit card, no matter how small the purchase. There is a $5.00 monthly fee if you let your account drop below $300, which is good so long as you avoid withdrawing from your account. Even in an emergency, $5 isn’t too bad.  My previous bank charged $10. The interest rate here is pretty low, as to be expected from a savings account. Overall, I am very pleased with my savings account. Wells Fargo has been a wonderful bank to me.

name: Brandon Oscar
review: This account is pretty good overall. However, I have had some issues with meeting the requirements for it to be free. I have to have an automatic transfer of $25 from this checking account to my savings account every month, which to be honest is really annoying. I forgot about this automatic transfer one month and made some purchases with my debit card, which resulted in my account being overdrawn. Thankfully, Wells Fargo was very understanding about the situation and reversed my overdraft fees for me. I wouldn't recommend this account unless you don't mind having an auto transfer happen every month.

name: Thomas King
review: This Wells Fargo Premier Checking Account has been quite good.  Since I've changed from my old checking account I've been nothing but satisfied with the account.  The customer service is quick and pain free unlike most banking experiences.   The interest rate is average but it suffices for a checking account.  The contract is cut and dry; you understand from day one what will and will not be charged to your account and when you think something is unfair its very easy to call Wells Fargo and figure out if you are eligible for a refund.

name: Matt Bryan
review: This checking account is amazing! I was given one for free at the age of 15, and I am now 19 and still using it. The advisor who set it up for me was courteous and friendly and gave me everything I needed to get it started. If you're under 18, this account is free until you turn 18. The fees, however, are easily avoided by doing things monthly, such as reaching a certain number of transactions and maintaining a daily balance. The only downside is that mobile check deposit is unavailable to me using this account.

name: Nichole Matteo
review: I was a Wells Fargo customer very briefly. I quickly closed my account after being fed up with the constant up-selling. It doesn’t matter if you’re at the drive up teller, in a branch, or on the phone, I have never been able to do any banking business without them trying to add a service, credit card, etc. Very annoying! If you can get past that or you have a ton of patience, their services might be good but I never got that far. Tellers seemed friendly enough, however the agents answering their customer service line have been pretty rude to me. I’d skip big banks all together and go to a Credit Union!

name: Marc simpson
review: wells fargo pma has a great checking account. One of the best things about this account is the great interest rate. This encourages me to always keep as much money as I can in this account. Another great benefit about this checking account is that there is no monthly fee for this account, which is always great. Overall  if you are looking for a great bank to keep your money this is a must have account.

name: Robbie Martin
review: I've been a Wells Fargo customer for over 20 years, and am very satisfied with them. I like the PMA account for a number of reasons, although the minimum balance required to avoid service charge is high. I live part-time in Mexico and I love Wells Fargo's Express Send service where I can send myself money directly to my Mexican bank account (or to someone else's account, or in cash for someone to pick up at a local bank). With the PMA account I pay a reduced fee for this service, and in addition, I have two free ATM withdrawals a month (in Mexico) with this account. There are times when I end up paying the monthly service charge because I don't keep the minimum balance, but overall, it balances out because of the savings on Express Send and ATM fees. Wells Fargo customer service in general has always been fairly good, although they seem to have a lot of turnover at individual bank branches.

name: Delilah Dugo
review: I had Wells Fargo all throughout college. They were amazing and it was nice to get the free checking account under the student program they had. the online banking its pretty nicely set up and its easy to move around. I still use Wells Fargo for my only credit card because of how they treat me and make sure i'm updated on all their new agreements and changes.

name: Brianna Gillett
review: This checking account is very easy to use, but it does have some downfalls. For example, the account automatically gets assessed monthly fees if you do not have an auto transfer set up between your checking and savings account. This can be quite annoying when you're trying to balance your books each month. Aside from that, it is a great checking account! The online banking features on Wells Fargo's website are very user-friendly, and their customer service has always been good in my opinion.

name: jesse
review: I opened a Wells Fargo Money market account about 3 years ago. I think that it was very easy to open and I love the fact that there is no minimum amount to start with. So, I started with a small amount and just added more and more money each month. Which has a compound effect. The rate for the money market account is not the greatest but no money market account really is. They are all low. My favorite part is that there is no fees involved. I don't have to worry about getting nickeled and dimed every which way I look.So, over all I would recommend them to anyone that is trying to start saving money and doesn't have a lot of it.

name: Logitech Scotch
review: I really love the bank Wells Fargo and its whole interface. If you apply to this card as a new customer you get 0% no interest for one whole year. Also earning reward points on this card is really easy if you are a gas guzzler. You get 5% cash back rewards for every gas fill up. Overall I really love the Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card for all the benefits it provides me.

name: robert davis
review: I have held a wells fargo checking account since they purchased Wachovia.  As an account holder at Wachovia, i was a little worried about the change, but I couldn't be happier with everything wells fargo has done.  I was able to keep my account number and "Way to save" account linked.  My debit card is linked and i recently received the new card (complete with the chip for more security.  This is a good thing, because my card number has actually be stolen many times.  Customer service has been great, as they quickly reach out to me with any questionable purchases on my debit card and quickly erase any unwanted/stolen charges (no questions asked).  I couldn't be happier as a wells fargo customer and will continue to be a loyal checking account holder of theirs for the future.

name: Jonathan Darrow
review: I have had several credit cards over my life and I would not consider this one very good.  Not only is the interest rate high there are annual fees as well. The grace period is a nice feature but overall there are better credit cards out there

name: Joel Cade
review: We have had Way2Save savings account with Wells Fargo for quite a while. It is set up to automatically transfer a single dollar per debit card transaction from our associated checking account to our savings account. This is a nice feature to build savings without really feeling the pinch. The interest rate is low, but that seems to be just be the nature of things with savings accounts like this. The online interface is nice and functional, and it's easy to set up recurring transfers and such. I would recommend Wells Fargo Way2Save savings accounts to WF account holders. It is a nice addition to an existing checking account.

name: Joel Cade
review: We have had Wells Fargo since they acquired Wachovia years ago. They have always been quick to resolve issues and helpful. Their online tools are great, especially the ability to deposit checks via a mobile device. I wish their ATM fees were not as high as they are. All around, I think Wells Fargo provides a decent option for a checking/bill-pay provider. I would recommend them to anyone that asked.

name: Daniel Espinosa
review: I've put down a reasonable amount of money down on a CD at Wells Fargo for my son whenever he's of age to be out on his own. I talked to the representative at my local Wells Fargo branch and they easily were able to hook me up with a 5 year CD. I plan to continually put this money back into another CD after these 5 years. The representative helped me in a fast and understanding fashion, it was almost effortless. I simply had to tell her what I wanted to do and she helped me set it up immediately. I have had nothing but a great experience with Wells Fargo.  I had no problems whatsoever setting it up and I would definitely do it again.

name: Daniel Espinosa
review: I've been a Wells Fargo member for a very long time. My parents went in with me to open my first bank account with them when I was in high school. I've had no problems whatsoever with this bank account, I have several under my name. I regularly check my account balance online which is incredibly simple to use and your history of charges is easy to follow. The interest in your savings account is laughable, but most banks basic savings are. I've had no problems with any kind of hidden fee or an overdraft, minimum account balance, etc. The only thing I dislike is how their online service keeps on wanting you to apply for their online services before you view your account. It can get annoying at times. Otherwise, I've had nothing but a good experience with Wells Fargo.

name: Candice Hopkins
review: Wells Fargo is the biggest nickel and dime you to death bank I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with.  And then, when they "mistakenly" deposited my pay check into someone else's account, that was the last straw.  I left and never turned back.  Well I should say I left and never turned back after almost 2 weeks of haggling to get MY money put into MY account.  Just avoid at all costs.

name: nathan mormann
review: Solid checking account and customer service.  Very friendly and personable when calling in for issues.  Good online experience and interface.Nothing incredible in terms of disclosures or differentiated checking products, but very solid overall.

name: AMY DUNCAN
review: I started with Wells Fargo about 1 year ago. Let me start off my saying that I have been happy. I do not like the fact that they outsource the customer service to half English speakers. But I can tell that they are progressing. I called and had my problem resolved in 1 minute mechanically. Overall I have been given great offers and I just applied for a secured credit card and maybe I will buy a house in the future with them. The last time I called I finished in less that 5 minutes and the representative was great. To sum it all up, best bank I have done business with.

name: hunter
review: I recently opened a Wells Fargo checking account and overall I am happy but I do have some issues.  The fees are a little high especially the monthly fee.  I think the value checking account may be better for me.  The foreign transaction fees are high with this bank so I am considering other banks that do not charge them.

name: Tammy
review: I had Way 2 Save for a long time. Every time I swiped my card,it would deduct 1.00 from my checking into my savings: great for a family that makes adequate money, but I have to pinch pennies to come up with enough for groceries a month. It was nice to link the account to my checking account, but that came with an automatic overdraft protection at a rate of 12.50/transaction. At least 3 times,  had to dispute these transactions because the bank transferred money and charged me, even when I had the funds to cover the charge. Combine these drawbacks with the ridiculously low interest rate and I had to leave Wells Fargo. I'm with a credit union now and enjoying the benefits that comes along with it!

name: Robyn
review: We recently refinanced our mortgage through Wells Fargo.  It was a smooth, easy process.  Much easier than I had anticipated.  The paperwork was quickly sent to us, and we faxed it back.  We kept in touch with them a few times a week during the process, and they promptly returned our calls to answer any questions we had.  The appraisal was easy to set up and completed in a timely manner.  When we closed, they sent an agent to our house to sign paperwork with us, which was great since we have kids and didn't have to worry about finding a sitter.  We got a great rate, and are saving a ton of money.  I would definitely finance a mortgage with Wells Fargo again!

name: Brian Johnson
review: I’ve been a customer of WF for almost 16 years.  I’ve had a Way2Save checking account for the last 4 and during that time I’ve enjoyed working with Wells Fargo.  I got the account because my wife and I wanted to set up an account for “fun.  That would also allow us to keep an eye on how much we were spending outside of our normal bills and insure that we weren’t overspending and were putting enough money into savings each month.  The account setup was extremely easy and the person we were working with at the branch was friendly and knowledgeable.  Anytime I have a questions about cards, checks, or anything else related I call and they take care of it immediately.  It’s a great account to have.  The only think you should watch out for are the fees involved.  They can really bite you if you’re not careful.

name: Sherese Rodriguez
review: I simply love my Wells Fargo Business Market Rate savings account.  It was super easy to open my business savings account.  My business banker was so helpful.  She also was very patient because I had my children with me and they were being a handful.  I really love the incredible ease of which I can access my account online.  There are so many business money management tools to choose from online.  Amazing!  And, best of all the monthly fees are super low if you don't meet your account minimum balance each month - for small business owners, that's a HUGE plus!!!

name: Dave
review: Overall I have been extremely satisfied with this checking account. The customer service has been fantastic. The tellers at the local branches are courteous, polite and efficient. I went in two weeks ago to my local branch and asked for some rolls for coins. The customer service rep advised as long as I am a checking account holder I can have all I want. I asked her if there was anything special I needed to do when I deposited the rolled coins (like write my account number on them or have a deposit slip) she advised as long as I have my debit card I could swipe it at the counter and then hand her as many rolls of coins as I had. Truly great customer service with a smile.

name: Sami Sullivan
review: This checking account is a scam at the most, and annoying at the least. It's a cute concept to send money to my savings account, and "force" me to save. However, it does things like, put money into my savings account BEFORE all of the pending charges go through. Then charges me a fee for having to transfer money from my savings account. Wells Fargo customer service has always given me the transfer fee back when I call and complain about it, but it's a big oversight that should be fixed and I shouldn't have to deal with it.

name: Sue Smith
review: I opened up my Wells Fargo Way 2 Save savings account several years ago when I opened up my Essential Checking account.  They recommended that I open up both accounts for two reasons.  Firstly my savings account would serve as an overdraft fund on any occasion in which my checking account ran out of funds.  The money would then come out of my Way 2 Save account without any fees or penalties.  Secondly, I can set up a certain amount (say $10 a week) to automatically come out of my checking account so that it is easy to build my savings up a little at a time.  As long as a minimum of five dollars is kept in the account there is no monthly fee.  Overall I am happy with this Wells Fargo savings account.

name: Lauren S
review: We have been banking with Wells Fargo for many years and this account type has definitely served our needs.  We have never been hit with a fee because the requirements for maintaining the account are minimal: essentially, if you are working even part time with direct deposit, you should be able to meet the requirements to have the fee waived.  In other news, the customer service we have at Wells Fargo is fantastic and we feel comfortable speaking with our banker about our needs.

name: Stephanie
review: I have two accounts with different financial institutions and Wells Fargo is my absolute favorite. The customer service that I receive both online and in the branch is second to none. The staff in my local branch always goes above and beyond to make sure that all of my needs are met and I feel valued as a customer. Even when the line is long and I need to wait, they keep me apprised of how much longer it will be, always apologetic and thanking me for my patience. I can't say that I have ever had a bad experience with Wells Fargo and will remain a loyal customer for a very long time.

name: Michael Flynn
review: I looked into this credit card while researching the Capital one secured credit card and I definitely prefer Wells Fargo. Its annual fee is only $25 which is a little lower than Capital One's $29 annual fee. The APR for Wells Fargo's card is very competitive at 18.99% which beats Capital One's 24.9%. As a bonus, you are also given access to  free online credit education courses to help you manage your credit. The only complaint I have is that, at $300, the security deposit is a bit steep. However, given the rest of the Wells Fargo secured credit card features, I feel that it's a great card overall for someone who is trying to rebuild their credit.

name: Aaron Bronson
review: The Dillard's Store credit card is great for me because I love shopping at Dillard's and they constantly run promotions where if you make a qualifying purchase you get a really nice financing option for it.  I've taken advantage of several of these and it's allowed me to get a bunch of really nice stuff that I wouldn't have been able to get otherwise.

name: Greg Killroy
review: I used to be with wells fargo because my parents had an account there and they liked it. The main issue I had was that unless you keep thousands in your account at all times, you may run into problems. Occasionally I would notice that I would be charged a $10.00 monthly fee to my checking account, for no good reason other than because I didn't have a lot of money in there. I mean how does that even make sense? Charge me more money because I don't have a lot in there? I left wells fargo and went with a credit union that doesn't try to nickle and dime me.

name: Valerie Artrip
review: I love our Wells Fargo checking account.  It's easy to manage and since we have our home mortgage with them too our monthly fee is waived.  We have been members for over 15 years and anytime we had a issue if our card was stolen or lost they have been very easy to work with.  I have nothing but great things to say about Wells Fargo and we will continue to bank with them.

name: Myles Lindeburg
review: I generally do not like store credit cards, even if they are all purpose cards, as their points are usually only earned on store purchases. This card looks to be a little different.  I like the fact you can also achieve double points on groceries and gasoline, which is very much like the Barclay rewards card I carry. Except, that the rewards on this Dillard's card can only be turned in for Dillard gift cards, while most other reward card can actually be turned in for statement credit to be used on anything or even against your bill balance.

name: dexterm1
review: I love Wells Fargo and have been a customer of theirs for many years.  This Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card has solid features but nothing that really stands out.  The ability to earn bonus points at specific retailers and for the first six months of the card is nice, but I earn better rewards on my Capitol One card, and the rewards are simpler (simply cash back) on my USAA Mastercard.  I prefer rewards programs that are simpler: just give me cash back, not redemption points (although these points can be redeemed for cash, obviously.)  The real problem with this card, for me, is the 3% foreign transaction fee.  That's just a killer for me as I do a fair amount of international travel.  With a foreign transaction fee that high I couldn't have this as my primary credit card.  As I said, I really appreciate Wells Fargo's customer service and support but if you plan to use the card in foreign countries you can do a lot better, and that's a big deal for me.

name: Dennis Cowell
review: Like any other card, there are always pro's and con's. The pro's of this card is that I have free cell phone insurance. I use Verizon and have a family of four. The card covers all phones and is only a $25 deductible with no monthly charge. I saved $336 and I don't have to worry about Verizon's $100 deductible. There is no annual fee for this card and the customer service is perfect. The downfall is that the 5% cash back rate is only for 6 months then its 1% for every purchase no matter what it is or quarter it is with no cap. I found that the higher rewards cards have annual fee's and rotating categories or exclusions that can be confusing. Overall, my first year I saved the $1,011 in cell phone costs (monthly insurance charge plus deductible reduction and $600 phone replacement) and $200 in rewards. This is just fine in my book.

name: Talitha GabriElle
review: I love Wells Fargo, and this card is great! This is my second credit card. I applied for this card last Fall and wasn't approved, so I had to go with another card. That card, which I will not mention the name of, was ok, but I really wanted to go with Wells Fargo because I had just opened up checking and savings accounts with them. Now that I have it, I love it! There is NO annual fee, the APR rate isn't bad, and if you're already banking with Wells Fargo, it's easier to pay it off.The people who work at Wells Fargo are great, as well. They have excellent customer service, and I cannot recall a time where I have been disappointed by their service. The approval was fast and easy, and my card was delivered in less time than expected! This card also has awesome security features, and alerts to help you keep track of your payments and spending. This card is great for building your credit, and I highly recommend it.

name: Brian Rooney
review: I've had my Way2Save account with Wells Fargo for about 4 years now. During that time it seem as if the policies have changed considerably with regards to ATM fees. Fees can be charged on top of a special charge for international withdrawals for example. The basic services of the bank are average overall. Customer service however is typically helpful in resolving issues although I would recommend going to a branch rather than trying to work it out over the phone. I would recommend this account to students but a long term solution should be found elsewhere.

name: Rebecca
review: I had an account with Wells Fargo and closed it 1 year ago. I didn't like all of their fees and I just didn't think the customer service was great. The checking accounts they offer are ok but I feel like there are hidden fees that they don't tell you about.

name: Michelle Rodriguez
review: My experience with Wells Fargo overall has been a poor one. My most serious issue that I've had with them is that they post payments once I make them but then take them off and re post them days later. Sometimes they'll be pending for about 3 days then come off and re post 5 days later which is really annoying. None of the other banks that I've been with have done that. This caused a serious issue because I have them linked to pay my mortgage and I ended up paying fees to them and my mortgage company for NSF fees because Wells Fargo took off some payments so I assumed I had enough money to pay the mortgage and then days later I got some emails about NSF from my mortgage company. It is least to say that I am no longer banking with them and have been doing my banking with a local credit union which is much better.

name: Peter Shadi
review: Generally the service has been excellent.  The only issue we have faced is that my wife, who has been a co-signer on the account for 17 years, suddenly could not perform transactions over the phone because she was not an "authorized user."  It took multiple phone calls to the central service line and to the local branch were required to straighten out the problem.  One issue is that the bank has changed owners several times since we first opened the account--From First Fidelity to First Union to Wachovia to Wells Fargo. Eventually, the did find the original signature card on file and all was made whole.

name: Trevor Coke
review: I have had many saving accounts in my life some good, some bad. But the wells Fargo Way2save savings account is by far one of the best accounts i have ever had. first of all this account allows you to link with your checking which is very convenient. It also helps you save! How do you ask? well this savings account links with your debit card and reward you with money every time you used your debit card. Having this account is a no-brainer, who would not want an account where u can actually save money as you make purchases. This account also has top notch security so it is very safe. Overall i give my experience with this account 5 stars.

name: Michael N Elly Suarez
review: I have had Wells Fargo for just a few months. I switch to them in hopes to find a bank that is caring and is somewhat personable. So far, Wells Fargo has delivered. My husband and I struggled with credit and our Wells Fargo personal banker has been there to hold our hands since the day we met him. We are on our way to increasing our credit score thanks to Wells Fargo and it's employees. I called the customer service center to file a dispute and they completed their investigation in less than 48 hrs. Within an hr of calling in the dispute my funds were returned to my account.

name: Gabrielle Coats
review: I like my account with Wells Fargo.  I don't have any complaints.  When I did have an issue with my account their customer service was very understanding and helpful.  I've also lost my card a few times and the process for getting another debit card is really customer friendly.  I was able to get a temporary card that same day and have my permanent card mailed to me.  I've been with the company for 4 years and I've had only positive interactions with them.

name: Max Jetts
review: I wasn't a big fan of the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card. It's like prepaid cards in that you have to load it your own money to use as a credit line but it comes with an annual fee and you still have interest charged to it.  It is a tradeoff though. With this you do get some standard card benefits like roadside assistance and the like but it still feels weird to me to get interest and annual fees when you have to put your own money up.If you're looking to build your credit and don't have much of a history, I would recommend one of the prepaid cards over this one. I've also had mixed experience with their customer service. I would recommend the American Express Serve prepaid card over this. It doesn't have the benefits but it also doesn't charge you fees or interest. And the customer service is great.

name: Anita B
review: Prepaid cards do not build credit.

name: Elicia
review: I've had a checking account (and other accounts) with Wells for the past 12+ years and have had almost exclusively good experiences.  On more than one occasion I've either lost or had my debit card associated with my account stolen and the Bankers have always guided me through the process of closing the card and getting a new card quickly and with the least amount of headache.  The staff at the 2 local branches I go to are AMAZING and always make me feel important.  I was really bummed when the manager at my favorite location transferred, but he continued to help me with a few things I had in process even after he'd relocated to another branch.  He definitely didn't have to do that, and it's actions like that which are above and beyond that will ensure I stay a customer of Wells Fargo for many years to come.

name: Samantha Vale
review: I was given a savings account when I opened a free student checking account, and rarely use it, but I leave money in this specific account because it has overdraft protection to my checking account. Instead of paying $35 overdraft fee, it is only $12.50 if I accidentally overdraft, which is nice! Although I don't really ever overdraft, I like being reassured that I have that option.

name: Bryan
review: I like banking with Wells Fargo since there is always an ATM around to use and plenty of branches to go to in person.  The account is very basic and not a lot of bells and whistles.  I was able to get some of the fees waved by making sure I had direct deposit.  I like that there is no fees to transfer money to others.  I have had good customer service but I have had my card frozen due to "suspicious" at in opportune times.  I make a lot of online transactions and their security is very sensitive to multiple purchases in a short amount of time.  I like having the security but think its too much some times. It was easy to fix but the timing sucked.

name: Stephanie Ann
review: I love the points system of the credit card.  I tend to look for credit cards that have good rewards systems because there are times when I do spend a lot and I want to get rewarded for using my credit card instead of cash or a debit card.  The late fee is slightly higher than my other credit cards but the other features seem to be pretty similar to my Lord and Taylor credit card.  The interest rates are average compared to other offers as well.

name: Carrie Throckmorton
review: I have had the same checking account since 1985 - it has bounced around between Central Fidelity, Jefferson Bank, Wachovia, and has now landed at Wells Fargo.  Overall, the experience with Wells Fargo has been pretty good- they have great customer service and also worked with me one on one when I had an identity theft issue.  I would prefer a checking account with a better interest rate, but otherwise I am content where I am.

name: Linda Kasem
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for 7 years. I have always had great customer service and absolutely no problems with them. They're a great bank but the only thing I don't like is the monthly fee. Lots of banks have gotten rid of their monthly fees. If WF ever increases it, I will switch banks. $84 a year is a lot to be paying just for having "access" to their bank.

name: Joshua Lockerby
review: I like how Wells Fargo Rewards card offers significantly more reward options than other rewards cards. Also, the amount of points you receive per dollar spent is quite a bit better than others I have used such as Capitol One Rewards program. The two downfalls of this card are the high interest rate and high fees for cash advances, although these pretty much line up with the rest of the credit cards I've used so its mostly the norm. Also, its nice how you have 0% interest rate for 15months.

name: Quiana Gibson
review: Dillards card is ok, I have had it for over 10 years.  Dont use it that much anymore since I dont shop there as often as before.  But it works as intended, the APR isnt the highest Ive seen but isnt the lowest either.  I like the reward points system where you are allowed to accumulate $10 or 10% off purchases.

name: Ana-Maria Cirstea
review: I have used Wells Fargo for years without a problem, but they have not particularly wowed me, either. The customer service has been very helpful so far; they are knowledgeable and always answer my questions politely.

name: Robin Catrett
review: My husband and I got this card to help build our credit. So far we are very pleased. We received and incentive of 0% interest for the first 12 months which is amazing. Wells Fargo customer service for this card is also out of this world. I had a little mishap with a charge and the representative was very understanding and polite while helping us. The company reports monthly to your credit report and already our scores have jumped a great bit which was the whole purpose of getting the card. I would recommend anyone to give this company a chance.

name: Jon C.
review: Opened a savings account when I opened my checking account with wells fargo about a year ago. Unlike other banks there is no fee for withdrawing money from that account, which I like. Though I try to never touch the money in there. As long as I maintain a certain balance withing the savings account I avoid the monthly fee of $5. The best thing I like about this savings account is that every week when my paycheck is directly deposited into my checking account I was able to set an amount to automatically be deducted and put into the saving account. I have actually been able to save up more easily now with this feature. Interest rates are not to great since I dont have a whole lot of money in there. But that's not what I got it for. I just wanted a place to start saving a little here and there, and this way2save savings account has provided everything I need in a basic saving account.  I am quite pleased with it.

name: Katy Askeland
review: I have been researching options to help me rebuild my credit and the Well Fargo Card does not seem to be the best option. The variable interest fee of 18.99% and the deposit amount of $300 is higher than other secured card options available such as the Open Sky Visa, which has a variable interest fee of 17.5% with a minimum $200 deposit required. The Wells Fargo Card does however, offer smart chip technology, offering extra security against fraudulent usage, whereas the Open Sky Visa doesn't. Before applying for a secure credit card, I would recommend doing some research to view the many options out there and choosing the one that best meets the qualifications that are most important to you.

name: Wendy Schwartz
review: Open Sky is for people who may or may not have current Checking Accounts or Savings accounts.  I am looking for a good credit-building card and although I understand the high-deposit issues with the Wells Fargo card, I have been a Wells Fargo Checking Account Customer since 2004 and have "Platinum Status" on my Debit Cards (I have 3 Debit Accounts and 1 IRA Account currently).  So what I'm saying is were you already a Wells Fargo customer/did you have an active Checking Account when you applied for the Wells Fargo Secured Card?  And if so...did you find that being a current/longstanding customer with Wells Fargo was helpful or not in terms of eventually establishing unsecured credit and/or benefits and rewards of the secured card?

name: Catherine Paolillo
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer since 2001. They have always been helpful from offering me custom products and services to resolving disputes and problems. Once a bank teller realized I was being overcharged for a checking account and offered me a cheaper product. You don't often hear about banks trying to save the customer money!

name: Jeffrey Martinez
review: Love this credit card. Wells fargo has always been good to me, and the cashback rewards are pretty good. They are a little stingy. I would you could get a little more money back for buying certain things, but that hasn't happened for this card yet. Customer service is great, they're always more than happy to answer my questions. The interest rate isn't terrible, and the monthly payments are manageable. You also get to use wells fargo's online banking which is probably the best online banking service that I know of. It's easy and really dependable. And paying bills on their online service is also very easy. Just input the company, and you're pretty much good to go. Set it on auto pay, and you shouldn't have any problems.

name: Cason King
review: Even though there is no annual fees, the other costs of this card (foreign transaction fee, cash advance fee, APR) is pretty high.  If you don't trigger those fees and you shop at Dillards often, this may be a good option for you.  However, AMEX cards do usually have slightly higher fees than Visa or Mastercards.  I probably wouldn't recommend this card unless you're a Dillard's regular.

name: Cason King
review: The Wells Fargo card is a solid credit card.  It offers the industry standard of 1 point/$1.   And on particular categories, it offers you 5 points/$1.  Unfortunately, this bonus only lasts for 6 months as to where other cards offer this for the life of the card.  However, those other cards charge big yearly fees as to where this card has none.  Also, you get all the benefits of having a Visa which is accepted almost everywhere.  Charging foreign transaction fees is also a pain, but again, it's a zero annual fee card so you lose a few of the perks.  All in all, a solid choice for those who don't want to pay a yearly fee.

name: Amanda Stover
review: This account is fine for my needs. I liked it when I had a direct deposit going into it every two weeks. However, I am no longer working, and it bothers me that I have to pay a fee every month for not having a direct deposit. That's the only complaint I have, though; every time I've had a question or a concern, it has been resolved very quickly. I am impressed with Wells Fargo and I will be sticking with them for a long time.

name: Catherine Paolillo
review: I have had my Wells Fargo Way 2 Save savings and checking account combo for several years now. The interest rate isn't great, especially since I don't have  a lot of money in there, but it is a convenient and easy to use service. I like that it automatically takes a dollar from my checking account for every purchase. It makes it really easy to save money. I also like that it backs up my checking account for any possible over draft charges. I was, however, surprised that I was penalized for making too many withdrawls in a single month. I lost my job and was frustrated that I had to pay to use my own money in an emergency.

name: Sarah Marshall
review: I used to have a Wells Fargo checking account a while back. It was horrible. I mean, the actual service provided wasn't bad, but their fees made everything just not worth it. They charged you a fee for everything. I mean, they even charge a fee to pay your bill online...who does that? After checking out how much money they take out of your account just for using them as a bank, it really feels like they are a huge rip off. I decided to leave wells fargo and take my business elsewhere.

name: Christopher
review: I currently have a Wells Fargo way 2 save account and I think its great. It basically just every time you make a purchase with your Wells Fargo debit card it takes $1 extra out and puts it into you way 2 save account. I think its great because your putting a little something extra away every time with out really noticing that your doing it. I think its easier to save this way and if you need it for emergency situations you can transfer the money from your way 2 save account to one of your personal checking accounts to cover something.

name: Catherine Paolillo
review: I love my Way2Save Checking account. I've been a Wells Fargo customer since 2001. Way2Save makes it easy to put money away, but I mostly stick with WF because of their customer service. I recently had to report some fraudulent charges on my account and they responded promptly, returned my money, and communicated with me during the entire investigation process. I was shocked. I don't find that level of service with a lot of companies these days.

name: Lorraine
review: I have had my wellsfargo savings account for almost 6 years. I originally opened it to save money and not be charged for my checking account and do not regret it! I can easily transfer between my savings and checking account online and have never had a problem with the bank depositing in the proper account. Of course I wish the interest rate would be higher (who wouldn't) I usually use the money in that account as an emergency fund and not really as a way to gain money through interest. The savings account fits my basic needs and allows me to store my money somewhere safely without any fees.

name: Lorraine
review: I have been banking with this company for over 6 years. The staff are always friendly and take care of my business efficiently. There was a point in time when they were going to start charging me for my checking account. I went to the bank and was going to close my account and move it to another bank that would not charge me. The man that assisted me offered to open a savings account and bypass the fees as long as I included the way2save feature. I thought it was a fair compromise and accepted. I've not had issues since. Usually everyone that works at the bank is on top of their job and it doesn't matter what branch I go to in any city I've never had a problem.

name: Shayna A
review: For someone just starting out or trying to rebuild credit the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card seems like a good option.A big plus is the annual fee is only $25.  That's cheaper than a lot of unsecured credit cards.  The regular APR is 18.99% which is high but if you don't plan to carry a balance you don't need to worry about it.I like the fact that it has built in budgeting tools as that can be challenging when dealing with credit cards. For comparison sakes I also looked at the Capitol One secured card. That card has a 22.9% APR and a $29 annual fee.  Both cards offer travel emergency and roadside assistance services.  Both cards are also issued by a well known bank which is a plus.If you are desperate to build/rebuild credit and don't plan to carry a large balance then the Wells Fargo card is a good option.

name: Kasey Bilik
review: I used to be very pleased with Wells Fargo when it was Wachovia, but after the merger years ago they have increased fees, and even added fees, to account that were once free. In order for my checking account to be free of fees I have to have my paycheck direct deposited into it. In order for my standard savings account (not the Way-to-Save) to be free of fees I have to maintain a balance of greater than $2,000.00. To know your balance on through the ATM there is a $2.00 charge. I can’t say I am pleased, but I have been banking with them for over 10 years and they are everywhere, so it is more of convenience than want. Also, when you are over-drafting your account (I would hope by accident) the way they do it is the largest amount will come out first and then the least. This way Wells Fargo gets more fees in my opinion.

name: Liz Morgan
review: I use the Dillard's store card almost once or twice a week. I'm always buying clothes, gifts, and birthday presents from them. I love the reward program and you can't beat the coupons and savings you receive from them as well.My husband and I own very few store credit cards, but this is one that I definitely can't live without!Recently, my mother-in-law asked me about our rewards program we receive from there, and she was ecstatic to get hers in the mail as well. Can't be beat!

name: Dana C Gibson
review: I have a checking account at Wells Fargo, and when I first opened it, I was thrilled.  I had not managed my money very well when I was young and kind of messed up my credit.  I was working on it so when Wells Fargo open my account, it was like a second chance.  The problem was they didn't tell me some very important pieces about my account.  First and foremost, the fact that I was unable to cash any check through my account.  The only check that could be deposited into my account was my payroll check, which was fine, but my VA benefits could not.  When questioned about this, they told me that I had signed up for a 2nd chance account and that those things were limited.  Why limit the amount of money I put into the bank??  Needless to say, I then had to find another bank that would allow me to do all things I needed to do at one location.

name: Alissa Kazan
review: Just like a lot of the other users mentioned, the APR is a little high for the credit card. What I like about this card is that you can earn points and you do get cash incentives and percent off coupons every-so-often, depending on how much you shop at Dillard's. I love that there is no annual fee for this card and the cash advance fee percentage. Overall it's a great card for someone who shops regularly here and pays on time, otherwise the card may start to hurt you.

name: Rhonda West
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards card seems to be right on board with other competitive rewards card programs. The rewards seem straightforward, spend up to five dollars to receive one point, with no limits on points you can ear. There is no activation fee, and the variable finance rate, starting at around 12% but no greater than about 26% is the norm. Linking your rewards card to your checking account is an excellent advantage.

name: John
review: I had an issue in which my online checking account was corrupted and a potential security breach had occurred. I immediately called up Wells Fargo and they froze all of my accounts. I then went to my local Wells Fargo bank and they quickly set me up with a new debit card and changed the security information on my checking account. Overall it was a pleasant experience for a unfortunate situation.

name: Beth Huizinga Cunigan
review: One of the nicest options for this card is that they offer free educational classes about credit and how to increase their credit. This is a great addition for those who use this card, because this card is designed for those who have had bad credit in the past and need an option. I also like that this has the pin and chip in it, as that is the more secure option for credit cards. The APR rate is also comparable to other credit cards out there.

name: Sarah Bolton
review: I am not a huge fan of this card. I feel like for as high as the interest rate is, it should have more perks. Other cards offer you a certain percentage off of all of your purchases made at that store and this one does not. I don't feel motivated to use the card. You do get points for purchases which is nice, but I'm not overwhelmed with the rewards. I also was displeased with the customer service after I had an issue with making a payment and ended up having to pay it late WITH the late fee. The issue was on their end but they were not willing to waive my fee (first time late) or do anything to rectify the issue :/

name: Mary Most
review: actually im am very much in favor of any of there cc card offwrs. if. you not abbusing the CC. I HAVE ITI L

name: Mary Ann Galbraith
review: I love my Wells Fargo Way2Save Savings Account.  I have had this account for many years and it has been a life saver for me at times.  It automatically takes money from your checking account when you spend money.  At times, I have had up to $10 transferred to my savings and this can add up. I leave it there and then I use it for special occasions, emergencies, unexpected bills, car maintenance and other things.  The interest rate is super low but I am not using this fund to make alot of money.  I use my checking account almost daily, with my debit card and this allows me to save money without even trying.  I am not good at saving so this is a forced saving and it has been so helpful for me.  I forget about the account and then when I look at it and see $50.00 I am so excited and grateful that i have it.  I like to keep my accounts at one bank or as few as possible and my Wells Fargo Accounts are my most used and so it really helps when I need to keep track of things.  I love this account!

name: Azzie Burns
review: This Dillard's credit card has a very high APR for one that requires Good/Excellent credit to obtain. It comes with many nice perks such as the Dillard's reward points, but for that APR I have to say NO. I comes with pretty hefty late fee of thirty five dollars if you forget and pay late too, pretty harsh for a card only for those that have a proven track record of good credit and so are far from dead beats. I would also say if a card these days is going to charge 3 percent foreign transaction fee, they should have the courtesy to put the chip in you will need in order to be able to use it in much of Europe these days.

name: Jordy Adams
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card seems about equal with other rewards cards that I've possessed, like American Express Blue Sky and Amazon Chase Rewards. All seem to have a base earn rate of around 1%, with opportunities to go higher based on where you spend money and other perks. Redeeming for airfare is a helpful option that I used often with Blue Sky, and it makes me more inclined to get and use this card. The late fee seems a bit high, but I have little sympathy for people who actually pay a late fee or ever need to know what the interest rate is. Responsible users will not pay interest or late fees, so that has no effect on my opinions about the card. Overall, I'd be interested in this card if the rewards were more than my current card, but at 1 point for every $1, I won't be getting it or using it.

name: Brandi Alexa
review: The launch of the Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card seems very exciting. This card seems to offer new benefits, but of course with benefits come costs and drawbacks. In this review, I’ve attempted to go over a number of the pros and cons of the card. Let’s review the basics. The card requires an excellent credit score. The intro rate on purchases is 0% for 15 month, and the same applies for transfers. The regular APR rate spans from 10.15% to 24.99%, which is pretty standard, if not on the lower side of interest rates. There is no annual fee, and the balance transfer fee is 3%.There is a max late fee of $35, no max overlimit fee or penalty APR, and a grace period of 25 days. Cash advances are available on this card at a rate of 23.99 to 25.99%. There is a cash advance fee of 5%, with a minimum of $10. Finally, the foreign transaction fee is 3%, and smart chip is available for this card.So what are the pros? Well to start with, the Wells Fargo Platinum Credit card offers a zero liability program, which automatically protects cardholders from liability if fraudulent or unauthorized charges are made to the card. Additionally, the card offers Visa benefits such as auto rental collision damage waiver, Emergency card replacement, Roadside dispatch, Travel accident insurance and Travel and emergency assistance services. All of these are nice perks, especially for those who are avid travelers. The card is also verified by Visa, and cardholders can create a unique password to use for online shopping purchases. Finally, overdraft protection is available, which enables you to link the card to your checking account in order to avoid overdrafting. Finally, one reviewer mentioned that they can immediately deposit cash into Wells Fargo ATMs and make payments on the card this way, which is certainly a nice bonus and pretty much unheard of with other credit cards.What are the cons then? While they seem minor, I have noticed a few reviewers say that Wells Fargo’s customer service is not always the best. Additionally, it looks like charges can be late to post to this card, which makes it difficult to know exactly how much you are spending on the card. Another thing I noticed is that if you are looking for a card with rewards, i.e. cash back, gift card rebates, airfare miles, gas points, dining out rewards, hotel stays, etc., this is probably not the card to choose as it does not offer any of those perks. These perks certainly do add up after a while. Why not spend money and get added value doing it? However, this is not a concern for everyone.Overall, Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card holders seem happy with this card, and it seems to be a good option to choose if you have an excellent credit score. Additionally, Wells Fargo is a really big name in the banking industry so to have a card affiliated with that bank is a definite perks. After doing some research and looking at consumer reviews, this card definitely has benefits that outweigh its drawbacks and would be a good option for many people.

name: Tatiana
review: I love this saving account, I just opened one a few days ago and I always put money into it when ever I get it. and I know my money is safe with them and plus you get intrest with them which is also good. and its also easy for me to transfer my money from checking to saving just in case I have some extra money around that I don't wanna spend right away

name: Christina Fernandez
review: I really liked my Way2Save saving account before the new federal transfer limit of 6 transfers per month. Every time I use my Way2Save checking account (which is connected to the savings account), it puts $1 from my checking, into my savings account. This was no big deal before, because I could go online and transfer the money from my savings account back to my checking account, even if it was only for $1.00. Now I am more hesitant to do transfers, because the limit is imposed. I feel like I need to wait for a long time before I can transfer the money out of my savings account. This is annoying because I do not make a lot of money, and at times am strapped for cash, and therefore even a dollar would make a difference. The convenience of being able to do my transfers online or on the WellsFargo App on my phone is lost when limits are imposed. Also, there is this limit, because my account is free, which is why I gave it 3 stars. However, it's still a hassle. If the limit was not imposed, this savings account would receive 5 stars, but since there is a limit now, this savings account can be a little impractical. Maybe a different idea for a free savings account would be more beneficial to me as a loyal customer.

name: Terry Goodhill
review: What can I say about Wells Fargo Value Checking. This company is the reason I left and went to a credit union. Everything they can charge you a fee for, they will. Pay your bill online? There's a fee. Receive a statement in the mail? Another fee. Monthly fees, debit card fees, atm fees. After seeing all the ways they wanted to nickel and dime me I left that company and didn't look back.

name: Danielle Jackson
review: Wells Fargo Way2Save Checking Package is a great checking account. The Way2Save account helps me save money while the checking account helps me manage my money. Customer service reps are always friendly and helpful. I really enjoy the internet banking feature of this checking account as it allows me to monitor my account on a daily basis. Pending ACH transactions are made shown on internet banking prior to be debited from your account to give you time to make a deposit before being charged overdraft fees.

name: dawn breidenbach
review: I had the Way2Save accounts since the takeover of Wachovia several years ago.  It's good for people who want to save money this way, not so much if you need every dollar you earn.  It was difficult if you needed to transfer the money back into your checking account more than six times per month, as the federal rules are there is a charge for more than six transfers or withdrawals out of savings per month.  This was the main reason I converted the account after several years of use to a regular checking with no savings attached.  I've avoided the fees by having more than ten debit card uses/payments every month.  Customer service is excellent, they're always willing to help if there are any problems, which is why I stick with Wells Fargo.

name: Miluska Gonzalez Polar
review: Horrible!, Customer Service the worst, my payment can not go through charging me late fees when paid on time ...... if is an option to write minus stars, I  will do it , do not recommend this card at all.

name: Nessa Landeros
review: Same thing happen to me they never received my payments but there was no problem till they switched over to Wells Fargo.

name: Michelle Espinoza
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for 18 years. I joke that they "own" my life. I've had 3 car loans through them, my mortgage, a brokerage account, and even student loans. They've always been excellent in customer service and willing to go the extra mile for customers. Years ago, a $24,000 check bounced against my $500 account balance. The woman from my local branch called me right away and we discovered that the check had been entered incorrectly by 1 number. While that may not seem like a big deal, most other banks would freeze your account right away and you'd spend days untangling the mixup. Not with Wells Fargo-- it was resolved within 2 hours. I love that I can make mobile deposits, email ATM receipts to myself instead of wasting paper, pay with my Apple Pay, etc..

name: Luiz Oliveira
review: Going into a Wells Fargo Bank Is quite the experience. The people are very friendly and the manager at Las Vegas Nevada in the branch of Indios and Boulder Hwy is really nice he is Hispanic and will greet you with a friendly smile and a personal handshake. I recently had to close my checking account and only kept my savings account open. The service is great fast and courteous I remember when I went in to close my checking account they said they would be more than happy to open a new account for me in a jiffy. I am overall very happy with Wells Fargo Bank they are a warm and friendly people. I also went in the other day to make a small withdraw from my checking account I recently opened and there was a young African American Gentlemen who was just so nice I felt like he was a brother to me he was really polite and playful we laughed together and that's what a bank experience should be.

name: John Smith
review: I used this CD as a saving mechanism for some money I had saved up after college. I figured it was better to keep it out of my hands for a little while and hoped it would grow a bit.
