The CD was good for keeping it out of my hands, but the return was very small...but that is what I expected, so it was all and all a decent move on my part, I would do it again if I was in the same situation.

name: John Smith
review: This is a good card to issue to some one like a teenager or college student. I deposited half my savings in the collateral account and then was able to pay off my balances from the earnings from my part time job. The Wells Fargo Secured Visa was a good way to learn about credit cards and how they work with out risking too much debt, since the credit limit was tied directly to the amount of money I was able to cover.

name: Lisa Parker
review: I got my Dillard credit card in December and I was able to buy a few great gifts for my husband with it. One of the things I like the most about the card is the perks you get when you use it, and not just when I use it at Dillards, which is helpful when I get gas for my car or groceries at the local market. Also a big selling point for me was no annual fee. I have had cards in the past that it seemed I was paying them for the privilege to use it. The APR is a fair one for credit during this economic time too.

name: Michelle Elizabeth
review: I've had a savings account here (attached to my checking) for a couple of years, and have never had a problem.  For us, savings accounts are straightforward as we're pretty much just looking for somewhere to keep our "extra" money, and not really looking for any bells, lights or whistles.  This account is great for that.  You won't get rich off interest, but there's no unattainable minimum balance, it's easy to tie it to your checking for overdraft protection and if you need to transfer back and forth from checking to savings, it's easy to do that too.  There is a limit to the number of times you can transfer from savings to checking, but that's a government limit and not  a Wells Fargo limit.

name: Michelle Elizabeth
review: My husband and I have an account here for about 4 years now, and I have to say that we are very happy. Usually with banks we have had in the past, something was went wrong, whether it was fees that weren't disclosed or poor customer service or slow processing time. But with this bank, everything has been very good. Recently, we fell into a rough patch during the month and one of our debit transactions made us go overdrawn. We reached out to customer service, who offered (Without us asking) to overturn the fee because they saw that we had been loyal, good customers. This is something that never would've happened with our previous banks.

name: Stephen Dolgos
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card has definitely ended up being worth it. The five times bonus points on everyday purchases really caught my eye, but I was unsure. It turned out that almost all of my purchases fall in to that category, so the reward points rack up quickly compared to other reward cards I have used in the past. I just wish it lasted longer than just the first six months.Be careful if you tend to carry a balance though. The interest rate is not super high, but it is definitely higher than what I have on my other cards. If you tend to pay off your balance every month or only carry a small balance, then this card is definitely for you.

name: Jennifer
review: I have had this checking account for quite some time now and the biggest issue that I have had was the fact that someone had stolen my information and purchased items using my money.  The wonderful thing was within a weeks time they had refunded my money and I was overall surprised at how quickly it was refunded.  Other than that one incident I have no other complaints.  I get direct deposit so I don't have to worry about the fees that could apply.  All in all I am happy with my checking account.

name: Bryan Fine
review: My wells fargo checking account is great! I can deposit checks from my smart phone, I can deposit checks and cash – multiple bills at one – at a wells fargo automated teller machine, and I never have to worry about burglars of any kind uncovering the secret stash of cash I used to keep hidden away under my mattress! I can take money out of an atm at any one of their convenient locations, I got this awesome shiny visa debit card, and I can check my balance, statement, and purchase history online!

name: Todd O
review: It's a simple card and a good way to raise your credit score.

name: Drew Gmitro
review: One of the best features of the Wells Fargo Secured Card, and one that's unique to this card alone (as far as I know) is: if you use it to pay your cell phone bill each month (to whichever carrier you use) , they'll cover your cellphone against loss or damage up to $600.00 with only a $25.00 deductible fee. That's a really sweet deal. I was paying $10.00 a month for insurance thru Verizon for each of my cell phones and they had a $100.00 (Android Note 3) to $250.00 (IPhone 6S) deductible.This feature alone makes this one of the best secured cards available.

name: Nicolas Gundersen
review: This was my first credit card that I ever signed up for. Being right out of high school, i was always nervous about credit and I thought I would just stick to debit for the rest of my life. But I had to get a credit card as I was going into college soon. Wells Fargo was extremely helpful, especially with the apps and easy payments. The customer service that I experienced had always been extremely helpful and I'm extremely glad I went with this credit card. I look forward to keeping this credit card for a long time and hopefully my credit will be excellent.

name: Mary Ann Galbraith
review: I love the Wells Fargo Rewards card.  The 0 interest rate for 15 months is awesome.  You can get your balance paid quicker without the interest piling up and also transfer your other credit cards to this card and get them paid off quickly with 0% for 15 months. I love the feature of getting 5 points on all gas, groceries and drug store purchases as well.  The no over the limit fee so you can have fun buying and not worry about your limit is great! The 1 points for every $1 spent is also a nice feature.  I have this on a City Card and those rewards add up believe me!  They sure help when you're Christmas shopping! They can be redeemed also for travel with no blackout dates, or minimum stays, or required Saturday stay.  You can use them for hotels and car rentals as well.  How great is this!  The only negative is the late fee of $35.  My other cards only charge $25.

name: Michael Czerniak
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for a number of years now and currently have a mortgate with them and previously had an auto loan through their auto loan branch. I initially did not intend to bank with Wells Fargo as I had heard nightmares about their checking and savings accounts (mostly because of their previous overdraft policy). I have since closed my auto loan with them (purchased another vehicle) and have had zero issues with my mortgage account. I get timely updates on any significant changes to the account, primarily dealing with escrow payments, and they adjust my payment automatically to account for rising property tax costs, insurance costs, and anything else. They also gave me a very great rate for our home mortgage.I have never had an issue with our auto payment and didn't even need to use my checking Wells Fargo checking account to make payments. I just setup auto payments through my primary bank and Wells Fargo handled everything else. They are also on top of their tax document game and the forms I needed to file my taxes were readily available days before the IRS started accepting returns for e-file. Overall I am happy with my experience with Wells Fargo and am happy to be serviced by them.

name: Patrick Eagens
review: I like that this credit card has a lot of bonus perks that other cards do not have. If you shop at Dillard's frequently or even shop at your local grocery store frequently, then this card is perfect. I'm not a fan of the foreign transaction fee, but that is pretty standard. The rates work pretty well at 13-22% and 27% cash advance. The late fee being $35 is similar to the Capital One Venture Rewards card so that also seems pretty standard. Overall it looks like a solid credit card with perks for frequent shoppers and no ridiculous fees or rates.

name: James Coats
review: I have had this account for a little over a year. It is nice because of all of the online features Wells Fargo has to help you keep up with your account. The website and app are easy to use and the organize things clearly. You can also connect it with your Wells Fargo Checking and do some neat things that automatically transfers small amounts from your checking to your saving account. This helps you to slowly built up money in your saving account. The interest rate always seems to be at, or slightly below, the market.

name: Dustin Brimhall
review: I like Wells Fargo because that's the main ATM where I live. I also kinda hate it because I just got my first job, it was seasonal but since I'm 18 I can't just walk over to a casino to cash it, the $5 monthly fee is taken out of my savings account whether I've made the $25 transfer or not. The woman I spoke with told me that since the place I worked at was associated with their company also, I wouldn't have the monthly fee. I believe that's false advertisement, I was shocked when the monthly fee showed up since I was told I wouldn't have one, and also by the fact it was taken out of my savings account.

name: Suzanne Lewis
review: I have had this checking account for 11 years, and I've been very happy with it. The account earns a tiny bit of interest (.01% for me because I don't keep much of a balance in the account.) I hardly make anything in interest, but it's still nice to know that I am earning something, which is better than earning nothing. I love the web access to the account. I can access my transactions, statements and balance at any time of the day or night. It's super easy to transfer money between my checking account and savings account online. Wells Fargo has many locations, making it really convenient for me to hit the ATM with my debit card for quick cash or to check my balance while out and about.

name: Samantha Archibald
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is my favorite, and I use it EXCLUSIVELY for groceries and gas. Sometimes for other things but only if I don't have cash on me. You get 5x the rewards on groceries and gas (and drugstores, but I don't purchase at those often). I pay it off every month, so its definitely worth it to me. If I used it for all my purchases I wouldn't be able to pay it off every month, so that's why it's strictly for groceries and gas.  I lost it once and Customer Service was super nice about replacing it. I used to use Bank of America and I only got free interest for 6 months, and I didn't get bonus points for buying gas/groceries/anything specific, so this is much better.

name: Rachel Mason
review: My experience with the Wells Fargo student account was not good. There are too many hidden fees for various things that can really eat up a students finances. We don't have much! And having a 500 dollar minimum to avoid a monthly fee is pretty absurd for a student in my opinion. Most students I know are stretching their dollars and at any given moment could certainly have less than 3 dollars in their account, which means just because I had to buy a couple packs of Ramen noodles that week, all of a sudden I have to dispute an overdraft fee. No thanks!

name: Kristy khalid
review: My husband has had his own account with Wells Fargo for years.  When we moved it seemed logical to come to Wells Fargo to open a joint account.  We told the banker we wanted an account just like the one my husband originally began with.  The banker set us up and then after all the paperwork was in place we were told we had to have XX amount of $ in the savings account at all times.  My husband's original account was never like that.  I'm kind of ticked because that wasn't disclosed to us prior to us signing on the dotted line.  The banker should have gone over the NEW policies they put in place and not just assume that we would know things had changed.  Even if a customer knows of every change when it is made, the banker should always check before anyone signs anything.  I'm still kind of riled up about that.  Other than that, the employees and other bankers there are quite nice.

name: Stephanie Pyper
review: Dillard's credit card sounds like a good choice for those who love to shop at Dillard's. There is no annual fee, which is awesome. It may not seem like a lot at the time. "Oh like 25 dollar annual fee, no big deal." It is a big deal when the time to pay comes around and you had that money earmarked for something else. You can earn points toward 10% off Shopping Passes or even get more points for $10 Rewards Certificates that you can use on Dillard's items. This would definitely be a lifesaver on top of the great sales they have at the stores. This says every dollar you spend you get 1 reward point, up to 2 reward points per dollar spent, depending on where you go. Unfortunately Interest rates are way high, for the regular rate it's 13.24%-21.99% and for cash advances it's 26.99% which isn't as much as Capital One for instance, but still pretty high. Again, wonderful card if you love Dillard's.

name: Carrillo Pro
review: Use this card instead of your debit card and always pay off the balance to reap the rewards. Only credit card I use and own, so far so good.

name: Stephanie
review: I have never had any problems with this checking account unlike other banks. As log as I meet the required min. there are no fees. I have never had a problem with over drafting or ATM fees. I love bill pay but i wish they would make it free. Compaired to other banks there was always a monthly fee of some sort, I could not stand it. I also have a personal loan and savings account with Wells Fargo connected to this checking account and it makes everything really easy to transfer and make payments.

name: Michael Berger
review: I have had a Way2Save checking account with wells fargo for quite some time. I have never had any issues with Wells Fargo and I feel safe and secure with this account. If there is anything that looks suspicious on my account, wells fargo will automatically put a hold on the card to make sure there hasn't been any fraud. There is no interest rate involved and you can actually acquire money to put towards gift certificates which is an awesome plus. So far I have no complaints and I will continue to use wells fargo.

name: Colin Stone
review: Overall this seems like a fairly good credit card, I do however have some complaints.  The initial deposit is a bit high for my taste, perhaps this be be brought down to a more reasonable number.  I also have some concerns regarding the reporting of various statistics, assuming of course that these are not used as advertising fodder I would be fine with it but too often is this information misused.  Additional clarity on this matter would be welcome.  Now as far as the positives go the annual fee seems very reasonable as well as the grace period.  The lack of one time fees is also nice and is a huge plus for me.  The zero liability program seems very generous and help ease my mind concerning the matter of credit cards and whether or not it would be stolen.  As a side note the access to free online education courses is a very generous program and does much to better my trust of this program and the company.  In conclusion a few small tweaks here and there would do much to sell this to me.  I may consider this card in the future.

name: Bryan Fine
review: My wells fargo checking account is great! I can deposit checks from my smart phone, I can deposit checks and cash – multiple bills at one – at a wells fargo automated teller machine, and I never have to worry about burglars of any kind uncovering the secret stash of cash I used to keep hidden away under my mattress! I can take money out of an atm at any one of their convenient locations, I got this awesome shiny visa debit card, and I can check my balance, statement, and purchase history online!

name: stephanie daniels
review: I really do not like Wells Fargo. I thought that because they were a big company that has been around for a while that it would be a good choice but I quickly releazed that was a misconception. They are just another rip off bank that doesnt care about thier customers. When I first opened up my free checking account the bank teller asked me if I wanted to sign up for Overdraft Protection. So not asking any questions, because I thought "Overdraft Protection" was pretty self-explanitory, I said yes. The whole time I'm thinking I am protected from overdrafting my account but I was completely wrong. Long story short..... I overdrafted by a few cents two times and it ended up costing me an arm and a leg. I called Wells Fargo to ask them how that was possible with the overdraft protection and that's when they want to tell me that overdraft protection still doesn't prevent you from overdrafting your account. They are just another scam artist bank if you ask me!

name: Brandon Kaplan
review: After 2 years with Wells Fargo and this checking account, I can say officially it is the best setup I have ever had at a financial institution. I am never charged unless I use the teller, but even those fees are waived when the mistake is on Wells or my employer. Use of Direct Deposit in relation to my employer having Wells as a bank is truly incredible..the ease of access makes me really appreciative of this bank.

name: Suzanne Shahin
review: The interest rate is a bit high. I have this card and a Discover card. I tend to use the Discover card more because of the low interest rate I was given. But I do use this card once a month because of the reward points. They are pretty nice when I need to make a huge grocery shop. I also use it when I go close shopping, need more school supplies, and books. Not all places accept my Discover card so I use this card as a back up. Customer service is pretty nice. I have had to call them a few times when my card was not working. It was just because of normal wear and tear and they had to send me a new card. They were pretty nice and sent me one for free. I would recommend this to people searching a second card to build their credit score.

name: Edmond Beneker
review: I've had a checking account with Wells Fargo for 8 years. They seem to be just as reliable or innovative as any other Bank. I especially like how quickly my checks, direct deposits and other deposits go. If you want to complain about that then I'd say try out Bank of the West sometime and see how slow and in stone ages they are. I've helped my parents do some banking with West. Over the years they have changed some things but mostly its the same old checking account. Exactly what I need. They also have many locations and ATM's around my state.

name: Terrance Mills
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card has been pretty good for me! Remember, this card is for people that have bad credit and can't get a regular card.  I made some bad financial decisions in the past that are costing me now.  This card is a great way for someone with bad to fair credit improve their credit score because it requires you to have a deposit.   Add that to the fact that there aren't overdraft fees and the like, and you have what amounts to a very solid credit card. After your credit rating goes up, then you can go for the better option cards.  But for what it does, it does good.

name: Samuel Gifford
review: I opened this savings account along with a checking account at Wells Fargo. The original reason for the account is that I was in school and all the ATMs on campus were Wells Fargo. There are positives and negatives associated with this account. First the account linked to the Checking Account is a definite bonus as each time I make a payment it will deposit $1.00 from my check to savings. A handy way of saving without knowing it. Another is there is unlimited withdrawals should you need dip into your savings in an emergency. There is no problem. However the negatives come with the low interest rate and the fees associated with the account. They charge a $5.00 fee if you do not meet certain requirements. (ie. A direct deposit schedule and maintaining a minimum balance. Overall a pretty standard account from a national bank with some added features.

name: Steven Spellman
review: I have a Wells Fargo value checking account now. When I first opened my account it was an at work account or something like that. They came out to my job offering it to numerous workers for free. Well everything was OK until I noticed that I no longer had a work based checking account now they had given me a value checking account. I called wells Fargo to find out what the difference was because I noticed I didn't meet the requirements that were needed to avoid the monthly fees. My at work account didn't cost me anything as long as I had direct deposit going to my account which I had been using. This new value checking didn't take money out of my deposit and put it into savings like the previous account had and I asked wells fargo customer service about it and no one had any idea what I was talking about. If you get this account please read every detail to the account and monitor it very closely because this bank doesn't do a good job of communicating account changes to its customers if it tries to at all.

name: Jobie
review: I have a Way2Save checking account with wells fargo. I enjoy the customer service. Also another thing I enjoy from wells fargo is the overdraft protection. One of the many things that I do not enjoy is the monthly fee. I guess monthly fees are a way for you to pay for having an account. Before switching to wells fargo I was with bank of america and I am happy I made the choice. Lastly whenever your card is about to expire wells fargo will send you a new one pronto. They will not wait until the last minute to get you switched to a new card and etc. I just feel that the monthly fee is pretty ridiculous at times.

name: Brian Clark Ignacio
review: The Dillard's credit card is a great card to use if you shop at Dillard's a lot. This card can also be used anywhere American Express is accepted. Using this card at Dillard's nets you 2 bonus points per dollar you spend, which is rather generous compared to my JCPenny card that only rewards 1 point per dollar spent. Since this card is an American Express card, you get even more points using it elsewhere ( 2 points on Groceries and gas, 1 point everywhere else ). If you love to spend, you can easily accumulate that 10 dollar reward certificates every month. Another high note to this card is that there are no annual fees. Interest rates on the other hand is a bit costly, but that is expected from credit cards no these days. Just be responsible with your payments, and you won't have to worry too much. Overall this is a nice card to have, especially if you love to shop at Dillard's.

name: Rhea Jaisingh
review: Wells Fargo is by far my favorite bank because they are so convenient for me. The savings is great and they do not require you to have a minimum or maximum amount in the savings account. This works for me because as a student, I am always frugal with money. Unfortunately I do not have a student savings account, but this savings account is fine with me for now and there are no hidden fees associated with the account.

name: Ben Ami
review: I have a Way2Save account and am very disappointed in it.  They charge me five dollars per month in "fees" for no reason.  I get absolutely no benefit for paying this five dollars.  The interest rate is absolute crap.  I have an online savings with another bank that has a really great rate, .9%.  I just have this savings because it is linked to my Wells Fargo checking, which is decent.  If you maintain a 300 dollar balance, the five dollar fee is waived.  Customer service for Wells Fargo is also hit or miss.  They can take up to 15 days to respond to an email question!

name: Nick Le
review: I've had my Wells Fargo account for about a year. I had it a few years prior, but closed it because I wasn't happy with their service. I re-opened the account last year after deciding that I wasn't happy with my checking count over at my former credit union.So far, I have very little complaints. They have an iOS app that has been very beneficial in helping me keep tabs on my checking account and there are many branches within miles of me. On one occasion, I mistakenly left my debit card in the ATM machine and as a safety precaution, the ATM ate it up. Within minutes of this happening, Wells Fargo sent me an email that I was able to conveniently check on my phone. I went back into the branch and not even 10 minutes later, an associate had already ordered me a new debit card and sent me on my way with a temporary card that linked up to my checking account.It was my mistake, but the way they treated me was with kindness and respect. The Way2Save feature of this checking account is very beneficial as well. I am not the greatest at remembering to save money, so to have a feature built in that transfers a small amount daily is great. The only downside to that is I often will need to transfer some money from my savings back over to my checking account, and that counts against my monthly transfer limit.

name: Cornelius Vanderwerff
review: I have a way to save account with Wells Fargo.  After having it for 2 years I have saved more than I ever would have saved with a conventional bank account.  It was always hard for me to put money away in my savings account till I got,  "a way to save account'.  The nice feature about his feature is that you don't have to manual input my money into my savings account,  it does it for me every time I make a purchase with my debit card with Wells Fargo.  The other great thing about getting the Wells Fargo account,  It was free of charge!

name: Little Wing
review: I have a Way2Save savings account with Wells Fargo. I like it because with every transaction I make, it automatically takes $1 from my checking account and deposits it in my savings account. Over time, that can really add up without you even making a conscious effort. This savings account also accrues interest, although very little. When you have a checking account linked with this savings account, it offers overdraft protection and will automatically take money from your savings account to cover what you overdrew from your checking account.

name: Ricardo Rodriguez
review: This account is pretty basic and does not offer much as far as a college checking account. It is a decent account and for the most part it works good for getting big deposits such as Financial Aid refunds. However, as far as making large purchases they are not very efficient as they will post as soon as they get charged and then they will drop off out of no where just to come back a couple of days later. In between those times you are under the impression you have more money when you don't and end up getting over drafted which they will hardly ever help you with. Overall it has not been a good experience and they seem to more focused on offering you additional products that to help you out with your current product. Besides large deposits I don't really use this account. I withdrawal my money once it is in there and I deposit to another one of my banks accounts that give me perks for having the open.

name: Terra Cadence
review: I've had this account for around three years. It's okay, but not the most user friendly, from what I've seen. I have, on multiple occasions, overdrafted and not been notified, resulting in a hefty fee that had to be paid when I finally was informed that my balance was negative. Also, pulling money from your savings to your checking to prevent an overdraft counts as a transfer, so if that happens too much, you will be charged yet another large fee.     Some good points though, are that the in-bank service is amazing. I always get the help that I need from the bankers, and the ATMs are very up to date and useful.     I would most likely recommend this type of account, only if nothing better was available, and just mention to be sure you monitor your balance.

name: James Noriega
review: In my opinion, this is one of the best savings accounts there is in the market right now, it goes perfect with my other Well's Fargo Way2Save Checking account. Although the % rate isn't that great, it adds up and it's worth it. The online features allow me to transfer money from one account to the other very easily, at my age, that is a lifesaver. I only wished that the minimum balance to keep was a little lower, other than that i love this account.

name: James Noriega
review: I have had this account for a about 5 years and i think its ok, but you have to be careful, i am a little old now and going to the bank is quite the hassle, so i opted to use the online features instead. It was a little confusing at first, but it is very convenient. I like the automatic transfer feature, it really helps us save quite a bit per month and the customer service people have always been very helpful. It is only the overdraft fees and the minimum balance to keep that i think are a little high, otherwise i would have given it 5 stars.

name: Paul Hunter
review: The monthly fee is ridiculous and more than the interest rate. The banker required me to have a transfer into my checking for 25 dollars when I opened up the account. I was required to have the account when I opened up my checking. I have to go in the bank every month and transfer the money again. I do not want or need this account and never use it, but they required me to get it. I would definitely recommend using another bank with better practices.

name: Paul Hunter
review: I have had nothing but problems with wellsfargo. At first, they would give me a free checking so long as there was direct deposit. I closed that account and years later this is what they gave me. I can't justify paying for the account, I have all of these weird restrictions on everything from atm usage to debit card use. They still make it so that transactions are held to increase the chance of overdraft and you should've seen the look on the banker';s face when I opted out of debit card overdrafts.

name: Janet Petramala
review: I like Wells Fargo checking and easy online banking. I have been with Wells Fargo for over 8 years and have been treated great as a customer. I have all my checks automatically deposited every month without any problems. I can always count on my money being there when I need it. I also have my children's savings account set up with Wells Fargo and it is so simple to transfer money from checking into their savings accounts. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a checking account.

name: Kelly
review: So I have been a customer with Wells Fargo (formerly, First Union and then Wachovia) for over 15 years. I have always had free checking. No strings attached. No minimum balance, no automatic deposit requirement and no requirement to use your debit card a certain amount of times during the month. This year things changed and I am now thinking of closing my account. All of the sudden, with no notice, I was being charged a monthly service fee. I know its not much for some, but with little income every dollar matters. I am very disappointing with banks in general now charging to use their services. Especially a bank I have been with for so many years.

name: Mercedes Burt
review: I switched to this bank when I moved to Minnesota. I heard great things about it, but now I know that they aren't true. I signed up with the bonus program that promised 50 if I set up direct deposit. I have yet to receive that money, and it has been nearly a year. Also, the fees that are charged to use my card at ATMs are a little ridiculous. It's about 4 dollars, compared to 2 at my previous bank. The customer service is ok, but at the end of the day I wish my previous bank had branches in Minnesota because Wells Fargo is highly disappointing.

name: Summer
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for over ten years. I recently became self employed and as a result no longer have automatic deposit from my employer. Because on this I now have to pay a fee for an account that has always been free. In addition to this, when I deposit check, there is now a 10 day hold put on them. I am thinking it may be time to switch to a small local bank or credit union...

name: David Dewett
review: I have had this account for about 6 years.  The account is fine, and because of direct deposit, it has always been free for us.  However, I do not like that the online bill pay feature withdraws money from your account the day you request the bill payment, rather than on the day that the bill payment is received.  The way2save feature seemed like a good idea, but it is a pain, and floods your statement page.  Otherwise, no issues.

name: Rachel Johnson
review: I have had this type of checking account for ten years.  I had moved from an area and had always been a member of a local credit union and could no longer use the credit union for logistical reasons.  We were offered this type of bank account through my husbands job and while I was nervous about it, I could not be happier. I am always treated with a lot of respect, I don't get sales calls in which people try to sell me things.  When I visit a branch the reps always remind me of the perks with the account so I can make the most of it.  Very happy!

name: felicia trevino
review: I enjoyed my free account with Wells Fargo, but I enjoyed the Premier Checking account even more after I upgraded.  I enjoy many features such as unlimited transfers into my savings account, which really does help me with managing my money. While you do pay a monthly fee, I do think that it is worth upgrading for the extra features and benefits.

name: jewel
review: I got my Wheels Fargo credit card around 2008 - 2009 and the first thing I've noticed was that they take all the necessary steps to accommodate as much as possible. Every time there was an issue, which was not that many, I got it resolved with one call, within 30 minutes.

name: Chad Sorenson
review: I have been using this checking package with my wife for about 5 years now, and we have really enjoyed it. We have never had a problem, and all of the online services and apps have been super convenient. We use the mobile check depositing all of the time. The one time we had an incorrect charge, they took care of it quickly, and we never experienced any other problems.

name: Chris Obermeier
review: Wells Fargo has a great savings account program.  Everything is spelt out for you very early on, and their accounts can help you meet your short and long-term goals easily without a fuss.  I highly recommend using this service due to the excellent customer service I received, and the knowledge that I was given to make my own decisions.  This isn’t a place where they just expect to listen to you ‘just because,’ instead they take the opportunity to explain to you WHY.  5 stars.

name: Scott Folsom
review: A decent account, it works for what I need it to do. The only problem that I've had thus far is that my banker encouraged me to include an "online shopping checking account" that is by and large useless, but necessary in order to avoid other fees. I'll probably end up closing it because I have no use for it after all.

name: Sarah Charbonneau
review: I love the Way2Save package that I have.  I have automatic transfers set up to my savings account from my checking account.  I also have had no problems with direct deposit or account fraud like I did with my old banking institution.  Wells Fargo have been wonderful in helping me save up money. Never in my life would I think that I could save over $500 by just setting up a transfer from checking and forgetting about it.  The only downfall to my account is the monthly fee when I do not hit the minimum 1500, which to be honest is rarely.  However, for the superb customer service I receive it is worth paying the monthly fee.

name: Melody Bluth
review: The Wells Fargo Secured credit card doesn't seem like the best option out there.  When my husband and I first started building credit we used Discover.  The rates on the Wells Fargo card are high.  There is an annual fee which you could always try to avoid.  I have used several different credit cards.  Some credit cards will offer rewards, which should not be why you pick a card but it is nice to have.  There are some good things about this card.  The collateral account is good for people who want to be smart about it and increase their credit score.  Overall this card seems to be an okay option, but I would say shop around for better deals.  They are out there.   I've used Discover and Capital One.  Neither of these have annual fees.  Be smart and pay off everything you buy as you go.  If you don't you will find yourself paying that 18.99%.  Once you start that, it is hard to get out of.

name: jewel
review: With Wheels Fargo I had account since 2008 when I opened my business and the first positive thing I've noticed was that the representatives take all the necessary steps and go behind to accommodate as much as possible.  Knowing that I just opened up my business they gave me the best interest rate. Every time there was an issue, which was not that many, I got it fixed within 30 minutes with one call. One time I got disconnected while I was talking with the representative named Jose he called me back immediately and a few days later I got a courtesy call from them.

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I like how this card offers rewards that can be used anywhere. It's cool how they give you bonus points when you buy groceries or gas because a lot of your money will go towards those necessities. The card also has good benefits and no annual fee, but the interest rate seems a bit bad.

name: Tina Molina
review: I think that with wells fargo they are very helpful.  They also make sure that your always covered.  If you go over on your checking account they will cover up to 300 if  dont have the funds which is really useful.   But the people are friendly and understand and care.

name: Ashley Ransome
review: I am pleased with this checking account. The account is kept current and the fee is very low. Most banks have higher fees and terrible customer service. I don't have any complaints with Wells Fargo and I will continue to bank with them as long as things stay this way.

name: Alexandria Jahn
review: I was really impressed with this account because, compared to each and every one of my other savings accounts that I have had previously, this one helped me save the most money. I love the fact that they can show you how far away you are from completing your savings goal, because this helps me save money. I also got my account set up to send $1 to my savings account each time I swipe my debit card for a checking purchase, which also helps me save money.

name: Elizabeth Gillypou
review: Overall, my experience with Wells Fargo Checking has been a good experience. I had a situation where somebody made charges on my account that I didn’t know about. They were quick to respond. Wells Fargo sent me a new check card and took the charges off my account. I also like that I don’t need a minimum balance to keep my account current and that the monthly fee is only $7.

name: Lia Poole
review: I was convinced by WellsFargo to sign up for this account several years ago and I haven't had any issues with it.  I don't end up paying fees and the website and app are really easy to use.  The app actually keeps getting better.  I use the bill pay portion and Money Map quite often, which I feel helps me manage my money and understand how I'm spending my money.  The branches are also very convenient for the few times I have to go in.  I would give more than 4 stars, but the interest pay out is pretty pitiful.  After hearing what other people I know go through with their banks I'm still very happy with my account overall.

name: Samantha
review: I have a savings account with Wells Fargo Bank, I like that I am able to link both my checking and savings together for a much easier online banking process. There is a fee, but it is waived when you set up an automatic monthly deposit (which helps boost your savings...no problem there!!). I have never had a problem with my service, and plan on staying a WF customer for quite a while. There is a maximum withdrawal of 6 times per month though, which was no fun when I didn't originally know about it!

name: Lisa Jones
review: The DILLARD’S credit card seems like a nice card to have with no annual fee being a big boost. However, the cards interest rate is a little high for usage especially when we’re talking about using it in a grocery or gas station. I do like the discount that is received when opening the account. I think if Dillard’s really wants this card to take off it should offer more incentives for use such as coupons and extra percentage discounts for in store and online purchases.

name: Kel Sob
review: I opened this account because I was very unhappy with First Bank.  I was worried I might not get approved for another checking account because of a bankruptcy I filed in 2013.  However, since I have recently gone back to school, I tried this account for Wells Fargo.  I am 29, and most student accounts and credit cards have an age limit.  I was surprised Wells Fargo did not have an age limit.  I have had the account for about 6 months now and I am very happy with Wells Fargo.  The customer service in the branches and on the phone are always very pleasant and helpful. Their mobile app is easy to use and has several nice features. For a big name bank, they take very good care of their customers. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone who is looking for a new account, especially students.

name: Jodie Coston
review: This is a good card and Wells Fargo customer service is always a bonus.  The point system of rewards is a little difficult to understand at first, but works out to be favorable.  Their interest rates and fees are about equal to the card that I normally use, but it's not a great idea to use this card for cash advances because that's where the rates go up substantially.  A card like this is handy for people like me who travel on a regular basis because there are definite rewards for booking airfare and rental cars.

name: Alex
review: I use this account for my husband and mine's business. We've used it for the past three years and have no major complaints. The customer service is better than our former bank, BoA. Once there was a strange withdrawal and I couldn't get a hold of my husband and I contacted them and they were very helpful, and when I later got a hold of my husband he said he had just withdrew some without first letting me know, but they were very diligent.

name: christine jalbert
review: I joined wells fargo a year ago and it has been very good, i have online access and when i use the atm they ask to just email a receipt instead of printing it out which i think is a hugh waste.  I also have them automatically transfer a lump sum from my checking into my savings each month, its alot better then them taking a dollar each time i use my debit card.  I think wells fargo is a great bank.

name: Collin Vickers
review: The rewards program on the Wells Fargo Rewards card leaves much to be desired - they offer an ambiguous points based system, which I find difficult to translate into tangible value.  I much prefer a simple cash back rewards program.  In my case, with the Capitol One Quicksilver, I get 1.5% cash back on all purchases, including my rent and utilities.  This discount adds up quickly each month, and I know exactly what I'm getting.  The one advantage this card has is that there is no annual fee.

name: Frank Perkins
review: I was upgraded from a standard checking account to premier once I ascertained a great promotional opportunity with my current job. There are certain things that they went over with me about this type of checking rather than other types such as unlimited transfers to savings. When I walk into the bank and they pull that information up I am treated with the utmost respect. The teller spends more time with you, and they assist you more than other customers. They offer you things that they wouldn't offer standard customers. When I had a standard checking I didn't like the fees, and when more money rolled in they upgraded my account. The only thing I do not like about it is the balance you must keep in the account. For me, I must keep $1500 in checking, or I will succumb to fees. My friend used to work at Wells Fargo, and he told me that when your name pops on the screen there is a signal that shows if your premier or not. Overall I have had a great experience with it

name: Nuri Lopez
review: I enjoy having my accounts with Wells Fargo.  I actually have a few accounts with Wells Fargo, not only a checking account.  I do not incur any extra fees monthly because I have direct deposit setup in my account.  I have Overdraft Protection just in case something goes wrong in regards to my balance, and if my account balance goes negative up to $5, it does not incur any overdraft charges, which I'm definitely happy about, just in case I lose track of my monies at some point.  The Customer Service at the local branch and even over the phone are very nice, and have always assisted me with the utmost respect when handling anything on my account.  That's why I would hope to stay for many more years to come with Wells Fargo, and that the way we bank with them never changes.

name: Zaakirah Muhammad
review: Before I got a saving account with Wells Fargo I went to other banks before I chose Wells Fargo.  I am a student and they had a great way2save savings account.  I love that I am able to make a scheduled withdrawal so every month it send a certain amount of money each month and I don't have to worry about doing it on my own.  I also like that you can have a goal and it show's you how close or far away you are to the goal.   It's good to keep you reliable and exciting when you see that you are getting close to your goal.

name: Ricky Harline
review: I actually did a fair amount of shopping around for bank services before I decided on Wells Fargo and this savings account. I was surprised in the process of looking around to discover that most accounts have a lot of hoops that you have to jump through. This account doesn't provide anything particularly amazing, but it is a no-hassle way for me to put my money in a safe place. I haven't had any problems and I like it a lot. Thanks, Wells Fargo.

name: Tracy Fischer
review: Overall, I've had a good experience with Wells Fargo Value Checking. I switched to Wells Fargo after moving to a location my previous bank wasn't in, and I'm glad I did. It's easy to set up your account so you can transfer money between your checking and savings accounts online, and it's easy to send money to other people. I do wish they didn't have a non-bank ATM fee of $2.50; when I forget to take money out at the bank and have to use a non-Wells Fargo ATM, I usually end up paying $6.50 or more for that option because of their added fee (on top of the ATM fee). If you plan to withdraw money abroad, you definitely should look into other options, as they charge 3% AND a $5 fee for using a foreign ATM. Overall, it's a good checking account if your needs are basic.

name: Elias Carlon
review: The bonus attached to this card is absolutely amazing if you have a mortgage through Wells Fargo. Basically you get a cent back for every dollar you spend on normal purchases and 5 cents back on groceries, gas and drug stores. This card isn't like other cash rebates though, the rewards are deposited directly against your standing mortgage balance in $75 increments. Anyone who owns there own home knows how big of a deal this is because the first 5-6 years of paying a mortgage is mostly paying interest. According to Wells Fargo, if you make $1000 in purchases a month on the credit card, you can cut out 8 years on your mortgage. Of course this only works if you have the discipline to pay off the card quickly!

name: Jerry Luhr
review: The discounts are good and I've had no issues with it.

name: Shanna Latiolais
review: I've had Wells Fargo for a while now.  The tellers at my local branch are amazing.  They're always helpful, and personable.  They all seem to genuinely enjoy their work, which carries over in their customer interaction.  I've also dealt with the customer service line with no complaints.  They're also helpful and informative. I've recommended Wells Fargo to my boyfriend and family members.  Other banks that are local to my area are usually filled with snotty tellers who can't be bothered to explain anything to you, or they're completely incompetent.  I will be a Wells Fargo customer for a long time.

name: Nick Dax
review: I find the rewards program on the Wells Fargo College Card to be somewhat stingy.

name: Collin Vickers
review: Wells Fargo was the first company I ever banked with, and I am still with them to this day, mostly for the sake of habit and convenience - the interest my account earns is hardly worth counting.  They waive my monthly fee because of my the minimum balance that I maintain.  Additionally, they automatically transfer funds from my checking into my savings, which is a feature that I appreciate because it saves me time and reduces the number of financial chores I have each month.  I particularly enjoy the online banking function - it saves me a great deal of time, and allows me to access my account information any time, anywhere.

name: Elizabeth
review: I initially had my account with Wachovia, and have had a very positive experience with Wells Fargo, both throughout the transition, and in the years since. I have a "Value Checking" account, and was able to have no fees because I had my pay direct-deposited every two weeks. I also have a "Way to Save" account, and appreciate that it makes saving more convenient, yet allows me easy access to funds through free transfers, of up to six a month. The customer service at Wells Fargo has been very good, both on the phone, and also at local branches, Depending on  your specific personal needs, I would recommend Wells Fargo as a good option for both checking and saving.

name: Michelle Lefevre Jones
review: I have had this checking account since Wells Fargo took over Wachovia. I have rarely had issues and when I did have one, they promptly fixed my problem and credited me all fees that were charged. Any checks I deposit have been immediately available and they have many convenient locations and ATMs for me to choose from. I love the fact that I moved to a different state and region of the country and there was a location here that worked for me. I do wish there was no monthly fee, but it is reasonable and worth it to me.

name: Joshua Kruggel
review: If you shop at Dillard's frequently, the Dillard's credit card is for you. Don't worry about an annual fee: there is none. You have a 23 day grace period to make your payment, and get free merch just for shopping there. The rate being set at 26.99% could be a little lower in my opinion though.

name: Daniel Lee
review: Overall, I was and still am completely satisfied with this checking account in which I had over four years. I was referred by a former business associate and got some kind of discount that escapes my memory. I had switched from a Washington Mutual before it went bankrupt and I remember being glad I did. Saying that, I did have encountered a few major issues with this account, concerning fraud and miscommunication that caused me a huge headache. I've had two incidents of fraud that I recall. Somehow someone hacked into my account and charged a significant amount. Wells Fargo did take care of the problems in a timely manner and I was fully reimbursed of any fees and fraudulent charges. Concerning the miscommunication, a bank representative that I was talking to confused what I was saying and transferred money from my Wells Fargo credit card with an interest charge. I was in dire straits with money and it was the last thing I needed.

name: Rasmi Anugu
review: I found Wells Fargo as the best bank in America.Soon after I entered in the customer service was awesome and the way they responded to my need and reacted was really impressive. I was able to open my account and got a temporary card and cheques on the same day.If I call them on any issue, I see they respond very quickly which is most important.The offers they provide to me is also very decent. I am happy to be a wells fargo user.

name: Susan
review: I really like banking with Wells Fargo. I can always send money from my checking account to my savings account, but it is a little irritating that they send $1 dollar from my checking account to my savings account for every transaction on my checking account. After using your debit card ten times in one month, or having direct deposit of 500 dollars in one month there is no fee. There's also an app to tell you your balance and to do transfers from your savings to your checking or vice versa which is really handy.

name: Leidiane Loureiro
review: With the Wells Fargo® Home Rebate Credit Card I love the fact that when I use my card the points or percent goes towards my mortgage. Even though it might be only pennies or dollars I still love that fact that I can spend money while paying my mortgage a little faster. The last year I earned over 150.00 towards my mortgage principal which is better than nothing at all.

name: Jon Mack
review: I like it. Its pretty easy to use, and the only thing I've had an issue with is the mandatory transfer from checking to savings each month. On the bright side, you can transfer it manually anytime during the month and then send it right back to your checking account. Takes a couple of days, but I like having my money usable and putting money in savings on my own time, when I want to. Its a pretty fast account as far as making payments or receiving deposits, though I find weekends it all slows down to a hault.

name: Rob Ivey
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for 20 years, and about 10 years ago they offered to convert my checking account into the PMA account, which would give me more benefits and options to work with, as well as take away checking account fees so long as I maintained a minimum balance. Having the PMA status to my checking account also has helped me to receive escalated customer service, as they apparently value PMA customers over standard customers. This account has not come back to bite me in the behind, and the zero fees (so long as I have the balance) has always been helpful - also the PMA status helped me to get an equity line from Wells Fargo when I needed it.

name: Keisha Pollard
review: In general, I enjoy my Well Fargo Platinum Credit Card. I had 0% APR for 6 months which was great because I was just learning how to properly use my credit card. My payments can be automatically withdrawn from my account or I can transfer it myself. It's easy to use and Wells Fargo Customer Service is always pleasant to deal with. I have never had any issues with the card, and when I used it on the East Coast the Fraud Center contacted me immediately to confirm that I was the one using the card. I also love that I can immediately deposit cash into Wells Fargo ATMS and make payments that way! When I applied for the card, it took less than a week for e to be approved and I was able to customize it online for free which is a nice gesture on their part. I have never dealt with a more friendly bank. Overall, a great card for someone just starting to build credit and looking to have low monthly payments.

name: Keisha Pollard
review: In general, I enjoy my Well Fargo Platinum Credit Card. I had 0% APR for 6 months which was great because I was just learning how to properly use my credit card. My payments can be automatically withdrawn from my account or I can transfer it myself. It's easy to use and Wells Fargo Customer Service is always pleasant to deal with. I have never had any issues with the card, and when I used it on the East Coast the Fraud Center contacted me immediately to confirm that I was the one using the card. I also love that I can immediately deposit cash into Wells Fargo ATMS and make payments that way! When I applied for the card, it took less than a week for e to be approved and I was able to customize it online for free which is a nice gesture on their part. I have never dealt with a more friendly bank. Overall, a great card for someone just starting to build credit and looking to have low monthly payments.

name: CHRISTAL STANDEN
review: I used to have Bank of America, and there were so many breaches at times that they would cancel my card, and I would have to go into a branch to get a new one the same day. Also, their systems were not as fast as many other banks, more so online, checking your balances. Items would show deducted, then suddenly they are gone. I decided to switch to Wells Fargo, and I have never looked back. I haven't had one problem so far. All debits seem to withdrawl the same day, the staff at all branches are very nice. Also, I rarely keep cash on me, I always use my card, and with no breaches from them, and being able to easily access my account information from my phone or computer is a piece of cake.

name: Akop Salmanyan
review: I am not a money saving type, so this savings account works perfectly for me. Every time I use my card a dollar is saved. This way the money keeps growing without me even knowing.  I told myself to forget about its existence so I won’t use the money. I have heard people having some fee’s with the account I haven’t had any fee’s yet, maybe it’s the way my account is set up to.

name: ben
review: I was relatively unhappy with this account. I was promised that overdrafting from my savings account would not cost me money at all. Little did I know, it was costing me $7 a shot. Being the dumb college kid that I was, I never recognized this. I will have to say that they need to be much more clear on fees and not evasive with answers. In the end, I decided to join a credit union with smaller fees.

name: michelle
review: I have had an account with Wells Fargo for a long time.  I only use this particular account to pay bills with, so I only keep the amount needed to pay those bills in this account.  When they started charging for the account, I had an issue because I never keep a daily balance of $1500, and I also don't have direct deposit through my work.  This was a problem because those were the requirements needed to have the account and not be charged the monthly fee.  My employer will not participate in direct deposit, so I called the bank and they were very helpful in my case.  Great account to have!

name: Walter Plucinski
review: I have had the Wells Fargo PMA Premier Checking Account for several years. There are pros and cons to any checking account, but I have been reasonably satisfied. Having PMA status serves well when contacting Wells Fargo for other services, and grants the customer a certain degree of leeway. Having said that, the monthly fee can be very steep if you do not have the minimum balance to avoid it. After opening a business, I've found it very difficult to get back up to the minimum balance, and I've been paying the fee for some time now.

name: Akop Salmanyan
review: I have had my Wells Fargo checking account for more than 6 years and always haven been satisfied with the card and their service.  I have a student account, which doesn’t have any fee’s, which is great, but recently I started getting fee’s applied to my account. I called the call center and the associate told me that I don’t qualify for the student account anymore, so they can’t offer the same deal to me anymore. After a long conversation back and forth with their supervisor, they were able to cancel the changes that were made to my account.  The most upsetting during this process was that my account was changed without my knowledge and if I didn’t notice the fee’s they would keep charging me.

name: Beth Croff
review: I have been a Wells Fargo Cashback Credit Card holder for about 7 years now, and so far I have no complaints about it.  I use my credit card for absolutely everything, but I keep meticulous spreadsheets regarding my finances so that I can pay it off in its entirety each month.  Because of this, I earn $25 cash back rewards fairly frequently, with no drawbacks to myself.  It is free, and the APR doesn’t really even matter as long as you pay it off each month.  It’s a breeze to use in that I can set it up to automatically send me my reward each time it is earned, and I can have it directly deposited into my account, so that I don’t have to hassle with waiting for it to arrive in the mail and getting to the bank to have it cashed.  I honestly haven’t looked into other credit cards, so I’m not fully sure of whether or not there are better deals out there, but since I bank with Wells Fargo, it is just a super easy way to earn a little extra money for doing nothing.  Can’t beat that!

name: DeVaughn Taylor
review: Like most credit cards this one is high risk and medium reward. I think It's perfect for responsible people that are looking to increase their credit score. Although I'm not to fond of the annual fee or the fact I can't pay bills with what I put into the account. It's not the worse credit card I've seen but  there are better ones to apply for.

name: Walter Plucinski
review: I like the fact that the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card requires collateral to establish a credit limit. I think this promotes good credit-building skills and responsibility. When I was young I had an unsecured credit card through Capital One, and the "something for nothing" model promoted too much extra spending. I like the idea of sacrifice in exchange for credit.

name: Geisa Henry
review: I've had  this savings account for a long time, the bad thing about is that the agency I started with is 70 miles away from my house, I have moved and never "moved" my account. The great thing about this account is that the agency is 70 miles away. The money is there, secure, and far  away from me. I like that is  growing and I don't really mind the pace. Customer service is awesome, they are nice to me over the phone or online this days and they were awesome to me when my English was not very good, 14 years ago (an they had a different name)

name: Chris Kurtoff
review: The Dillard Store credit card is a must have for anyone who shops at Dillard's because of the amazing 10% discount you get for every purchase you make at the store.  The APR is competitive with most store credit cards, so you can't really complain there, although it is a little bit on the high side.  If you shop at Dillard's and don't have this card it's like missing out on a year round sale!

name: Daniel Burgess
review: I have previously had issues with Wells Fargo, and illegal overdraft protection practices. In the last few months I have noted, and called Wells Fargo on this. Currently if you have a balance and two items will come through their policy is to push through the largest charge first in hopes of catching multiple overdraft fees. This is instead of pushing the smaller charge through which would allow for less fees to be incurred.

name: Theo Kaisa
review: Wells Fargo is a great bank and has always been helpful for me. There was a time earlier this year when there were unauthorized fraudulent charges to my debit card and the company that charged it to me would not move it. I called wells fargo and explained the situation and they were more than likely to help. They reached out to the company and they  still would not give me my money back. Wells Fargo immediately deactivated my card so that I would not have recurring charges to my account and they sent me a new card in the mail which I got about a week later.

name: Sonia Garcia
review: I've had a Way2Save account with Wells Fargo for about 2 years now. It's a great account. It is a checking and saving account. Each month $25 is automatically withdrawn from the checking account to the savings account. You are able to choose and change the date of the transaction. It's great because although there is a monthly $10 fee; there are several options to have it free. I've had it free by just making the required monthly deposit. I use it quite often; so that too is another way to get it free. I love that there are so many locations in my area and they are conveniently located. I am also grateful that they do stay opened an hour after 5:00PM each weekday! They also have hardcore security; I've been refused withdraws when I don't have my ID with me; and when I make big purchases online--I get a phone call from the bank asking me to verify my order. It was kinda annoying at first; but now I just wait for the call :)

name: Angie
review: Saving money for a college education is not as easy as you would think, because there always seems to be something getting in the way of starting to safe the money. So when I decided it was time to put money aside for a college fund, I was thrilled when I found the perfect savings program for me at Wells Fargo. The customer service representative was so helpful and gave me just the guidance I was looking for.  I know I am on the way to helping my child go to college.

name: Leidiane Loureiro
review: even though the savings rates are very low, I still love this account because its give me the peace of mind that I am saving my money and I love when my money grows even by just a penny. I love the way to save program GREAT SERVICE. This account gives me the ability to transfer money to this from my checking account in a heart beat. I love this account thank you so much wells fargo for this amazing account and services it comes with.

name: Joao
review: the account i have at wells fargo is simply the best. First of all every time I use my debit card the bank transfer over 1.00 which I see that it really helps me save money. On average I save about 100+ just with this service. Great job wells fargo another way to make your customers happy. I love this account

name: Leidiane Loureiro
review: with my wells fargo account i have never had a issue because it is my primary bank. i love this bank, i love the fact that i have direct deposit, with my bank, and also i have my most important investment in wells which is my MORTGAGE and i really love the online banking and how easy it is to use and transfer money when needed. Wells fargo will always be my primary bank, I will never change it.

name: Joao
review: Where do I start with Wells Fargo, How about they are really great and easy to do deal with. I love the fact that they are my primary bank and never have they failed me. Their customer service is amazing always showing that they care about me and not money. Every time I go to Wells Fargo I have the best experience, from their products to their staff. I love this bank and its products, overall I give Wells Fargo a 10

name: M. DeRizz
review: The Dillard's credit card seems like a reasonable credit card to own, particularly if you are a regular shopper at the Dillard's stores.  There are several pros to owning this card:  no annual fee, 2 points for every dollar spent grocery shopping or buying gas and a decent discount after spending $100 in Dillards.  However, there are a couple of cons also:  a relatively short grace period, high annual percentage rate.  Also, the American Express card is not accepted everywhere and Macy's offers coupons for 20% or more.  Because there are no Dillards department stores in my area, and I am not a fan of buying clothes online, I will probably not apply for a card.

name: Leo Alarcon
review: No, no, There are other options for secure cards with better rates.

name: Allison Groll
review: I've had a few ups and downs when using the Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card. At the beginning it was amazing, seeing how I had a high credit limit and no interest fees for 6 months. But after the "honeymoon" so to speak, it became a bit of a battle. Purchases would take weeks to post to my card, and thus I never knew exactly how much credit I had left at any given time. Guessing would cause me to overdraft occasionally which was very frustrating. These days I've been able to use my card with few problems, but I never know when they will pop up again and cause my credit score to suffer. Hopefully this is just a personal issue, and not something many people deal with on the regular, but I figured it'd be good to share my opinion just in case it has happen to others. Best of luck with your W.F. Platinum card!

name: Tara
review: My husband and I opened our first joint checking and savings accounts with Wells Fargo over a year ago. They helped us set up our debit cards, online banking account and even assisted us in getting a cute photo of our Pug on each of our cards. They've been extremely helpful and we know if we spend a bit over, they have our account set up for overdraft protection which takes out of our savings. We have had 0 problems with Wells Fargo and plan to continue to use them for a long time.

name: Chris Kurtoff
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card has been amazing for me!  It is a great way for someone with bad to fair credit improve their credit score because it requires you to open a collateral account, which they double to create your credit limit.  Add that to the fact that there aren't overdraft fees and the like, and you have what amounts to a very solid credit card.  Similar options by other banks will typically have not only higher APRs but also higher cash advance fees and rates as well.  And if you ever run into any issues, Wells Fargo has branches literally all over the country so an associate will be able to remedy the problem face to face, and that is something that gives me additional comfort especially considering a collateral account is required.

name: Brian Ackroyd
review: I opened a second checking account with Wells Fargo.  They are not my primary bank.  I opened due to work.  I haven't had it open for that long, but so far I have to say that I am pleased.  It is always easy to find a location, or atms.  I hate paying fees, so it's nice to always be able to find an atm, even in cities I'm not firmiliar with.  All employees have always been nice and pleasent when I have had to go into a branch.  Overall, I would say that I would recommend Wells Fargo if someone asked.

name: Brendan Williams
review: I am not a fan of checking/savings accounts with fees.  There are plenty of options for higher APY accounts with no fees associated.  Other than that, Wells Fargo is a great choice for convenient ATM and branch locations.  If you are someone like me, however, who does a lot of his banking online, it makes sense to go with a competitor instead.  With that said, I have been a Wells Fargo customer for a number of years, and recommend them to anyone who needs a brick and mortar bank.

name: Jack
review: I use a few different banks in addition to Wells Fargo. When paying my credit card bill last month I accidentally clicked to pay using Wells Fargo. After realizing that I had used the wrong account, I also realized I didn't have enough money in this account to cover the charge. I called Wells Fargo, explained the situation to them and they were very helpful in allowing me to deposit funds to cover the charge so I could avoid an overdraft.

name: Daniel
review: I recently switched to the Wells Fargo Value Checking Account and i must say im very pleased with it. The online features are on par with other checking accounts i have had and you can open this account with just a $50 deposit. The fees are very low and can be waived if you maintain a minimum balance or have $500 or more in direct deposits per month.

name: Christy Nicole
review: Overall, I have had a good experience with Wells Fargo. I will say, however that I do not like that I signed up for Over Draft protection (to move money from my savings to my checking when am negative in my checking account) and the first time I had to utilize this feature, I was charged $15! I do not think they should charge anything to move my own money from one account to another.

name: Matt Morgan
review: This is an excellent credit card for everyday usage. I like to use this card instead of my debit for all of the extra protection it offers from fraud, as well as the bonus points to use towards cash back or other incentives. My other card is an AMEX Blue and this Wells Fargo Rewards cards beats it easily! The card provides 0% apr for the first year, which is another added bonus. The best part about the card is it provides 5 points for every $1 you spend on gas, grocery, and drugstore shopping trips for the first 6 months. I give the card 5 stars for an everyday usage credit card. I highly recommend the Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card to my friends and family!

name: John Irwin
review: I have been a customer at wells fargo for many years, anytime i have a question or concern involving my account it is always taken care of fast and with ease.  I recently wanted to open another savings account with them. It was quick and easy.  It took about 15-20 minutes and i was on my way feeling feeling appreciated.  Their website is always up and it is very easy to navigate to check on my savings account.  I always tell my friends about them and try to persuade them to use my bank.

name: Ashley Roberts
review: I have had multiple accounts with Wells Fargo over the past few years and I am pleased with them all. The way to save account is free for me because I have direct deposit to my checking account I believe. I have weekly reoccurring savings transfers set up and the way to save moves a dollar for every transaction I make in my checking account making it easy for my savings account to grow when I'm not looking. I have never gotten a surprise fee and I am able to easily move money between all my account immediately. I would recommend it to anyone.

name: Ashley Roberts
review: I went through a many banks before I landed at wells fargo and cannot think of any negatives after a few years with them. We have two checking accounts. The second one has a small monthly fee because we chose not to do direct deposit to it, most of the time when that fee hits it overdrafts that account and we are able to move money from the other account to cover it with no consequences. No matter what kind of deposit we make and no matter what time it is nearly always available immediately. I have only had to call customer service twice that I can recall but both times they have been friendly and American.

name: Brian Clark Ignacio
review: This is my go to card when I fill up my car, because there rewards points for it is generously high ( 5 points per $ spent), not bad, especially since I gas almost every week. Their interest rates and fees are up to par with most of the other credit cards around. What I won't do with this card is make cash advances on it, since the rates are high. What I especially love about this card is, its the only one I have that has a built in gold chip on it, which gives me the extra security I need, and want in a credit card. I'm planning to take a vacation abroad soon, and with the gold chip technology built on my card, I can feel safe using my card outside of the country.

name: Cory Williamson
review: This is a card where the limit is equal to the amount of collateral, and yet they charge $25 in annual fees, plus interest. My sister got this card and when I told her she should cancel it because it was a terrible deal, they tell her it will take 45-60 days to refund the money that she put up as collateral. They were able to get that money out of her account the *same day* the card was opened, but can't refund it for two months? That's even more absurd.

name: SaidandBobbiejo Lazo
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for a long time. I started as a young married mother with little to my name. I was always treated with respect even though I hardly had anything to deposit. As I've aged I have been to several different branches across the country, with good customer service at each location. One time I even deposited over $600 in coins into my account and the tellers helped me roll them. With such good customer service Wells Fargo also now has my mortgage too!

name: John Irwin
review: I have been with wells fargo for over ten years now and decided to open another checking account.  It was very easy, took less than ten minutes and i was set.  What they didn't tell me was i had to have 500 dollars in the account or i would get a ten dollar fee. I talked to one of their reps and they credited my account and even gave me ten dollars extra for staying with them. I will keep using wells fargo as long as their customer service stays the same!

name: Anna Borja
review: I love my Wells Fargo checking account. It's the customer service that they offer that makes all the difference here. As with any product or service there is always a margin of human error that will show eventually, and with some banks more than others! I have been pleasantly surprised with the consistency of quality and service offered in my 20+ years with my checking account, so much so that I have since opened accounts for more of their products. The only issue I have ever experienced is, because I have had my account for so long, the occasional modification of their fee structure. I am of the opinion that since I started out with a free checking account it should stay free. Every rep I have spoken with over the years in person or online has patiently worked with me to make this happen, with the follow up phone calls, and etc. to ensure my full satisfaction. Every employee I have ever dealt with is not only very professional but also very knowledgeable. Full A1 service that I have yet to find elsewhere!In short, Wells Fargo is the best checking account I have tried, from credit unions to premier accounts, very highly recommend.

name: Mary
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for several years and across multiple states and have always enjoyed a sense of security with them. When I forgot to update my address and had checks ordered and sent to a previous address, they were able to reissue the box of checks with minimal hassle. The same thing happened with my debit card a year ago. I primarily use online services to manage my account, and am very satisfied with how easy it is to find everything from the routing number to the account details.

name: Anna Borja
review: This is a very good credit card, though not the one I use for daily purchases, because the rate is variable and I prefer the fixed rate (and 3x rewards, since I frequently shop Amazon) that I get with my Amazon Rewards card. I keep this as an occasional use card, and as overdraft protection for my Wells Fargo checking account (and it helps me get free checking which is something to look into if you also have other Wells Fargo products, which is a tidy reward in it's own right). The rewards are OK and they do sometimes have promos for extra rewards. The major selling point that keeps this in my wallet is Wells Fargo customer service, which is excellent.
