This is a card I would highly recommend  to anyone.

name: Julie Curts
review: I initially got this Wells Fargo secured business credit card when I started my nanny business. I made the decision to go with Wells Fargo security card because I had a bank account with Wells Fargo. Previously, I had been married and had to file bankruptcy when I divorced . I faced many troubles when I was starting my small business. I will be grateful to Wells Fargo and the secured business card because I was able to build my credit up from virtually nothing.My credit score went up and I was able to pursue other ventures, but this was my start. My initial investment was $5000. I would recommend this to anybody who is looking to start a small business and may have some past financial mistakes.

name: Lindsay Haggenmiller
review: I like that you can link the card to your checking account to help avoid overdrafts.

name: Dustin Smith
review: I have used Wells for approximately 5 years. Customer service has always been willing to discuss and help fix any issues I have encountered during that time. Never had any issues with hidden fees or charges, which is uncommon compared to other banks I have used. My satisfaction with their customer service for my checking account led to me opening up additional accounts with WF, all of which have my needs.

name: Trace Martin
review: Worst credit card ever. Never call customer service for anything, they will freeze your account. Twice now I've called trying to get them to send my new card to my address, but they sent it to a different address! They charged me for rush shipping both times, even though they explicitly said they wouldn't the second time after having messed up the first one. I have no problem with the credit card itself the customer service is just terrible.  I went through a name change a few years back and they froze all my accounts until I had to physically go into a Wells Fargo branch and get them to unfreeze it. I love my Wells Fargo checking and savings account, just NEVER get the credit card. It is awful.

name: Heather Hulett
review: What I do not like about this card is the high interest rate.  I currently hold the Discover card and that interest rate is a bit higher but I do get cash back rewards.   I also have the Alaska Airlines card and it has a much more affordable rate and I get free flights with my miles quickly.  I think the Wells Fargo card would be a great card if you are not planning on using it much if you wanted to connect it to your Wells Fargo account to have the overdraft protection.  The annual feel is reasonable.  The cash advance fee is 23.99%!  That is outrageous.  For people that want or need a secured card it is a decent option but I think you would have to be very disciplined to keep from getting into trouble all over again!

name: Christine
review: I've used Wells Fargo for years now and anytime I have an issue I go right into my bank, where they all treat me warmly and greet me by name, and they take care of my issue right there. Even when I call CS over the phone for issues, its resolved within minutes and I don't have to worry about speaking to a robot in another country. They understand issues come up and even have fee forgiveness and have helped me out. When going to my branch they even disclose to me the small print as a heads up, so I don't find out about it by surprise and have an issue!

name: wes
review: I've had a checking account with Wells Fargo for many years now and I can say that it was a fantastic choice. Having direct deposit at my job has voided the monthly fee for many years and my money is always available and under trustworthy security from fraud. Overall a great experience and I would recommend Wells Fargo to people debating which bank to open a checking account with.

name: Tim Lawrence
review: I opened a Way2Save account with Wells Fargo a couple weeks ago and couldn't be happier. The banker was great, she set up the online banking, bill pay and even made it so I wouldn't be charged the monthly fee.  She went as far as entering the first vendor in my bill pay so I knew how to do it.  I may have lucked out with a great banker, but every time I have been into a branch they have been helpful and pleasant.

name: Derek Jenson
review: This is a good card. I have always had success with Wells Fargo customer service. I have a different Wells Fargo credit card linked to my account in order to avoid overdraft fees. It works out quite nicely when things like that happen. The rewards are similar to my Capital One venture card. The interest rate is pretty standard. Also the introductory rate is great. You can even transfer balances for 12 months for 0%, obviously at times this would come in very handy. I would definitely recommend this card to friends and family and would even consider it for personal use.

name: Blythe Passanando
review: I think this is a great card for new credit card holders! To put in and only use what you put in is an easy way to learn how to properly use credit. If I had this option when I was younger it would have helped me a great deal. The annual fee is on par with my current credit card the Amazon Visa and I think would give credibility to the actual experience of charges and fees most credit cards have. Given the chance to use only what is available and nothing more could lead to a better economy, in my opinion.

name: Christopher Ryan
review: The Wells Fargo Platinum Card has been great for me. The annual APR is usually really low, and my credit has been extended multiple times. The service also sends reminders if I am past due for a minimum payment!

name: Jesse Stone
review: I opened up a secured card with a $300 deposit. I have found that it has been a great way for me to build my credit score. You need to be very careful about paying off the card so you don't get hit by the large interest rate. One problem I've encountered is that it takes a week to receive your $300 deposit back if you try and close the account. It also will turn-over into a credit card after 12 months.

name: Abraham Bloomer
review: Are you still using it?

name: Daniel Ducharme
review: I love their basic Way2Save checking and savings account. I have also had my credit card through them for several years. I have never had any problems and have been very happy with their service and their products.One tiny blot on their record for me happened when I had some debits and credits miss ordered during one day, and they fined me about 45 dollars. When I received my statement and saw the charges, I went in to a branch. They said that because I didn't come right to them, they were unable to fully refund the Insufficient Funds fee. However they did refund half. In my thinking, if they felt responsible for half, they were responsible for the whole fee.However, their online and mobile banking is exemplary. I have had no issues and find them both very useful.

name: Angelique Lacognata
review: I have had a Way2Save savings account for a couple years now and I love it. It is super easy to transfer money and moving $1 to savings when I make a purchase from my checking has been an easy way for me to save. I use the Wells Fargo app on my phone and it makes checking my balance, transfers and everything else much easier. I have only had to call their customer service one time and I got right through to a person! When I was with Regions I would be on hold for a minimum of 10 minutes.

name: Brian Shaw
review: I have had nothing but positive experiences with the Wells Fargo branch my wife and I became members of once we got married. Following getting married we combined our accounts (which seems not to be the norm any more, but I guess we are old fashion). When we went in the staff was very helpful, answered all our questions and didn't try to up-sell any new exciting offers we were not interested in. Every time since, I have had the same great experience.

name: Wayne Pittman
review: We've had this card for 14+ years, I just found a car rental for about half of what the big travel sites were running, I didn't have enough points to get it free and clear, but was able to use my points and cover the rest with $.  So it really worked well.  I ordered plane tickets for my parents awhile back and the Wells Fargo Rewards website had tickets on Southwest Airlines lower than Southwest.com.  Every time we have looked to go to a different card, the Wells Fargo Signature still wins out.  We pay the balance every month so I haven't had any dealings with the interest rate.  Wells Fargo has done a great job with fraud detection and stopped payments on fraudulent charges over the years.

name: Carrie Willis
review: I wish they had the feature to create sub-accounts to help you save for certain goals like some of their competitors do. I have several different goals that I save for and knowing how much I have saved towards each one would be very handy.  Otherwise, it is just a plain boring savings account with no real features to help you organizes your finances or improve your saving habits.

name: Katie Lynn
review: I own a Wells Fargo Cash Back card and overall have had a fairly good experience with it. I have found that it takes quite a while to receive any cash back. I use my card to pay off only a few bills and then switch the money over right away from my other accounts, because the way I see it is if you build up interest at all the money that you are earning for your cash back rewards is a wash. You have to be using your card quite frequently with no lag-time to pay it off. However, I have been doing smaller payments that are payed off fast for several years and have kept the money accumulating. Over that period of time I have earned quite a bit of "free" money!

name: Cory McGuffin
review: It takes forever to get that 1% rebate. If it kept the 5% it would be worth while but the APR is super high. They have made the payments better than what they were and have allowed the use of more keyboards other than the default keyboards. The customer service isn't too bad. I know that I have dealt with worse. Not the best credit card that I have had that is for sure.

name: Jake Frischknecht
review: The cash advance rate is very typical for a store card.  However what i really like about this card is the no annual fee and the max late fee that is set at $35 each!!

name: Derek Jenson
review: This is just your basic card, not too many bells and whistles.  I use this mainly as my emergency card, it is linked to my checking account in case of accidental overdraft.  Wells Fargo has always provided me with great customer service,  and this card is no different.  Would definitely recommend to anyone.

name: Aaron Kettler
review: It is nice to get additional markdowns of 30%, plus 10% off for a shopping pass, plus 25% off for working there. Tailored suit for $205.00.

name: Kate Mecary
review: I like that it's a credit card for people with bad credit scores.  I don't like that you have to deposit money into a collateral account.

name: Justin
review: I haven't had too many problems with my checking account. The only thing that bothers me is the federal maximum amount of times I can transfer my money between accounts. I understand this isn't the bank's fault, but it's ridiculous that I'm restricted with what I can do with my own money. Overall, the account has been a good experience and I've been able to manage my funds how I want to.

name: Justin
review: I haven't had too many problems with my credit card. The only thing that bothers me is the interest rate. I understand this isn't the bank's fault, but it's ridiculous that I'm restricted with what I can do with my own money. Overall, the card has been more bad for me than good, but that's with all credit cards. The temptation is too high to not use it. I have since destroyed the card but it was useful for me at one time.

name: Barrett Round
review: I have had this card for many years. And while I have little use for it's uncompetitive 1% flat-rate rewards, it has a 2.99% + Prime rate which I negotiated before the turn of the decade and the tightening of that tactical option used over the phone with a service rep. It also has such a high limit, I was able to create my start-up (food truck).

name: Karen
review: I love having a Dillard's card because I travel in the South and they're popular there (I'm in California and they are few and far between here). I also like the card because it actually has a decent APR -- it's lowest rate is only about 13% -- though it can go up to over 20%, so beware. I use my store credit cards sparingly because I don't want to get buried under debt. However, I do like to use them stores at the stores I like due to special deals and coupons. The rewards also make it attractive. Unlike Macy's, they send reward certificates based on how much you use the card and spend. The discounts aren't as deep as Macy's, but they're still good enough, coupled with the lower APR, to entice me to go to Dillard's and use my card.

name: David Donahue
review: On the up side, the card can improve your credit score.  The downside proves why people find their credit score tumbling.  With a high interest rate against your own money and not to mention the fact that if you take a cash advance on your OWN money which has secured the card, a fee of $20.00 is assessed for any transaction up to $100.00. After that it is 5%. So, it's up to you but I'd be very very careful especially when considering a cash advance or transfer of funds to your checking account.  Transfers are also considered cash advance.  It's typical of banks but I don't like the way consumers are tricked into getting walloped if they take $20.00 out of an ATM.  Your best bet if you use the card is to use it only on transactions, don't use it at an ATM or go to the bank and take money out on it.  You will be unpleasently suprised.  It's great if you use it responsibly and pay off the balance each month.  Sorry, but I can give it no more than two stars..

name: Ashley Smith
review: I enjoy my WellsFargo savings account because it comes with additional features that allow me to save even if I don't always remember to. As a college student, with lots of expenses and little finances to handle them, building a savings account is easier said than done but with the feature of my account that takes a small portion from my overall balance with each transaction I make, I have been able to accrue a sizable amount of money which I never would have were it not for their help...Saving made easy.

name: Kathy Holobar
review: As far as secured credit cards go, Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card looks pretty appealing.  The minimum deposit is only $300, while other secured cards require more than this to open an account.  I like that they do report to credit bureaus so that folks with bad or no credit can obtain a credit rating.  And a positive credit rating by paying this bill on time.

name: Jessica Cunningham
review: I was a Wachovia customer since 1989. I loved banking with them always helpful and never had any problems. Both of my checking and savings accounts were free, no monthly charges. This all changed when Wells Fargo took over. I started getting charged a monthly fee. This is WRONG! You should not debit someones account without their authorization. When I called customer service, their response was this was happening to everyone's account and there was nothing she could do to help me. I decided to go to the branch that I used most often to see if they could assist me. The gentleman was nice, but he was unable to return the money they debited without my consent. I they proceeded to close ALL of my accounts, personal & business. I am now banking with Bank of America & Suntrust. I am very happy with the two banks I use now.

name: Anthony
review: I signed up for the account two years ago, but it was not until a year later when i needed to withdraw a lump sum amount of money to pay for tuition that i decided to close the account. The manager told me because it was the end of the month they would not let me withdraw the amount i wanted to withdraw because they had restrictions on the total amount someone would withdraw in the middle of the month and the end of the month. This left be with no option but to close the account so that i can get my money. It was a very frustrating experience considering the fact that i needed that money real bad.

name: Renée Aspinwall
review: I have had the Wells Fargo Platinum credit card for over a year now. This has been my first credit card and overall the experience has been very good. I was approved quickly and received the card in a timely manner. So far I only use my card for gasoline and emergencies, paying off any debt I have immediately which has been working for me very well in building my credit score.

name: Jaime Park
review: I've had my Dillard's credit card for about a year now and what's great is that it's a rewards-based card. I have a long commute to work so earning 2 reward points for every $1 spent on gasoline is awesome to go towards that purse I've been eyeing on lately. I can also use it at the grocery store which is an added bonus, who doesn't shop for groceries? So, earning rewards goes fast at 2 reward points for every $1 spent. This is why I keep my Dillard's card at hand always, compared to the Nordstrom's card I have, that doesn't have as many member discounts. Definitely would recommend to anyone who likes to shop!

name: Barbara
review: Compared to my Capital One platinum card, this seems to be a great card with lot's of benefits. The interest rate can be a bit high but I think the rewards make up for that. I like the fact that you can link the card to a checking account to avoid overdraft fees. Roadside dispatch and emergency assistance services can come in real handy! This card is way better than the one I have now!

name: Rob
review: I became a Wachovia member before Wells Fargo purchased them a few years back. I thought the service was good then, but when Wells Fargo took over, the customer service got even better. I've been a member at two banks where the service was absolutely awful, so when I say that I've NEVER had a bad experience when dealing with Wells Fargo, you have to realize that this goes way beyond my expectations. The folks at the counter are always prompt and genial. If I have a problem and call the bank I always get somebody who is happy to hear from me and who helps in every way possible. I recommend this bank to everybody I know who is looking to make a change. Thanks, Wells Fargo!

name: Nick Wygonik
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for almost 5 years. Wachovia was my first choice, but was soon bought out by WF. As you could imagine switching banks unwillingly was a bit tense at first but I am very happy with the experiences I have had since then. Their have some of the most professional customer service for banks I have ever dealt with.  When ever i do business I feel that they are always looking of for my best interest by offering services that are beneficial to me. For anyone whos new to banking or just looking for something better, I would highly recommend giving this bank a try.

name: chase joslin
review: I just switched to Wells Fargo because I moved from Hawaii to Texas and they do not have Hawaii banks in Texas. I searched up and down to see which banks offered the best checking account in regards to fees, convenience, and location. I couldn't be more happy with my selection. Wells Fargo lets you do just about anything you can think of online. You can transfer money from your other accounts with just one touch on your smartphone. I have never had a problem finding a branch as they are on just about every corner. The lady that help me set up my account was extremely nice and thanked me more than once for choosing them as my bank. So far, I love Wells Fargo!

name: Joe
review: My savings account is very good with a good bank.  At First I was not sure about it, however, it creates a security blanket if the checking account is out of funds.  However, during the turnover from Wachovia, my savings was not working for a while.  I was very confused until I went to my local branch.  The manager helped me and got my account back on track.  This was an issue however, this was fixed and made my day.

name: Douglas Griffin
review: I have a general opinion about Wells Fargo that has manifested during the past 8 years of using their checking and savings accounts. Wells Fargo usually has good customer service, but if there is ever a charge to be disputed, do not count on them for much help. I once spent 2 months trying to get $500 returned to my account that Wells Fargo was blocking. They never told me why or how to speed up the process. The other company involved had released the money but Wells Fargo held on to it. Eventually the money did appear in my account, and I immediately called to find out where it was from (unexpected jumps in deposits and withdrawals worry me) and the customer service person acted like I was crazy, like "why are you worried about how long it took, it's in your account now". Satisfactory service but there is no sense of customer loyalty. No incentive to stay, and usually it's the customer service that saves business.

name: Lakeisha Morrison
review: I use to have the Way2Save Savings account from Wells Fargo. It is a convenient account, because it is free under a few conditions, but I decided to close it because they started to charge me fees that I didn't know I was going to get charged. When i signed up they didnt mention anything about fees being charged monthly until I would look on my account and see money missing. After a year with them i got fed up and closed my account.

name: Princess Apache
review: I had this card back when I was an employee for Dillard's.  There was absolutely nothing that I did not like about this Dillard's Store Card.  The fees and rates are typically lower than other department store cards.  The best part about the card was the reward points, and the shopping pass.  I used to be at the mall all the time, so I have definitely gotten my fair share of use with this card and have racked up many points.  Also, the customer service department has always been very helpful and professional in answering my questions and concerns.

name: Rory Whyville
review: I do not make much money so this is a nice basic checking account. It's awesome to have the second option of having $500+ direct deposits a month instead of the minimum balance. Don't expect to be making bank with interest ;) They are very good with security: after the latest breach at Target, they contacted me saying my debit card might have been affected (even though there were no fraudulent charges) so they would send me a new card with a new number. Using their ATMS is easy, I love that you don't need an envelope for deposits at most either! In Salt Lake City there are a ton of ATMs and banks around so it's never an issue getting there.

name: Early Nineties
review: I usually do not enjoy using cards that have an annual fee.  Especially when there are no bonuses and the fees are high.  However, the required credit score is "bad", this means you can use this card to help your credit score go higher!  I highly recommend it for a person that has made mistakes in the past and has ruined their score.  Be careful, the rate is a little high though.

name: Rory Whyville
review: I loved the idea of cash back and had a good experience with another rewards card from Wells Fargo so I thought why not earn cash. It takes a while for the charges to stop pending so it takes a while to actually get the cash back balance updated. It's worth it if you will use it for weekly expenses, such as groceries, that you will pay off right away and get the cash back. If you can't pay the balance right away I don't think the card's the best option since you won't get any cash back until it's paid and the interest rate, after 12 months, can be very high.

name: Tony Schmitt
review: The Dillard's store card is a decent option if you tend to shop there a lot. The 10% initial discount is a nice perk. I recommend waiting until you have a few large purchases, then getting the card to receive that discount, so that you maximize your savings. The point system is also not too bad for those who shop there frequently. What may seem like a small perk can really add up over the years.

name: Janie Richmond
review: There are some definite credit card benefits that can be felt by frequent Dillard's shoppers. As I'm in the midst of repairing my credit, interest rates are already fairly high on new accounts, so that doesn't necessarily surprise me. However, I currently have a cash-back card through CapitalOne (Quicksilver)- and I'd much prefer cash to points! While the 1.5% cash back is a fairly low number, it's exceptional in that it applies to all purchases. Overall, I wouldn't receive much benefit from the Dillard's Credit Card, especially in comparison to Quicksilver which gives me the only reward I'm interested: money!

name: Phillip Cahill
review: I have been using this account for 5 years now and I have always been satisfied. Wells Fargo doesn't always get the best reputation, but their service for this has been impeccable. I don't pay fees, I don't have a minimum balance, and they've always been very flexible with me about problems. I definitely recommend this account for anyone who is eligible. New students: this is a great place to start.

name: Gershom Richards
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card has various options that make it highly consumer favored. The Intro Rates provided for the card aren’t matched by many card of its caliber, as it covers both purchases AND transfers. The cash advance fee is smaller than the card that I use, which makes it useful to get cash in a pinch, without being put back too much. The cash back program goes up to 5% for gas and grocery shopping, a 2% increase from their college credit card. However, the regular rate appears to have the possibility of reaching high numbers, up to 25.99%, which is very high.

name: Lawrence
review: My issues with Wells Fargo began while I was still a customer of Wachovia before Wells Fargo acquired it.  Wachovia would always post purchases on my debit card late, leaving me with less money than my account routinely informed me that I had.  I had hoped that those problems would be resolved once Wachovia became Wells Fargo.  It certainly did not.  Things got better when for about a year Wells Fargo offered me overdraft protection on my account by paying a monthly fee that would go towards overdraft fees.  Then out of nowhere, last November, I was charged an overdraft fee despite having the money for overdraft protection taken from my account.  After calling to speak with them, I had a rude customer service rep tell me that it was impossible for me to have overdraft protection on my checking account, despite my bank statements from previous months showing that I had never been charged when I had overdrafted.  This same rep then tried to rush me off and forward me to a credit card that I said I was not interested in.  If it were not for family members that have the same bank, allowing me to easily transfer funds back and forth, I would have left Wells Fargo.  I have been thoroughly disappointed with their service and would not recommend it as a bank to others.

name: Peg Fisher
review: I was originally a customer of Wachovia, and Wachovia got bought out by Wells Fargo. With Wachovia, I had free monthly checking. When Wells Fargo came in, they hit me with a monthly fee! I'm on a small budget, and this was bad for me. I had to leave Wells Fargo, and switch to my current Credit Union, where I once again can get free checking.

name: Joe
review: After the transition from Wachovia to Wells Fargo, the bank has been nothing but great.  They are courteous, professional, very personable and helpful both in the bank and on the phone.  The webpage is easy to use, easy to follow along with the banking app.  I occasionally get phone calls from the bank to see how I am doing and if I need any help with my student loans or refinancing.  They are all over the place, meaning it is not hard to find a branch.  Recently I had to change my debit card and it was hassle free.  Two thumbs up for this bank!!!

name: Josh Ward
review: Like most other people on here, the Dillard's Card is absolutely amazing. I must say i use this card more than any of my other cards. A lot of people are talking about the 10% off discount which was nice but the aspect i like most about it is its point system. Since i shop there very often i can redeem my points for gift cards in which i can buy more things! I highly recommend this card to anyone, even if you don't shop at Dillard's too much!

name: Rory Whyville
review: The 0% interest rate is great, as long as you do not spend more than you can pay off. After the six months I had a balance that I could not pay off and a very high interest rate. Obviously this is my fault, and not Wells Fargo. Right now the card is canceled and I am working on paying it off. While I did have it, it was always approved quickly. If you cannot pay off the balance before the interest is added I would recommend looking for a card with a lower interest rate.

name: susy seija
review: Banking with Wells Fargo has not been a good experience. Their posting of transactions is not accurate. There were times where transactions would disappear giving me a higher account balance from what I actually had making it so much harder to balance my checkbook accurately and until I caught on to what had been happening I had many unexplained overdraft fees. I would expect a large bank like Wells Fargo not to have this kind of issue with their systems. When I would call customer service they would be able to explain to me what was going on either. They claimed they've never heard of that happening.

name: Theo Kaisa
review: This is a good option for someone with bad credit or no credit who is trying to build credit. For me, i'd prefer something like the capital one venture card which is unsecured since I have good credit.

name: Heather
review: I have had little else but bad experiences with Wells Fargo since I opened my account. The first time was when I deposited a check. The sign stated that deposits made before 4 PM would be credited that business day, it didn't specify that certain types of deposits or accounts were not applicable to that statement. I deposited a check and was not told that there would be any type of hold on it and because I had done it before the cut off time I assumed that it would be readily available. I went to make a purchase at a college bookstore and was humiliated when I was told my card declined the sale. That is when I found out that Wells Fargo does not post the check deposit on my type of account until the following business day and that they won't cash checks for my type of account either. If I had been told when making the deposit this detail I wouldn't have been as upset and would not have attempted to make my purchase that day.

name: Kristine
review: The Dillard's Credit Card carries quite a high interest rate which compares to a card I've had through Chase.  If not mindful of spending, the interest rate can be very costly on a higher balance.  While the rewards can add up, I wouldn't use this card to buy groceries or gas to make this worth my time.  While Dillard's is a great store, I don't shop there enough to have the points be of any benefit to me personally.

name: Katie
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for five years. I switched to Wells Fargo after having a problem with my previous local bank, where my debit card was stolen and I received no assistance in recovering stolen funds. I have NEVER had a problem like this with Wells Fargo. My checking account has always been secure, and the staff has been helpful every time I have called customer service or gone into a branch. They have locations everywhere, which is very convenient for travel and moving. I also LOVE their new mobile deposit system. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking to open a new checking account!

name: Samantha Weilacher
review: I have had my account for about five years and have been very happy with it. I started out as a Wachovia customer and after the merger became a Wells Fargo customer with the Way2 Save account. I love that I am putting money away for a rainy day without even thinking about it. I do wish that there were branches closer to where I live now, as I have to travel thirty miles to get to my bank now. However, I find it so helpful that I can make deposits through the ATM until 9pm and it is treated as the same day transaction. This makes driving out of my way a little better.

name: Logan
review: Good checking account for those with few other options, as the fees can be avoided and it can be a "free" checking account if you watch what you are doing. However, it is very very easy to rack up fees either from ATM transactions or from simply not using the account enough. If you are careful however, the service is also great, I've lost multiple card and had purchases on them and have had Wells Fargo take care of it quickly and effectively every time. Just watch the fees and don't forget to make your purchases!

name: Becky Weaver
review: Wells Fargo offers a great checking account for college students and has top-of-the-line customer service. A few months ago I incurred a charge on my debit card for over $150 from a website that I had never visited. It had also caused an overdraft of my account. I contacted Wells Fargo who immediately flagged my account for fraud. They told me to attempt to contact the company first to get a refund, and if that didn't work, contact Wells Fargo again. I did as they told, but got no responses from the company, and after a few days, called Wells Fargo again. Customer service was such a help! They refunded the charge, removed the overdraft fee, and set me up a completely new account. I had a new debit card within a few days as well! Overall, I have been extremely happy with Wells Fargo college checking account.

name: Patrick Yercich
review: I have a Wells Fargo Way2Save checking account, and in general it's just fine. We get same-day deposits on checks taken to the ATM, even after-hours. Online transfers are easy, and stuff from PayPal posts really fast. However, I had to dock the review a couple of stars because they DO alter the order of withdrawals to extort more overdraft fees. We ate a $70 overdraft for two items (a bag of diapers and some gas) because of an electric bill we paid the next day. Apparently those two purchases remained "pending" for an extra day after our electric bill went through, even though they were paid first. The bank refused to waive the fees. So, be careful if you account is low and you're making purchases. You may end up with some surprise fees.

name: Alex Jachym
review: The rewards and incentives for this card seem like a very good deal. I typically do not leave a balance on my card so the interest rate is not an issue for me. If you take advantage of all of the rewards, you can really save a lot of money.

name: Ashley Davis
review: I was offered this checking account when my husband and I went into Wells Fargo to open an account. WalletHub states that there is a 10.00 fee for having this account, but I do not believe that is true. This account is free as long as you either have direct deposit going into it and if you have a transfer to a savings account at least once a month. I have not had any issues with account and use it multiple times a day! It's great and you can control it from the mobile app as well. I would highly recommend this to a friend!!

name: Eric Luna
review: My wife and I have had checking accounts with Wells Fargo for many years now. We have been very satisfied with the financial products and services they offer as well as their great customer service. Its easy to access our accounts online and transfer funds anytime we want. The bankers at Wells Fargo are very helpful and can assist us with any financial questions that we have had. I know we will continue to use the excellent services at Wells Fargo for may years to come.

name: Ashley Davis
review: I have the Way2Save Savings account from Wells Fargo. It is a convenient account, because it is free under a few conditions. if you have a job that has direct deposit, there is no annual charge for the account. Also, one per month if you make an automatic transfer from checking to savings it's free as well. i love the automatic transfer because it's a way to save money without even thinking about it. I would recommend this account to a friend who was just starting to save money or wanted something the basic. The interest is pretty low, so you won't be making much extra.

name: Cody Kalinowski
review: I have never had a problem with my Wells Fargo checking account. They have a wonderful online banking system that makes it very easy to cash checks, transfer money, and keep track of my current balance. Also, they have an awesome Way 2 Save system that helps me slowly save money every time I spend. I highly recommend Wells Fargo for anyone who wants a reliable and convenient bank. I see myself continuing to use them in the future.

name: Chris
review: I have used my Wells Fargo Way2Save account for overdraft protection as well as an emergency fund. I like having my savings and checking account linked, and the convenience of having all of the information available online makes the accounts a great fit for me. The auto-transfer feature is also a great way to save extra cash without really realizing it!

name: Wendy Damske Gabrysiak
review: I’m not a fan of the Dillard’s Credit Card. While your point earned per dollar is similar to other cards I have the simple fact that’s its part of American Express isn’t something I would be interested in. For the simple fact American Express isn’t always accepted where I shop. The interest rate is high compared to others credit cards. The grace period on the card is 3 days shorter than most credit cards. And since I don’t charge gas or groceries on any credit card. I’d never earn the maximum number of points to make the card worth considering.

name: Sunshine Mares
review: I had a checking account here a few years ago, and I constantly had problems with them.  Anything from deposits disappearing in the system to fees appearing from out of nowhere.  I finally had to close my account and go to another bank.  I was not a fan.  They may have changed things since then - I hope so.

name: Larry D
review: This Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is a good option for people with bad credit to restore their credit rating.  Going beyond a typical pre-paid card, it actually reports to all of the major bureaus on your payment history, which is a big plus for anyone who pays their bills on time.  However, if you have a strong enough credit score to get a traditional unsecured credit card, this would be a terrible way to go.  You are basically paying a high interest rate (19%) on your own money, as opposed to paying an interest rate on someone else’s money (typical credit card).  The annual fee and absence of other fees are in line with more competitive credit card, but this is not a good option for anyone that can get a card.  You are paying them almost 19% and $25 a year to tell the credit bureaus you’re paying on time, so you have to evaluate how much that is worth.

name: Jen Lee
review: I've had Wells Fargo savings account for many years. I love it. I never had any problems with them at all. The customer service on the phone and inside the locations are all great. It is extremely easy to make transfers from one account to another. It is also great to have $1.00 of each transaction transferred from my checking into this account. It makes saving so much easier. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to save.

name: mary hart
review: I've had a Wells Fargo savings account for years! I love wells fargo! If you EVER have a problem they will help you understand and they will fix it. The customer service when you go into a location is like no other. They are a smoothly run instituiton that makes you feel secure that you're saving with them. If I didn't have a saving account with them I doubt i'd have so much money saved!

name: stephanie silva
review: I have had this savings account for about a year now. I really like it because it is connected to my checking account and I can easily transfer money between the 2 if I need to. I can also set up automatic transfers into my savings which is nice to get a nice cushion in there in case of an emergency. I use paypal alot too with my checking and it comforts me to know that most of my money is safe in savings in case my account ever gets stolen. I think me only dislike is the charge fee they charge you if you do too many transfers in a month. I found this out since I transfer money alot between checking and savings.

name: Lisa Atwell
review: Dillards is an excellent store and now they are offering a great card with excellent cash back and points options.  I love that it is backed by American Express so I feel confident that my information is secure and the company is ethical

name: Adriaan Otterloo
review: I've had an account with Wells Fargo for years and I love it! The bankers at Wells Fargo helped me avoid the annoying monthly fees associated with checking accounts by introducing me to this account. It is a good option for a checking account with fees that are easy to avoid as long as you have direct deposit or with a minimum balance. Also by linking the account with a Way2Save account it is very easy to build up your savings--every transaction you make on your debit card will put $1 into your Way2Save account. Highly Recommended.

name: Amanda Taylor
review: I have had my college checking account with Wells Fargo for 3 years now. The only issue I've ever had with this account was when I went into a branch to make a deposit, and then wrote a check for an application fee to a college. The check arrived on time, but it bounced. I double checked my account to find that somehow, the deposit was never made. Luckily, I kept my receipt, which showed that the money was accidentally placed in someone else's account. The bank was able to recover the accidental misplacement of the money, and wrote an official apology letter to the college about my financial integrity being sound. All was well that ended well.

name: Danielle Most
review: I have had my Checking account with Wells Fargo for about a year now. The most serious issue I faced while using this account was when the Wells Fargo Identity Protection Plan took monthly payments of $12.99 out of my account, when I had never signed up for this feature. The bank employee sat with me and refunded all payments to my account. They are always beyond friendly when you visit a branch, and I really enjoy banking with Wells Fargo.

name: stephanie silva
review: I have had wells fargo since 2003 and have had great experience with them. They are everywhere which is nice and low on fees.  When I signed up there was no monthly fee I think because I was in school..it is still like that after all this time and considered a grandfather account so it will take me alot to get me to switch :) I like that they have mobile banking and I can deposit a check from my phone. I think my only problem I ever had with them was getting a bunch of overdraft fees and they would only reverse 2 out of 5. I try to manage my money a lot better now though and have overdraft protection.

name: Andrew Weiss
review: I have been a member of the Wells Fargo family since 1990. I have had only positive experiences with Wells Fargo. I have lived in numerous states and have only banked with Wells Fargo, due to the fact that they treat me with respect and will bend over backwards to do anything for me. I have called them up in the middle of the night to correct problems and the person on the other end of the phone has been very helpful. If i have ever had a problem with them, they immediately corrected the problem no questions asked. They offer me amazing benefits to stay since I have been a loyal customer for so many years. Between the service on the phone and going into the different branches they are amazing people toward me. They are always there with a smile and a good day attitude. I love Wells Fargo and plan on going nowhere anytime soon.

name: Brandy Jankowski
review: I have had this checking account since taking it out right before starting college. There are no monthly fees, which is awesome, and I have never had any pressing issues with the account. Wells Fargo has a decent banking customer service, though automation has taken over most of it, it seems, and to me that is quite frustrating. When you do reach a live person, though, the experience usually goes well. I plan on keeping this account, checks are cheap, again, there are no monthly fees, and as a whole I like Wells Fargo. I also appreciate the fact that there is something out there that is available to college students, without giving them the burden and worry of having to pay fees.

name: Mark
review: The Wells Fargo Way 2 Save savings account is great. I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for a few years now, and the Way 2 Save is great paired with the student checking account. Every time I use my debit card, or make an online purchase it automatically transfers $1 to my Way 2 Save account which is earning interest. Not to mention that I am always greeted quickly by name when I go to my local branch.

name: Logan
review: This checking account is great for those who are younger and don't need a whole bunch of support or features, just a simple, high-value, low-fee checking account. No minimum balance and you only have to make a few purchases to avoid all fees. Wells Fargo does a great job at having few fees, tons of ATMs (Outside of the Deep South), and a great wealth of online features though both their website and their App, which allows you to transfer money and deposit checks from your phone. Only thing to worry about is using ATMs from other banks, as many times you will be "double-charged" by both that bank and wells fargo. Go with this is you're a college student with a small savings account.

name: Jackee Lindow
review: I have had this savings account for about four months. I originally got it to go along with my checking account as a form of overdraft protection. However, the way it was initially set up provided issues with the overdraft transferring. The first time I overdrafted my normal account it charged me a fee when it transferred from this account. I was under the impression that it was a free service. Now I know to just transfer the money over from my phone, but the whole point of that account was to avoid these types f fees, so be aware of that.

name: Jennifer Nelson
review: A year or so ago I had very very bad credit. I really wanted to get a credit card because I wanted to improve my credit plus have a back up amount of money in case of emergencies. I was getting secured credit card offers like this one but I didn't have the money to put a deposit down. I ended up being able to apply for regular Capital One credit card. It had an interest rate of 23% but no annual fee and no deposit required. I was able to start fixing my credit with this card. I think this Wells Fargo secured card is decent but not good for people financially strapped. It's hard to come up with $300 sometimes. I feel the interest rate could be better since you're putting a deposit down AND there is an annual fee.

name: Robert
review: This is the bank I've chosen because specifically as long as your qualifying for the no monthly service fee's and the convenience of the ATM's and branches they provide for their customers you're winning in every aspect . I previously worked at other banks and have grown accustom to the policies and procedures and I'd have to say Wells Fargo has always maintained great service and professionalism.

name: Matt B
review: I've had Wells Fargo for some time now. Like any bank, they're hit or miss. I lost my job recently and haven't been able to keep the minimum balance, so I could do without the $8 monthly "maintenance" fees; I'm sure maintaining my account doesn't require all that much work. Another minor thing I could do without is their overdraft policy. I overdrew recently, which was the first time with WF in the five years I've been with them. I called them to see if it could be reversed since it was my first time, I was only overdrawn by $6, and I had the $6 in the account the next day, but all they would do is waive half of the overdraft fee; not particularly great customer service. However, I've stayed with them because they're right down the street and they have ATMs everywhere(and I must admit that I'm a fan of being able to deposit checks through the ATM). Plus, a bank's a bank; unless you want to constantly hide money throughout your house, you have to use one.

name: Brett Cole
review: I had just moved out to Tempe, Arizona to go to Arizona State University. I had no credit cards prior to this so I figured it was going to be very hard to get one that suited me well. I had been banking with Wellsfargo since I could remember. I figured I would give them a shot first and maybe try others later. I was not let down. The low APR was awesome. They even gave me a credit limit of 800 to start off with. I wasn’t expecting anything more than 500. To this day it’s the only credit card I use. I’ve had nothing wrong happen and my limit keeps going up. 5 out of 5 stars.

name: Alla Goltsman
review: I like to use the Dillard's card in a store. My points go up quickly. I like to earn two points for every dollar I spend on gas. I recommend the card to everybody who likes to see $$$ accumulate fast. I know, my friends love it 2. I usually receive a lot of rebates when I shop at Macy's. Another good thing is that your credit goes up when you use the card. I remember I had to call customer service once. It was a fast call & they helped me. The card has good interest rates. They have a long grace period.

name: William Totten
review: I used this bank for my personal checking and savings for years. Upon arrival one day I noticed a "No Guns" sign on the door. This meant that I could not enter as I go no where where only criminals will carry a gun. I then drove to drive thru window to ask "Why" and was treated very rudely and informed that I would have to come in to cancel my accounts. I could not get the lady to understand that I could not come in to a place where i had to surrender my Constitutional rights as a Virginia citizen to enter. Needless to say a huge scene was created as I refused to leave drive thru without my money. They called the police who informed them that they could not stop me from entering with however many guns I wanted to enter with as long as my money was there. They let me in long enough to cancel my accounts then told me to leave. I would not recommend this bank to any law abiding citizen of the state of Virginia as they made it clear we are not welcome there.

name: Brandon Phelps
review: I enjoy my Wells fargo card because getting paid bi-weekly it gives me a back up on the week that I do not receive my check. It also makes me secure knowing I have the money if needed.

name: Andy Garcia
review: I like that this card offers 5 points for every dollar spent on gas. That's extremely high and considering that I spend $50+ per tank fill, this can really add up to some serious rewards. I use the Chase Signature credit card and American Express Premium rewards as my primary cards and while they don't quite stack up on the gas front, my American Express card offers fantastic rewards overall which I think outshine this card. The Chase card however doesn't stack up with the offerings of the Wells Fargo card.

name: Linda Parent
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer since 1986, yep - 28 yrs!  I have nothing but good things to say about this bank.  I have a checking account with a debit card and Bill Pay and also a credit card.  Wells Fargo also handled my mortgage in 1996 when I was just sure no one would loan me money for a home!  When I initially set up my account it was through an in-store kiosk and the whole process took 5 minutes.  I had never had a  bank account before at that time, and they made the sign-up procedure very simple.  As a customer, I love the convenience of Bill Pay.  Nearly everyone allows you to pay bills online now, but when WF first started offering Bill Pay that was not the case.  If you do direct deposit and deposit $500 a month or more into your account there are no fees!  When I moved from Indiana to California it was so easy to get everything transferred over.  I didn't have to do a thing other than tell them I was moving and they noted the account to expect hotel and restaurant charges from out of the area.  For security measures, they normally confirm out of the area charges, which I really like.  It is a security measure to reduce fraud.  I've dealt with the bank before due to attempted fraud and they made the issues so easy to resolve because they do an outstanding job of protecting their customers.  Also, I've had a couple of incidences of non-sufficient funds and when I have contacted them and explained the circumstances, they waived all fees both times.  I highly recommend Wells Fargo.  Wells Fargo has a ton of branches just about everywhere and also lots of ATMs.  They are a solid, established bank that has been around for many decades and all indications are that they are not going anywhere.  So many banks these days fold, are bought out by other financial institutions, etc.  I value the security of a well established bank that knows how to take care of its customers.  Yay for Wells Fargo!  :)

name: Jane Zen
review: I like wells fargo value checking for its efficacy and trust . It is an honor to feel peace of mind that my money is secure and just for my reaching at the end of every day. I have used other banks' checking services and are not as good as wells fargo for all the reasons stated. Whenever I reach them on the phone for any problems they are happy to help me and answer all my questions accordingly without a bad attitude.

name: Margaret Hayes
review: I opened my account at Wells Fargo this year and have had a pretty good experience so far.  I moved across the country and needed a national bank.  The customer service and online checking are wonderful and all employees have been polite.  The only issue I have had is with the card getting cut off.  This is probably due to moving and whatnot, but I feel it has happened too often and has been somewhat of a hassle compared to other banks I've had accounts with.

name: Brittni Malinowski
review: I have been using my Wells Fargo branch for a little over a year now, and had no complaints. Until now.When I opened my account, I was told that as a courtesy I would not be charged any fees, or be responsible for having a minimum balance because the company that I worked for also banked with Wells Fargo.Flash forward a year and I was laid off.Naturally there is no money in my Bank Account and I am receiving fees for not using my card often enough, and not having the minimum balance. When I went into my branch they said there was nothing they could do.I am disappointed in you Wells Fargo!!

name: Shannon B
review: I've had my checking account with Wells Fargo ever since they enveloped Wachovia, and my experience has been mixed.  Generally, I enjoy the bill pay option, ATM availability in my area, and relatively low fees compared to the other big banks.  I have also had a few issues with them.  In the most recent issue, I noticed an unauthorized $150 had been removed from my account at the end of the month, which overdrew me (for the first time), and it had overdraft fees assigned.  When I called them, they said I'd taken the money out with a deposit slip: an item I haven't used in years.  When I stated it was an invalid charge that needed to be investigated, while they did begin to look into it, the customer service was snippy, and despite it being my first overdraft, acted like she was doing me a favor by returning half the overdraft fee, which she stated "they wouldn't normally do".  When I followed up later, it turned out that they had accidentally switched the number from another customer's bank account, and at that point, apologized and corrected the remainder of the fee, but it was not great treatment.  I've also had issues with them cancelling a card due to a potential third party compromise, but neglected to inform me that my card wouldn't work.  I would still rate them a lot higher than Bank of America, but if you don't need wide ATM availability, I would still recommend going with any credit union checking account before Wells Fargo.

name: Mark Watson
review: This was really great for us at first it seemed anyhow. We opened this account not knowing we even qualified for it and came to find out the personal banker that opened the account did something shady to get it open. I'm assuming that he wanted the commission that came with a new account. Anyway I saw it as a nice gesture and was happy to have the account. About 6 months into the account being open I was told that they were going to demote the account back to an opportunity account. Now the account is closed and I will not be banking with this institution again.

name: Phil Carson
review: The Way2Save program really makes it easy to increase your savings without putting a major dent in your paycheck.  Every time you use your Wells Fargo checking account debit card for a purchase (including online), they transfer $1.00 into your savings account.  This makes it REALLY easy to maintain a savings account.  Also, if you need to transfer some cash into your checking account, there are no additional fees involved - I love it!

name: Laura Bjork
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for 6 years and have never had a problem.  One time they sent me a new debit card because of internal checks they did that said my account may have been compromised.  It turns out it wasn't, but I felt very secure when they sent me that.  Every time I go in to the bank the clerks are very friendly and sometimes thank me for how long I've been with Wells Fargo.

name: Sam
review: While Wells Fargo has been okay to save with in the past few years, I mostly have just used their account as an extra savings account without having to deal with them too often. The interest rate isn't really great by any means, but you can also avoid the monthly fee by having a regular deposit set up.  The little I've had to interact with the customer service was pleasant, but slightly artificial, more so than other banks I've used. They're friendly overall. I would recommend this bank for minor transactions.

name: jake wine
review: It's great to save money, but don't expect too much from the interest. I use my savings account all the time and it's great. The customer service has always been great, I've been using Wells Fargo since 1999. The fee isn't much at all to worry about, and I don't even get charged because I deposit more than $300 every month.  It's very easy to transfer funds from your checking account and your savings account.  All in all, I'd recommend using it to anyone looking for an account to save money.

name: Amanda Taylor
review: Although the interest on the card is a bit high for me, I can say my experience with this card has been fine. I get around $25/3 months in rewards for groceries and gas, which is great because I just put it back into the credit card. They do offer more points per dollar for certain items, but those items have to be bought through their online rewards store (things like flowers for delivery for mom). I'm giving the card 4 stars because I've had it for 6 years now, have received a credit limit boost each review period, have never made a late payment on it, and still am getting their highest interest rate despite requesting them to lower it. It'd be perfect if they'd just lower that APR.

name: Stephen Mcmadu
review: The dillard's credit card is not a great card compared to a lot of other ones out there. the rewards are not neither are the benefits worth applying for the card compared to others i have seen like the shell gas card. A poor one here.

name: Jennifer Oliphant
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo since 2002.  I started as a college student.  I had almost nothing to my name.  I was always treated with respect.  Now that I am a professional with substantial business to bring to Wells Fargo, I am still treated the same way.  I have been into several different branches across the country, with good experiences every time.  I bought two cars using Wells Fargo car loans with no problems.

name: Kim
review: We have had our Wells checking account for years and we don't have any issues, if anything the staff at the branch is very polite and friendly not to mention helpful.  We have not experienced any unnecessary fees being taken out of our account and they always seem to want to help make our money work for us.  The one think I don't like is the reward card. They are kinda pushy with it and there is a charge.  We tried it once and paid $19.95 for a year and ended up with a $25 gift card.  All in all we only came out $5 ahead, not worth the money.

name: Nicole
review: We have had a checking account with Wells Fargo for over 11 years now. I love that they are such a large national chain! This comes in handy when traveling because you can find a Wells Fargo just about anywhere. When a branch is not available, they offer a great website, mobile site, and debit card. I’m never charged a monthly fee with Wells Fargo and deposits are posted the same day! Wells Fargo also makes it easy to transfer money between accounts and pay bills. They have really made an effort to be user friendly.

name: Edna
review: My checking account was compromised when I did an online transaction through an online pay day loan. Money was taken out of my account without my permission. I went to the branch and they immediately had me fill out an affidavit and closed my account. They credited the money that was taken to my new account. This all took a matter of 10-15 minutes. It was no hassle for me and everyone was so pleasant. I feel safe with my money at Wells Fargo.

name: Amanda LeAnn
review: The Dillard's card is great for use in the store. The points add up quickly and you can not beat the interest rates for a department credit card. I especially like the fact that you can earn two points for every dollar spent on gas. This card is very beneficial to me and I would recommend it to my friends and family. This card has a much better rate and rewards than my Macy's card.

name: Andrew Barron
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for about six years now and honestly I am pleased with where it is heading. Banks used to be annoying to go to and they would rarely provide great customer service. Over the past few years I've noticed that Wells Fargo has taken time to study customer service and implement tactics to enhance the customer experience for those walking in and driving through. Having a host by the door to help you as you walk into the bank provides the customer with a sense belonging. Another positive I feel noteworthy is the process for acquiring credit cards. Simple, to the point and it doesn't take too much of your time. The only negative I have noticed since I've banked at Wells Fargo is they seem to always have new staff training at the front.

name: Heather Payton
review: A few years back I got in a financial pinch and was late on several items. It was hard to rebuild my credit and get a card. I applied for a Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card. To my surprise I was approved. I had to put a deposit of $300 down. I found that the interest rate was very competitive compared to other cards. After several months of on time payments, I was able to turn my account into an unsecured card. They also reported positive to the credit bureaus and helped me rebuild my credit.

name: Lucien Abouya
review: Hello Heather, How did you proceed to be refunded? In my case one year later my $ 500.00 secured deposit is not yet refunded.

name: Dusan Dravinec
review: Wells Fargo platinum debit card is the best in the world........

name: HELEN B
review: I wasn't a fan of Wells Fargo.  When I banked with them I was working a lot of different hours and it was never convenient to get there when the bank was open.  I needed a bank that had more hours and more locations.  It might be different now since that was some years ago. The customer service in person was fine, but again, nothing to write home about.  Everyone that I dealt with just seemed either bored or didn't really want to be bothered.  I really do like friendly service and it helps to have a connection with a bank.  You want to feel comfortable in dealing with a company that has your money.   It wasn't a bad experience, it just wasn't for me.

name: Jesse Enloe
review: This account makes it incredibly easy to save money. I have a direct deposit set up at the end of the month to avoid the fee, plus transferring money every time I use my debit card- which is a lot! The biggest problem I have with this account is the interest rate. 0.01% is not much of an interest rate, but for a young saver like I am, I use the account to fall back on for bills or overdraft- I am not looking to draw a huge interest rate yet. Like I said, this account makes it really easy to save money for a little fluff account, and I have been very happy with it.

name: Jesse Enloe
review: I got swapped to Wells Fargo when they bought out Wachovia. Many of my friends have switched banks because they are unhappy with Wells Fargo- but I haven't had any problems with them yet. I receive online statements and find their Bill Pay to be pretty decent to use. I avoid the fee with my direct deposit paychecks. Customer service is pretty friendly and always able to help. All in all, no big complaints- a few minor issues that were always resolved for me in a courteous and timely manner.

name: Brandon Kaplan
review: This account was made to help young people like me out. There is a required minimum amount every month to keep in the savings account ($25), though with help from a manager I was able to keep it at $5 a month. Transfers are incredibly easy with this account and if I have less than the minimum required I can transfer from my checking account and then back into my checking account.   Late fees hardly ever come, and help is incredible from the WF hotline. Way2Save is a great first savings account for younger people trying to save.

name: Michael Miller
review: I opened my Wells Fargo savings account the first weekend I accepted a job after graduating from college. The first draw to this account was that i could easily transfer funds between my primary checking and savings account instantly for no fee. I was concerned about an account fee but that is easily avoided by simply having an automatic deposit into your savings account once a month which I planned on originally.

name: John Hoe
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards credit card seems like a cool credit card to have.  You get reward points (with each point being $1) for buying everyday items and you can use those points to make other purchases like travel.  I think the interest rate is pretty decent as well.

name: Sarah Schiavone
review: I used to have a Wachovia account just on the same block as my building so banking was easy for me.  When they switched to Wells Fargo they were great, then they closed every branch in NYC except for the ones in Manhattan.  So my local branch located in Queens was gone.  The other day I over drafted and didn't get a notice ran out to Manhattan to make a deposit but still got an overcharge fee.  I called them up and they were kind enough to waive the fee.  I just wish they would at least have atm's out in the other boro's instead of needing to rush to Manhattan no matter where I am.

name: Pauline Cushman
review: I have had my college card for a long time now, and even though I had decided to not go back to college I was able to keep my card. The monthly payment on it is almost nothing, which is really helpful, and the card is very easy to keep track of. I have had no problems with my card so far, it has been a wonderful card. Even when I had almost maxed out my 1500 limit on my card, the monthly payment barely increased, which I thought was awesome and the overdraft protection is very useful for keeping you in the black.

name: Gary Cazorla
review: I am loving this card!  Having a long relationship with Wells Fargo as my bank, it's a company I can trust.  This card has been great for gaining rewards for trips I have planned.  The amount of gas and groceries I buy per year adds up to free trips with this card.  Having no yearly fee and 0% interest for the entire first year has been a god send.  I would definitely recommend this card, awesome company, great rewards and low interest rates.

name: Jerry Berg
review: I have the Way2Save account with Wells Fargo linked with my checking account. Every time I use my debit card, $1 is deposited in my savings. This is a really convenient boost to my savings. The account is also linked to my checking and will cover any overdrafts I might incur. It's just another layer of protection. Overall a good way to stuff some more into the piggy bank!

name: Joe Archbold
review: I haven't had many problems with Wells Fargo until recently. I started working abroad and receiving checks from foreign banks for my work. Usually I would just go to the ATM nearest me and deposit my check instead of having to walk or drive all the way over to the bank. When the ATM did not accept my check I tried to use mobile deposit on my phone. That did not work either. My checks are frequent, but necessary to pay the bills. Now I have to go to the bank in order to deposit my checks which is a mild annoyance. The other thing is that I always have a fee when depositing my international items, but the fee is not too high to be upset over. Otherwise I am fairly happy with this checking package and haven't had any major problems.

name: Steven Smith
review: I got transferred to Wells Fargo when they purchased my old bank, Wachovia. I enjoy the web interface and modern capabilities that come with Wells Fargo, but I find it quite difficult to use their Bill Pay system. Other banks that I'm familiar with (like my wife's) I've helped her set it up and it's pretty straightforward and intuitive. However, with Wells Fargo, I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong but the setup I feel could be a lot more "user friendly".

name: Linda Goffigan
review: The Dillard’s Card has been award winning with me.  I have been able to keep under the threshold of the credit amount without any problem.  The credit limit is reasonable and it is not difficult to adhere to.

name: Zachary Leclair
review: I had to call customer service a few years ago to ask a basic question on my account. It was just a quick question, so I didn't want to take the time to stop into a branch and wait in line. The next month I noticed a $2 fee on my account, so I called them again to inquire about the fee. I was told it was a phone banker fee. I asked if they were serious about charging me a fee for providing customer service to a customer. I was told that if you have a branch location in your area and call with an issue that could have been resolved at your branch, they charge this fee. I'd never heard of such a thing before and I don't know if they still do it or not. I'm new to this site, so I thought I would share my experience. I still give them 3 stars as they have many branch locations and ATM's.

name: stephanie
review: There are definitely positive benefits with the Wells Fargo Premier account.  You get interest, and the tellers are a little more apt to help when needed.  However, I've been noticing lately that my Visa associate with my account has been frozen more and more frequently for "suspicious" activity, yet the activity is always normal and my own.  It's a hassle to have to call them constantly to get this resolved.

name: Amy Eldridge
review: The Dillard's credit card is a great rewards card for the store itself, and it's easy to earn points and rewards, even just by buying gas. Great interest rates as well! But because it's specifically Dillard's brand, its rewards don't really extend beyond the store itself like other rewards cards that can be redeemed at more than one store.

name: Eric
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for about 12 years now(back when it was Wachovia), & I have fairly enjoyed it. A big part in why I chose them in the first place is because they have branches everywhere, making it fairly easy if I have a problem that needs to be discussed face to face. Fees aren't that high, except for transferring $$ from savings to my checking. But even when I had a problem with that,the wonderful customer service reps chose to waive them for me when I asked! Plus, the online checking feature really moved me to stick with them for the long run: I can't do everything online these days, from getting statements, to transferring funds, to setting up a budget. Go WELLS FARGO !!!

name: Elizabeth
review: I love Wells Fargo. I have had an account with them for a little while now, and I especially love the way-to-save account. The way it works is you can set up  a withdrawal from you main account with them, I have mine set for the 15th of every month. I love that you even have this option actually. They withdraw $25 every month and put it into my savings account. Another thing that I like is that in the event that you do need to take some money out of the way-to-save account, you can do so up to 6 times a month. A lot of other places don't offer this option. I believe you can withdraw again after the 6 times, but you will be charged a small fee. Also, if you have overdraft protection, the transaction will take from your savings to make sure that the bill does get paid. Overall, great service and I would definitely recommend.

name: Rob Mid
review: I have a savings account with Wells Fargo, and I know I can count on them to keep my money safe in their account and also let me have access to it in case I have any emergencies. I deposit at least 25 dollars a paycheck into my Wells Fargo savings account, and my pile of money just keeps growing! I really love using Wells Fargo as they make me feel like a valued customer!

name: Rob Mid
review: My checking account with Wells Fargo is great. They keep my money safe and secure for only a fee of seven dollars a month which is a steal. I absolutely love using Wells Fargo because when I go into the bank to manage it I never have any problems whatsoever, and the people there are nice and friendly and they even sometimes have greeters. Wells Fargo really makes me feel like a valued customer.

name: Marie Tackett
review: I have had three of these accounts, one for each of my children. I have never had to have a certain amount in there, i never get charged ANY fees to any of them no matter what i have or don't have in their accounts. These are great accounts to start teaching your children how to save money and how to use deposit slips too/ When i signed my children up for the accounts they also got a package with info and a list of prizes they could receive after making a certain amount of deposits and reaching a certain amount of money in their account.

name: Alexandria Kinsey
review: I signed up for this Wells Fargo Platinum card years ago when I worked for Wells Fargo. The APR rate was low which was exciting to me since I was 19 at the time and finding a good credit card rate with no credit history was difficult. I have now had the card for 11 years and it is my most trusted credit card. Having recently gone back to school I have been relying on it more, so I appreciate the lower APR exponentially. I also like that I have never had a problem making fraud claims, as when I have, Wells Fargo credit services are quick to take action and reimburse me. Overall I intend to keep this card as my major credit card for a very long time. I have accumulated quite a number of points over the years but have yet to cash them in, I look forward to doing that very soon as they have a ton of great offers.

name: Amber Senser
review: I've been with this bank for 8 years and have never had a complaint. They always have friendly staff on hand that are quick to lend a hand and help me with any issues I might have. They also have tons of locations which makes it easy for pulling out cash when I'm out of town. Their way2save program also makes it easy for me to save without breaking myself. All in all I think this is one of the best banks out there!

name: Reg King
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Card has different opportunities to receive bonus points than the other cards I have.  I haven't seen any others that give you five points for groceries and gas.  It would be nice if they offered an initial bonus, but the bonus points should add up fast.

name: Sherri DuMont Loft
review: The thing that I like about the Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is that you can earn points on money spent. And the cash advance fee is very low at 5% compared to my Capital one card that is at 24.99%. I also like that you can link your credit card to your checking account to help avoid any overdraft fees. All in all I think this a great card and think it should definitely be considered if you're looking for a new card.

name: Abbey Dennis
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for just over a year and I am pretty satisfied. They literally have branches everywhere I go and some even offer extended and Saturday hours. Even though they are a large company and we get all the perks that come with it, the staff at my local branch know me by name and are always professional and friendly.  Both the website and mobile app are easy to navigate, and thanks to direct deposit we don't have to worry about any fees.

name: Dawn Maupin
review: Wells Fargo offers a variety of checking account options. Their customer service is outstanding. They offer on-line banking, overdraft protection, and Saturday hours at most branches. They are always offering great features like direct deposit. For example, I have direct deposit and when i signed up for checking with direct deposit, they gave me $100.00! Most of us find direct deposit an easy and quick way to do banking and when they have these promotions from time to time, you not only have a great checking account with a great bank, you have a long lasting financial relationship with a bank that has been established for many, many years. The fact that they have been in business for all these years tells me they treat their customers right.

name: Carrie
review: I have been somewhat impressed with Wells Fargo. I had previously held an account with them in the past and was not happy with the customer support provided. After leaving for a while I decided to give them another try, and have been very happy with the improvements made in customer service. They are always friendly and helpful when I have questions or concerns. They also helped me find what accounts would serve me best.
