I love the phone app that is provided from them, it helps me keep up to date on what is happening with my accounts and is free to use. You can also make deposits right inside the app.

name: Bethany Brewster
review: I have been really impressed with Wells Fargo. The huge benefit to having them as our bank is they are pretty much everywhere. SO if we are out of town or moving there is a much greater chance that we will not have a problem banking. The customer service in the banks is always friendly. The mobile app to make deposits has saved me tons of time commuting to the bank, when I just have one check to deposit. I use their online banking almost daily to keep up on my accounts and it is easy to use and helps keep everything running smoothly.

name: Rusty Shackelford
review: In today's world it is extremely difficult to get any kind of credit line without a credit history. It's a bit of a catch-22, and things aren't like they used to be where you could use your utilities' history of payment or anything like that as proof you are a good risk, so a card like this has a lot of benefit for someone like me. $300.00 is a good price for a secured credit line and I especially like the feature that it can easily transition into an unsecured card once you have built the history, so instead of just randomly applying for other cards, the one you have can just mature into one. Very nice.

name: E.j. Valinski
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card appears to be a financial tool to assist individuals with bad credit to eventually re-build credit history, by utilizing a secured credit card.  The interest rate seems high, however, I understand that a bad credit rating typically results in higher rates. It makes sense that the credit limit for this card is directly connected with the amount of the security deposit given. However, I feel that it should be disclosed that Wells Fargo is basically receiving an interest free loan from this type of cardholder, in addition to collecting interest on any unpaid balance.  I also think that if Wells Fargo is truly interested in assisting people with rebuilding their credit, then Wells Fargo would explain to these types of people that if they have enough liquid cash on hand to provide a security deposit, then they should just use that cash to make purchases without relying on credit. The rest of the information in the offer appears no different than any other card offered by any other financial institution.

name: Kate Pacheco
review: This is a really great card - it has low APR and easy travel features.  I've always had really great customer service with Wells Fargo credit.  Fraud protection is also really great, I've had to use it on very few occasions since they realize pretty quickly when my card is at risk.  Overall it's a great card that's really convenient to use and has great online access and is easy to pay off since it's linked to my other Wells Fargo accounts online.  I occasionally use the rewards and have even gotten cash back which then I've credited towards the account which i think is neat.

name: Scott Johnson
review: I have had a savings account at Wells Fargo for about fourteen years now.  I have been very happy with the customer service at Wells Fargo and have no complaints regarding their service.  I also have a checking account with them so it is nice to have my Savings account linked to that account.  Their online account tools are helpful and make transferring money between my savings and checking very easy.  I highly recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking to open a savings account.

name: Kate Avansino
review: Of all the checking accounts I've had, Wells Fargo is really my favorite - There's a ton of ATMs to use practically everywhere and it's super convenient.  I have online bill pay and great online banking services, which makes it really easy to transfer money and take care of business.  They also have a really great iPhone app which makes it even easier to do all of those things.  Customer service via telephone and online has always been really great and helpful.  They're also very careful with their customers; I've used the debit card for this account a few times traveling and the fraud department immediately let me know of any suspicious doings. Overall I really recommend Wells Fargo overall as a bank and especially for checking account services.

name: Kylee Tong
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is obviously a card for people who have bad or no credit. The nice thing is that you only have to put a $300 security deposit down, and you don't have to have good credit to use it. The fact that there is a 25 day grace period and a maximum $35 late fee is nice too. The benefits of the auto rental collision damage waiver, roadside dispatch and travel and emergency assistance services are nice perks also. The interest rate is not superb, and the fact that there is no 0% offer for a limited number of months is also disappointing, but I guess if you have bad credit you shouldn't expect more. Finally I like that there are no monthly or one time fees. I have not used any credit card that is comparable to this one.

name: Allie Bentley
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards card is a great and convenient card to have and offers great rewards for money spent.  However, the regular rate can be eye-wateringly high and cause you trouble if you aren't careful, so only choose this card over a card like Capital One Venture Rewards if you are careful about money.

name: Jerry Berg
review: I am in Augusta, GA and opened my Wells Fargo checking originally due to convenience of location. I was very impressed by the customer service at the branch. They are always pleasant, and helpful, and offer bottled water during our scorching Summer heat! I signed up for a deal, where if I use my bank card 10 times in a month, my checking is free. This is easy, as I just use my card for shopping and try not to carry much cash. I also have the benefit where every time I use my card $1 is deposited into my savings account. Not a big amount, but it does add up, and also is an easy way to keep track of my activity. I check my balance daily online, ( which I highly recommend) and I can say that the Wells Fargo website is easy to use. So, an overall very positive experience with Wells Fargo, and I can honestly highly recommend their checking account.

name: Danielle M
review: I really enjoy using my Wells Fargo checking account. I have been a long-time member and have been consistently impressed with how WF continues to remain a reliable, secure, and excellent account to have. Wherever I am in the world, I can log-on to my online banking and pay bills, set up transfers, and even email customer service agents about any questions I might have. In addition, WF makes it easy to set up recurring payments for bills so you never miss a payment! Overall, GREAT!

name: Shea Ramey
review: I like that the Dillard's credit card is a rewards-based card.  But it is too limited for my use.  I do not drive so earning 2 reward points for every $1 spent on gasoline is not useful in my situation (this would not apply to most people, however).  And my primary grocery store is a co-op that does not accept credit cards!  So for my own use, I would never earn 2 reward points for every $1 spent.  This is why I stick with my current card (Chase Rewards); it rotates the bonus categories every 3 months and includes options like Amazon.com, movie theaters, other department stores (e.g. Kohls) so that even folks like me get an extra bonus from time to time.

name: Dan
review: I bank at Wells Fargo, and when I went in about a year ago to talk about mortgages, they talked me into getting the Wells Fargo Platinum Card. They started me off with 2500 points, which was nice. I like best the easy integration with my other Wells Fargo accounts. Very helpful web interface for exploring your activity of your card.

name: Lindsey Hall
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for more than 10 years. I do not have any kind words. Their fees are much higher than another bank I used for a second checking account. There has been more than one instance where they changed the type of checking account I had and began charging me monthly fees without any notification. If I didn't have an auto loan and multiple direct deposits and automatic payments on the account I would change banks without a second thought.

name: Nick Tuinstra
review: This type of credit card is interesting because the user can build a Collateral Account to set their credit limit. Although the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card carries a fairly high APR (variable 18.99%) interest rate, this type of card can help those with bad credit build better credit. It includes many benefits of regular credit cards such as Zero Liability, Overdraft Protection, and online account services and bill pay. One down side is the amount in the Collateral Account doesn't gain interest.

name: Number TwentySix
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards card offers some great perks. In this era of tight money even a small amount of cash back on purchases is a big bonus. Also great is the fact that you can use the rewards in so many different ways. When it is time for a new credit card I will certainly consider this one.

name: Kurtis Nelson
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is a great way to build your credit if you've gotten into some financial trouble.  Unlike prepaid debit cards, such as the Walmart MoneyCard, the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card rebuilds your credit as you use it.  Your account performance is reported to all of the major credit bureaus, which in turn, builds your credit.

name: Lindsey Smith
review: I migrated to Wells Fargo when I moved to a different area where my previous bank was not very prevalent. I signed up for the Way2Save checking and savings account, and as long as I have a direct deposit or a certain number of debit card transactions, there are no fees. I think there may also be a minimum balance, but I keep a cushion in my account anyway. I actually meant to decline the automatic saving option, but it was enabled anyway and it's nice to have an extra little bit of money in my account every month, simply by using the debit card. IT is $1 per transaction, which isn't hard to keep track of and adds to my savings. Additionally, when I lost my card, Wells Fargo customer service was immensely helpful and got me a temporary card that day, unlike my previous bank where I had to wait for a replacement in the mail. The option to deposit checks with a mobile app or send them directly into the ATM is another thing I like about Wells Fargo. Overall, I have been very satisfied with this account.

name: s l
review: This is the first checking account I've ever used, so my experience is a little limited, but the way it was presented to me was that it institutes a few methods to help you save money. You have the option to deposit money into savings every time you make a transaction/use your card. They help you become a little more financially responsible in a couple of ways that you wouldn't even notice. You'll go to your savings and you won't even recognize how the money got in there and so it will be somewhat of a small, nice little surprise.

name: Brandon Kaplan
review: This Dillard's card is quite good. After a single day of birthday shopping at Century City, I found how many deals work in conjunction with the actual card if you spend at certain times. I received so many rebates from spending at Macy's alone; I was also offered a credit raise after my first two months in possession of the card (as opposed to other cards I have waited 6 months for). The customer service is more than reasonable as well, there was actually an error on an item being overcharged and the balance was replenished in my account before anything. They put customer before protocol (at least that's what it felt like)!

name: Griffin Emerson
review: The branded credit card is going the way of the dinosaur, my dynamics eplate from UMB let's me choose from over 50 reward categories,  including cash back and air dollars. I would earn rewards for dillard's but not if it meant adding another card to my wallet and credit score,

name: Kurtis Nelson
review: I signed up for the Way 2 Save Savings account with Wells Fargo about 2 years ago.  I am happy with this account.  It is great for people who have extra money at the end of the month and want to start saving.  Every month when I am paid, $25 is taken out of my direct deposit into my checking account and put into my savings account.  Also, every time I use my checking account's debit card, $1 is transferred into my savings account.  This was great when my income was higher, but now it is often a burden to transfer the funds back to my checking, because I can't afford to save since my pension was severely cut.  I tried to close the savings account, but cannot do that without also closing my checking account and changing my VA direct deposit.

name: Elizabeth
review: So far I've had only good experiences with this checking account. My biggest qualm is that the interest rate is not as high as other savings accounts I have held. The automatic transfer to savings that is made with each purchase is a great feature. It forces me to save money with each purchase I make. Wells Fargo does charge fees, but there are a number of ways to avoid being charged those fees. I sat down with a representative to figure out the best options for my situation and have been happy ever since.

name: Kirk Davis
review: I love my local Wells Fargo bank and my savings account.  You can avoid the monthly charge easily by maintaining a $300 monthly balance and you even get a small bit of interest.  I do almost all my banking with Wells.  The customer service is professional, helpful and friendly.  The on-line banking website is great.  I do almost all my bill paying and bank transfers there.  It has always proven an accurate and efficient means of meeting my banking needs.

name: Elizabeth
review: I like this account, but in order to avoid monthly fees you must keep a certain balance or use your debit card x amount of times a month. I didn't realize this when i signed up! One good feature is that every time I use my debit card it transfers money to my savings account. I like that it forces me to save money!

name: Megan Schratwieser
review: I started my Wells Fargo account before I met my husband, back when it was Wachovia. Since that point, I've loved working with this bank, and my account. Once my husband and I got married, he transferred from PNC to join on with me. I think my absolute favorite thing is the fact that when I need to deposit checks, all I have to do is snap a picture with my phone or tablet and it's deposited right there. Completely eliminating the need for me to go to the bank. I feel that perk right there is worth the $7.00 a month for me.

name: Kirk Davis
review: I love my local Wells Fargo Bank and this checking account.  This account is free if you have direct deposits over $500 a month.  The website is great and I do almost all my banking business there.  Wells Fargo's customer service has always been professional, helpful and friendly.

name: Daniel Webb
review: I started out with Wells Fargo in my area before I was 18, and decided to get a checking account when I was 18. Overall, I am fairly impressed with the functionality of the account, and my ability to pay for what I need to. I recently had one issue with my card number being stolen online, but it was resolved quickly and discretely. My biggest complaint is the $7/month monthly fee, as I've never had enough in the account to waive the fee. Other than that though, I am happy with the service overall.

name: Tracy
review: Wells fargo has always been very good in my opinion. They are always so professional and friendly. They are very user-friendly whenever I have to check any account information online. Especially when I had an issue they solved it In a very fast manner. the savings account also Is very good because you can keep money in there with a very low minimum and no monthly charges. Overall I highly recommend Wells Fargo and the savings account as well as their other accounts. I have a checking with them as well.

name: Eric McConnellogue
review: I started this account when I was a teen, thirty five years ago.  The bank was sold twice, first to Wachovia, then to Wells Fargo.  Things improved each time.  Very simple account, and the monthly fee is easily avoided through direct deposit.  Great website, making money transfers to business associates and bill paying are a breeze.  I have never had an issue they couldn't resolve quickly and professionally, and the sheer number of locations makes things easier.  I love the new ATM's that accept cash and check deposits directly.

name: Dan
review: I got this account when I went away to school. It has been a hard transition, moving into a world of personal finance and responsibility but Wells Fargo has helped me every step of the way. Especially Way To Save. It was the best introduction to saving money because it does it every time I have bought something. Not only that but in most cases you can get the monthly fee waived if you choose certain options when opening the account. Personally, I have to use my debit card at least ten times a month and then the monthly fee is waived. I am not sure if this is a location specific promotion, but with Wells Fargo being such a large chain I would assume this offer is available everywhere.

name: James Lindsey
review: I have used Wells Fargo for more years than I can remember. They used to not charge for International ATM usage, which is very important if you travel or visit other countries often.  After the 2008 Financial Crisis they started to charge this fee as well as others. But I guess they all raised their fee's after getting bailed out...

name: Wes Kalata
review: I wish I could get this card, the Dillard's Credit Card has all around good interest rates, a good reward program, late fee is a normal amount for a late fee, I like that it has no over limit or max penalty APR, Even if the interest rate on this went to the highest variable rate offered, it would still give me 1% less interest rate than my current card at 22.9%. The thing about this card I don’t like though is that it has such a high variable, a 8.5% variable interest rate is a considerable amount of money all things considered, while my current card is 22.9% and though I dislike how high it is I like that I know that this month, next month, and so on my interest rate will be the same. I’m not going to get a letter telling me this month my rate is 13.24% and next month it's 19.97%. I’d like to have this card if I could but with the variable as it is, and the need for excellent credit I think I’d leave this one alone for now.

name: Scott Johnson
review: I have been a member of Wells Fargo for about fourteen years now.  I have had a checking account with them the entire time.  I have zero complaints about Wells Fargo.  Their customer service is excellent and they have always been able to help me whenever I have had a problem.  They have locations all around the US so no matter what city you are in, you can find an ATM very easily.  They offer all the typical benefits/services of most banks.  If you are looking to open a checking account, I highly recommend Wells Fargo.

name: Corey Jablinske
review: I have had a Wells Fargo Checking account for quite some time now. I must say that the customer support is outstanding compared to other checking accounts I have had. I have never had a problem with Wells Fargo. I really enjoy the option to deposit my checks by phone and also at any Wells Fargo ATM. This is a great feature that saves time and money. I look forward to continuing my banking needs with them. I would recommend their services to my friends and family due to my experience.

name: Yoan Rodriguez
review: Wells Fargo college combo is in my opinion one of the best options for a college student. I've tried other banks but so far wells Fargo is the only bank to live up to my expectations.The college checking account offers a low monthly rate with adequate overdraft protection and easy to navigate online transactions.If you get an overdraft fee they will often waive it if you call or submit an email to them.The 3$ monthly fee is very reasonable for the variety of options wells Fargo gives you.They quickly approved me for a checking account as well as a credit card all in an hour.I got everything I needed in less than a week.great bank!!!

name: Tatiana
review: I think this checking account is really good in my opinion. It has a lot of benefits to it. It's too bad you can't get rewards for it. I think that would have been pretty nice but oh well, what you see is what you get. I don't really like the monthly fee that much, but it's not all that bad to be honest.

name: Erin Katsura
review: Although I was a little hesitant at first to join Wells Fargo because it is such a large company, it could not have a more small-bank feel. It was easy to get started and they are friendly and caring and I now have all my accounts with them. I have had some glitches with my accounts, but any time a wrong charge is made they are quick to right the wrong and are always very accommodating and apologetic. Overall a very happy customer.

name: Alex Hawk
review: The Wells Fargo Platinum credit card is a good overall card.  Mine has a low APR, and I keep it for emergencies. It doesn't have good rewards so I don't use it for my daily expenses but it really comes in handy for bigger emergencies, so you can pay it off over time and not be paying too much in APR.  I also like that you can customize the card so I put my cat on it. Overall I'm happy with it.

name: Jon Miller
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is pretty nice in comparison with some of the other cards I've had.  The ability to secure a line of credit with your own money is nice, so you can budget your credit expenses more easily without over-leveraging yourself.  At 18.99% APR, the credit card itself is on the lower average for most credit card interest rates, and this card is a boon for people who are looking to build their credit quickly and easily.

name: Ben Schulz
review: I've had a checking account at Wells Fargo for about 6 years now.  I haven’t had any problems when it comes to banking.  I really like the online banking feature and it always works well for me.  It is really easy to check my funds and transfer money.  The only problem I've encountered is the number of banks/ATMs.  I moved to a different town in my state and there weren't any Wells Fargo ATM’s for miles so it was a bit inconvenient.  Overall though I would give it a 4/5 stars.

name: Chad Gerald
review: My wife and I have had a savings account with Wells Fargo for many years. While we have moved on to a different bank for most of our banking needs, we do keep a savings account there that is for emergencies.  We love that you don't have to pay  fees as long as you keep a certain amount in the account each month. Since we never use the account it is not a problem for us. While Wells is not a favorite bank of  ours it has worked nicely for an emergency account for our family.

name: C Sully
review: I used to belong to a local bank before I was married to my wife. Once we got married we combined accounts at Wells Fargo, which is when I opened my checking as savings with them. From day one it has been nothing but exceptional customer service and banking services. There was a small error they made when first setting us up but they worked diligently to accommodate us and to correct the error. I thoroughly enjoy having my checking through Wells Fargo as well as doing my overall banking business with them. They have been nothing short of excellent. One feature I really like is the free overdraft protection when paired with a savings account.

name: C Sully
review: I have had a savings account with Wells Fargo for about 2 years now and they have been absolutely great to deal with. I actually have 2 savings accounts, both of which are linked to my checking for easy money transfers in and out of either savings account as needed. The set up process for the second account only took about 15 minutes and was really quite easy. I was pleasantly surprised. Wells Fargo is an awesome place to have a savings account and do overall banking.

name: Marina Moore
review: I like Wells Fargo, and I think this is a great card to have. I like how you can earn points for money spent. I would recommend applying for this card, if you are looking for a new credit card to have.

name: tom davis
review: I think it is a great card, one of the best things about the card would be all the rewards you would get just for charging what you normally would.  The only downside would be I don't have perfect credit so would never qualify.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: I operate a small business and use Wells Fargo for both my checking and savings accounts. When I needed a line of credit it was a simple and painless process to get the Platinum credit card that they offered. It has served me well and been reliable to this day, I fully recommend it. The annual fee is very small and the interest rates are acceptable, especially if you are just starting your business and don't have a long credit history yet. The customer service at Wells Fargo is exceptional and they do a great job at not making you feel bad for having low credit.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: I was a Bank of America person, I had used them for several years but a friend of mine works at a Wells Fargo and he told me about their checking and savings accounts. I was looking for an account to receive direct deposit with and when he told me that I could receive direct deposit and the account would be free as long as long as they totaled $500 in a month. This was perfect for me because I was paying 120 a year at Bank of America and I wasn't pleased with their service. I was constantly having problems with my old account and since switching to Wells Fargo I actually worry about my finances a lot less. I actually feel like the people there are genuinely interested in helping me succeed and I would recommend their value checking account to absolutely anyone.

name: Stephanie L Martin
review: I really do love these guys. There's several banks in my area and I recently chose them because they have the nicest people. When you walk in, everyone is smiling and happy to help you. They explain everything to you so it's simple to understand. You can even design your own check card free of charge.  I had really lost my faith in banks and only used this bank to get quarters to do laundry. The people there made all the difference in the world. Their products are tailored to fit each person's needs. Their app is cool too and mobile deposits are really simple!

name: Gary shaffer
review: Wells Fargo in Tempe, Arizona offered me a Savings account which I received without a monthly service charge. I simply had my pay-check electronically transferred directly to my savings to allow me to avoid the $5.00 charge. [One also needs to have 10 debit card purchases for free checking too.]I like Wells customer Service-always professional and friendly. Their ATM's are all over the place-easy to find one and very reliable. All in all-I think for the average person this type of savings with Wells Fargo can not be beat.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: I am really pleased with Wells Fargo so far. I have just recently made the switch from Bank of America and one of the best things about switching has been the service. I am treated with respect at the branch and I never got that at Bank of America. What's more, Wells Fargo got me set up with a real business checking account for the small business I run so I could take advantage of it. The business checking account only requires an automatic deposit of 150 dollars from checking to savings and it's free! You can even transfer the 150 right back to checking if you want. This is a substantially better deal than paying 120 dollars a year at Bank of America just for their awful service. Now I have online banking, mobile banking, and feel like my money is safer overall with the people at Wells Fargo.

name: James Lindsey
review: I have had a Wells Fargo Business Checking account for many years now and have never had any problems with it. My monthly fee if the balance is below $3000 has been only $10 per month for the past decade or so. The checks are accepted everywhere and the debit card works internationally as well. I would recommend this business account to anybody that has a small business and wants to keep track of their expenses and income.

name: Leann Heato
review: This card is reasonable, but there are some things about it I don't particularly like. I don't like that the card has a 23 day grace period, I have other cards as well, such as the JC Penney, Walmart, etc. and the majority of them allow a 30 day grace period. I also dislike the fact that on every purchase other than Dillard's, groceries, and such, you only get one point per dollar. Most of my rewards cards give multiple points for their store, and more than two everywhere else.

name: James Lindsey
review: I like the Wells Fargo Visa Signature card for it gives me reward points for every $ that I spend with it. In the past I have purchased items such as an Apple iPOD Video with the points, as well as having redeemed the points for cash back checks in the amount of $100 each. It is accepted internationally and is a great card to have! They also have a "Rewards" web site where you can redeem your points, and they have a very large selection of items to choose from. And that includes gift cards from many of the bigger retailers out there.

name: Kevin S
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo since early 2009 when the department of Education used them to fulfill my student loan. Since then, I've been able to house everything under 'one roof' so to speak. I have my savings, credit, and student loans all with WF, and it makes it easy to go online and complete any of my banking needs. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a new bank to use.

name: Joe Archbold
review: I have been a satisfied customer for many years with Wells Fargo. The big thing I noticed when switching is not having monthly checking account fees like with previous banks. ATM locations are everywhere, so I never have to worry about fees. They also have called me when suspecting fraud on my account. Wells Fargo has many services available to its customers. Of the large banks, Wells Fargo is what I would recommend.

name: Sarah Hall
review: I have banked will Wells Fargo since I was in High School back in 2005.  They have always been there to help me out when I needed them.  Throughout the years I have had credit cards with them, student loans and savings accounts.  They have amazing customer service.  One time I was accidentally charged twice by my cable TV provider.  I notified their 24 hour customer service line.  Within a couple days they had contacted my cable provider and had the problem fixed.  I would recommend them to anybody looking for a truthful and honest banking relationship.

name: michelle
review: I have been a customer with Wells Fargo for about 5 years now.  They are a very good bank, and I've had mostly good experiences with them.  Their interest rates and fees are pretty fair.  The only thing that I wasn't happy about was when they started charging for a checking account if you didn't have Direct Deposit or a certain amount for a daily balance.  I did have to close my personal small account with them, because neither of those options were possible with that account, but all of the rest of mine and my husbands accounts are still with them.  They always have good customer service, both on the phone and in person.  Overall, a great bank to be with, and they have options for all of your banking needs!

name: Gary shaffer
review: Wells Fargo has been my main bank for 7 years. From sign-up to the present, whenever I need to contact them, they are always friendly and cooperative to make me a happy customer. This is what I expect from any business I do business with, but rarely receive it. Wells is exceptional in this regard. Their customer service has satisfactorily resolved a few issues with my account that were not easy to find in my favor. Most banks would NOT have seen things MY WAY on these discrepancies, but Wells Fargo did!

name: Dennis Sanders
review: Having been dealing with wells Fargo for the last 3 years, I will have to say that they are a pretty decent bank. They actually call me every 6-12 months to make sure that I am satisfied with everything that they are doing. If I have any questions they are very easy to get a hold of. I also receive my statements very promptly. Overall a really good bank.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: Since changing to Wells Fargo I have been absolutely amazed at the quality of service that they offer. I even find myself finding reasons to go to the bank, I enjoy visiting with the employees and the vibe of the bank that much. The savings account that they offer is wonderful. Way2Save savings accounts come with no strings attached and I don't even have to pay for it as long as I transfer at least $150 to my savings account from my checking. I think this is a wonderful approach because it is an attainable amount for me (and I'm sure most people) to put into savings. I find that it is reminding me to transfer money to savings and I otherwise might not have been as diligent about doing it. Wells Fargo way2save savings accounts are wonderful for people beginning banking and long time bankers alike. I fully recommend Wells Fargo for your savings account and I truly believe you will find it a wonderful experience!

name: John Richard
review: I’ve been banking with Wells Fargo since 2008, and so far I haven’t had any major issues. Their lines always seem short, and their branches always seem clean and inviting. Out here in the West, they’re an institution.The downside is that when they transfer funds between this account and my savings account to cover a debit transaction, they charge a huge fee. They certainly try to sell you their various jumble of services, and they are always pushing you to “go paperless,” which can be annoying, even when you are online banking.  They have fewer ATMs where I need them than Bank of America.

name: Doug MyVegas
review: One of the first credit cards I ever got was a Dillard's credit card. I was excited because I had just gotten an office job and needed to buy an entire wardrobe because I’d never had a job like that before. I was able to go in and get everything I needed. Then I got my first bill and realized, that I probably should have waited and bought a few things at a time because my new job would take a while to pay off what I’d already spent. Their interest rate was pretty high and I felt like I was always trying to dig myself out of a hole. I did have to call their customer service a couple of times and they were friendly and took care of my issue quickly.

name: sal Nar
review: I was talked into opening a Wells Fargo "way2save" account a few months back. The bankers told me that if I was to accidentally overdraw my checking account, this would serve as a backup. Of course, a few months later I overdrew my checking account by .85 cents, and sure enough the Savings picked up the difference. What Wells Fargo did NOT tell me is that there is a fee for them providing me with this service. Wells Fargo charged me for automatically transferring the money from savings to checking. If I had just kept the funds in my checking (like I used to) I would not have had to pay this fee. Closing the account however, was easy, and the bank staff was very helpful.

name: Beatrice Renee
review: I've had no problems with Wells Fargo Way2Save savings.  It has helped me manage my money and set a little aside from checking.  Wells Fargo waived the $5 fee for me when I went to the branch store and they set up an automatic transfer from my checking account every month.  Every month on the same date they transfer $25 from checking into  my WF Way2Save account.  On top of that I can easily transfer any amount I want from their online banking portal.  I also have my student loans set up to be automatically removed every month from my Way2Save account.  Along with the automatic transfers this is one less thing I have to worry about.  There is a federal limit of how many withdrawals the bank can allow you to make from a savings account and they are very clear up front in letting you know what that amount is per month, I believe it is 6 or 7 withdrawals. Overall if you are already a Wells Fargo customer I think adding the Way2Save savings account is a great idea.

name: Lakeisha Morrison
review: This card is great for being a college student. At first I was kind of nervous to use it since it was my first card, but the bank assured me that I should be fine. Right off the bat they gave me $700 credit that was available immediately and the card was shipped out right then and there. For the first few months I had no interest rate which was great and I had tons of cash back rewards.

name: Scott Brosman
review: This is a good card for college students. There are several benefits with this card that help out college students. The overdraft protection is helpful and has saved me from being charged several times. The benefits it provides are also nice; like the emergency card replacement. Just in case you accidentally misplace your card you can have a new one sent to you at school.

name: Terri Coy
review: I really like my Dillard's card because I shop there all the time.  So it makes sense for me to have this card.  I have had this card for about 10 years.  When I first got the card my credit was not so great.  I kept this card and always made my payments on time.  Within a few years my credit had improved quite a bit.  I wish the customer service was a little better though because they are not always as helpful as they could be.

name: Rob Doe
review: If you shop at Dillard's often you need to get the Dillard's Credit Card because without it you're losing money. You can get so much more out of your shopping with this card. You can't earn points like this with your other cards that aren't from Dillard's, you can earn 2 Dillard's Reward Points per one dollar spent at Dillard's and that is huge, and even more you can earn 2 Dillard's Reward Points per one dollar spent at grocery stores and gas stations when you use your Dillard's American Express Card. So you will be racking the points up like no one's business. Be sure when you open your account that it's a day you plan on spending some money because you get some great opportunities on that day that i have never seen from another card. Automatically receive a bonus 10% Off All-Day Welcome Shopping Pass in your first statement when you spend just $100 the day you open your account. That's just crazy! With all the points you're earning you can get more 10% off times if you miss out on this one, because you can earn points toward 10% off Shopping Passes or earn points toward $10 Rewards Certificates that you can use on all Dillard's Merchandise. This card is better than most store cards out there, it's a must get for any Dillard's shoppers.

name: Mike Broemmel
review: I have maintained a savings at Wells Fargo since approximately 2004. I have found their customer service to be very solid. This includes both assisting with ensuring that I have the most suitable types of accounts at the bank as well as assisting in the resolution of problems or questions. Wells Fargo is also a convenient institution at which to maintain a savings account. The bank maintains a solid number of branch offices throughout the community in which I live as well as in other locations in the country. I also have a high level of confidence in the reliability and financial stability of Wells Fargo. In this day and age, when the economy and status of even major financial institutions can be so unpredictable, this is a very important factor.

name: Sarah Pentecost
review: As a student this card is perfect for me because it goes along with my free checking account. It's great to know that I always have it to fall back on and the cash rewards program is great -- basically free money!

name: chris lee
review: I've moved over from Bank of America to Wells Fargo and I have been more than satisfied with the service so far. The fees are cheaper than Bank of America, and the service is on par or greater. ATM machines are plentiful and the customer service is helpful and knowledgeable. Their online service is pretty good as well.So far I have not had any issues with unauthorized charges, weird fees or any other annoyances like I have had with my former checking accounts with different banks. I highly recommend Wells Fargo if you're looking for a straight-forward checking account with few hassles.

name: Jeff
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card, compared to some of my other credit cards seems to be a good deal.  I really like the fact that I can get up to 5 points for every dollar I spend on gas and groceries.  That is a large percentage of what I use a credit card for and this will really rack up in the first 6 months.  Some of my other cards still have blackout dates for travel redemption, and this card does not have any blackout dates.  This is a major plus for me.  Otherwise it seems to stack up pretty closely with my other credit cards.

name: Suzanne Cunningham
review: I love the fact that the College Visa does not have an age limit on it, and actually relates to whether or not you're IN college.  I'm a returning non-traditional college student, and they let me have the benefits of a better interest rate (19.8%) than I could otherwise get on my own because of my own previous mistakes.

name: Cookie
review: I've been comparing this card to my Amex blue cash preferred card. First off is the interest rates. With my Amex card there is only a maximum potential of a 22% rate. For the Wells Fargo card it goes up to 26%. It's unlikely that would be my or your rate, but it's something to keep in mind.Next is rewards. With my Amex card it is strictly cash back and I can earn up to 6% back when I use it at the grocery store, 3% for gas and 1% for everything else. the Wells Fargo card works on a point system, but I feel they win in this category because they have a lot more variety in rewards including airfare, cash, and merchandise. Maximum possible points is 5 points per $1 for the  first six moths. After the intro period it goes to 1 point per $1.I really love my Amex blue cash card, but I'm seriously considering switching over. The Wells Fargo card seems pretty solid and it comes with more benefits than the Amex card. It is also a Visa card, so technically it should be accepted more places than my Amex card. Though, its been pretty rare when Amex isn't accepted. Still that is a definite plus for the future.For the big spender, I would recommend the Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card, but if you only spend things on the necessities, I would recommend the American Express Blue Cash Preferred Card for the straight cash backVery solid card from Wells Fargo with really great rewards and points system, but be careful with some of the rates, Make sure to pay your balance!

name: derrick dawkins
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Card is a great way to electronically pay your bills and make online purchases.  This card is no substitute for a bank account and obviously comes with a price.  The annual percentage rate is in line with most cards available.  The fact that the deposited collateral amount doesn't earn you interest, is not ideal.  This card is a great option if you're looking to start or rebuild your credit, however it comes with the price of annual fees, and putting down collateral.  Overall it's comparable to other cards of this type.

name: Quinn Carter
review: I have had the Dilliards store card in the past, and I was not a fan of it. I did appreciate the initial 10% discount bonus, which saved me money. I would have liked to see more consistent discounts, though. Earning points is a bit harder with this card since the max you can earn is 2, which is the same amount of base points earned. I also did not appreciate the very high interest rate. This card would have been a bit more worth it if I shopped at Dilliards more. Overall, however, this was not the right card for me.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Card is a great card for someone who has bad or no credit and is attempting to rebuild their credit. The idea behind it is pretty simple. You give them an amount of money anywhere from $300 to $10,000 and that give you a credit limit in a equal amount to your deposit. In comparison to other secured cards the $10,000 limit they offer is on the high side. With an apr of 18.9% and a $25 annual fee its in line with others as well. This card is a no frill basic card for basic needs but it does have a purpose for those who need it. And I recommend.

name: Andrew Lopez
review: Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card is a great card which also allows you to design your own card.  I used to keep all my checking and savings account in Wells Fargo, but I moved my accounts to another bank leaving this card as my only connection to the bank.  Over the years I never had any major issues with this card other than less than satisfactory customer service, but how often do you need that any way.  I have very low APR for this card, which is the main reason why I still hold on to it.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card, in my opinion, is an amazing card to have. Other credit cards do not have a rewards system as good as this one. In comparison to the Bank of America Credit Card, the benefits are so much better. A lot of other banks hit you with fees that you didn't even know you would ultimately have to pay for. With the Wells Fargo Credit Card any fees they might hit you with they make sure you know ahead of time.

name: Wes Johnson
review: I signed up for this savings account in combination with my college checking account immediately upon beginning college. It has served me very well, as the fee waiver of sending money from my checking account to savings was painless and efficient. There is 24/7 online banking, so at all times I am able to get online to check the balance of my account. The 1% interest accrued monthly may not seem like much, but for the easy fee waive and limited restrictions, this is a great feature. I have since moved away from any Wells Fargo banking locations, but it is next to impossible to find an account that is comparable to this one in quality and service.

name: Lyn Whipple
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card seems like a very straight forward card for people with bad credit. Like any of the secured credit cards I have used or know about, such as Capital One, the $300-$10,000 is pretty much to be expected with a card of this sort. This card has a low annual rate which is appealing.  It is also a plus to me that there is no one-time processing fee or monthly fees associated with this card.  The interest on purchases is also a plus at only 18.99%.  I have seen way more than that in my experience.  This is an excellent card for people with bad credit.

name: melanie cutler
review: I love Wells Fargo's checking account.  It's super easy to set up direct deposit, the customer service is outstanding and so is their online checking.  What I love best is that overdraft is totally optional so if I don't have overdraft protection there is no way to incur NSF funds fees to my account.  No money in the bank, no transactions.  This helps me to stay on budget.

name: Scott Moore
review: I've been comparing several different cards, and I've found that the Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is a good overall choice. I like the introductory APR, and when used responsibly this card can offer great membership benefits. Visa is universally accepted, and the point rewards are better than a lot of cards I've reviewed. I personally like AE cards better, but this card offers a better standard interest rate after the introductory period ends. One thing I always look for are annual fees. They really eat up my rewards because I don't typically use credit cards on a daily basis. I think there are better choices for myself, and my spending habits, and I will continue to look around for better offers.

name: Edward Mitchell
review: I have had my mortgage with Wells Fargo for about two years now. They have been great. I was 5 days late once on accident and they were great about it. I didn’t have to pay a late fee or anything. They were very understanding on the phone. The wait time to talk to a person was not that bad either. My checking account is with another bank but it is still real easy to make a payment on Wells Fargo’s website. My interest rate is rock bottom and I had no trouble getting a mortgage through them. I did a VA loan with them and it was pretty easy. Overall I would highly recommend Wells Fargo and I may move my checking to them in the future.

name: Wes Johnson
review: I signed up for this credit card immediately after setting up my college checking and savings accounts at Wells Fargo. They allowed me to choose the date of my payments which was very beneficial and I have had no troubles paying my card on time. Online banking is 24/7 so I've been able to keep up with my spending easily. The 1% doesn't seem like much, but the amount adds up faster than you expect if you use your card regularly. After just two years of membership Wells Fargo upgraded my account giving me more credit and a lower interest rate which is fantastic.

name: Rusty Shackleford
review: This was the first credit card I signed up for before I started college and it is still my primary one. I started off with an average limit and it has risen over the years to a great extent which is very convenient in case of emergencies or expensive purchases. The interest rates and the minimum payment each month are fair. I also have the Wells Fargo rewards program linked to this credit card which allows me to get cash back and reward points which makes using it even better. Overall, I'm very satisfied with my card.

name: Rachel Bishop
review: I really love this bank out of all the ones I've had. Every other bank has treated me poorly and that my money was their& money and really didn't care at all if I had problems with anything and would promptly dismiss me until I threatened them and even then was almost impossible to get what I wanted or my point across. I believe a bank should never treat their customers poorly, their paychecks and reviews rely on us, their users. I've been treated well by any banks I've been with in my life until this one. If ever I have a problem with anything Wells Fargo addresses the issues promptly, and politely and I am not the brightest crayon in the box, and they are very patient and willing to work with me. I haven't had many if at all, any, problems with them thus far.

name: Angela McCavera
review: I have never had a negative experience with Wells Fargo's Way to Save program. Whenever I have had any questions, someone has always been there to help me. I like that it is linked to my online account so I can make transfers if necessary. I truly feel that my money is safe in this account. I wanted a savings account so that I could have somewhat of a savings as I continue on in my life, and this account was extremely easy to set up. The only complaint I have is that there is only a certain amount of times per billing period that I am allowed to transfer funds. In my opinion, that is my money, and if I need it accessible in my checking account, I should  not worry about being charged. Other than that though, I am very happy with this service through Wells Fargo.

name: dana dunn
review: I used to shop at Dillard's and I would always pay with my other cards. While on their website, I noticed they had a store card. I figured I would apply since I shop their weekly. I was happy when I was approved, but then things went south. I was on time paying all my bills and even had a credit increase. My husband lost his job and I had to call their customer service and cancel my card as well as get the ending balance. The lady I spoke with was not only rude, but she seemed like I was not allowed to cancel my card. After about 40 minutes on the phone arguing with her, I asked for a supervisor. I was transferred, not willingly, and had no problems. I love shopping there but I am so glad I no longer have their card.

name: Will Mundie
review: I have been with Wells Fargo since before they purchased Wachovia, and with Jefferson National before they merged into Wachovia.  Each transition has been seamless, and each has provided me with more benefits than the previous company.  I've never had any issues with Wells Fargo, and am considering refinancing a vehicle through them since I've been a customer for so long.  I've yet to experience any monthly fees, and my local branch has told me that I will not have to worry about seeing monthly usage fees on my account.  When that day comes, i change institutions.  Until then, I'll remain with Wells Fargo.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Card has fair rates, especially for those who qualify, with a floor of 12%. Still, if you aren't as fortunate as some you could be looking at a rate as high as 26% which is quite high and would send me looking elsewhere for a credit card.  The real meat and potatoes of this card is the reward system and since I don't have a card with a great rewards plan I wanted to look further into this card. The first 6 months you can really stack up points earning 5 for every $1 spent at select stores. After that you drop to a 1 for $1 ratio. I went to the store to see what you can get for your points. They have, for example, a gift certificate to AMC (movie theaters) for $25 that costs 2250 points. Using this one example, I would have to spend $2,250 to be able to purchase a $25 gift card to the movie theater. That is a 0.01% return on your spending (which is pretty low compared to the savings you can get with other reward cards).An Acer 7" 8 GB tablet would cost a bit over 25,000 points (and would require you spending $25k on your credit card to rack up at the regular rate). To their credit they do have a wide number of interesting rewards and getting a reward is better than getting nothing. Still, reward rates like this are so low most it would take most people quite awhile to accumulate enough points to be able to redeem them for any decent items. There are some cards that offer instant savings on your purchase and I personally would rather have one of them than one that has a reward system such as this. If you just want it because you qualify for a decent rate and accumulating the points is just a nice bonus for you, this card really isn't too bad. The reward system alone isn't enough to make it stand above others though.

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Wells Fargo Secured card is great for rebuilding your credit.  There aren’t many other options when you have bad credit, so you need a great secured card.  The annual fee is only $25 which is significantly less from many other secured cards such as Capital One.  The interest rate is very reasonable at only 18.99%.  I have unsecured cards with worse perks and worse interest rates.  The advantage of cards such as the Wells Fargo Secured card is that after your credit has improved, you will get your money back and sometimes the card can even be converted into an unsecured card!

name: Kyle Porter
review: I have the Wells Fargo college credit card and have been using it since I enrolled in college two years ago. This card is perfect for my situation as being a college student. The cash back rewards are absolutely amazing. I use online banking and the mobile app of Wells Fargo to keep track of my accounts. Overdraft protection also has been pretty valuable in my experience. All in all, this card has pleased me and I have no complaints. I do not intend to switch until I graduate. I would also recommend this card to fellow college students as many of us have tight budgets.

name: Montana Jamole
review: do you have to pay it back and can you spend it on anything

name: Suzanne Cunningham
review: I love to shop at Dillard's for just about everything. Their store card has been a blessing to me, which I've had for the past 18 years. They actually extended my credit back in 1996 starting at a mere $500 and the relationship has built from there. I was impressed and surprised that such a reputable store took a chance on a student since they really don't have to being their size. Their customer service is always outstanding and I have enjoyed my financial relationship with them thoroughly.  Throughout the years my credit limit has increased and my interest rate is now almost non-existent, even with a less than perfect payment history.

name: Jane Lill
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is an okay rewards card when compared to other options on the market. The 6 month intro rate of 5 points back per dollar is a nice perk, but obviously not permanent. The 12 month 0% interest rate is probably one of the biggest advantages to this card right now. And then the regular rate of 12.15% - 25.99% is really decent compared to other cards. The redeem limit is not capped, which is also a plus! However, there are other rewards cards that might offer more bang for you buck long-term. The American Express Blue Cash card offers 5% on grocery, gas, and drugstore purchases once you have met the annual threshold.

name: Eric May
review: This card is designed for individuals looking to increase their credit scores. The interest rate of 19 percent seems extremely high but for the nature of what this card is, I understand why. This, simply put, is just a typical secured credit card as you set the spending limits of how much you can deposit, and in return spend. The annual fee of 25 dollars is quite reasonable, and I think  the card, overall, is a good way for individuals to build credit. I have had great personal experiences with Wells Fargo throughout my banking endeavors, so to most I would recommend this card and their service.

name: Jester O Court
review: Many of the prevailing features of the Wells Fargo  Rewards  Credit Card are strikingly similar to most of the rewards program credit cards currently being offered. Standard rewards rate is 1 point for every dollar spent with a max earnings level of 5 points for each dollar. Nothing to get overly excited about as this is a pretty standard rewards level. The Wells Fargo  Rewards  Credit Card has an average appeal when it comes to balance transfer perks, with 12 months interest free, but also with a 3% transfer charge per balance. The standard interest rate after the introductory period of 12 months for all purchases has as vast a range as about any of the cards on the market, with an appealingly low potential percentage of 12.15%. The possibilities of this lower than average interest rate on standard charges is the most attractive aspect of the card. Cash advance rates are relatively high, plus there is an additional charge for foreign transactions. One feature that does add the slightest bit of appeal is the 25-day grace period on bill payment. Taking into account all the factors involved in selecting a rewards credit card, the Wells Fargo  Rewards  Credit Card rates average by all accounts.

name: Dan Diciaula
review: One of the best things about the Wells Fargo saving account is security.   I feel that my money is safe and is growing and that's the most important thing.   I'm not a big risk taker and high risk stocks and funds don't interest me.  What interests me is that my money is safe and even earning at all times.  It links nicely with my checking account so I never get an overdraft fee on my checking account as they are linked and will automatically draw from savings if I go over with my checking.   I can access my money from my savings right through my ATM with my debit card as well.  If you keep over $300 in the account there is never a monthly fee and it has the standard .01 APY.  There is nothing sexy about this, or any savings account for that matter.  But I sleep safe at night knowing my money is safe with Wells Fargo.  I would recommend for anyone who wants peace of mind.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is a credit card for those who have bad credit or looking to build credit. Because Wells Fargo is protecting its interests, there is a $25 annual fee, and a high APR at 19%. There are no rewards, no jazz, no extras with this card. This is pretty much the training wheels credit card that you get put on when having bad credit or starting off. There is also no max penalty APR or over limit fee, so be careful, if you are late or dont pay your card off, those interests and penalties will start accruing fast!

name: Quinn Carter
review: Looking at the Wells Fargo rewards credit card makes me wish that I would have gotten this card instead of the one I have currently! With up to 5 points earned per dollar when you use the card at specific locations, those points will add up quickly. On top of that you get 1 point for every dollar earned everywhere else you use the card. Not to mention the huge selection of point redemption options. The possible low interest rate of 12% just makes this card even more appealing, as well as the 0% interest rate for 12 months. I also really like  the 25 day grace period for late payments.

name: Heidi Joy
review: I was with Wells Fargo for close to a year.  Most of the problems I had with them revolved around excessive fees, with holding payroll checks, poor customer service at the banks.  But what pushed me over the edge was when I deposited a $5000 student loan check into my account and, several hours later, when I went to use my card the money was not there.  I called the banker who deposited the check and he proceeded to ask me if there was something funny about the check.  He told me it had raised a red flag.  The bank then proceeded to shut down all of my accounts and open me up under a fraud investigation on the grounds, solely, that I had never deposited a large check before.  The check cleared Bank of America as a real check.  Wells Fargo was basing this solely on my checking account having a usually lower balance. I had to call an attorney and threaten the bank with a lawsuit to get them to release all of my assets and it took almost 2 weeks. So, of course, I will never bank with them again.

name: jen oliphant
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for over ten years.  I don't pay any fees, because our paychecks are automatically deposited.  I use the online bill pay for nearly all of my bills.  I'm able to set up my payments, and choose the day I want the payment to go out.  I can even use the service to send money to friends and family.  I have to keep my balance at a high level to use bill pay for free, but since I do everything through Wells Fargo, it's not a problem.  I would happily recommend Wells Fargo to any of my friends and family.

name: Jay Fry
review: I had a Wells Fargo checking account but I no longer do business with them. I got tired of having to deal with their fees. This is a fine account if you always depositing a steady pay check into it but at the time I had the account I was only able to maintain contract and temporary work. If you aren't able to place $500 dollars in the account via direct deposit each month or maintain a balance of $1500 then you will get charged $7 a month. I was unable to do this and was getting paid in cash. I wound up having a low balance and no direct deposits placed into the account for nearly 5 months. They closed the account on me and charged me $50. So, if you have steady income or don't mind paying $7 a month (not to mention a $2 paper statement fee that I didn't care for) then it would be a decent checking account for you. I did find that they have top-notch customer service when I lost my debit card. I also enjoyed the many different locations they have in my area. They have very nice ATM machines that make it easy to make deposits as well. I think for people with steady income this is a fine account if you don't mind the fees.

name: Missy Johnson-Trimble
review: The interest rate is frightening but we did get one for our daughter before she went off to school. She knows that if it's not on the card, it isn't available. If she had a regular card the statements would probably leave me crying every month. I have had secured cards before that charged me for taking money out at an ATM or as a POS and those are obnoxious. I was getting charged to take out my own money! I don't see that problem with this card so I am very comfortable letting our daughter use it. The money used to replenish it is money she makes at her part time job and she makes all the arrangements to get the money on the card.

name: Karissa
review: Wells Fargo is a bank with a lot to offer. They have multiple types of checking accounts, savings accounts, and loan products. I had a savings account with them for roughly one year. I started out with Wachovia, but they were bought out by Wells Fargo. They have wonderful customer service reps, short lines, and locations in most places. I ended up closing my account when they started charging fees that Wachovia did not charge. I was able to go to another bank and get the same products without the fees. I recommend this bank for those who do not mind fees, but I personally would rather go without them.

name: Richard Thompson
review: Designed to help those with poor credit begin repairing their credit score, the Wells Fargo Secured credit card charges a frighteningly high 19% interest rate for a card requiring equivalent collateral for each dollar of credit available. With none of the benefits you'd see on an unsecured card, the Wells Fargo Secured card requires that your money be tied up in the bank, collecting interest for them and not you. While you're unlikely to find much better in terms of cards offered for those with poor credit, this card seems like it's just taking the opportunity to gouge those who are already in trouble.

name: Kelli Ortega
review: I use several different banks, and of all of them, Wells Fargo is by far my favorite. First, they have a great student checking and savings account option, which allows me to forgo having required minimum balances and the like in order to have no monthly fees. The customer service has been fast AND easy both when I visit a branch location or when I call on the phone. I once lost my debit card and had multiple mysterious charges which resulted in significant overdraft fees, and when I called customer service to report the missing card and open a claim, they resolved the issue within 24 hours and reversed all of the fees. It was such a relief to be able to know I can rely on them to help me.

name: Dan Diciaula
review: For those with excellent credit the Wells Fargo Rewards program is an excellent choice for purchasing power.  It gives you more bang for your buck as the reward program is great.  You get 1 point for every $1 spent and 5 reward points for every $1 spent on groceries, gas and drugstore purchases.  There is so much you can do with your reward points, but the things I do most with them is use them for travel.  They offer travel rewards without blackout dates which is important.  What good are travel rewards if you can't use them when you are available to travel?  A similar card is the Sony Card from Capital One.  The problem there is you can only earn 5 rewards per $1 if you spend money at the Sony store.  Personally I buy more groceries than I do Sony products.  I'd also rather spend my money on travel, hotels, and car rentals as opposed to being forced to use them on Sony merchandise.  The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is great.  It protects your card from theft with it's Zero liability program and gives you all the great benefits you deserve from Visa.  I would highly recommend this card to anyone looking for a new card.

name: brookeanne
review: I wanted a Savings account that I knew was going to save me money and help me stay secured.  I chose Wells Fargo after a long debate of big name banks, and I am glad I did. They were friendly, and they made me feel safe with the fact that I was saving my money in their bank.  I have never had an issue with my savings account here at Wells Fargo. If I ever encounter a problem, I know that Wells Fargo is there to help me through it every step of the way!  They send me monthly statements of what I am saving, etc.  I love Wells Fargo Savings, and I am saving!

name: Brendan Cooney
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for about 3 years now. As someone who uses direct deposits regularly, as well as my debit card, I have never had an issue with their system. One of the ways their ways2save program works is that each purchase you've made with your debit card, $1 gets transferred to your savings account from your checking account -- this has aided in my efforts to save money for things such as Netflix subscription and other monthly bills. A few months I have had to pay a monthly fee for lack of funds in the account, but it is a very small fee and it has not significantly impacted my experience with them.

name: Angela McCavera
review: I am a 20 year old college student, so for me, having great money management is vital. I have been with Wells Fargo for years. I joined back when it was Wachovia. For me, this is a great bank and I have not had a single bad experience in all the years they have been my bank. I live right by a branch, so this is the most convenient bank for me, but even if I had to drive there, I would be fine with it. I love the new addition of banking on the outside ATM's. It makes my experience so much easier not needing to go inside or during open hours to deposit a check. I could not be happier with this bank. Customer service has always been great, and the employees have never been anything but pleasant. Overall, I would recommend this bank to anyone who asked.

name: Tyler McCray
review: I have had a Wells Fargo account for quite some time now. I did a lot of research on it and the information hasn't failed me. It is a really good bank and it's easy to work but I do receive a lot of letters from them for some reason. It's easy to keep up with my savings and bills. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong or what but I am still very satisfied with the services. My mother has been using it longer than me and she's still happy with everything. I would recommend this banking to friends and others.

name: John Richard
review: My chief concern in applying for this card is the “excellent” credit rating requirement. A lot of Americans surely don’t have excellent credit, making this card a poor choice for most people.Although I enjoy a zero percent APR offer, I would be concerned what my real APR will be when this card’s actual APR kicks in. I also enjoy having a card that can move money from my checking account to my credit line to avoid card declines—especially when that service is free—however, hopefully that will not be an issue. Travel points are not a worry for me providing the APR is low.  This would be a good card, assuming that a person is accepted. If you have poor credit, you should not be applying for this card in particular.

name: Asu
review: I was a Wells Fargo customer for several years and initially I had no problems with them. I really do not know what happened but eventually I started getting letters and complaints from them saying that I was transferring money in and out of this account too often and threatening to close my account. Like I said, I'm not sure what brought this on, my habits have not changed and I was using this account similarly to how I used my accounts at another bank at the same time and they had no problems with it. It did however really sour my relationship with the bank and I left less than a year later. It's not very consumer friendly to threaten your customers in my opinion.I tried to talk to my branch and they weren't sure what the problem was. Customer service was friendly and I believe tried to help but it must have been something with their system and they were unable to even tell me why I was getting monthly warnings.My example might have been some glitch though, I otherwise (for years) had no problems with Wells Fargo so overall I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt a little bit.

name: Hannah
review: I really enjoy this savings account, as someone in college this easy to maintain savings account has worked very well for me. I enjoy how easy it is to set up and move funds between savings and bank account. The online feature, being able to deposit cash easily is something major that made me stay with this bank. I also have a U.S. Bank account however I only really use my Wells Fargo, for both savings and regular banking. The ease at which it can be used makes other banks seem not as up to par. The five dollar monthly fee associated with this account is small enough that even when I cannot pay the 300$ to avoid the fee, the fee is so small that I do not mind paying it.

name: Nick Martocello
review: Used to be a good bank, then they started to charge monthly fees if your balance didn't have 500, which may be hard for the college student. They also added surcharges onto ATMS beside their own. The fraud area is probably the best part I have knowledge on, they spotted bad transactions on my card and helped and sent me a new card right away! This is a good bank if you can keep more than enough in your account and not worry about it. It wasn't enough for me to stay there, but I was a college student at the time and didn't need extra money being taken out because I couldn't keep enough in. They were always friendly though!

name: Jordan Webb
review: I’ve had a Wells Fargo checking account before and had little to no problems. The account itself was actually very nice to have, and the availability of Wells Fargo allowed me to conveniently deposit and withdraw accounts. However, I had a couple of bad experiences with when payments were actually taken from my account; for instance, more than once, a check was taken out before my paycheck was put in (on the same day) so that  I would get an overdraft even if I did have the money. Because of that I have to give it four stars, but everything other than this was pleasant and easy.

name: Jane NIPPER
review: I like the idea of the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card and if you have bad credit then this is an option to help you improve your score.   It is like the secured cards offered by other banks such as Bank of America Secured Credit Card or the US Bank Secured Credit Card. The interest rate is high and don't expect it to drop after proven on time payments..  Also read the fine print when you want to close out the card make sure you do it the right way and do lose your deposit.  Also you should know that because the interest rate is so high that with 100 dollars sent on the card that is an extra 19 dollars and for a cash advance its an extra 24 dollars a month per hundred.  So I suggest that this card be used for a few short years as an excellent credit building tool.

name: Marcus Edwards
review: 19 percent APR stands for annual percentage not monthly percentage. Therefore it is not 19 dollars a month but a year.

name: Rebekah Farris
review: I have always been a regular Dillard's customer; my mom and I have a joint card, and I use it every year to buy school clothes. The 10% you get off when you sign up is nice, but really only if you had been planning on making a big purchase anyway; I feel the incentive there could be a little better. That being said, the point system is pretty nice and we actually get to redeem them every so often because we frequently shop there. The APR seems pretty steep compared to other cards, but, compared to other store credit cards, it's about average. Overall, it's a great deal if you shop there often; otherwise, just use the credit card you already have.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is an okay rewards credit card, but there are many other rewards credit cards that have more to offer. The best part about this card is the 5 points per dollar spent on gas and groceries, but unfortunately that stops after six months and reverts to 1 point per dollar spent everywhere. Many other rewards credit cards are better, such as Bank of America that will give you $100 rewards PLUS up to 3% back on purchases, and that doesn't expire after six months. The APR is standard with other rewards credit cards, 0% for the first 12 months then around 12-26 after that. In the end, this is just a decent rewards credit card, as it is very attractive for the first six months, but it is not very good after that.

name: Ethan Wu
review: I have this checking account and Its a good basic checking account.  You have online access which is good with lots of services, my favorite being Direct Deposit advances if you ever find yourself in a bind.  For every $20 you borrow, its a $1.50 fee.  Not bad for emergencies.  Also you have your debit card too and a mobile app for mobile banking.  The fee can be waived if you add a savings account or if you maintain a certain amount of cash in your account at all times.  I have no complaints, been with WF for over 10 years.

name: Thomas Burke
review: I got switched to Wells Fargo when they bought out Wachovia (which bought out Southtrust) and the accounts got all new numbers. The staff there got a lot worse when it comes to knowing what they're doing. I do a lot of online banking, but the drive through is like a roll of the dice if the teller will know what to do or not. An ACH transfer from just about anywhere arrives the next day, even when they say it will take several days. An account with them is good, but your mileage may vary as far as the amount of training the tellers get. Phone support at their headquarters is always good though, and no long wait on hold times.

name: Shannon
review: I started using Wells Fargo when I moved out of state and it so happened there were some perks through my employer.  Initially I was pretty pleased, the in-branch customer service was always decent, though they seemed to have a high turn around.  I was also happy with the online and mobile options for managing my accounts.  As time went on, however, service went downhill and each interaction I had with a representative by phone or in branch was turned into an opportunity to hard sell me into products I did not need.  Little by little the benefits of having an affiliation with my company dwindled as well and I started moving my accounts over to the credit union I used for my vehicle loan.

name: Amberjade Mccracken
review: I have this Wells Fargo Secured card and it's definitely served its purpose. I have really bad credit because of choices I made as soon as I was old enough to have a credit card, and this card has really helped me come back from it. Of course, I had to put a deposit down for it, which makes a lot of sense being that obviously if you need it you have no credit, or poor credit.
