The interest rate is okay considering the lack of options available for poor credit individuals. The limit is usually based on how much you put up for deposit although according to the lady that signed me up for mine if your credit isn't to bad you might get a higher limit than your deposit.  Plus Wells Fargo usually has really good customer service!

name: Emma
review: I had written a previous review about my Wells Fargo personal checking account, which still stands and I am still very happy with that account. In fact, my good experiences with that account led me to open a business account when several family members and I started a small business. For that account I have been overall happy with it, with one important consideration.I would suggest that those interested in a small business checking account open one with a different bank from their personal checking account. There have been several times when I deposited a check using the mobile app where it went to the wrong account--both personal checks have been deposited in my business account and business checks have gone to my personal account. I have been told by multiple people that this "shouldn't happen" and is "rare" but honestly that isn't my experience. My experience has been that it takes at least three business days to sort out and often involves calling multiple customer service reps since inevitably the reps that service checking accounts cannot access business accounts and vice versa to understand the problem. This has been my only problem with Wells Fargo as far as the business account and I would say I'd likely be a lot happier if I had just chosen a different institution for one or the other of the accounts.

name: Jeff
review: I have this checking account, and I am fairly happy with the features of the checking account.  However, Wells Fargo, as an institution is not very good with their customer service.  One major problem that I have is that they tell you that your deposit will be available on day x.  What they really mean is that on day x at MIDNIGHT, your funds will be available.  This has caused me several problems, and they are never willing to do anything about it, and are always rude about it.  One good feature that I have enjoyed, however, is being able to deposit a check over the internet by taking a picture of the check with their mobile app.  I have used this feature several times, and I must say, that it is very nice.Overall, if they could improve their customer service, this account would be a great account and I would recommend it.  If customer service is not important to you, it would also be great.

name: Elizabeth
review: I am so pleased with Wells Fargo. I've been banking with compass for a few years, and I'm so done with them. I had received a check that was from Wells Fargo last week, and I decided to go to a wf branch because it was much closer than any of the compass locations. I originally came in to just cash the check, but I wound up opening an account with them before I left. I don't usually act on impulse with these kinds of things either. When I spoke to one of the tellers, they asked me if I had ever considered opening an account with them since my employer banks with them too. I was a little hesitant at first but the woman that took care of me was amazing. Her name was Vanette, and she explained everything to me about the account I had opened, what I would benefit from switching banks, she even set up my online banking. I've never had this kind of treatment at compass. Overall, completely pleased with the service and what they have to offer. I would highly recommend them to anybody.

name: Dan G
review: I have been using Wells Fargo since I got my first job and have nothing but great things to say about them. I first got my account to cash my checks and prefer them over any other bank I know of and used. I really wanted a debit card once I started working so I didn't have to pay with cash anymore and I walked out of the bank with one which was amazing. Their website is very helpful and easy to use and navigate. After my first debit card expired I ordered one from them for free, and was allowed to put almost any picture I wish on it, so I choose an awesome design I made and people wish they had my card. Every building of theirs I have gone to has had very kind and generous people, and their service is fantastic, Not to long ago someone got my debit card info and bought about 1000$ worth of stuff, the same day I noticed it was gone I called and got my money back! I have nothing but good things to say about Wells Fargo and see myself using them for a very long time to come.

name: Howie
review: Wells Fargo caught my eye a few months back. I saw a promotion they were running at a school fair and was interested. I talked to a few people and they convinced me to sign up for a checking account. The people there really do care about you as they are willing to take the time to explain everything. I had all my questions answers and it's something I can really appreciate since nowadays a lot of places treat customers as nothing more than ways to make money. So upon signing up for my checking account, I also received a few perks due to the promotion. I am happy with the honesty and the level of care Wells Fargo provides and have had no issues as of yet. I would definitely recommend them to people who are looking for a place to open a checking account.

name: Denise Smith
review: I was a long-term Wachovia customer who happened to move from North Carolina to Texas years ago.  Since there were no Wachovia branches in the state, I ended up creating a Wells Fargo Account for my primary checking deposits.  I did miss Wachovia for a while.  I had always enjoyed their service.  Yet, the Wells Fargo Branches in Houston (namely, the one located near Smith Street downtown) were always professional and helped me continue to confidently perform the banking tasks that I needed for myself and for other family members who had experienced some health problems and changes in the living situations.  So, it was a taxing move but having a trusting banking partner made the stay much more enjoyable.

name: Milli Cash
review: They were fantastic at first, then about two years ago they started  to mess around with my privileges like the free gift wrapping and the free shipping.  Then I noticed that every time they paid they would reduce my limit.  After a while I noticed that they started to charge for services that were free.  I paid off all that I owed them according to my figures and walked away. l love the card and the store but i did not like the customer service reps had one that was so aggressive and rude. I no longer have their store credit card.

name: Jeremy Arotsky
review: Having a secured card is a big step in either establishing or reestablishing your credit, and Wells Fargo does deliver in that aspect. Keep in mind that putting down a deposit lets you control your own credit limit, and this is standard for every secured card. The good news about this card is that I believe Wells Fargo will also allow an upgrade from the secured version to one of their standard cards somewhere down the line, so if this is your bank and you need to establish credit, perhaps it would be worth looking into.

name: Thomas Sandberg
review: Though Wells Fargo is technically relatively new to where I live, I've been with the same bank since it was called Central Fidelity, stuck with them through their years as Wachovia, and here I am now, a Wells Fargo customer. In all honesty, the idea of banking being consolidated into an ever-smaller number of megabanks concerns me, but there's no denying that the customer service has improved at my bank since Wells Fargo took over, probably because there was a large amount of turnover among the management and staff. All in all, I'm still satisfied enough with them that I have no intention of changing to another bank at this time.

name: Alex Steven
review: I've been using the Wells Fargo college credit card since I enrolled in college 2 years ago. I do like it, and don't intend on switching. Customer service is excellent, I've never had a problem with Wells Fargo. No annual fees and 1% cash back is great as well. Being able to see my statement online is a big plus as well; this definitely is geared for a college student.

name: Flora
review: I have been a checking account customer with Wells Fargo for over fifteen years now, and I have to say, I am pretty satisfied with their service. I have a Custom Management checking account and if I maintain a minimum amount, I don’t get any fees with it at all. Direct deposit makes this account easy to manage, and their bill pay service is awesome and really convenient. I’m also able to transfer money to family members with Wells Fargo accounts pretty easily when I need to.  Overall, I’m pretty happy with how convenient my Wells Fargo checking account is, and I think it’s pretty great that I’m always able to find a bank or an ATM when I need one.

name: jake wine
review: I've had a Wells Fargo Checking account for many years now, and it's had it's ups and downs.  Their customer service has been great, if I ever had a problem, they made sure to fix it and sometimes reimbursed a fee that I had.  I started Wells Fargo when I was young with my parents, and continued throughout college and until now.  They've always been great. My problem with them was the constant fees that I keep getting which would cause me to overdraft my account which added more fees. I know it's my fault when I overdraft, but the fees just add up. I still use my this account everyday, and overall I really like Wells Fargo.

name: Sara Gee
review: I've used Wells Fargo's checking account for just a few months now but I've been very happy with it.  Although the minimum balance is kind of high, it's super easy to avoid it by having my husband's check directly deposited and by automatically transferring $$ to our linked savings account each month.  We can even go right in and transfer it back if we need to and this still helps us avoid the fee for not maintaining the minimum balance.  I also like how convenient it is to zip to the bank and the number of ATMs in my city.  This makes it overall very convenient to use this checking account.

name: Bela Kalinova
review: This is a basic rewards card. There is not much that is special about this card. Here are a few of the things I liked:I like that they have a grace period that is 25 days. For me that is pretty flexible. I have had good experiences regarding their grace period. Also, I like that there is no overlimit fee and  no max penalty APR. This is pretty helpful for those of us late on payments.The Wells Fargo Rewards Credit Card is a safe bet for anyone. One of the downsides, however, is the late fee of thirty five dollars.

name: Ryan Hannigan
review: I got the Wells Fargo Reward Card, because I bank at Wells Fargo, I set it up so my balance gets automatically paid out of my checking account.  I can alter the payment amount anytime with ease, if I ever do splurge on something big or need to make an emergency payment on something.  I haven’t had to do that yet.  What I like, is that I can easily build points by doing this.  With 2 kids who are going through growth spurts, I am spending a lot on groceries early on, so I am building points quick, I have had the card for three months and am quite pleased with my accrued points to this point, I haven’t fully looked through my options for rewards, but I did notice a bunch of cash and prepaid store cards on the list, so I know soon, I will be getting something.  Good card, be aware of the points limits and cut off dates on some of the point building features.  The late fee isn’t a problem unless you can’t fit in the 25 day limit.

name: Tatiana Joseph
review: I think the Wells Fargo bank is pretty amazing, they have really nice people who are willing to help you with any problems you may have with your bank and I really like their debit cards, and you can also change their designs and such that's pretty cool. The cards that they have give pretty nice offers and stuff like that. Plus if you have any questions about anything you can just call them and they will gladly help you. They have pretty nice customer service. You can also go to their website and check your bank account which that is also convenient, I go on there all the time just to see how things are doing, and they made it easy to pay any bills at all on the website too so that's another good thing about them

name: Laura
review: While it's not bad, the Wells Fargo Rewards card is pretty basic, without any benefits that really stand out over most other cards that are out there. The cash advance fees and interest rates are pretty high, and the foreign transaction fee of 3% is very high, so using this card out of the country isn't advised. The rewards point system is basic, with most purchases being a straightforward 1 point for each dollar spent. In the initial 6 months of owning the card they offer 5 points for each dollar spent on grocery, gas, and drugstore purchases, which is a nice bonus, but it's only temporary. While it's not a bad card, there are many better ones out there available.

name: Benjy Saloman
review: I have a value checking account with Wells Fargo. I do the vast majority of my banking through credit unions, but they are not always convenient in terms of ATM machines available when traveling out of the area. My parents have always had accounts with Wells Fargo so I keep my small checking account open to make transfers to and from them easier. The convenience is fantastic, but I don't like the fact that I have to pay a 7 dollar fee on my account per month if I drop below 1500. That is essentially every month for me. I don't think you should ever have to pay a bank to just hold your money. I will say the few times I've gone into my local bank, I have been treated very well.  Other than the 7 dollar monthly penalty I don't really have any complaints.

name: Janice Krone
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card is a unique card and a pretty decent option  for people with bad credit, and need help limiting their spending. You can only spend whatever amount you deposit onto the card, in the range of $300 up to $10,000. If you know in advance how much you will allow yourself to spend, and meet the minimum monthly payment, it would be a useful way to improve your credit and keep your financial situation in check. This credit card also sends you alerts when you get close to your limit and when payments are due, so that's just another way to help you manage your situation if you aren't so responsible. Overall, this credit could be very useful to people who need a little extra help with their finances.

name: Ray Fath
review: The Wells Fargo Secured credit card is a good option for those who have spending problems, little or bad credit.  You can load any amount $300-$10,000 making purchases each month up to this set limit you have loaded.  The purchases will not be taking from this secured amount you will only be required to make small monthly fees.  Secured card accounts are reviewed and can become unsecured and the collateral amount would be released.  In contrast to other cards the Wells Fargo Secured credit card is offered at only an annual fee of $25 dollars with no monthly fees at all.  This card is verified by Visa and has emergency card replacement as well as roadside dispatch and travel assistance you can also link the Wells Fargo Secured credit card to your bank account to avoid overdraft fees.

name: Andrea Elise
review: I first got this credit card when I started college and like most college students with a very low income I did not know how to budget my finances and ended up maxing out my card within a couple of months.  Thankfully after landing a great job, months of payments, and a great tax-return I was able to pay off my balance.  Now I use my card for my regular monthly bills and make timely payments.  I've never had any many issues and have been a long time customer with Wells Fargo.  They've raised my credit limit multiple times which is great for my overall credit score, but I'm determined to never again max out on my limit.  I really enjoy the rewards program and have a fun picture of my godson when he was a baby that I got to design for free!

name: Ric Rogers
review: This Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card works like most secured cards in that it allows you to add money to it and as a result, you never spend more than you are capable of spending.  It is a certified Visa card, so it allows all the benefits you would expect like emergency assistance services.  It is great that it does not have a one-time or monthly fee, but the annual and penalty fees are a needed negative i suppose.  A very important part is overdraft protection using your checking account.  This is a life saver!  My friend built up over $400 in overdraft fees on her unrelated card and if she had protection like this, it wouldn't have been such a burden.  Overall, highly recommend this card!

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Card is not that great compared to the other credit cards out there.  While companies like Capital One are offering 1.25% back on all purchases with a no annual fee card, Wells Fargo is offering 1% back on all purchases.  The big difference is that the introductory promotion is 5% back on gas, grocery, and drugstore within the first 6 months, but there are other cards that have much better introductory offers that don't require spending in certain categories.  For example, the Chase Freedom card has a $100 sign up bonus for spending $500 in the first 3 months.  You're better off going with either of the other two cards I mentioned.

name: Constantina Hauser
review: I have never had an account with Wells Fargo but an offer came in the mail and I applied for the card and was approved.  The process was quite simple and I received the card in the mail which took less than 5 days.  I use this card for small purchases and pay the balance every month in order to avoid fees.  I got this card with a high interest rate and I have other cards with lower rates so using this card is not so feasible for me. Only for small and urgent purchases.  I have never looked into their rewards program, that is something I should look into in the future.

name: Ashley Lane
review: If you are considering the Wells Fargo Secured credit card, chances are your credit is not in the best shape.  That's okay because a card like this will help you to regain your credit score if used responsibly.  It has an interest rate of nearly 19% which is quite high, but being that the set limit is usually low, most people will be able to pay in full to avoid the interest hit.  The late fees are harsh at $35 per late payment, but this card is meant to promote responsible credit use for people without credit or a bad history.  While it might be one of your only options, it doesn't mean that it is a poor card.  Just remember to use responsibly or you will find yourself in a hole quickly.

name: Sudipto Banerjee
review: My Wells Fargo Credit card was inadvertently cancelled by a Wells Fargo agent. First of all the agent did not tell me that the card was cancelled. I was not able to use the card in a restaurant. What an embarrassment in the presence of my guests. Next I called to activate the card back. They created a new card and let the old card deactivate. I asked for the reward points to be moved to the new card. I was assured that it would not be a problem and would be posted in the next statement. The next statement came and my points were not there. I called again 5th time and then after bouncing around 3 times and validating my authenticity as many times and wasting more than total of 3 hours I still did not get my card award points back. Extremely poor service in case if run into any issues even if it is created by their staff.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: The Wells Fargo Secured Card is not your typical credit card.  It's designed for people with bad credit that are looking to build it up.  The way it works is that your credit limit is determined by the size of deposit you put into it, that way they know you're good for any money you charge to the card.  The nice thing about this card is that you do actually get some perks that you would get with a normal Visa card, such as all of the travel benefits like the auto damage collision waiver.  While it does come with an annual fee, it's relatively small compared to other secured cards which will often add a monthly fee on top of an annual fee too.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: The Wells Fargo Rewards Card is pretty basic when it comes to rewards credit cards.  It's the standard 1% back which you can find with pretty much any Visa card out there.  They claim you can make up to 10% back by using their online shopping portal, but it's no different from the same portals offered by other cards like Capital One.  When you also consider it has a foreign transaction fee of 3% and a limit on the amount of rewards you can earn annually, I cannot really recommend this card.  I give it two stars because it has a rewards program, but there are better ones out there.

name: aadff bdaf
review: Dillard's Credit Card is just too good to be true. With their 2 points for every dollar spent, you're basically getting 2%  cash back if  you do a lot of shopping there! And then they still offer 2 points on the dollar at grocery stores and gas stations? That's just unbelievable! Major Dillard's shoppers will love this card as it shouldn't be too hard to rack up the points and get tons of gift certificates for essentially free stuff! The only problem I have with this card is  that there's no 0% intro APR. Other than that, this is a must-have for any person that frequents Dillard's.

name: Tiffany McLean
review: I was very excited to find out about this Wells Fargo Rewards Credit card because I bank with Wells Fargo. It got me excited about the rewards program because if you're going to have a credit card I think it should have some good incentives. I like that there is no annual fee because many cards now days like the Southwest Credit Card require a steep annual fee to use their card. From what I know about credit cards the APR seems pretty good, though the cash advance rate seems pretty high. This seems like a great card to use to buy smaller things and build up your credit that way, instead of needing a card to buy big things that you can't pay off quickly.

name: Benjy Saloman
review: As far as in store cards go, the Dillard's credit card is not so bad. Most in store cards, JC Penny, Belk, and TJ Max for example, have an APR around 25%. The Dillards card has a variable rate between 13.99-21.99. More reasonable in my opinion. I also like the rewards system better than most other store cards. Not only do you earn 2 rewards points for every dollar you spend at Dillards, but also when you buy gas and groceries. It is nice to get rewards points for essentials. The TJ Max card offers only one reward point for every dollar spent outside the store, but does give you 5 points for in store dollars. The APR is pretty high at 26.99 though.  On both the Dillards and TJ Max cards you get 10% off the first day of shopping upon signing up. With the Belk card you get 15% off. Frankly, getting a percentage off the first day of shopping doesn't really sweeten the deal for me that much. You could go into a random clothing chain and get 10-15% on any given day just based on a current sale.

name: Russell Utter
review: No matter where I’ve lived here in the States, it has been particularly easy to keep my relationship with Wells Fargo up. They have locations, ready and accessible across the nation. I have had the pleasure of being a Wells Fargo member for several years after switching from a particularly nasty experience with a credit union in my hometown in Arizona. From the online banking, to the fantastic customer service that is always friendly, Wells Fargo has been an amazing banking experience. They easily beat out other banks in those two categories alone. No matter where you are, if you want a good bank that’s looking out for you, the choice is Wells Fargo.

name: Pat Esswayne
review: For an annual fee of $25, people with bad credit can get the Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card with some interesting and beneficial features. I've never had a so-called bad credit credit card, but I can see how things like email alerts could be useful for staying on top of your account. Often I've had trouble remembering when payments were due, and it would be nice to track my spending like this card features. The APR isn't too terrible, either, and there are no other overzealous restrictions as far as I can see. Overall a decent card for those without bad credit, definitely one to consider.

name: Tara Bonhorst
review: I opened this card many years ago when I was first opening my checking account with Wells Fargo. Though I recently moved my account to a credit union, it was very convenient to have this card connected to my checking account. It allowed me to automatically pay my bill easily, which has been an issue for me with some other cards I have. I was also able to link it with my checking account to provide overdraft protection, though if you use it for that purpose you pay the much higher cash advance interest rates. They have consistently raised my credit limit as I established my credit, though like some other users here have commented my interest rate has not budged in ten years. One other fun feature is that you can design your own card with your own photos, I have gotten a lot of compliments on my card.

name: Lisa Baer
review: I think everyone is being really generous with their reviews of this Wells Fargo Rewards Credit card. The foreign transaction fee is 3%, there's a sky high cash-advance fee, and the APR is really nothing to squeal about. I agree- it's a good card to use as a beginner, but it doesn't really offer anything exciting for someone with better credit. There's no miles, and it seems like a very closed reward system with a simple 1:1 ratio UNLESS you pay more via their online shopping center. I've had better cards (0 charge when I withdraw from other ATMs, 0 charge when I withdraw in a foreign country, and MUCH better programs), but this is okay if you want to build credit and get a little something back eventually.

name: Chrysann Sutton
review: The best part about this Dillards card is their rewards program. If you buy a lot of groceries and gas, they'll give you 2 points per dollar spent. Those points translate into cash later on. I have the Bank of America World Points Rewards card and their program is pretty similar, although they only offer 1 point per dollar spent on everything. Best part is there's no redeem limit whereas with my Bank of America World Points Rewards card, the points do eventually expire. I love that they give a 10% discount. Combine that with the post-winter holiday sales (in January) and you can get an incredible deal on your purchase! The only thing that I don't like is that there is no intro rate. This is really the best part of switching to a new credit card, especially if you want to transfer a balance over that you can pay off over time without accruing interest at the same time. If you're opening a brand new account, this seems like a great option if you can get the lower interest rate (13.24%) that they offer. All in all, this card is a great option if it works for you. Personally, I'd use it just for groceries and gas to get the 2 points, and keep my Bank of America card for all other purchases.

name: Katie
review: For the individuals with poor credit, you have very limited options and are forced into a corner. If you make your choices wisely and don't make any serious mistakes, you can slowly work towards rebuilding your credit. The Wells Fargo Secure Visa Credit Card is a good way of reestablishing yourself and working your way out of bad credit. You have to initially put down what you want your credit limit to be, which is most likely a problem for most people in this situation. It's probably best to start out small by putting a minimum of $300 down. This card is probably one of the few options someone with poor credit may have, but it's your way to fixing it.

name: Dan
review: Overall, I feel the Wells Fargo Rewards credit card is a good entry into the reward card arena. Getting triple rewards points for gas, groceries, and drugstore purchases is a fine perk, and the different ways you can redeem points (for cash, for gift cards, and for other merchandise) are attractive. I don't think this card stacks up to the best cards of this variety, however. The American Express Blue Cash Preferred, for starters, offers 6% back on groceries, which the WF card cannot compete with. The Chase Freedom card, which offers 5% cash back in rotating categories, is also a better option. Be mindful that these other cards also offer great sign-up bonuses, which the WF Rewards does not. Still, the flexibility of this card makes it a fairly attractive option, if not one worth seeking out.

name: Kaci Butry
review: I like that for the Dillard's Store Card you get 10% off the whole first month, what I don't like is that you have to spend at least $100 on the first time you go there. The APR doesn't really matter to me because I pay off all of my credit cards each month. The other neat thing is that you get 2 points for every dollar you spend, most places you only get 1 point for each dollar! I also think it's a great way to bump up your credit score (if you know how to limit your spending and pay it off every month! :)

name: John Peterson
review: The store card offered by Dillard's is actually one of the better store cards on the market. Its offered to a bigger selection of people not just those with great credit which ultimately allows those with not so great credit to build up there credit scores and get some nice clothing while doing it. Another big plus of the Dillard's Store Card is that you save 10% on all purchases, which may not sound like a lot but depending on how much you spend can add up to major savings in no time. if your considering only getting one store card the Dillard's Store card should be it.

name: Mark Hodges
review: When it comes to the Dillard's Store Card, this is a good offer, but not great.  Taking 10% off your first purchase is a good incentive, but the fact that you have to spend $100 to get it is a little steep.  The rewards program is more generous, with two points for every dollar.  That's a good reason to get the card if you shop at Dillard's often.  The main issue I have is the 22.99% interest rate, with no intro rate.  You can get a much better rate with a regular credit card.  Plus, many regular credit cards have rewards programs, too.  This card would be perfect with just a few changes.  Make the first purchase discount a little friendlier and reduce the interest rate - or at least have a better intro rate.  Conclusion: this card is a good choice only for people who frequently shop at Dillard's and don't rack up a high balance.

name: Alex Lupu
review: I also like Dillards, they are very big here in the southeastern coast of the US, in fact, based here. I have this card for almost 3 years now I started out at 1400 and now I am at 10000 if you can pay most or all of your balance monthly and you will more then likely get an increase about every four months and this one is ran by get money and you don't have to deal with the American Express customer service. They are not bad. And then if you spend 2000 in a year you will become elite and you get more rewards. this card has been good to me good luck with itThey also have awesome sales.

name: Liana M Arnold
review: Once upon a time, in galaxy far, far away, there was a bank called Wachovia that offered excellent checking accounts for the common consumer, free of fees. It also offered good call center customer service, and online help. Then some evil emperor must have taken over from the shadows of the planets of over-commercialism and over-cost cutting in the name of Wells Fargo. The whole system started to break down.The checking account I had with Wells Fargo had been mine for over twenty years and had seen three changes of bank ownership in those twenty years - Georgia Federal to First Union,to Wachovia to Wells Fargo. Never had I been charged fees for my checking account, or expected to maintain a minimum balance, free checking was free checking. Then, Wells Fargo took over. within a year, I was charged minimum account balance fees. The cost of such items as money orders, that had been a fee free part of being a customer of the bank, now turned out to be more expensive than going to Western Union or the Post Office. Online customer service became hard to navigate. Call center customer service put you on hold forever...The worst thing that happened was, that, after more than twenty years of holding onto this account with no other names on it, Wells Fargo decided not to treat me as the primary account holder when I added my husband to it. The first time my debit card expired, they re-issued current cards and gave my husband a whopping $4,000 dollar greater limit on total daily withdrawal than me. When I asked about this, noone could tell me why, and noone was willing to fix it. It didn't even matter to them that I could prove that I was the only one putting money into the account for a long as I had been.The most pleasant part of customer service was when I went back to the original state and original branch that my account had been at, and closed it. The bank manager there was very helpful, non-confrontational, and apologetic for the service, or lack thereof, that I had received. This big bank turned out to be very disappointing after it's predecessors had been very service oriented.

name: Reylin Bates
review: To start off, Dillards is one of my favorite stores to shop at. I like the variety and prices. I have also never had a bad experience there. I am a regular customer. Now with that said, the Dillard's Store Card is amazing. The rates are great. One of the things I really like about this card is the gifts. I love racking up points and getting things. You can even get discounts. The only thing I dislike only a little is, now even though the rates are great, if you compare it to a card like Slate by Chase, the rates aren't that great but, the Chase card does not have any rewards so this makes The Dillard's store card is better.

name: Jordan Webb
review: If you spend a lot on groceries, you might want to invest in the Dillard’s Credit Card! The main benefit of this card is that it awards you points back on any purchases you make; these points can then be used for money off at Dillard’s when you shop. While this may seem like a great deal, I am aware of other grocery chains that offer cards with lower interest rates than the 13.24% minimum the Dillard’s card has, such as Raley’s/Bel Air. If Dillard’s is your favorite and you always shop there, this is pretty useful, but I would look around for other offers from grocery stores as well.

name: Jessica Trivalia
review: I have a Dillards that just expanded in the Westfield mall in my area. It is a beautiful store but I do not shop there often because of the high prices. I really enjoy shopping in the clearance sections and when they have a sale. I think that earning two points for every dollar spent would help offset the higher prices at the store. This card would make me shop there more often because I really love the selection of clothing and other merchandise they have. I am going to apply for this card and use the initial 10% discount in combination with the tax exempt holiday coming up for even more savings on my back to school shopping for the kids. Looks like a great deal.

name: Jalisa
review: I've never shopped at a Dillards store ever, but this card would definitely make me change that. I like that it doesn't take very many points to get cash rewards back with this card. I've heard good things about Dillards before and this card is just another wonderful addition to all the positive feedback I've heard in the past. It's also pretty cool that you can get rewards back from places other than Dillards. I'd definitely pick up this card if I had the chance and have nothing negative to say about the terms or cash back rewards that are outlined.

name: Mary Webber
review: Been banking with Wells Fargo for 4 years now, and they've been great. I've never had any problem with hidden fees. And as far as my branch goes, whenever fees do pop up, they are quick to tell me and get me with a banker to help waive them. They all know who I am, and greet me by name. Online banking is a plus, although I wish they could take checks through the app like chase can. My one problem is crazy long lines on Fridays, but I can't blame them it's payday. Never had to wait when I go on any other day though. Overall although there interest rates suck, they are still the only bank I would consider for checking accounts and mortgage. As far as credit cards go there okay, I have the 1% cash back and pay in full. Stay away for savings if you have a credit union near by. And loans aren't great although I've never had any need for one, but with some of my family members they are the only bank that approves anyone, so that's something to keep in mind. Overall I love the bank!!

name: Zetta Schlindwein
review: I love shopping at Dillard's. Its one of my firs choices to go. You can avoid the interest rate and still get your points by paying off the balance immediately at the register. Your rewards are in the form of points which are redeemable for gift cards. for every dollar you spend you get 2 points. If  you're like me your points rack up fast. You are also eligible for other discounts for just using it. They have a great selection of merchandise, do if you can't find anything to spend your rewards on there is something wrong with you :)

name: Romeo Gj
review: I love this card.  It's so convenient to use since I shop at Dillard's all the time. The interest rate is decent and the best part is you earn rewards with your card by receiving gif cards just from shopping.  As much shopping as I do, I get a new gift card every other week.  Also I have referred some friends to use this card and I have gotten great specials and benefits.  Ask the customer service to see what you can qualify for with your card. All in all, I am satisfied with this card so far.

name: Senny Drak
review: This has been the only bank I've ever been somewhat satisfied with since I opened up a bank account for the first time in 2007. The customer service I have received since then at my local Wells Fargo has been amazing! The clerks with whom I get the pleasure to associate with are always very friendly and never seem to absolutely hate their job, like most people now a days. The representatives I have spoken to over the phone have been just as delightful. I love the fact that if your account goes into the negative and you manage to balance it out within a day, they will refund the whole overdraw fee. That has saved my butt a couple of times! I also really love the fact that if you have a monthly direct deposit linked to your checking account, they will give you a credit of $500 in case of an emergency (though it is something you must pay back, if you use that money.) Since I currently do not have a credit card, knowing that I have that extra money, in case of an emergency, makes me feel more secure! Despite the bad rep that Wells Fargo often gets, on a personal level I am utterly happy with their services.

name: Laura Perry
review: I used to bank with Wells Fargo in Alaska. I had a personal checking account and because of my job I was also depositing money for my corporate chain into their company account. I had excellent customer service no matter if I was coming in to take care of corporate or personal business. I remember having a few corporate deposits that I had dropped of the previous night and receiving the receipts for them the next day or if a receipt was missing they would give me a copy. The staff was always willing to go over any discrepancies that either they found or that I found. When it came to personal banking they were timely with deposits and the rates at ATMs were acceptable. I never had a problem with any of their rules.

name: Roxana Missey
review: I've been a customer of Wells Fargo for quite a long time, and got a credit card with them recently. The cash back credit card is nice for the first 6 months, when you get 3% rewards, but then it drops down to 1%, which is better than nothing, but not as good as some other cards. I have a couple of other cards that pay 2% constantly, so I'll quit using the Wells Fargo card as soon as the 3% deal is over, and keep it for emergencies. As long as there isn't an annual fee, I figured getting 3% back was better than 2%. I mean, that's how they get us, right? Nickel and dime us with a % here, and a % there; so that's what I want to do, too. If I can get an extra % out of them, for 6 months, I'll take it. I pay the purchases every month, and if I can't pay for it I don't buy it. SO the ridiculous interest rate doesn't matter to me. You'd think that in a time when the Federal Reserve is driving interest rates into the gutter, that credit card rates would be a bit lower too, but no. I haven't had any problems with the card or the service from Wells Fargo. They're definitely not as nasty as Bank America.

name: Alan-Michael PIcheta
review: Wells Fargo made banking and checking easier than any other bank, for me. They have so many perks for college students, such as free checking, which is perfect when you're living off of ramen noodles and need every penny. Since making an account with Wells Fargo, my life has gotten significantly easier; it's nice to not have to worry about finances so much, especially during finals week! Not to mention the people who work there are friendly, and beyond helpful. They've walked this inexperienced young adult through every step of the banking process, and they did so with smiles on their faces. I've recommended Wells Fargo to all of my friends and family members.

name: Yara
review: I've only had one bank since I first got a checking account. I first started off with Wachovia, and I was pretty content with that, so I was a little worried when it became Wells Fargo. Well, it was a silly worry. I actually prefer my account with Wells Fargo. Activity is updated more frequently on the account. I would definitely overdraft before because it was so slow to update on Wachovia, but I haven't had that problem with Wells Fargo. In general, I also much better prefer the layout of the Wells Fargo website. The way the bank page looks is very important to me because it's where I access my account mostly.

name: Aimee
review: I used to run multiple student organizations with bank accounts at Wells Fargo. I had to frequently interact with bank personnel and my experiences always ended positively. For example, any time a new officer needed to be authorized, we would go down to get their name added to the account and the old officer removed. The staff were always friendly and helpful in facilitating this process. One of the best experiences I have had with Wells Fargo related to problem resolution. Another member of the organization had accidentally overdrawn the account, thinking that a check had already been deposited by the treasurer. This resulted in a huge fee that would have meant big problems for our group. When we talked with Wells Fargo, they reversed the charges for us. That was extremely helpful, great customer service, and really meant a lot since a lot of banks would not have done the same.

name: Jane Smith
review: The process for applying is easy and it seems that just about everyone that does banking with Wells Fargo has this card. It is one of the entry level credit cards but it isa good start to build up credit and take care of small emergencies. You also have the option of picking the billing date when you apply which can be very convenient in order to schedule your payment at a time that you know you can take care of it.

name: Dorothy Musacchio
review: This was my first credit card, and I've never had any issues with it. I was pretty hesitant to take out a credit card just because I didn't really need or want one. I was persuaded to take apply for the card by one of the employees at the bank. I like the convenience of having it linked to my regular checking account. It is incredibly simple for me to transfer money from that checking account to pay the monthly bill. I don't regret taking this opportunity to build credit while finishing school. I've never had any serious negative issues, and hopefully it will remain that way. I would recommend this card to anyone who has a checking account with Wells Fargo.

name: Stephen
review: I joined Wells Fargo about 2 years ago. I liked the idea of having a national bank to deal with when I traveled for work. This because I live in a small town and my primary bank is regional. Which, while I love my small town credit union, can sometimes cause me a few problems. The folks that worked at Wells Fargo were great, I gave them 5 stars, hard working folks all of them. And they were always cheerful. Honestly though, after a few months I was less than positive about my account. Hidden fees... every statement that came in had one fee after another. I spent a good deal of time talking to the young lady who sat down with me to start my account. We went over all the paperwork and I left feeling that my work account was in good hands. I guess I needed a couple more hours of her time to go through all the small print hidden between the lines. Well Fargo made it insanely easy to start an account. The workers were great, helpful, and polite. But I felt as though the bank was doing everything in it's power to skim money off the top of my account like a thief in the night. I closed my account.

name: Jane Smith
review: This card is great for small purchases that you can pay off at the end of the month. If you are good at keeping track of your spending then you can enjoy setting up the automatic withdrawals from your bank. But use caution and always be sure to have sufficient funds. If there are not sufficient funds you end up paying a fee through your bank and one for the card.About every year (it seems) they will offer to raise the credit limit which is nice as well.

name: Maria Solis
review: I can honestly say I preferred the older, more “regional” versions of this bank (Wachovia, First Union) to this new one, Wells Fargo. I had been working with the customer service reps for a while, so at least that stayed the same, but some of the new policies that were implemented when Wells Fargo merged and went “national” were a little “too big” for me. I was not about to get nickel and dimed by a company that just didn't care about me or my money. I want to feel confident in my banking institution, not bullied by them. After seven months of being with what is known as Wells Fargo, I took my business elsewhere. My business wasn't much, but it was something. If others were like me, all of that lost business could add up.

name: Jennifer
review: I am now using Wells Fargo for a checking account. I decided to switch because it was going to make it a lot easier for me to start paying my bills online instead of by hand (and writing checks) each month. I now have all of my utilities being automatically drafted from my Wells Fargo account. This includes my mortgage, power, water, phone, internet and cable TV. The online web site sends me an email when these transactions take place so I do not have to worry about if they got their payment each month or not. Another nice feature of the web site is that it will send me an alert email if my balance goes below $100. When this happens, I can simply log in and transfer money from my savings account. This transaction occurs instantly which is very useful in some situations!

name: Mitchell Santarino
review: My wife and I were seeking a good mortgage rate for our first home. We sought advice from a friend and he suggested a well-known firm. Needless to say, we weren't happy with the rate we sought. Our apartment was close to a Wells Fargo that used to be a Wachovia so we figured we'd take a chance and see what they were offering. After the loan officer took at look at our financials and credit history, he helped us secure a very reasonable rate. They were very helpful in the mortgage and we have not had any issues with rates changing on us. For our credit worthiness we received a very good rate that we just recently were able to refinance to a lower rate with another lender. If you need a home loan, I would definitely recommend checking out Wells Fargo.

name: Jenna Burn
review: I've had a very positive experience all around (and I am not an “ideal” client from a bank's perspective - I had a high debt-to-income ratio and high utilizations for all but the last year and a half). Every employee I've dealt with, in person or on the phone has been kind and helpful. There have been times that I accrued a *legitimate* fee, and they'd take it off when I asked, just as a courtesy. (One overlimit fee per year, for example.) Their deposit availability is second to none. If you deposit cash in an ATM it's available instantly, and if you deposit a check, the first $100 is available instantly (with the balance available the next day, or one more at the MOST, even for large checks). And if you REALLY need a check to be available right away (especially something like a payroll or government-issue check, where they have no reason to worry about it) you can just call or stop by a branch and ask nicely and they'll take the hold off immediately. I highly recommend this bank to anyone. A spoonful of sugar goes a LONG way with their (or anyone's) customer service. :)

name: Bridget
review: I used Wells Fargo for my student loans for college. It was an easy application process and the staff were very helpful with helping me fill out all the needed forms. The disclosures were very easy to understand and were also very realistic. I would highly recommend Wells Fargo to any college student who is needing any student loans. If there are ever any issues with the loans the customer service staff is always willing to get it fixed and handle any questions that may be asked. I am highly satisfied with the service I receive at Wells Fargo, thank you!

name: Marianne
review: I was originally a customer of Wachovia for many years, and was initially nervous when I heard they were being bought out by Wells Fargo, a much bigger bank. However I have to say that the transition was so smooth I almost didn't even realize the change at all, and I have so far been very happy with Wells Fargo. Their online service and bill pay is great. Every time I need to go into the bank to speak with someone, they are always very helpful and courteous and tell me about the services they offer. Recently I signed up for their Way2Save program, which has no fees and automatically transfers $1 to my savings every time I make a purchase. So I have been saving some money without really even noticing. I would most definitely recommend Wells Fargo for both checking and savings account holders.

name: Rachel
review: When I moved north I had to leave the bank I had been with for the previous 10 years. I chose Wells Fargo because they seem to be located just about everywhere. I've enjoyed banking with them mainly because I don't feel like I am being grilled every time I go in to change something on my account. They are always polite and very efficient.Anytime I've had an issue it has always been handled very quickly with minimal fuss. Plus, I like that if they see something that could benefit me they let me know and don't pressure me into choosing if I want those options/upgrades on my account. Overall, banking with Wells Fargo has been a good experience and I recommend them to friends who are considering changing the banks that they use.

name: Lenton Lees
review: I got married back in September of 2012 so needed to switch banks from Bank of America to Wells Fargo and join my wife's account. While trying to leave Bank of America was a horrible, long, unrelenting experience, I soon gave up with them, took my money out, and marched straight to Wells Fargo.When I went I was accompanied by my wife and two step-kids. The woman who joint accounts for us was super nice and great with the kids. She did it all quickly with no issues, told us we brightened her day, and we were out of there within ten minutes. Amazing customer service and the overdraft protection works wonders for us! We never have to worry about our card being declined. Absolutely zero complaints with Wells Fargo thus far!

name: Katherine Pharis
review: I went into my local Wells Fargo branch to cash a check, and somehow wound up with a checking account there. The representative that I spoke with was so positive and helpful, that I found myself saying yes. The disclosures and all the fine print were explained to me in detail. She helped me set up my online banking account and even showed me how to design my own debit card. I walked out of the office with a temporary card, which was really convenient because I needed to be able to access my money. As far as all of the monthly fees, they are all going to be waived as long as certain requirements are met (ten deposits/withdrawals/purchases on debit card, monthly transfer to savings, etc). I am a very satisfied new customer. She even told me that if I wanted to look into improving my credit and one day buying a home, to come in and talk with someone and they would help me set goals. I felt as though Wells Fargo values me as a customer and as a person.

name: Michelle Kellum
review: I love Wells Fargo and would recommend them to anyone. I have my home mortgage through them and they have been wonderful. They have very competitive mortgage rates. The process of applying for and setting up the mortgage was made very easy by my assigned mortgage representative. The approval process was very fast. I love the website. It is very easy to use and has all of the information I might need about my mortgage. I can make and view payments, see the details of my escrow account, see when they review my account and any changes made, check how much of my payment goes to principal and how much to interest. Each time I schedule a payment, I can add a little extra and choose how to allot that amount. I have never had a problem with the website being unavailable when I need it. I always access it with my laptop, so I can't speak to any apps that may be available for smartphones. Overall, I have had a great experience with Wells Fargo. If I had to do it all again, I would absolutely choose them and wouldn't change a thing about them.

name: John
review: I just recently switched our bank account to Wells Fargo about 3 months ago. So far everything has been very good. They have five convenient locations around my town that makes it easy to get money from the ATMs. The bank tellers are always very nice, friendly, and courteous. I was able to get a check cashed about 5 minutes after closing time. This is something my old bank would have never done for me. Their online banking website is also very easy to navigate and use. It links both my checking and savings accounts together and makes transferring money a cinch. There online bill pay is also easy to use.

name: Chery Clapham
review: I signed up for this credit card to begin building credit when I had started college. At the beginning, it was great. I have never had a problem with the customer service on the card, or with experiencing fees. However, my opinion of this card has recently changed. I have had this card with Wells Fargo for four years, and have never missed a payment or made a late payment, and my APR continues to be at 24.99%. I faxed a request to the executive office, asking that my APR be lowered considering my good standing with Wells Fargo (as I have other accounts with them) and excellent credit, and they have refused to lower the APR. I liked that Wells Fargo helped me to establish my credit, but since they will not lower my APR based on my credit, I am changing credit cards.

name: Jennifer Mings
review: This credit card is decent, but not something to write home about.  I signed up for it as I was leaving to college, and figured that it would be a good thing to have in case of emergency.  However, I wasn't aware that the interest rate would so quickly inflate.  I have made all of my payments on time and I still have an 18% interest rate!  The good thing about this card is that if the bank notices you making payments on time, they will raise your spending limit as a reward, which is nice.  In addition, they have the option for online banking, which is very important to me!  Overall, I would only recommend this card to people that are desperate for a beginner's credit card.  For everyone else, find a card with a lower interest rate!

name: Julietta Kapsos
review: Been using this credit card for a while and had no trouble at all during my duration. I mainly just use it for small purchases at grocery stores or whatever and its very convenient to use and plus the bank itself is very accommodating. Whenever I have an issue I can just call up my bank and they will fix anything quickly and easily. It's great if you don't have the best credit, and still gives you rewards. I would pretty much recommend this card to any friends or family, and I have already done so because how easy it is to use.

name: John Jones
review: I have not been very satisfied with Wells Fargo. It is nice that the bank is everywhere, but the service I've had just hasn't been great. The employees at the branches have always been nice. I've had some problems with the bank making mistakes, and even though the employees wanted to help found that they couldn't really do much to fix the situation. I just don't really see the advantage of this bank over some of its competitors. They also have almost no rewards offerings and low interest on checking accounts. Maybe if they improved their customer service I would be able to recommend them again because as I said the employees have been nice.

name: Joey Thompson
review: I've been banking with Wells Fargo for a couple years now. I started off by getting a student checking account in my first year of college as a freshman. When I first walked in and a personal banker assisted me he was very polite. He broke down everything I needed to know about my bank account and answered any questions I had with great expertise. Since it was my first time opening a bank account I didn't know a lot about how it worked so I had to ask a lot and do a lot of reading when I got home. Wells Fargo has been good to me and very straightforward. There are fees associated with accounts but it clearly states how to avoid these fees and it has been a long time since I've gotten hit with an account activity fee. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone who is financially stable and looking for a simple bank account to use. If you are a paycheck to paycheck type of person I would not recommend Wells Fargo to you. I give them a solid four out of five stars and plan on staying with them until they give me a reason not to.

name: Ashley
review: I have been a customer with Wells Fargo for almost four years now, and I can say I'm extremely happy with their service. I currently have a checking account and student savings account which have both been easy to maintain through Wells Fargo. I've lived in multiple states as a Wells Fargo customer but they've always had close, easy to get to locations. Whenever I needed assistance, the customer service has been great and they handled my issues almost right away. Their online banking website is also a great convenience for me since I'm a full-time student and have a part-time job. I would definitely recommend Wells Fargo to everyone.

name: Annberlynn Belle
review: Wells Fargo is the closest bank to my house, so I transferred over from my previous bank. The application process was a little lengthy, but nothing harsh. They did have a few monthly fees that I caught, at which they never explained to me, but I asked them about it, and they told me. Their customer service has been okay, given that this is a very busy branch all the time, so you're bound to wait a few minutes if you want to see a teller. Overall, this is a good bank, and there's no major problems yet. I am pleased by Wells Fargo.

name: Kirk Miller
review: I didn’t really have too many problems with Wells Fargo, but whenever I did have a problem, they were just a huge headache to deal with, unless it was they would profit. Several times the order I bought stuff in would be rearranged so that I’d get hit with as many fees as possible, I’d complain and they fixed it, but that’s really not the sort of thing I should have to do in the first place, it’s incredibly sleazy. I never felt like it was the individual workers fault, however, they just seemed like they knew there were problems and were used to dealing with these types of corporate shenanigans.

name: Marianne Swann
review: I do not like credit cards in general or credit card companies. I have had bad past experiences with many card companies, dealing with fees and rates. If however, you were going to choose to use a credit card, this is one of the ones I would personally positively recommend. I have had good experience with their customer service. They have good rates and fair fees. No annual fee. I like the rewards program and have used it multiple times to get rewarded with different types of gift cards. If you are looking for a low interest card with good rewards, this could be what you are looking for.

name: Bradley Stannish
review: I started out many years ago as a customer of Central Fidelity bank when I lived in Virginia. I stuck with them when they were acquired by Wachovia, and I am still with them now that they have been taken over by Wells Fargo. There haven't really been any substantial changes throughout that time other than colors and logos and some of the faces I see at the branches. I still lack a compelling reason to change to any other banking institution, for the latest owner of the bank I've used for twenty years still serves my needs well and still offers good and friendly customer service.

name: Tony
review: Wells Fargo is a good bank overall. They do have quite a few fees though but there are ways around them if you meet requirements. I've been banking with them for about 6 years and have had no major problems to speak of. The customer service has been good, either over the phone or in person. Each branch I've been to has been staffed with helpful polite employees and at least in that aspect I can say that they get things right. If you need a national bank, you could do worse. The ATMs are up to date and easy to use, and at least in my area, located with convenience in mind.

name: Kelly
review: I have only been with Wells Fargo for about a year now but, I really appreciate their business attitude. They work hard for their customers' satisfaction at my branch and online. I personally like working face to face and it is never a problem to walk in and get the service I am looking for besides, I find it better to communicate in person. They offer many services to fit your needs and also offer other services that I haven't seen at other banks. For example...A teen checking account. This can be opened for your teen once they hit 13 and allows you to monitor their account while they learn how to manage money before making it into the real world. Their application process can be lengthy but, this is only to set up any future financial obligations you may encounter such as, home loans, car loans, or a budget for retiring.

name: Brittany Brown
review: I've been a client since around 2004, in San Francisco Bay Area.I've had a very positive experience all around (and I am not an “ideal” client from a bank's perspective - I had a high debt-to-income ratio and high utilizations for all but the last year-and-a-half).Every employee I've dealt with, in person or on the phone (including in Wichita, KS) has been kind and helpful.There have been times that I accrued a *legitimate* fee, and they'd take it off when I asked, just as a courtesy. (One overlimit fee per year, for example.)As someone else noted above, their deposit availability is second to none.If you deposit cash in an ATM it's available instantly, and if you deposit a check, the first $100 is available instantly (with the balance available the next day, or one more at the MOST, even for large checks).And if you REALLY need a check to be available right away (especially something like a payroll or government-issue check, where they have no reason to worry about it) you can just call or stop by a branch and ask nicely and they'll take the hold off immediately.I highly recommend this bank to anyone. A spoonful of sugar goes a LONG way with their (or anyone's) customer service. :)

name: Dan
review: Wells Fargo has been my savior last year. I was able to apply for, and receive a student loan within months. And with a Wells Fargo customer co-signer I was able to get an interest rate that rivaled the Federal Loans! A week later I was then able to open student checking and savings accounts and leave the bank with a debit card. My only complaint is that the student accounts still have monthly fees unless certain requirements are met. Personally I have to use my debit card more than 6 times a month and have every purchase with my debit card deposit one dollar into my savings account. Now while these are easy to meet (usually) and can be useful (usually) it does make it a bit harder to keep track of my money. And if for some reason these requirements aren't met I am smacked with a maintenance fee. Though this is a small thing I do know that some other banks have no minimum balance or fees for student accounts. So it is good to see all sides of a situation.

name: Audrey Anderson
review: I really like the branch that I go to. The tellers are always friendly and helpful and try to make me as comfortable as possible. There are plenty of Wells Fargo ATM locations in my area and the ATM system they use is nice and easy to use. The only thing I don't like and that I find annoying is my money automatically transferred without me knowing with the Way2Save Savings account. It's frustrating for me because I work a minimum wage job and I have absolutely no wiggle room in my budget. I would like there to be a feature where I could turn off the automatic transfers, but it's been difficult to find out if there's a way to do it without getting rid of the savings account altogether. Overall, I am happy with my checking account here, the great customer service overshadows the slight annoyances.

name: Travis Chapman
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for quite a few years now, since it is the bank that our family business uses. We use it to manage our business checking and savings, and all of our money goes through there. They are a good bank, but there are more up-to-date ones out there, with better benefits, and better rates (there's always someone bigger and better, isn't there?). Overall, they are a good bank, not amazing or horrible, but more or less middle of the road bank. We have had a few issues with deposits and withdrawals over the years, but nothing to warrant moving our entire business elsewhere. All in all, it's a decent bank, but if you have the means to do so, check out other options in your area.

name: Brittany Swain
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo since they bought out Wachovia. Many of the same problems that I had with Wachovia have been the same with Wells Fargo, except when I told them I wanted to cancel Overdraft Protection on my debit card they did so. Now, if there is not enough money in my account, my card will not work, which saves me those $35 fees for a bunch of $3 and $5 purchases. However, when someone stole the number on my debit card and charged a $10 online purchase, Wells Fargo gave me a hard time about solving the issue. Other than that, there have been very few problems with them. I would score them much better if they had been helpful with the $10 charge instead of saying that I may have paid for something and forgotten about it, I am sure I would have remembered typing in my credit card information.

name: Bradley Jacobson
review: Wells Fargo has been my bank of choice for the past four years now. Since that time, I have had my main checking account as well as my savings account with Wells Fargo. I love how convenient it is to access my money and access my statements whenever and wherever I want. I routinely transfer funds back and forth between accounts online, and it there is no processing time that I need to wait in order for this to happen. I can be on my computer at 3:00 A.M. and transfer funds, and they are instantly where I want them to be. This is great, particularly when I am trying to pay my bills online. It is a large, national bank, so there are tons of branches and automatic teller machines all over the place when I need one. I also really like Wells Fargo’s smartphone app. I use it all the time to check my balance, and deposit checks that I receive in the mail. They have made it so convenient that I very rarely, if ever need to visit a branch, or speak with anyone at the bank. My Wells Fargo accounts suit my busy lifestyle, and I am very happy to trust my money with them.

name: Melissa
review: I had a pretty bad experience with a Wells Fargo student loan. I deferred payments on the loan for several years because I was in school. However, even though I was not making payments during the deferment period, that period still counted toward the total amount of time I had to pay back my loan, which was not explained to me. Once I began working and started repayment, my minimum payment was increased to nearly 800 dollars a month, as the term of the loan had been decreased substantially. When I ran into trouble making my payments, I contacted Wells Fargo and asked them for help consolidating the loan or changing the payment plan. They told me flat out that they could not help me in any way. I sucked it up, made partial payments until I could afford to make the full payment, and took the credit hit. I finally paid off the loan, but I remain unimpressed with the fact that Wells Fargo was unwilling to work with me in any way. I am glad to be rid of them and won't do business with them again.

name: Lissa Nypaver
review: I was originally a Wachovia customer that became a Wells Fargo customer due to the merger a few years ago and I believe that things have definitely changed for the better since the change. The bank communicates through email and post regularly to keep me informed of any policy changes and my account status and their terms and fees are comparable to similar institutions. My only complaint would be that the website often is not reflective of what is happening with my accounts in real time as I had thought they were. I learned this the hard way when I ended up overdrawing the account based on the balance listed on my mobile app. I contacted the customer service immediately and they explained what the issue was and even refunded the service fee that was charged for the overdrawn account. Otherwise, I have been very satisfied with Wells Fargo as my bank.

name: Dan Ackman
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for a little over two years now, and I'm getting to the point where I have had enough. So far, the hassle of switching banks has outweighed the negatives of staying with Wells Fargo, but it looks like the point at which that reverses is swiftly approaching.When I first opened a linked checking and savings account, I had a steadily paying job and a consistent paycheck being directly deposited twice a month. I was assured that I would never have to pay any fees and that through depositing $75 dollars a month from my checking to my savings, it would stay that way. Well, a year later, no longer employed, I start receiving monthly services fees on my account out of the blue. It turns out there was a minimum direct deposit amount that was a required to maintain the fee waiver. I went to my branch and explained to them that I was never told this, and they offered to refund the fees and rearrange the account so that I would not be assessed any further charges. They could only refund some of the fees, though, so I did end up losing some money, but at least I didn't have to worry about fees anymore.Wrong! The same thing happened again six months later, and I went back to the branch and they again offered to refund the fees, but wait! Policy had changed and they were no longer allowed to do that. They did set me up with a new account without fees, however, as long as I use my debit card for a certain number of purchases a month. The hidden fees are annoying, the constantly shifting requirements for avoiding them are outrageous, and I am tired of playing this game. I will soon be switching to a bank that offers me more, with less financial drama.

name: Kerryn Otto
review: I chose Wells Fargo as a bank where I could have a secondary checking account. My primary account was with Bank of America and I had a Keep the Change option connecting my checking to my savings. I heard really positive things about Wells Fargo so I decided to try them out.At first, I was a little apprehensive about joining them. The branch I went to was in Pineville, NC and was a little pushy with their sales. I understand the whole process about trying the sale numerous times, but I was in a rush and felt a little pressured to join. I repeatedly offered to take her business card and come back another day and she kept pushing me to give her my license and social security number to get me set up. I ended up leaving without opening an account that day and coming back a couple weeks later to speak with someone else who wasn't pushy at all. I am glad I went back because I really like their banking policies.I am also not fond of monthly fees when it comes to bank accounts and with Wells Fargo, as long as you use your debit card 10 times a month, there is no monthly fee. I probably use my card 90 times a month so it wasn't an issue to me.Their customer service is great. Going in to do a deposit or withdrawal is simple and I have always had pleasant experiences with the bank tellers.I would highly recommend Wells Fargo to those looking for a good place to open a checking and savings. Haven't experienced any other types of accounts but I'm sure they're great!

name: Salvador
review: I have been banking at Wells Fargo for about 5 years now and I really don't see a reason to switch banks. What I like about Wells Fargo is that they have a lot of ATMs everywhere, which makes it really convenient whenever I need extra cash and the banks are closed. Also, I've had a couple issues with my accounts but whenever I called customer service they were always happy to help and actually resolved the issues. If you're looking for convenient banking, I'd recommend Wells Fargo. They're not much different than other banks, but they work and their customer service is top notch.

name: Mike Yee
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for more than 2 years. It became my primary bank when my old bank Wachovia was bought by Wells Fargo. I had my reservations when that happened, but the experience ever since is nothing but smooth. Their clerks are always very friendly, and their ATM service has a later cut-off time for the deposit – 8PM instead of the regular 6PM. Its envelope-less service on the ATM machine is always a pleasure to use. Recently, Wells Fargo added a new service so that I can deposit my check through my phone – I basically take a picture of my checks, and the money will be automatically deposited to my account. This definitely is a time saver for me and I use this feature very frequently. Overall, I am quite satisfied with its service, and I would anticipate staying as their customer for a long time.

name: Dan Q
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for over 10 years. I originally belonged to the bank when they were known as First Union, then Wachovia, and now Wells Fargo. I have never had very large issues with Wells Fargo bank except for the few times that there were some inconveniences. Several charges that I wasn’t aware of were applied to my account and when I tried to resolve the issue the process was long and arduous, and I got the impression at times the customer service was not willing to help me all that much.Other than that they have been reliable and forthcoming providing me with a relatively easy banking experience and have not driven me away from their services.

name: Ryan
review: I have been a member of Wells Fargo for over a year now and it has been a fantastic experience overall. There are tons of ATMs throughout my city, setting up my account took less than 30 minutes and the staff was really helpful in setting up the right type of account for me. The only complaint I have is that there are fees for my account if I do not use my debit card more than 10 times in a month, but that limit is very easy for me to hit personally. However, I would recommend this bank to anyone looking to start up a new account!

name: John Martin
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for 18 months now, and I absolutely love it! They have handled my mortgage in an extremely professional manner. I had a lot of questions about mortgages, but a lot of my questions could be answered right from their web site's FAQ. I love how easy it is to navigate their web site, and especially the My Account page. I have automatic payments set up on my mortgage, and I don't even have to worry about it each month. Wells Fargo automatically deducts from my account the correct amount each month. A few months ago, I made a mistake and accidentally submitted a double payment for my mortgage – I had thought that the automatic payment had failed, because it was a holiday, but it was just a day late. I contacted Wells Fargo via phone and they were extremely helpful and QUICK to respond to my call. They resolved the issue with no delay and I had the double payment back in my account in just a few days. The lady that I spoke with on the phone was pleasant and very kind to me, even though I had made such a dumb mistake. I hope that I can always do business with Wells Fargo, because they have excellent customer service and make you feel like you are important to them.

name: Mark Morton
review: I should maybe start by saying I've been following the “Stagecoach” for over 20 years now, pretty much without incident. Truth be told, when I joined WF the options seemed abysmal. Bank of America? Ick!Wells Fargo has worked for me primarily because they seem to stay out of my way most of the time. I'm not looking for a 'personal banking experience' – quite the opposite. I've weaned myself from ever going into a branch, and they're okay with that. I hammer away on the ATM keyboard and remain a happy camper.The fees seem ridiculous, but so are every bank’s fees these days...it's how they make money.
