When I've had a dispute or inquiry, I've found their phone support quite solid – and without a hint of “overseas-ness” (a personal gripe of mine). Non-phony friendliness and clarity...good stuff.As they've sucked other banks into the fold, I've considered going the Credit Union route, but I'm in love with the ATMs taking cash deposits and CUs around where I live in NorCal just don't have that going on.Unless they light themselves on fire, I imagine I'll continue following the horsies into the Western sunset...

name: Stephanie Zarandy
review: I applied for this credit card since I needed to build some credit. It requires a $300 deposit, which I did not mind paying since this was my first credit card.  I have a savings account with the bank so paying the balance on my credit card online through the Wells Fargo website has not been a problem at all. I also use the iphone app in order to heck my recent transactions. I find the rate a little high but I have been careful and made my payments on time, after all this card is to start up your credit history not go crazy and buy everything you see.

name: Randy Van Winkle
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for over 15 years. I hold several accounts with them including a savings account, and two checking accounts. There are two main reasons why I like Wells Fargo and continue my banking with them. The first is the distribution of locations in my home town. There is a Wells Fargo location within about a 2 mile radius of most places that I frequent. This makes banking and locating ATMs very convenient. The second reason is for their online banking environment. I have been using it for some time now and find it very convenient. I can check my account balance, transfer funds, review individual transactions, view cleared checks and even print a statement. I do have some reservations about some of the fees and policies, but these are currently overshadowed by the convenience services that I noted.

name: Mark Hodges
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for quite a while, and I was a Wachovia customer for over a decade before they were purchased by Wells Fargo. I have had a number of accounts there, including checking, savings, and a personal loan. They have always had the best customer service, and I could always count on them to solve any issue quickly and efficiently. They have more locations than anyone else, and this is especially helpful when you are out of town and want to make an ATM withdrawal without any fees. It's almost like having a local bank wherever you go! I love working with this bank, and I would recommend them to any and all my friends who are looking for a bank.

name: Melissa Miller
review: I had a checking account with Wells Fargo for a few years while I was in college. It was a very convenient bank to have since they had banking locations right on campus. However, the free checking account I signed up with ended up getting changed to a checking account with a monthly fee. Once they did that, I started looking for another bank to go to. I needed to keep every dollar I could while attending college, and I'm sure I wasn't the only person like that. Their customer service also left a lot to be desired. Really, the only reason you should bank with them is for the convenience factor. Banking with a credit union is a much better option than Wells Fargo or any of the other big banks. Stay away from Wells Fargo if you can.

name: William B
review: My family always used Wells Fargo when we were growing up, so I recently opened a checking account with them. From the moment the application process started, I was extremely well taken care of. Their employees know a LOT about banking and seem much more qualified than tellers at other banks. They all dress really nice, too! There were a few things I was confused about that they had to explain. I gave the clear disclosures area a 4 out of 5 stars because there were a few things even the tellers thought were a bit silly. I deposited $600 and plan on using that account mostly for groceries/shopping. I plan on putting a little bit in each month. They told me this was a better option than a savings account, which I'm inclined to agree with. Overall, my experience with them has been perfect. They're definitely the ones I'll go to with questions if I have them in the future.

name: Bergen
review: Recently our account was hacked and over $16,000 was charged. The Wells Fargo agent said that it was a common scam – order the items online and pick them up in the store rather than have them shipped to an address that can be traced. Even so, the money would not be redeposited to our account until an investigation was done. Weeks have gone by and we are still waiting. Each time I call I am told they need more information from us to “get this going.” Yet I never receive a call requesting more information, I only find out it's needed when I call in. Overall, I would say they are not clear about how they handle security problems. They are in no rush to help their customers get their hard earned money back. I asked what I could do to ensure this never happened to us again and the agent said, “Nothing. You can't do nothing.”

name: Cassie Miller
review: The Wells Fargo Platinum credit card is great, when I was just starting college my grandma added me to her credit card to help assist with school needs. Now I have had it about ten years and love it. The interest is not too bad for what you are using the card for and I have never had problems with customer service. Any time something didn’t look right on the card I could call and get the information that I needed to clear up the matter. Also what is great is that you get rewards for what you spend, so every so often I go in and check my rewards and I am able to get gift cards, travel vouchers, and even money added to your account. My credit on this card has gone up over there years which has really helped me out, I don’t know what I would do if I didn’t have a Wells Fargo Credit Card.

name: Rob Thompson
review: Nice commercial! =)

name: Hannah Boyd
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo since I first set up bank accounts that I would use to pay for my college funding. I have never had a problem with this bank, and whenever I visit it, the bankers are always very accommodating and polite! I have been a patron of banks in the past that didn't really care about your finances and simply wanted your business, but Wells Fargo tries to work with you to satisfy your needs. It has always tended to be an easy process to transfer money from my savings and CDs into my checking account. I would definitely recommend this bank. They make savings easy.

name: Jim McLaughlin
review: Wells Fargo provides very reasonable checking and savings products. However, they are a heavy fee driven institution. If you have less than $500 in any account expect to see very significant fees on a monthly basis with most account choices. Also, overdraft charges are $35.00 for every transaction – credit or debt. Wells Fargo does offer excellent fraud protection support. However, you need to keep a close eye on your account. Overall, given the fraud processing and account fees, as well as the slow processing of deposit/withdrawal transactions, I give them a three star rating. Wells Fargo offers a quality line of banking products but keep a close eye on your account transactions for extra fees and unauthorized transactions.

name: John Jameson
review: My wife and I just opened a checking and savings account for our son through Wells Fargo. In the past I’ve secured several personal and business loans through this bank. Other than the initial deposit and seven dollar monthly maintenance fees, there are no other hidden costs. The savings account even comes with a reasonable interest rate. This is my son’s first account and he will probably use it for the next ten years or so. The application process was quick and painless since I was already a long standing client. The accounts representative was professional and courteous as always. What more could you ask for in a bank.

name: Zachary Abresch
review: Wells Fargo catches a lot of flack for being a “big bank”. When I first moved where I live now, no one would give me a bank account, especially the local banks and smaller banks that I tried first. Even with someone willing to guarantee my accounts I still couldn't open a bank account in my city. I walked into Wells Fargo and walked out with a checking and savings account in 30 minutes. It was fantastic and I've banked there ever since. They've been awesome about overdrafts and don’t charge me exuberant fees. In fact, my girlfriend and I are going to open a joint checking account there when we move in together purely because of the great experiences I've had with them. All in all, it's nice having the power of a large, stable bank behind my accounts and you could do a lot worse with those local banks.

name: Lucas
review: I opened a Wells Fargo Secured credit card back when I had new credit. I was not a fan of having to set a minimum deposit, but I did it anyways to start a relationship with Wells Fargo. It ended up paying off because after a year of having this card, I applied for a normal card, and I received my highest limit yet. My experiences with this card have been about the same as my other Wells Fargo card (other than I had to set a deposit in the beginning). Wells Fargo offers many online features that are easy and convenient to use. I have had really good experiences with their customer service members anytime I have had to contact them. They use to offer a program where you would be eligible for an upgrade to a normal credit card account after a year of good payments, but I think they ended that program sometime in the middle of my first year. This is a good card for anyone with new or bad credit; it will help you establish or fix your credit report.

name: Lucas
review: I created my Wells Fargo checking account online. It was not that hard of a process, but I would recommend just going into the branch if you are interested in an account. They had to send back papers of missing information for me to sign. The whole process probably would have been easier if I just went into the bank. Other than that, I have had great experiences with Wells Fargo. They offer great customer service and problem resolution. I have had to call them a few times about errors on my online account and they fixed them immediately. They have branches in many locations so it is easy to bank through them when you travel to other states. Overall I have not had any bad experiences with them, and I would recommend them to anyone who is interested in opening a new account.

name: Britt Pack
review: I have this credit card and would not recommend it to anyone.  I opened a Wells Fargo college checking account about four years ago, and at the time I was young and thought it was smart to open a credit card as well.  Wells Fargo convinced me this card was a smart idea.  The interest rate is about 24% and even though I have paid my bills on time throughout the time I've had it, Wells Fargo has refused to lower my interest rate because it is still a college account.  I finally had to close my account so I could pay it off because my interest payments were just as big as much minimum monthly payments. I was never making progress.  If you are planning on getting a Wells Fargo credit card, I would suggest reading over all of the fine print and ensuring you're getting what you think.

name: Victoria Heckstall
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for three years after making the Switch from Bank of America. They are a great bank and I highly recommend them to anyone who needs a checking or savings account. Their customer support staff is friendly and knowledgeable and if you set your account up online they have a lot of tools that help make your banking experience more enjoyable such as the “My Money Map”. In all of the time that I have been with them I can honestly say that I have never encountered one problem and they always alert me of any changes via email.

name: Pecola Coleman
review: I used to bank at Wells Fargo when I lived in San Diego, California. I had a very bad experience with the bankers. The managers gave me problems continually and they did strange things to my account. They continually threatened to close it and wouldn't process some of my deposits. I think they were discriminating. They finally closed it. When I moved to Burbank, California, I got verbally and almost physically attacked by the bankers just for asking for an American banker. They refused and cursed at me. Security had to be called. It was terrible. I am expecting court so I can get some justice. I need it.

name: Jasmine wright
review: I have Wells Fargo now because they bought out Wachovia and I just stayed because it was easier. Since the switch I've not been a happy customer. They now have fees for everything. I know nothing is free but how much do you really need to watch my money? I've slowly started to just use cash so I don't have to get charged thirty dollars if they take two cents out of my savings to cover a purchase. The status of my account is always delayed. It is always saying pending or will not show the transaction and therefore I overdraft. I don't have millions in the bank. I have to budget my money and if my account states I have fifty dollars in it and I have to buy my baby a pair of ten dollar shoes that cause me to overdraft it's pretty ridiculous. When the company was Wachovia I was very happy it's sad to me that they were bought out.

name: Dani Caren
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for six years now and as a bank, they've done pretty well for me. I can usually find a branch of their offices in whatever city I'm in, though I haven't traveled much outside Washington and Oregon. Their tellers are always friendly and their bankers are willing to help find the answers to your questions. I was upset when they were going to start charging a monthly $10 fee if you didn't adhere to very specific requirements, but I talked with one of their bankers and he set me up with an account that waived the fee. My only complaint is that their fraud department can be a little overzealous in freezing card use. I once went on a camping trip and my card was frozen because I'd bought supplies in an area I'd not been to before. Aside from that, I would definitely recommend Wells Fargo.

name: Beatrice Renee
review: I bank with Wells Fargo because it is close to my house, along with an ATM which I need occasionally. I can also make deposits at this ATM and it is quick and easy. For the most part I like their online banking and the ATM. I will go out of my way not to have to use a teller just because it is so much quicker to use their ATMs, which are great. The things I don't like are trying to be sold on services I don't want or need, and the checking fees. I don't have any fees but that is only because my home loan is with them. I feel like I am sort of tied to them for services in that regard. If I go anywhere else I will have checking fees. Overall, everything is just OK. They haven't been bad to me at all as a local branch, and they are always helpful and greet me. I've refinanced with them in the past and it was a slow process with many papers being asked for multiple times. The second time I refinanced for a lower rate years later was much quicker and easier due to a streamlined process, but not everyone is eligible for that.

name: Kjell
review: I have been with Wells Fargo as a checking customer since 2001. I think like many large banks, Wells Fargo receives a lot of criticism, some fair and some misinformed. Over the course of 12 years of banking with them, I have had my fair share of issues. I have been charged fees that I felt were unfair, and had some money I felt was held too long after the deposit was made without me having access to it. I think I would encounter similar problems at any major bank. But when I have had problems, I spoke with a teller and they were able to resolve them every time without hassle. Even things that were my fault, such as overdraft charges, the tellers were able to reverse. All I had to do was ask.

name: Joslyn Muta
review: This is not one of my favorite cards.  I have had a good relationship with Wachovia which was then bought by Wells Fargo.  Since I have other accounts with them I decided to open a credit card.  The service is nothing to write home about.  I started first with issues getting my statement each month and then with having questions answered.  You call the number and the automated service is not much help.  When you finally get someone on the line it is often in the wrong department and you are on hold forever.  The interest rate on the card is high and there the benefits/rewards are okay, but easily beaten by my other cards.  I don't have much use for the card and only use it in an emergency.  I would recommend many other cards before this one.

name: Marlena Griffin
review: I joined Wells Fargo on my husband's existing account about five years ago. He thought highly of them at the time. Then around two years ago, I opened an account for my son (he receives disability benefits and I am his representative), and that is when this bank's customer service really started to stand out to me. I worried that it would be a complicated procedure to apply for and set up this account, but that was not my experience at all. After meeting with one of their employees, I left the bank feeling happy and confident. I switched to direct deposit a few months ago. Between that and being able to pay my bills and check the status of my account online, it has been smooth sailing. Also, I plan on relocating out of state, and thankfully I do not have to worry about switching banks or having to change anything, because they have locations just about everywhere. Overall, I have found this bank to be helpful and convenient.

name: Cassie Miller
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for over ten years now. It was my first bank when I was 16; I let it go for a while but came back because of their great service. Not only do I have my checking account through them, but I also have a savings account, a credit card, and student loans. Well Fargo has been there to assist me with all my needs. When I was about to leave the country I was able to get foreign currency from them and return what I had not spent when I came back. The customer service is always great. You can either email them online and somebody will contact you or you can call the customer service line. I always get through. I have only had one other bank but to me Wells Fargo is the best choice for all my financial needs.

name: brittany
review: I have multiple checking accounts, but my Wells Fargo account is the one I primarily use. I really enjoy that there is a Wells Fargo located pretty much everywhere; it is always available when I go on vacation or just go out of town for the day. Even though there is always a location available, online banking is flawless. I got my Wells Fargo account when I was in college and since then I have not had to pay any account fees. It's simple and easy to open the account and continue to have it. The customer service is always fantastic as well.

name: Charita Mondier
review: This is an OK credit card to have. I signed up for this because I have a checking and saving account with Wells Fargo. Nothing-fancy going on with the card, just very basic features with no rewards programs and higher then average interest rates and fees. Get this card if you can’t get approved for any others. Competitors offer much better interest rates and incentives. I do regret signing up for this, not because it is a terrible card, but because compared to what is out there this is at the very bottom of the pack. Also watch out for free trial offers for other products they try to get you to sign up for, they are not free and will cause a lot of confusion when you try and dispute the charge, as you will talk to a totally different person who doesn’t know what they offered.

name: Lori Soule
review: Seven years ago, when Wells Fargo was Wachovia, I opened a business checking account for my corporation. I also opened a personal account. I have been somewhat happy over the years with the service at my local branch, and with the website which makes online banking and bill paying very simple. What I am NOT happy about since the bank became Wells Fargo is that the minimum balance requirements for their accounts are higher and I now have to pay a monthly service fee for my personal account. Fortunately, I was able to change my business account to a “free small business account” and now do not have service fees associated with it. But I am shopping around for another bank for my personal accounts where I won’t have to pay a $10.00 per month service fee.

name: Brandon Richards
review: I've been using Wells Fargo for the last 6 months or so, and while I am not the biggest fan of this bank, all the people I've dealt with there are great. Opening my accounts and getting everything set up was a quick and painless process, even though some of my accounts carry fees which I don't necessarily like. The accounts are necessary for me, and the customer service at my local branches is top-notch. I have never left the bank without knowing exactly what my accounts were doing, and where my funds were at. An overall average banking experience has been elevated by great customer service. I planned on closing my accounts here shortly, but I think I'll stick around for a little while longer. :)

name: Jessedio
review: I joined Wells Fargo a few years ago and feel it has been an overall positive experience. What I like is the “nationwide” convenience of having their branches all over every state I travel to. Their customer service is always friendly and courteous, not to mention that when I use the drive-through teller option the nice lady always gives my puppy a dog treat when she sees him in the car with me. It is little gestures like that, that make me want to be a loyal customer. So far, so good. I even opened a business checking account and got a free customized debit/credit card for my business when opening the account.

name: Knute Gregory
review: I’ve been a member of Wells Fargo since I was five. I loved having Wells Fargo when I was in college as it was convenient and free. I loved being able to open a certificate of deposit with them and used the money that I made to partly pay for graduate school. After I was done with school I did not have any money in my account and Wells Fargo changed my account to one that charged me 15 dollars a month, which I understand but they did it without my knowledge. For someone in my current financial state 15 dollars a month is enough to make me consider changing banks. Overall, I am still satisfied but not as satisfied as I was in the past.

name: Dave
review: I've had checking and savings accounts with Wells Fargo for 14 years and have been very satisfied. I became a customer when I moved to California and needed a new bank. They seemed like a good choice, because of their reputation and the convenience of their many branches and ATMs. It turned out to be a great choice, as their customer service and overall service quality are also top-notch. While their monthly maintenance fees are fairly high, it's easy to avoid them with multiple options that most people can manage, such as just using your debit card a few times a month to make purchases. Their online and mobile banking services are great; I've never had a problem accessing them, and the available services keep improving (you can even deposit checks with a smartphone now by taking a picture). Customer service by phone is excellent – a friendly, knowledgeable rep has always answered right away and been very helpful. Finally, it's great that they bought Wachovia to increase their presence even more.

name: rabi Akbar
review: I opened a checking account with Wells Fargo Bank at their branch location in Provo, Utah.  I have tp say that I am pleased with their outstanding services and employees.  At the branch location, the customers´ queue is well managed as there are at least three clerks available at all times to handle the customers´ business.  The branch is very clean and looks marvelous with red carpets and the people are truly the nicest bank employees around in Utah. Wells Fargo checking account also provides extensive online services such as Bill Pay and wire transfers which make life a lot easier.

name: Jenna Chavez
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo since 2008, when it was Wachovia Bank. I have been relatively satisfied with the amount of service I have received. Tellers are typically very friendly and smiling, and open to client relations. However, the customer service via phone can be rather lacking. They seem experienced, but not as friendly as when I go to the branch for assistance. They are not as knowledgeable as the branch representatives when it comes to questions about joint accounts. For example, last week I called to find out what I would need to do to take a name off of my joint account, and add another person to it. They told me all I would have to do was go into the branch and add the new person without removing the other. When I went into the branch, I was told that I would have to completely close my account out, and open a new one to remove the name on it, and to add the person to my account, I would have to have the person I am trying to remove to agree to add the other person. It was very confusing and not what I had been told by the phone representative. Luckily we managed to fix the issue at hand without having to involve everyone at one time, and it took about an hour to open a new account in the branch, whereas I do not remember it taking that much time online. However, at the same time, when I have had issues with unexplained charges on my account, Wells Fargo has taken immediate and appropriate action.

name: Samantha
review: I have nothing bad to say about my experience with Wells Fargo. I have been with them for about 2 years and everything has been pretty smooth sailing and hassle free. I haven't really had to deal with their problem resolution because I have not had a bad experience with this bank thus far. I joined this bank for the reason that it’s a large sized bank that I visit when traveling for business and for the ease of their online banking and drive-up ATM services. Concerning their customer service, my particular branch is pretty consistent and provides overall a pleasant experience. However, I have been at several other branches and they are a little disorganized, scatter minded and unhelpful.

name: Crystal Boulton
review: Wells Fargo was literally the only bank in Oregon who would give me a checking account. I had a terrible time with Wachovia. Due to identity theft, they released every penny in my checking account to an “officer of the court” to satisfy a settlement entered against me, that I had absolutely no idea about. No bill collectors, no statements, no court paperwork, nothing. It was all sent to the fraudulent address the imposter had furnished to apply for (and default on) a credit card. Wachovia didn't even notify me that they had released all my money. My paycheck was auto-deposited, immediately released to the “court”, and then Wachovia continued to allow me to use my debit card for a week and a half before denying me a fill up at the gas station one day. Needless to say, I was devastated when I attempted to find out why. At that point I was -$600.00 from online bill pays and -$250 from Wachovia fees. (They charged me $100.00 for the inconvenience of having to give my money to someone else.) I was told it would be at least a year before anything could be done about the identity theft and I could get some recovery, but in the meantime I would continue to incur penalties over the $850.00 overdraft. I managed to broker with Wachovia to waive the penalties and paid them back the $600.00 principal. I then closed my account and opened one again in another local bank. No problems. A year later I decided to move to Oregon. The new bank I had chosen didn't have branch offices on the west coast so I needed to transfer my funds to a new bank. I tried the closest one to my home, Umpqua and was rejected. Rejected?? I'd never heard of such a thing, they rejected my application to open a checking account. I was informed that because I had an outstanding debt with Wachovia that I had been put on some awful “Banking blacklist” that could follow me up to TEN YEARS or until Wachovia removed me from the list. Astonished, I called Wachovia over and over and over to try to figure out what was going on. As far as I knew my account with them had been satisfied and closed. I even had a case number. By this point, however, Wachovia was gone, absorbed by Wells Fargo. So... to make a long story even longer, I went to Wells Fargo and sat down with a financial adviser. After relaying my story he made several calls to banking entities that aren't even available to the general public to try to figure out what I “owed” Wachovia and what I could do to satisfy the debt. After 2 solid hours on the phone he finally gave up. Wachovia was no-more. My name is on a debtors list but there is no account information attached to my name or SSN, so nobody can figure out what I owe who or why, and since Wachovia destroyed any possibility of me being able to do banking ANYWHERE for the next 10 YEARS, they would have to be the ones to release my name from the list, and because they were gone, they couldn't, and nothing can be done for me. Sweet, right? So, I think out of pure pity Wells Fargo decided to give me a probationary checking account which I rolled-over into a regular checking account after the 6 month probationary period. Wells Fargo has been ok. They keep instituting new weird rules about how many times I have to use my debit card and they are often the target of scams so I have to keep on my toes and watch my account like a hawk. Other than that, I enjoy the online banking. I've never had trouble depositing checks through the ATM (which is really handy) and my basic banking needs are met. However, I have no other choices at this point, or may not for the next 8 years, so, Wells Fargo it is. (I do have joint accounts with my husband at two other credit unions, but I had to go through a lengthy appeal process and my access to those accounts is very limited. I could not open an account at either on my own.)

name: Devon Miller
review: I had been with Wells Fargo since college but left because they got bought out. I went back to learn about my options for when I purchased a car and they were actually happy to see me. I thought they were going to try to sell me products I don’t need me or be upset that I left, but instead they tried to win my business back. And they got it. Their rates were by far the best and their customer service was excellent. I had a problem with a late payment once and they were actually very cool about it. It’s definitely worth looking into additional loans and business.

name: Vincent
review: As a customer for the last few years in college, I've found through my experience at Wells Fargo Bank that it is one of the most helpful and genuine banks I've done business with. From their friendly customer service representatives to their straightforward, user-friendly website, I've never had any problem solving an issue with Wells Fargo. Although their interest rate and cash back reward isn't as high as the ones offered by other banks, I've always appreciated their great customer service and most importantly, their understanding of how to treat a customer. I recently deposited some cash in the wrong joint account, but they quickly helped me transfer it in a fast, efficient manner. In the end, I am extremely happy with Wells Fargo and will definitely continue staying with them for awhile.

name: Liz Buehler
review: I went through Wells Fargo when I was trying to get a car loan. They were very helpful and because I was in a rush to get a new car, they made the process quick, easy, and painless. All the paperwork was filed, processed and approved in about an hour and I was able to pick up my new car a few days later. The representatives were all very nice when I had any questions about interest rates and payoff amounts. It’s also very easy to make payments and check information about your loan right on their website. It was a wonderful experience and I would go through them again and I would also definitely recommend their services to my friends and family.

name: Tori Riemersma
review: Wells Fargo has been my first and only bank for a few years now. I really enjoy their great online services and how available their ATMs are. Every time I have spoken to a banker, I have been provided with great service. My only real complaint has to do with their student loans: I was approved within a month, but even with a cosigner on the loan and a discount for being a Wells Fargo member, the interest rate was still pretty high. However, it is easy to pay off my loan and to see the updates in interest. All in all, Wells Fargo is a pretty simple and easy bank to use, they just charge a little more in card fees and loan interest than I would like.

name: R Fritz
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for more than 23 years (I started with other banks that were bought out and eventually ended up at Wells Fargo). There is usually a line inside for on-site banking but they tend to have most teller windows staffed. If you do have a problem to deal with, prepare to wait at least an hour but they will help you through it. I had a bank check that was lost and it took a while but we did get it stopped and reissued. The bank fees can be a little steep but I think they are pretty comparable to other banks.

name: Jaylene H
review: I like Wells Fargo because they took me in when no other bank would. They also were very friendly and patient. I opened my checking account in hopes to start over again with my money management. I really appreciate the service they gave me and letting me know what offers I could receive. I hope to get many more years of great service.  With that said I dislike that every time I go in to make a transaction they try to upgrade my account after I have already been denied the offer that they make me. I wish that there was a way to change that or mark that they have already offered it to me. I just don't feel ok when I have to tell them no every time. Maybe a flag can come up saying they have already tried and I didn't qualify. Thank you so much Wells Fargo.

name: Jessie
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo since college, so I have a good grasp on how they operate as a company etc. I can honestly say that they are about average in all areas. Oftentimes you can go into a branch that has great customer service, but there are times when the service is well below average, especially when you are dealing with their male tellers. They don't seem as nice as the females. I once opened a business account prior to starting a business and it got cancelled within like a month because the person setting it up didn't disclose important info to me. Also one time I deposited money into a friend’s account and they were deposited into a wrong account, and I had to call and get it straightened out the next day. I will say that the resolution department handled it very well though. They got the issue taken care of to the best of their ability, so they get an A+ for that.

name: Tammy Clark
review: My husband and I bank with Wells Fargo. We have banked there for several years now. Overall, our experience with them has been a positive one. The tellers extend satisfactory customer service by being helpful and very polite. They are professional and friendly and if you do have a problem that needs attention, they are quick to find a resolution. The only drawback with the bank is, that during certain times of the day they are very busy and if you need assistance it can take a while, but that's typical with most banks. Overall, I would highly recommend this bank to friends and family.

name: Anonymous
review: I've had an account with Wells Fargo since they bought out Wachovia Bank in North Carolina. In my years with Wachovia, I always received excellent service and I had an incredible banking experience. Sadly, this has not been the case with Wells Fargo. The tellers and staff at all of the local locations are extremely rude, and have not been willing to work with me as a customer or make my visits more enjoyable. On several occasions, I have attempted to withdraw cash or deposit a check into the ATM, only to find that the ATM system was down. One night (when my deposit was extremely important), I drove to six different locations in Raleigh, only to find that I wouldn't be able to access my account with any of them. I officially decided to pursue another banking experience after I was informed that Wells Fargo would be charging me a monthly premium because I chose to have my paychecks in paper rather than direct deposit. I would not recommend Wells Fargo to anyone.

name: Christa
review: I've always found the staff at Wells Fargo to be very personable, professional, and kind, even during those busy hours when everyone in the area seems to be cashing their paycheck at the same time. I used to do a lot of shopping on eBay, and, back when I was more ignorant of how to protect myself from scam artists, I purchased some collectibles from a seller that turned out to be both a bootlegger and a thief. A good chunk of money went missing from my bank account shortly after my purchase – an amount far higher than the cost of my collectibles and shipping – and I contacted a representative at Wells Fargo right away. I was able to meet with an employee the next day with very little hassle, and the money was restored within two days.

name: lindsay mcmullen
review: I switched to Wells Fargo after being with MT for a few years. I had heard good things and was anxious to leave my previous bank due to a lack of customer service and general attitude. For the most part I am happy with WF. The gentleman who opened my account was very helpful and knowledgeable. Since then, I've had positive experiences with all the tellers I've encountered. My only qualm is that when I opened my account I opened an opportunity account. There are a number of things I am unable to do, things like simply depositing a check or money at the ATM, which I was unaware of when I opened my account. I don't mind, as after a year I'll be able to do these things, but none of this information was presented to me when I first joined WF. I would have still done business with them had they disclosed this, and everyone I've talked to has always been very apologetic when I brought it up, but hopefully they will be more open about what exactly you get with personal checking to other customers in the future.

name: Andy
review: Wells Fargo is a good banking company with great service, but they have some questionable policies that keep me from rating this place with five stars. Firstly, I have always had great customer service here, compared to other banks. All the employees here have always been nice and courteous. I used to work in landscaping and come in dirty a few times and have never been rude about my appearance and have been offered respect and kindness.Their services are great too. I love their online banking as well as their simple and many ATMs all over the place. I have really liked the new way to deposit cash without an envelope.Lastly, I just think these new strict policies about a minimum amount in your accounts are really dumb. It really irks me the wrong way.

name: Jen
review: I was a member of Wells Fargo for quite a few years.  In the time I was a member, I really wasn't pleased with all of their services.  I had a savings and checking account, and also took out a couple loans.  It seemed like every kind of service that they provide, has a bunch of hidden fees.  It really seemed like everything I did with them, I was charged some small little fee.  I really didnt like that they did this kind of activity and it really put a sour taste in my mouth.  After putting up with all of this for a few years, I decided to take all my money and business to another bank.  Since then, I haven't had to pay any hidden fees.

name: Marilyn Schehl
review: I signed up for this credit card when I got my first job at a retail store. I was then living with my parents and was saving some money earned from my job as well. For the first six months, the card was interest free so I didn't have to worry about paying more than the price of my purchases. I like the services Wells Fargo provides me with this credit card and find the online features very useful for bill pay, card payment, account balance etc. Because this is my first credit card, I try to use it responsibly so as to not accrue any fees and ensure that my credit score improves. Overall I can attest that its a good service Wells Fargo provides.

name: Knute Gregory
review: This is a very user friendly card that is great for people who have not have credit cards before, or have only had a few credit cards in the past. I love the fact that this credit card gives me cash back regardless of what I purchase. Since I’ve gotten it I already have gotten 42 dollars back. I am a faithful user of Wells Fargo and really like that I can access my credit card information through the same website where I also monitor my checking account. This also makes it very easy to transfer money from my checking account to my credit card when I’m ready to pay it off.

name: Heather Dew
review: My husband has had this credit card for two years, and I just signed on with him about a year back when we combined bank accounts. So far, it's been a fine experience. We never carry a balance from one month to the next, so I have no experience with interest or late fees on this card (nor have I ever done a balance transfer or taken a cash advance). I do know that they raise our credit limit regularly, which is nice for building our credit score (higher limit + low balance = better score). One of the other reviewers mentioned rewards points, which I was not aware this card had--I'll have to look into it, I guess! Overall, this card has been good for our needs: raises credit limit often, and fees/interest aren't an issue because we use it responsibly.

name: Benjamin Goodberry
review: As there was a Wells Fargo bank open on my campus, I decided to go with convenience and open a credit card there. I do not regret doing so at all! After paying the minimum fee for opening the account, I have had no run-ins whatsoever with the company, and no issues making payments or purchases. Also, the annual fee is minimal for the service provided, as it works out to about $2 a month. The issues mentioned by others seem to be problems that would be solved after looking through the "regular" bank options. Especially considering I had no previous credit history, this is providing me the opportunity to develop strong credit for when I need it down the road. I would fully recommend signing up for this card- you won’t regret it!

name: Diana Bailey
review: I signed up for my Wells Fargo credit card when I left home for college so that I could start building credit. For the first year or so, I had a really great experience. The statements are clear, and they even increased my credit limit after about a year of good payment history. Recently, however, charges from the bank have been showing up on my card and when I call the bankers, they can't tell me what the charges are for. I really loved banking with Wells Fargo, but I cannot stand by a bank that isn't completely transparent with its customers.

name: Zebediah Wezensky
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for over a few years now, and my experience has been nothing but great. I started with a student checking account that my parents set up for me in high school, and after moving off to college I have had a standard checking account. Everything is very straightforward and clear. There are a lot of helpful features, such as mobile banking, that I take advantage of, and even more that I don’t use. It’s super easy to transfer money between me and my parents, and the customer service is wonderful. Derrick in Colorado Springs set me up and I have been happy ever since!

name: Alexa Varano
review: This is the first credit card I have ever had in my own name and I am very happy with it so far. It has only been a few months since I have had it, but I am happy with the idea that I can gain rewards for things that I typically buy anyway. I make sure that I only use this card for the essentials, things like groceries and gas, because prior to charging my card, I know I have the money for this already and won't worry about having any late fees add up. That's the one down side about this card, which I have not yet experienced and don't plan on experiencing, but if you don't pay your credit card bills on time, the late fees will get you pretty harshly. The first 6 months at a 0 apr though is pretty impressive! Like I said, I enjoy gaining rewards for things I will be purchasing anyway so it works for me!

name: Alexa Varano
review: I absolutely love my bank. The reason for that is pretty simple: they never seem to give me any trouble no matter what kind of trouble I have brought to them. Every time I enter into the bank I am greeted with friendly faces and smiles that tell me I am welcome, and they are here to help address whatever need that I may have. I have never been penalized for overdrafting my checking account, which is a great thing considering my college career and my poor banking during that time. I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a new bank. I recently made a call to my bank because of holds that were placed on my checking account and although it was me who was trying to purchase something, I still felt safe knowing that people would have a very hard time trying to get away with using my card to their advantage!

name: Jesse Quinn
review: Wells Fargo provided me with a notoriously bad experience. The only part of the process that was smooth during my entire five year relationship with them was the initial application. Unfortunately, that is because the contract turned out to be riddled with deceit. Fine print is buried to negate every positive guarantee that they make; however, this is not even the bulk of the true nature of my grievances. I paid close attention to the details but what they do not inform you of is that they can change these details on a whim without any notice. All of a sudden, Free Checking is gone, Overdraft Protection requires exorbitant expenditure, and fees are constantly added and hidden into the mechanisms of every day financial activities. Soon, online banking and transfer services cost extra. They overdraft us with surprise fees and then use that as an excuse to take more money. Trying to resolve this problem was impossible, as the customer service professionals down the line were vapid and incapable of doing anything more than reading along with you. If you want a safe place to keep your money, try a credit union!

name: Emily
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for 4 years. Since transferring to the branch in St. Augustine, Florida, I have been nothing but delighted with my service. I opened up a checking account with the bank as well as a savings account. As a college student, I struggled to save money. The encouragement and friendly service given to me by the staff made me feel like I was at a local bank rather than a large bank. The staff truly was the best. While there were problems at the beginning of my time using Wells Fargo, mostly because of the switch the bank was going through from Wachovia to Wells Fargo, the staff made it all worthwhile. Wells Fargo has since got everything under control and I couldn't be happier with my experience. When I had to go to Europe this past summer, I needed to exchange currencies. There is at least one Wells Fargo in every city that has foreign currency on hand, ready for exchange. This convenience is truly appreciated. They also offer identity theft protection at a reasonable price, which I also purchased for my trip. Wells Fargo is a wonderful bank to use. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new bank.

name: utaba ratata
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo since they bought my local Wachovia location. I must say that I've been pleased with the transition.The staff remained the same, courteous individuals I came to know after starting business there. Staff has helped me with personal finances that include more than just my checking account. They have assisted me with credit repair as well as financing a mini-van for my growing family. The only issue I've had with them is communication, at times, regarding electronic transactions. Someone had somehow gotten information about me and had attempted to open more accounts and lines of credit. It was a mess at first and I was pretty upset. Even then, the issue was resolved in more than timely manner with many smiles and apologies.I'd recommend this financial institution to anyone.

name: Rebecca Herbert
review: I am not a fan of Wells Fargo. I was originally a Wachovia customer until they got bought out by Wells Fargo. I had a checking account at the local branch, but I closed it. I was tired of the extra fees. It was also not easy to bank there, as there were no ATMS close, no drive-up ATM at my local branch, and a lot of the time the walk-up ATM was out of service. I still have a student loan with them until I can get it paid off. The customer service was helpful when I needed to get a deferment for going back to school, but they did make me pay the current month due first before they would give me a deferment. My advice is don't be even a day late with a payment or they will call you 2-3 times a day, even when you tell them you are back in school. The interest rate is fairly high too, but the application process was easy enough.

name: Angela Hannigan
review: My husband and I switched to Wells Fargo when we moved to our new home. The set-up process was pretty normal without a lot of headaches, but it did take a good hour. Since we have had the account we have had a few electronic problems, but the people have done a good job getting them resolved. Posted amounts get run through quickly. There are two things I don’t like. One is the change in customer service from person to person. Some are friendly, others are pure professional. While not the biggest problem. You get used to friendly then you get someone who is just about moving along. Second, they are running promotions every month and they call you, or send you information or try to talk to you when you are running through to do something. Overall, these aren’t too big a deal, and this is a good branch of Wells Fargo.

name: Ashley Sjodin
review: I had Wells Fargo until I moved. I loved banking with them. I had family and friends that banked with them as well that referred me. I never had any issues and the customer service was great too. I had wells fargo for a couple of years and would recommend them to everyone. If i get the chance to bank with them again, i will. The only thing i did not like about wells fargo who was why i closed my account, was the fee they were going to start charging every month. I though it was a little ridiculous . But if they did cut the fees, i would go back in a heartbeat.

name: Scott Johnson
review: I have been doing my banking with Wells Fargo for over 15 years now. I originally began banking with them when I lived in California. I moved to Illinois approximately 7 years ago and was disappointed to learn that they do not have many branches in this state. However, I liked banking with them so much that I kept them as my primary bank even though I would have to drive to Wisconsin to do any in person banking. The customer service is great and everyone I have ever dealt with at Wells Fargo has been extremely nice and helpful. I cannot think of any complaint I have had over the years with Wells Fargo. The only thing would be the fees I have to pay when going to another bank’s ATM. There are other banks out there that waive the service charge of using another bank's ATMs and also refund any fees charged to your account by the bank that the particular ATM you used belonged to. Other than that, I cannot think of a better bank to do business with. I highly recommend Wells Fargo!!!!

name: Doug Watkins
review: I became a Wells Fargo customer after Wachovia became a Wells Fargo Company. I wasn't looking forward to changing banks, but I have to say that I've been pleasantly surprised. Since then, I've moved across the country and I was pleased to find Wells Fargo branches near my new apartment on the West Coast, even within walking distance.I've run into some snafus with Wells Fargo, but they were all handled with grace and efficiency when I called in. I will say that Wells Fargo has too many fees, but I haven't been able to find a bank yet that doesn't.Easily Wells Fargo's best asset is its customer service team. I always feel taken care of – like I can rely on the voice on the other end of the phone, or the representative across the desk

name: Doug Watkins
review: I've had this card since college and I've never had any serious issues with the card or Wells Fargo.  In fact, just last year they increased the credit limit, which was very useful at the time.  I really love online banking with Wells Fargo, as they make things pretty easy and I always feel "in control" of my finances, bills, and payments.  Wells Fargo also provides a lot of tools to help you manage your account and your finances - although to be honest, I could do with more practice with those.  At the end of the day, I can say that this is the only Credit Card I've ever owned, but I've never had any complaints with it and I've used it for years.

name: Jennifer Bussiere Leighton
review: Wells Fargo might be one of the larger banks out there, but as far as banking institutions go, they are really a cut above the rest. We’ve found their customer service to be really personal. Even the times when we’ve had to wait for service we’ve been greeted with a friendly and attentive employee. Their disclosures and fees are very straightforward and well laid out. No surprises there in the fine print like with some other banks. And throughout the time we’ve worked with them, there haven’t been any unexpected increases in fees or terms or any other charges that seem to be sending folks away from larger banks and back to smaller banks. All in all, I’d easily recommend Wells Fargo without any hesitation.

name: Kira DeFehr
review: I banked with Wells Fargo for several years. They are very courteous and prompt with their customer service. I did, however have a serious issue, and I found that I was not alone. I checked my account one morning only to find that my checking account was in the red. I was overdrafted by about $180.00. I had been transferring cash from my checking to my PayPal account, but had made sure I was within my budget. I was very confused. I reviewed my online statements, and found that in one night I had been charged 9 $10.00 fees with no notification. There were no details regarding the cause of the fees. I called the customer service number and they informed me that there is an online transfer limit. I was never informed of this, and could not find anything in my paperwork. I asked why all of the fees had shown up simultaneously, and the woman informed me that they hadn't. They were clearly charged all in one night, as reflected in my statements. She said there was nothing I could do other than pay. I did some research online and found out that many other people had suffered the same issue. Strangely enough, all of them were between the ages of 18-21, and all were college students. I felt as though we were being taken advantage of, so I dug further. I found that FDIC law states that an account holder cannot be charged over 7 times without notification. I presented this information to their customer service department, and they said they would get back to me. Nobody every reached me, and every time I called they told me they would call back. The issue was never resolved. They simply closed my account and ceased correspondence. I would be careful banking with Wells Fargo.

name: Justin
review: I've had a few accounts with Wells Fargo for the past six months. I haven't had very many problems, but when I do, I really like that I can walk into any branch and get them taken care of. I used Bank of America in the past and compared to their terrible customer service, Wells Fargo is amazing.They're friendly and honest like a credit union but they have cool features like depositing checks from your phone, ATM deposits without envelopes (and which clear instantly a lot of the time), online budget management software, and a free notary at every branch.I also like that they have a lot of stuff in one place. They offer car and renter's insurance, and many other services. Just don't buy any money orders here – they charge $5 compared to most places charging 75 cents.

name: Brian
review: Pros – Great people work here, who really do go the extra mile. Seriously. Also, it's relatively politics-free, which is unusual for such a highly-regulated business. Because the business is all about whether you make your numbers or don't make your numbers, there isn't room for pushing responsibility for missed deadlines or incomplete projects off onto another person or team.Cons – Salaries are well below industry average, especially on the non-sales side. Benefit plans are not great.Advice to Senior Management – Seriously look at investing into your current non-sales workforce, with increased salaries and bonuses. Sales teams are making more and more, through incentives and increased comp. Non-sales professionals are still being told there isn't any funding for higher salaries, even though we are making record profits.

name: Randall G
review: I needed to start up a new bank account after having been unable to make some wrongful payments with my last one. Wells Fargo gave me a second chance account. For this account I would need to have $25 in my savings that would then go to my checking on a certain date. They never informed me of this, so I was charged $3 after the first time this happened. I contacted customer service about trying to stop this monthly transfer, and they told me that they could not stop it as it’s part of the agreement for signing up with them. So the solution is to just have $25 in your savings and let it flip flop back and forth between it and checking. Wells Fargo is a pretty nice company, and outside of this $25 thing I had never had any problems with them.

name: Ken Barbs
review: I've been banking with Wells Fargo for about 6 years now. I have been using Wells Fargo since my second year of college. I took out two small student loans to help pay for my tuition, after I received some good reviews from friends. After I finished college I noticed that the interest rates were a little higher than I thought they were going to be. I went to the bank to figure out why, and I guess there were some hidden fees in my loans that I was not aware of before. They were small fees, and the interest rates were just a little higher so I was able to get the problem resolved quickly through their great customer service.

name: Matt
review: Wells Fargo has been a great bank for me. When I moved to a new location Wells Fargo (then Wachovia) was the only bank within driving distance. I was reluctant to change my bank, but I did and I still enjoy Wells Fargo to this day. The staff has been courteous and has always helped me when I have a question or want to change things with my account. Although it is a large corporation they still take the time to know me by name and say hello whenever I enter the location. I have been to other locations and they have been just as helpful. As a person who grew up in a small town it is encouraging that my local bank treats me like I was still living in a small town instead of a city.

name: Tiffany Zappulla
review: The interest rate is a bit high on this card but as I always pay it off on time, I've never had to worry about it. The points system is excellent because you can get cash or credit back onto your account, so it's basically like getting free money every time yo use it. If you are good with your finances, you can just use it to charge everything and get serious points. The best thing is the Rewards Mall. Before making ANY online purchase, go through the Rewards Mall (virtually every online company is there, except Amazon) and you will get even more points.

name: Tiffany Zappulla
review: Wells Fargo is comparable to the other giants out there. I originally switched to WF from a local bank so that I'd have greater flexibility with my funds when I lived overseas (for example, not having to call up my bank every time I wanted to make a purchase over $1k, like an emergency flight), and it worked for that. I was able to manage everything through online banking, and their Money Map tool is brilliant for budgeting.However, twice so far they have hammered me with unwarranted fees, claiming they were a glitch when I contacted them about it. It took them a day to sneak in the fees, yet it took more than a week for the fees to be undone. The folks at my local bank were helpful, but the nimrods at the HQ must have had no idea what they were doing. My accounts work for me now because I am employed full-time. But should you ever end up in tough spot where you are not making Wells Fargo's definition of minimum deposits, it would behoove you to switch banks so you don't get slammed with fees.

name: Bob Dean
review: This is one of my favorite banks because of the customer service. Wells Fargo was the first bank that I ever had. They made me feel right at home, and they took time to explain my checking account. The fees are minimal, and I didn't have any problems with the application process. The entire process took about 20 minutes to complete, and I was out the door. I was afraid of overdrawing my account, so I asked them if I can have overdraft protection. They obliged without hesitation, and I was so relieved. I've been banking with Wells Fargo for a couple of years now, and it's been a wonderful experience.

name: James Carter
review: I've had my auto loan with Wells Fargo for the past 2 years. It was a three year loan so I'll soon have it paid off. For the most part the employees there were very helpful in getting me through the sometimes confusing process of getting a loan. Greg, a manager at my branch, was especially helpful and very understanding. Even when I was once late on a payment because of my own oversight, they worked with me. I was a little reluctant having my loan through a large bank. But, it turns out that my concerns were totally unfounded.

name: Brian Tek
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for a few years now and with all the issues people seem to be having with the big banks all over the country, I guess I was just lucky choosing WF. Our checking account has always been pretty much perfect. Both our paychecks go into the account and we've never had any trouble with late payments or money going missing. The account has no fees beyond the standard ones you'd expect either. We've never had the need to apply for a loan from them so I don't know how good they are there but we also have a savings account which is in good health and gets a pretty decent interest rate.

name: Loreen Mako
review: I applied for this card and had an automatic approval while visiting a Wells Fargo branch about a month after I had opened up a checking account there. I was a college student, but my husband and I needed to start building credit, and this was the perfect starting opportunity. It's been a great, reliable card that is accepted everywhere, even on international trips. The international transaction fees are a downside, but that is rather difficult to avoid. The card is easily manageable online, and you can transfer money from another WF account to pay your credit card bill. It's really well laid out. The two big downsides to this card are a high APR despite having much improved credit and no late payments in 7 years, and a lack of a rewards system (at least one that is worthwhile when given the cost of the one they offer). Overall, it's a decent card though and a great place to start!

name: Stacy Spradley
review: I just got my Wells Fargo card a few months ago right around Christmas Time. I got The Wells Fargo Card  because for the first six months there is no APR. I also earn rewards for groceries that add up very quickly. I like that I can access my checking savings and credit card account all in one place. Plus this is a Visa card that is accepted just about everywhere you go. I read all the fine print and it seems late fees can add up, so be sure and pay the account on time to avoid the late fees.

name: kynzi klingbeil
review: I have been with a bunch of different banks, but this one has by far been the best experience. It used to be free but now they charge me $5 a month for my checking, which is the only thing I don't like, but it's not that bad. The online banking is easy to setup and use. I like that I can make deposits at the ATM and they hit my account pretty quickly, especially cash. It used to take awhile but now it's really fast. All my direct deposits get processed really fast and it is nice to have the money available right away.

name: E Engel
review: Wells Fargo has its positives and its negatives. One thing that I really like about them is that they are everywhere, no matter where you look you will find one. They also have very friendly staff that are normally willing to do all that is in their power to help you. One thing that I do not like about Wells Fargo is that you are just a number to them. Have a bad day and overdraw your account twice, you are sure to get 2 thirty five dollar charges on your account for those overdraft fees. I guess that is how all banks are. They will try to help you out, though, whenever they can and I appreciate that. I have been a customer for 10+ years and will continue being their customer!

name: John Jameson
review: Lately I have been posting quite a few reviews on Wallet Hub because I am currently seeking out the best possible financial institution to secure a loan with. So far I’ve only been met with unprofessional customer service and ridiculous interest rates simply because of my age. I have a great credit score and a steady income; however, I am still not able to secure a loan for a business venture. The last bank I visited was Wells Fargo and I am pleased to say that the employees there are truly the nicest bank employees I have met yet. They didn’t keep me waiting for longer than 10 min and the loan officer patiently listened to my proposal. So far Wells Fargo is the only bank to grant me a loan at a reasonable interest rate.

name: Kelsey
review: I have a Wells Fargo retirement savings account. It's not bad, but I have a few minor complaints. The interest isn't the best so I don't really make a whole lot off interest. Also, when I called to ask questions, the banker didn't seem very helpful. I have only called once, so this may be one specific banker and not the entire company. Other than that, I think Wells Fargo does a fine job with my account. I get monthly statements showing my interest and how much is in my account which is quite nice. I would for sure do more banking with them in the future, as I feel my money is secure with them.

name: Raymond
review: I have been a long time customer of Chase and I was sorely disappointed by their recent policy changes to their “free” checking accounts. It turns out that they are not free anymore. It was time for me to change and Wells Fargo was the right choice for me. When I stopped in, there was no wait and they were very courteous to me. They even made me coffee! I was so happy that they had a free checking account that met my needs. They were very upfront with the requirements for the account so there were no surprises. They thanked me for my business and were generally happy to have me as a customer. You can’t find that kind of service anywhere else.

name: Sebastian
review: Wells Fargo is my favorite bank in America. I've had the same account there since I was 13 years old. They really act like they care and that they know who I am. They seem to have branches everywhere I go, including my local supermarket. If I ask them for a favor, like cancelling a fee for overseas use that seems too high, sometimes they'll actually do it. It pays to ask nicely. They will usually cash any check I ask them to, even if the amount of the check is greater than my balance. They really are very good at taking care of their customers.

name: Matt
review: I've had an account with Wells Fargo since I began studying at the University of Florida in 2010, and have zero regrets about starting the account. It's conveniently the official bank of my college so ATMs and local branches are available. I also have a credit card with Wells Fargo, and it has been incident-free. I had one payment dispute which was resolved quickly and fairly. I don’t have many bad things to say about my banking experience with them, as even their tellers learned my name after a few visits (in a school with 50,000+ students, that's impressive). Undoubtedly better than my previous banking choices.

name: Matt Reed
review: Upon entering college I started an account with UF’s official bank, Wells Fargo, and since the beginning, it's been great for me.  Between paychecks it gives me enough credit to keep everything afloat, and I've never had any technical difficulties using it.  I had one charge that was disputed and was refunded fully.  Additionally, it’s Visa, so it’s accepted virtually anywhere that I’ve used it, including abroad (went to Peru on a Heal the World Trip).  Wells Fargo has worked perfectly for myself as my personal and only credit card, thankfully so.  I would highly recommend this card to those students currently using Wells Fargo banking services.

name: Ross
review: I have been banking through Wells Fargo for over 10 years now. I have to say that while I have not always been 100% pleased with their service, they have been consistently good. Not great, but good. They have a good website that makes online banking somewhat easy. My biggest dislike comes in their cash back redemption process. It is hard to find any information on how to redeem, and in the end you have to call in to redeem, unlike most others where you can do this online. Their checking accounts are a good service, and I can always find a branch or ATM if needed.

name: Lauren Edwards
review: I have used Wells Fargo in the past, and I thought I got average service. No one went out of their way to help me, but I would not say that the service was bad. The location was close to my home and easy to get to whenever I needed to go to the bank. The tellers were personal and attentive. Some banks have a children's area, but this bank did not have any such place. The bank was clean. Bathrooms can only be used if you get a key from one of the tellers, which can be difficult for parents with children.

name: Robin
review: I opened a savings account with Wells Fargo because there is always a need for a brick and mortar bank close to home. There are times when I need to use the ATM, cash a check or need a notary, so this bank has been very useful for me. When I enter the branch, the staff is more than friendly, almost too much so. They always try to sell me something like a checking account, health savings account, or an individual retirement account. I would never open a checking account there because it is very expensive. One way to avoid fees on their checking account is to keep a large balance around $1500.00 or more.

name: Andrew Grubbs
review: I have had accounts with Wells Fargo in the past. Overall, I have been mostly satisfied with my experiences with them. I don’t currently bank with them as I had to switch banks due to relocating. Previously I had a checking and savings account with them. In addition, they helped me out with a student loan. Their customer service is great and they are always very friendly. They also have great financing opportunities. The only complaint I have is that I had a few unexpected/hidden fees. However, these weren’t a major issue. I would consider going back to them in the future.

name: Cristian Garcia
review: Wells Fargo has been around for a very long time and I can see why. Their services and ability to assist are outstanding. I've been with them for less than a year and I already know for sure that I'm with them for the long haul. They're 100% reliable and take care of all or your problems whether its overdrafts or even lost credit cards. Now as a college student I took out some loans for school and the application was easy and hassle free. My advisor said he would take care of most of the paper work so I feel secure.

name: kanisha
review: I have had Wells Fargo for about 2 years now. Overall I have been impressed with its performance with my checking account etc. Mainly, there was an issue with late posting of purchases. It would show like the money was already gone but sometimes it wouldn't or would be in there. Customer service always helped me find some reasonable answer to why the posted amounts were late. Once I had an overdraft and didn't understand why there was a complementary fee reversal for me. One time I overdrafted for a penny, ridiculous to say the least. Wells Fargo is the second bank I have ever had and they offer so many other different services. They have up-to-date ATMs where you can deposit money and checks with no envelope. I plan on keeping Wells Fargo as long as their around because I know that my money is safe and secure.

name: Christina
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for about 8 years. I have two checking and savings accounts, a business account, a credit card and had my car loan with them as well. Overall I would recommend them because I have had a pretty positive experience. Most people will talk negatively about their bank because they got an overdraft fee or because their bank charges for bank accounts... Well, it's not the bank’s fault you overdrew your account! Most banks charge for accounts as well but will have some way to avoid the fee (like auto transfer from your savings). In the end though, you must realize that every bank is a business. So, as a business, their goal is to make money to pay their employees (yes people at the bank do NOT work for free). They have to make money somehow!

name: Chad
review: I recently got a car loan through Wells Fargo, and the process was for the most part painless and simple. The customer service was excellent, as they handled all of my questions and concerns immediately. The entire process was very quick, and I really appreciated that. Most of the other banks that I tried to get a loan through weren't too excited to give me only a 2 year loan, but Wells Fargo made the process very easy. My only complaint would be that my interest rate is a tad higher than what I expected, especially since my credit is so good. But considering it is only a 2 year loan, the interest won't be too bad. I appreciate the way Wells Fargo handled the process and how their staff has treated me during this time.

name: Rachel
review: I am a customer of Wells Fargo for about ten years now. I use them for multiple checking and savings accounts, and credit cards. They are ok; I have never had any serious issues with them. However, there have been issues that have come up that did not make me particularly ecstatic. For example, I wrote a check to the local court for a speeding ticket, and I wrote an amount for more than the bail amount. Someone at the court changed the amount without informing me, so when I noticed something strange in my banking activity, I went to my local branch. The manager printed a copy and confirmed that someone wrote on my check a different amount than what I had signed for. She told me there was nothing they could do, and even said to me that I shouldn't even bother calling because “it's not like they wrote in more than you signed for.” I guess I felt it wasn't handled professionally, and that my bank should be more on top of things like this. It did make me feel a bit uneasy.I can also say that the customer service has declined over the last few years. I felt like everyone at the branches used to be friendly and helpful, but lately at almost every visit I end up with someone who barely speaks English and who is somewhat condescending. I hope this changes soon!

name: carron cook
review: At the end of December, I started to apply for bank accounts. Before, I had a hard time because of my past banking history. Well this time around Wells Fargo gave me a chance to make my finances right and open a checking and savings account for me. It was easy and I only had to put 20 dollars to start. Now there will be no more check cashing stores for me. I'm saving money with Wells Fargo every week. They take one dollar from my checking account and put in my savings account. It’s called the way2save program and it works automatically to help you save without trying.

name: Amanda Campbell
review: I banked with Wells Fargo briefly while I was in college. Initially I thought they were a great choice because they gave a great incentive to get started with them. I was a college student so any incentive would have been fantastic. After I was with them I found out there were some hidden fees and charges with my checking account which did not make me very happy. They were not always very polite and I felt like I ended up paying more money than I ever kept in the bank there. I just feel like it may not have been a good option as a college student.

name: Mike
review: I just got a loan for a used truck at the end of last year. So far, it was been a good experience with Wells Fargo. I bought the truck and did the financing through the dealership. It came back that I got the loan through Wells Fargo. I was very happy to get the loan, because most of the banks I talked to wouldn't give me a loan longer than 3 years, because the truck had just over 100k miles. About 2 weeks after I bought the truck, I got a call from them asking me to confirm that I bought the truck and all my info. I figured it was just a call to confirm everything, but then they started explaining all the ways I can pay for the loan every month. I was able to pay online, over the phone, or with a check through the mail. It's nice to have so many different options. The lady was very nice and was very helpful about explaining everything. She was able to answer all the questions I had with no problem. So far Wells Fargo has been great!

name: Sarah Galvin
review: I have had a Wells Fargo Student Checking and Student Savings for years now, and I haven't really loved them. Every time I go in the branch they all try to sell me things... I know it’s part of their job but it’s really annoying when they're offering me credit cards and loans that I wouldn't even be approved for anyway.
