Even when I call them they try to sell me on more services. Other than that though, they're ok. Banker’s checks are like 10 dollars or something ridiculous. Usually though, when I have a problem, they are very kind and try and help me fix it. They do focus on their customer service.

name: Jennifer Edwards
review: I use the Wells Fargo Home Rebate Card to earn rewards toward the principal on my Wells Fargo Home Mortgage.  1% doesn't sound like a lot, but we pay for a lot of our monthly expenses on the credit card and pay it off each month, so we accumulate a rebate pretty quickly.  And since we pay it off each month, it's not costing us anything, so it's just free money.  But, we have to be diligent to not get in over our heads so that we don't end up paying interest.  I've had a couple of occasions to call customer service and they've always been really helpful.  I don't have any complaints about the card or it's benefits and it works well for me.

name: sam
review: I originally switched from US Bank to Wells Fargo last year. I am very happy with my decision. Wells Fargo has treated me much better than any other bank has. It's as if they are my close friends or even a family member. The customer service is amazing; they answer all of my questions and more. My checking account has never been fuller, and my savings has also increased a lot. My family loves it too. They are also happy to have switched banks. Not to mention how much many I have saved since then. I would never change a thing about this bank.

name: Vanessa Hamann
review: I opened a Wells Fargo account when I was just a teenager. It was the only bank within walking distance from our house. They were very friendly and made me feel like a valued consumer. At the time they had a “Christmas Club” that I joined so I could save money throughout the year and have money in December to shop with. I thought it was the best idea yet for saving. I got a coupon book and went every pay day to make a deposit into my savings account. Now, many years later I still use Wells Fargo. I have moved to Southern California but there is one about a mile away. They are easy to get to and offer great service. Any problems that arise are always taken care of in a timely manner. As far as I can see I will always have a Wells Fargo Checking account.

name: Nathan Denney
review: Wells Fargo is a great bank. Their customer service is really outstanding. I have been banking with all of the branches on the Monterey peninsula for over four years now. Most of my business has been with the Carmel-By-The-Sea branch. They have a friendly staff and really see things through. They call back the next day to see what you thought of their service and how they can improve. I have also visited the Pebble Beach branch. The manager there is very helpful and knowledgeable. Most banks these days seem to brush off clients that they feel are "annoying" or are going to take a lot of time. Wells Fargo never does that. They seem genuinely interested in hearing you out and making sure that your problem is resolved. Their online banking is also very easy to use and user friendly. I would recommend Wells Fargo to any of my friends.

name: J
review: Getting financing for a new car can be quite a daunting task. You're dealing with so many things at one time already, you're not sure if you're getting the best rate, or even the best level of customer care. Wells Fargo loans came through for me when I definitely needed a load off my mind. They approved me right away at a very fair percentage, appropriate to the credit rating I had at the time. Their customer service staff was nothing but helpful when I called them for questions that I had, although there were times where I had to wait exceedingly long on hold. I only had small issues with Wells Fargo loans during my time with them, most of them being related to getting repeated paper bills despite being signed up for having them delivered electronically. I would recommend Wells Fargo as a great bank, a great lender, and a valuable asset to have financially

name: Mary Boles Herbert
review: I have been banking with my local Wells Fargo since it was another bank and was bought out by Wells Fargo. So far I am pleased with the customer service, and it is even better than the one offered by my prior bank. In addition to a checking account, I also have a home loan and student loan with Wells Fargo. I have had no problems with any of the above. I like that I get paperless statements online when my bills are due. The one thing I would like to see is more ATMS and a drive-up ATM at my local branch. Otherwise I have no complaints!

name: Sheli Carr
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer since they merged with Wachovia a few years ago. My experience has been excellent thus far. Their customer service is far superior to any bank I have done business with in the past. Whenever I have had a problem, they are very quick to rectify the situation. For example, I had ordered a custom debit card a few months back. For some reason, the new card was returned to sender by my apartment complex (I had just moved in). For security reasons, Wells Fargo canceled my debit card to be sure there was no fraud at play and contacted me so I could go to the branch and get a temporary card right away. Branch locations for Wells Fargo are very convenient and accessible. I would highly recommend this bank.

name: James Alexander
review: I became a Wells Fargo customer in January of 2012. I am 25 years old just getting my mind straight on savings and checking. I saw an ad on television about Wells Fargo offering a lot of online banking options so I stopped in and checked it out. Let me tell you, if you’re like me and you hate waiting in bank lines all day this is for you. You can deposit cash right into the ATM machine outside the bank. Plus, make transfers right from your personal computer. Also, if your card happens to get lost or stolen, they will take care of that right over the phone free of charge. They also have what they call “Way2Save”, which takes $1 from your checking and puts it in a savings account every time you use your debit card. Great way to save. I recommend this bank to everyone!

name: Nicolette Kullman
review: I have been with Wells Fargo since 2006. My entire family is with them as well. I've never had any issues with them and nor has my family. I have all my checking, savings and credit card accounts with them. I love the mobile options they have, where you can text them asking for your accounts’ balance and get a reply in a few seconds. It's very helpful and helps me stay up to date on my balance. The only complaint I have is when I call their customer service line and speak with a live customer service representative they are helpful but they speak like robots. They have a lot of scripting, which I find impersonal. Other than that, they are great. I recommend banking with them.

name: josh smith
review: Wells Fargo has been a good bank to me and they have sold me every financial product that exists. I got my first savings account with them when I was 10 and haven't left them yet. Now they have my brokerage accounts, checking and credit cards. They have great service and really try to help you out if you need something. They seem to truly care about you and what you need. Also, their online banking is fantastic and with the addition of mobile deposit they have made it to where you almost never need to go into a banking center.

name: Ron
review: I just opened a Merchant Services bank account with Wells Fargo and I was very impressed with their personal service. I'm opening an online business for the first time and they walked me through the gateway and merchant service aspects. They gave me direct line numbers and their names to call if I needed additional help, not just a call center. It’s also costing me 2% per transaction less than PayPal, Google checkout, Amazon payment, etc. It's very nice that there's a branch within a mile of home in two directions. I also get a checking account, debit ATM card, and a business visa card. I also have the ability to transfer funds in or out to any other institution. If you're a small business person don't be fooled by these online services into paying twice what you have to.

name: Edward
review: My experiences with my branch of Wells Fargo have been wonderful so far. Every time I go in, the tellers are polite and warm towards me. They're very efficient, so I can get in and out quickly if I'm in a rush. When I was looking at my options for student loans, they sat down personally with me and clearly explained how they could help. Their staff knew what they were talking about and listed the best options for me. In the end, I was able to make an informed decision. I would strongly recommend Wells Fargo to anyone searching for a new bank or people who are looking for information on student loans.

name: Bill
review: Wells Fargo is the company that I was checking with. They were very satisfactory to work with! As soon as I walked in the door I felt very welcome. The people I worked with were very satisfying to work with. Everything went very smoothly in the offices, they practically took care of everything for me, all I was trying to do was fix a little issue I was having with a check and it was a very speedy service! I will certainly work with Wells Fargo again. I am unbelievably satisfied by this company and especially with their customer care. They were also very, very clear about anything they were going to have me do or do for me. I am certainly going to take all my credit issues to Wells Fargo from here on out!

name: Timothy Kenniston
review: My experience at Wells Fargo has been quite satisfactory over the years. I opened a checking account there when I was 16 years old after landing my first job at a local supermarket. I had my direct deposit set up with no problems and was able to withdraw cash quickly and easily from their ATM which was conveniently located close to my mother’s house. Probably my best experience with Wells Fargo was when my debit card was stolen and seven hundred dollars was spent at the local mall. I simply called Wells Fargo and explained the situation to them. All they asked I do was show up at the local branch, fill out some paperwork, and then my money was reimbursed back into my bank account with very few questions asked. Overall I would rate their customer service in person as an excellent enjoyable experience.

name: Megan Vincent
review: This was my first ever credit card. I got it when I turned 18, and I have used it all through college. It was good because it is simple to use, easy to check my balance online, and I could link it with my checking/savings account at Wells Fargo and easily transfer payments over. It helped a lot to build my credit up from nothing and establish a good credit history.  I would recommend it for someone starting out with credit. It’s also nice because it’s a VISA card so it’s accepted pretty much anywhere. I was able to use it in China for most places. Overall I recommend it for someone who is just starting out with credit.

name: Megan Vincent
review: This was my first ever credit card. It was good because it is simple to use, easy to check balance online, and I could link it with my checking/savings account at Wells Fargo and easily transfer payments. The rewards are a little confusing on the downside. I'm not sure they are the best deal. on the other hand there is no annual fee and its easy to keep track of my payments. Its also helped me build a good credit score.

name: Megan Vincent
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for over 5 years now. They were the first bank account I opened when I turned 18. Overall my experiences have been positive; however, as when dealing with any large corporate entity there have been frustrating experiences as well. Pros:  Good customer service once I actually get someone on the phone, many locations, many services, easy to use and access, nice online banking service.Cons: Difficult to get a hold of someone when calling the customer service line, occasional advertising when I really don't need it, service charges unless you maintain a certain balance which can be confusing.I recommend Wells Fargo if you need a reliable bank that is going to be very accessible and well known. The only caveat is sometimes you might have to put out some effort to resolve issues because they are so big and their customer service is hard to navigate.

name: Suzanne Lyons
review: I banked with Wells Fargo for nearly ten years. Recently, things have declined so much so rapidly that I closed my accounts. In the beginning, account application, setup and support was easy. Everyone seemed to be interested in providing great customer service and helping with any issues that came up. Then a few years ago came the sales pitches. The company started requiring tellers, account admins and phone support representatives they had to offer other products to each customer. So I’d call to ask a quick question, and would be kept on the phone much longer than my question took, being offered additional products (like home loans and credit cards) I didn’t need. Very frustrating. Then came the week-long holds on bill payments until funds to cover the holds weren’t present in my account due to normal spending. You guessed it - bank fees, loads of them. Naturally, customer service wasn’t very helpful but they were happy to offer me loans! The last straw was the news that my ten year old free checking account wouldn’t be free anymore, despite my having been a customer for that long and maintaining a good-sized savings account and other investments in the bank. I transferred all my money to a credit union, closed my accounts and am thrilled to not have to deal with Wells Fargo anymore!

name: Katie
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for several years and overall I have had a good experience. There is not a shortage of branches near me, so the convenience can't be beat. I also rarely have a problem finding a branch or ATM when I am not near home. Their customer service is good and I have had to take advantage of their 24/7 number on several occasions. My checking account is free, but extra charges are an annoyance. $2.50 to use a non-Wells Fargo ATM is ridiculous to me. Fees aside, I have no plans to stop banking with Wells Fargo. I am pleased with the services they provide and would recommend them to my friends and family.

name: Regina Sheppard
review: Wells Fargo is an average bank in that it doesn’t do anything to make its customers feel special. Customer service is there 24/7 to assist with various needs but fraudulent charges brought forth on accounts require insurmountable time to be rectified. Maybe it’s just me but there also seems to be hidden fees. I say hidden because any changes that occur come with pages and pages of info so one is inclined to miss the point of it all.  I think it’s silly that there is a transfer fee and an overdraft transfer fee. I know for a fact that at several other banks these fees don’t exist. I’m not happy with Wells Fargo and will be switching in the next few weeks.

name: tim lopresti
review: I love the ease of using Wells Fargo. There are branches everywhere, so whenever I need to go to one, it is never far away. The online banking is super simple to figure out, and I love having the mobile app so I can always be on top of my banking. I like how easy they have made doing transactions at the ATM, you just sign your check or just put cash right into the machine, it is a big time saver. Every branch I have been at had helpful and courteous staff. I have been banking with them for about 8 years so far.

name: Goldie Raske
review: This card has always been good for me, as has Wells Fargo in general.  I’ve never had a problem processing payments or getting in touch with customer support.  The one time I was a victim of fraudulent charges, the card support services were the ones to contact me and inform me of what was going on.  They had detected possible fraudulent charges and wanted to verify that I wasn’t the one making the purchases.  After that the resolved the matter quickly and efficiently, cancelling the bad charges and issuing me a new card within a few days.  Card benefits are good, a fairly low interest rate and no annual fees.  Being able to manage the card alongside my other Wells Fargo accounts in Online Banking is a huge plus as well.  All in all a great credit card!

name: Jessica Solaris
review: I am currently with Wells Fargo after they bought Wachovia. I haven't had many problems and things have gone smooth for me. I am fortunate enough that I am able to carry over my free checking account into Wells Fargo. They are pretty fair when it comes to fees and if you call them at times they will give you a break by only charging you half of the fee. I do wish they were a bit more advanced when it came to technology. I also have an account with Chase and love the app where I can take pictures of a check and deposit it via my smartphone.

name: Benjamin
review: I opened my Wells Fargo checking account about 4 months ago, and have been almost completely satisfied. The customer service in my location (Lakeland, FL) was fantastic, and the workers went out of their way to help me with any issues and answer questions that I had. Though I had to wait for my information to be processed to open the account, the wait time was only a couple days. When I returned to fully open an account, the process was simple and customer-friendly. The only real negative I encountered was the bombardment of booklets on the various policies. I think that for a checking account, the information definitely could have been simplified. However, on the whole Wells Fargo is a great company, and I will continue to be a customer there if this continues.

name: Megan Westbrook
review: I really did not like banking with Wells Fargo. I constantly encountered overdraft fees with this bank, and have yet to do so with my current bank. I honestly felt like Wells Fargo held on to debits. For instance, I would pay my phone bill, then I would see it pending in my online bank. A week later I would check to see my balance and if had money in the account to spend. So I would make a purchase, and lo and behold, the cell phone payment would be taken out and then the additional purchase. But it was pending earlier right? So I shouldn't have had available money right? Exactly. I would see it pending, assume it processed after a week, see the money in there thinking that the bill had gone through already and that was extra money to spare. Once I didn't have enough in the account to cover the bill payment, it was put through. I have a credit union now, and the payment is done and processed the next day, so the phone company is not at fault. And of course the customer service helps you with none of the extra charges. What a huge scam.

name: kate
review: I switched to Wells Fargo from Bank of America when I was in high school and I couldn't be happier with the change. I always seemed to have problems with Bank of America for some reason or another and this has never happened in all my years at Wells Fargo. The customer service is great to. I love my local branch because everyone is so friendly and knowledgeable. Recently, I moved to an area that doesn't have Wells Fargo. I decided to open a Chase account in addition to the WF account. I miss being able to use Wells Fargo as my main account and would recommend them to anyone that wants a stress-free bank.

name: Crystal
review: I recently opened an account with Wells Fargo bank. In the grand scheme of things, I'd have to rate them as a good bank. Whenever I call to speak with a CSR, I'm always greeted warmly. They also provide great information and prompt service over the phone. The only problem I have with them is the fact that it often takes an incredible long time when I visit a branch. Doesn't matter if I'm going to a teller, or if I'm looking to speak with a banker. For example, just recently I visited the branch because I needed some forms notarized. It took over an hour just to sit down with a banker. Now to be fair, there were a few people ahead of me, but still, I can't fathom why it took over an hour just to notarize two forms. So yes, despite, the long lines, I'd rate them as a good bank. A great bank would remove the fees associated with a basic checking account. As of right now, I'm satisfied, but I'm still keeping my eyes open for a better bank.

name: Lori McEntire
review: I wouldn't say I'm a fan of Wells Fargo exactly, but I have been doing business with them for quite a few years. I've never had any real problems with them, but I haven't had any great experiences either. The checking account that I've had for quite a while has had its share of standard problems. Overdrafts that shouldn't have happened were quickly remedied. Fines that shouldn't have been taken from my account were put back. There have been quite a few mini issues over the years, but they've always been taken care of. A bad thing for a good thing. I suppose it all evened itself out and that's why I'm still with Wells Fargo after all these years. Not too much to complain about, but not too much to brag about either. They're fairly average I would say.

name: Kristen Gardiner
review: I've been a Wells Fargo customer for over 10 years. I have mostly been satisfied with them, but over the past few years, I feel like the quality of service has declined. It is very frustrating because it seems like there is a fee for everything. You have to dispute everything and it takes a while to get to someone who will actually help you. Their email and phone line services give you the runaround and do not really answer your questions. Last year, I was informed that my free checking account would now have a monthly fee, unless certain stipulations were met, like a minimum balance or qualifying direct deposit. I immediately inquired whether or not my direct deposit would qualify, and I was told that it would not. I asked 3 or 4 times why it did not qualify, seeing as I had worked at a reputable and very large state funded organization for four years, but no one could ever tell me why. It was absolutely ridiculous and I have been frustrated with them ever since. Bill pay is not free. They are quick to charge for everything.

name: Walnut Bee
review: I've been a customer with Wells Fargo for awhile, and I rarely have any complaints or misfortunes dealing with them. They are very swift and efficient when it comes to solving any problem that I may have. When I enter into a Wells Fargo Branch, it has such a “homey” feeling, so I feel that I have become very good friends with some of the bank tellers and office workers. I have an iPhone, and the Wells Fargo App is very very useful when I'm out on the go, and I need to check something, or transfer funds for some reason. Overall Wells Fargo is very great in every aspect, whether it be Customer Service, to just the good “presentableness” of everything else they have to offer. I don't plan on switching to any other company for banking, because Wells Fargo does such a great job to keep me satisfied.

name: Tee Allday
review: I hate this card. I think the bank has it set up wanting you to get late payments. I think this for two reasons. First, Wells Fargo has very limited options for making payments that are inconvenient. You can’t use an ATM to make a payment, so if you want to pay your bill with cash then you have to do it way ahead of your due date to make sure they have time to process the payment.  If you are willing to give the bank monthly fees and open a checking or savings account, then I guess this ATM issue isn’t going to be a problem for you because you can deposit in the bank account and pay the credit card’s bill the same day with your bank account. The second reason I think they have rules set up to make late payments is that there have been times that I tried to make my payment online with them, and they would not let me pay with my outside bank. There is a little drop down box on the payments page, and several times my outside bank has disappeared from the payment sources options.

name: Jason
review: When it was time for me to get my student loans for college I went to Wells Fargo only because my parents already had accounts there. My parents loved them so I decided to give them a try. I've loved them ever since. They made the whole process simple and straightforward. They explained everything me so that I could understand it and it all went smoothly. When I needed an additional loan to cover unexpected expenses related to school I went back and they were able to help me out again. I recommend them too all my friends looking for loans too!

name: Te. Maguire
review: Currently I am a customer of Wells Fargo. I was reluctant to bank with them at first, when they took over Washington Mutual, because I really liked WaMu. I let them convert my account and then didn't use it much. I opened another account, at Suntrust. My daughter opened an account at Wells Fargo as well. Recently we needed to withdraw money from an out of state money managed account, credit card as we needed it to help rent my daughter a house. First we went to Suntrust and they were unable to do it for unknown reasons. We decided to try Wells Fargo, since she has an active account there as well. When we arrived it was almost closing time on a Thursday, so we were worried they'd close before we could see a teller. We managed to be seen before closing and couldn't have had better service. Not only did they make the cash advance on the spot, but they also helped us convert it into 2 money orders to give the property manager. All of this was done for NO CHARGE. Because of their willingness to help us at closing time above and beyond what we expected, my daughter was able to get a lovely rental house, in the nick of time, before someone else rented it. I can't thank Wells Fargo enough for being there for us in a pinch. That's the kind of bank I can do business with and will again!

name: Trey Redding
review: I was a customer of Wachovia before they merged with Wells Fargo. Once the merger occurred, I noticed a steep decline in services, and a sharp increase in fees. My minimal balance to maintain a free checking account was increased, the fee for not maintaining said balance was increased, as well as fees associated with my debit card. When I spoke with the customer service representative about it, their attitude seemed to convey that they could care less whether or not they retained me as a customer. This spoke volumes to me. In addition to that, if I wrote a check to a friend, Wells Fargo charged $5 to cash it, and then has the nerve to ask that person to become a customer of Wells Fargo. This attitude has seeped into every corner of the banking industry and is why I am currently with a Credit Union, and I am very glad I ceased doing business with Wells Fargo.

name: Harry Johnson
review: I've had a Wells Fargo checking account for a little over 4 years now. I've been pleased with some things that they have done, but some things have irritated me a little bit. When I started out, there was no monthly fee for the account so long as I had $1000 in it. No problems there. However, they increased it a few months ago to $1500. Not a big deal, but I got hit with a $15 fee because they did not notify me in time, and I was unable to get the minimum balance in time.My least favorite part has been their service in the banks. Some of the employees are helpful, but many are not. One time I went in to deposit $400 in coins and the teller looked at me like I was crazy. I had it rolled and everything, but they did not seem to understand that people might actually deposit coins. They eventually got everything done, but I had to wait nearly a half hour. The deposit did not show up in the account until a month later. That has led me to consider changing banks, though I have not done it yet.

name: Bradley Rettler
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for 10 years now, and I'm about to transition fully to a credit union. I started banking with Wells Fargo because I anticipated moving around a lot, and I wanted to be able to keep the same bank everywhere I went. But I'm realizing now that it's far more important to keep your money somewhere that cares about you; Wells Fargo has done many things that indicate that they don't. For example, they allow you to overdraft rather than simply declining your transaction, and they deliberately structure their withdrawal attempts (largest first) so that you overdraft as many times as possible; then they charge you $35 per overdraft. If you get overdraft protection, it still costs you $12.50 every time you do it, and they still do the largest first so they can charge you. Such tactics make it clear that they're not grateful to be able to hold on to my money and invest it, which would be a mutually beneficial scenario; they want to take as much more of it as they can. For that reason, I'm leaving.

name: Beneeta Dean-Felton
review: I have been with Wells Fargo officially for about a year. I originally was a Wachovia customer but when the bank merged to Wells Fargo, I became a Wells Fargo customer. I am okay with Wells Fargo for the most part, some of their policies for fees are confusing, such as overdraft fees when my Way2Save Savings account transfers money to my Checking automatically, I get charged a fee for that. But it is my money! I got to customize my own debit card and I always get comments on how cute it is (I chose a Taj Mahal background because that is a place I really want to visit). Customer service is fine and I do not have many problems with the bank. I prefer small town banks but I do like being able to find an ATM anywhere I go.

name: daniel
review: I have the worst credit but still Wells Fargo let me open a checking account the same day I walked in. They are by far the most relaxed bank I’ve dealt with and are more than willing to let a guy have a 2nd chance. It helps too that they have branches all over the city where I live so I never have to go out of my way to get to one if I need to do some face to face transaction. I hardly ever have to go in, however, because their online banking has just about everything that I need covered. This may just be my personal experience but the people who work for Wells Fargo seem to also be much more relaxed and friendly than any other bank I have worked with in the past. I recommend them highly.

name: M M M
review: I just recently switched back to Wells Fargo as I used to bank with them a few years back. The only reason I switched banks in the first place is because I moved across town and they were just too far away for my taste. The thing I love about Wells Fargo is how they treat their customers. When I go into this bank they always make sure they have plenty of teller windows open to meet customer demand and needs. There is nothing worse than going into a bank and seeing a huge line with a long wait. They always have at least 10 tellers active at any time, which is great for when you're in a hurry. The staff here is always nothing but friendly and always ask how your day is. These are the little things that will keep people coming back. I've had to even call them before and the wait on the phone was minimal and they were able to answer my problem and solve it within 5 minutes without any hassle. I highly recommend this bank to anybody looking for a new bank.

name: James
review: As a member of Wells Fargo when it was Wachovia Bank, I was very pleased with my experience. It really seemed that the bank went above and beyond to make sure that the customer was taken care of. I misplaced my debit card several times, and it was always a breeze to access my account without it. The staff was always helpful and courteous, and went lengths to know you on a first name basis. The branches were kept clean and inviting, and whether via drive thru or in-store, I was glad to be a customer. I would bank with Wells Fargo again.

name: Evan
review: Before any other banks opened up, Wells Fargo was always in my small town. Because of this, this was obviously the town bank. When I first came to them, I didn't know much about checkings, loans, savings, etc. The employees at Wells Fargo were all very helpful in creating my first checking account. This account required me to deposit a certain amount of money each month, which was pretty inconvenient at the time since I was jobless. Wells Fargo did give me a small cash bonus for creating a checking account though, which was really nice. I have moved on to using credit unions, but for big banks, Wells Fargo is one of the best ones.

name: Jennifer Ingalls
review: I had been with Wells Fargo for five years up to past year, and I have experience little complications up until these past previous months. In the last months I had my account, I was transferring money from my savings to checking to pay off some bills and my account clearly stated that i was allowed 7 transfers. I never once went over the seven transfers, but I started getting charged daily for transfer fees. When I called the main customer service line, I didn't have my card number on me and gave them my social, they then told me that wasn't acceptable and they could not talk to me (did I mention I was hung up on 2 times and had to call back). As frustrating as that was, I decided to go into a bank and talk to a manager to resolve this issue. When I went into the office, the guy immediately struck an attitude with me once I explained my situation and didn't even bother looking at my account first...he automatically assumed I was wrong. When he finally did look at my account, and saw that everything I said was correct he was making excuses to try and not refund me my money. Bottom line, I cancelled right then and there. I did receive my money back, but I felt very belittled and felt that my time has a GOOD customer meant nothing to them.

name: kim dupre
review: I have a refinanced mortgage with Wells Fargo.  They have been a good bank to deal with but the application process was lengthy and took a long time to be approved.  I have not had any problems with them so far and any paperwork sent to me even about my escrow account made sense and was very informative. I have not been able to access my online banking and would be interested in getting that set up, but have been unable to do if from their website. Their rates for mortgages was very good and I was able to roll the closing costs for the refinance back into the loan so the only thing I paid for out of pocket was the inspection for my house.  I have been pleased with this mortgage so far, much better than the one I had with Chase Bank.

name: Analicia Murray
review: My experience with Well Fargo has been great! They have always been very helpful when I have questions regarding my account and other services. They take the time to treat me as an individual which is very important to me when trusting someone with my money. I constantly tell others about Wells Fargo when they ask about my experience. We are a military family and there are many banks that offer amazing services. We have been with Wells Fargo for 6 years and they have been good to us and we have no reason to switch. They provide great interest on savings account and it was very easy to join. I remember when I first signed up, the lady was very helpful and happy to help us. I believe that the customer service I have experienced has made all the difference in the world when it comes to choosing a bank.

name: Nathan McKnight
review: My experience with my Wells Fargo checking account has been a good one. The application process was a breeze, and in no time I was set up with a free checking account. My direct deposit goes in on a timely manner every two weeks, and accessing my money has never been a hassle. I once had a fraudulent charge on my account, and with one call to their customer service line, they had the issue submitted and it took about a week to resolve the issue. Quick and easy. I would recommend their free checking account to anyone looking for fantastic customer service and ease of service.

name: Mark
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for about 5 years now and I love it. I have been with two other banks and it is by far the best. The customer service is great and everything you could ask for. When I go to a location, I am never in line for more than five minutes, and they are very helpful and quick when it comes to solving any problems I have. After numerous frustrations with other banks, I am so happy that Wells Fargo is able to help me with any needs that I have. It is nice knowing that they will help me in any way that they can.  if you are looking for a bank, I strongly recommend Wells Fargo.

name: wade andersen
review: I have been a customer with Wells Fargo ever since they took over Wachovia. Initially I was satisfied with Wells Fargo because all I needed from them was a working checking account, but I was displeased to find out that they added a fee for old Wachovia accounts that didn't meet a certain cash threshold. I went to my local branch and set up a new checking account, and the associate helping me was very knowledgeable and answered all of my questions accurately. Although this was inconvenient, at least Wells Fargo set me up with a checking account that had an interest rate attached, which although isn't very high, is still better than nothing.

name: John
review: I've been a customer for 5+ years now. I like the availability of ATMs (as in number of them available in a given area). I don't like how little interest they give you, but I suppose that's more a fault of the Federal Reserve setting low interest rates. Their website has a Web 1.5 feel to it but it works. I've never had a problem with them. I thought I should add that I'm not in any way related to Wells Fargo other than as a paying customer (i.e. I don't own stock in them, I don't work for them, I don't have any family members [even distant ones] who work for the company).

name: Frank Thomas
review: I was originally a long term Wachovia customer and was very happy with my banking with them over the years.  When Wells Fargo took Wachovia over, I was a bit cautious in the beginning and took the time to really watch and analyze how things were going with my account, and make sure that nothing was changing that I wouldn't be happy about.  Over the years, I had taken a few small loans from Wells Fargo for small things, and never had any big problems, other than the fact that they like to hassle you, if you are even just a little late with a payment, but overall, had a good past experience with them.  Over time since the take over, I haven't noticed anything that has made me unhappy, or anything that would make me change my bank, which Im very thankful for, as its just such a hassle to change banks.  I was sad that Wachovia was taken over as I have a good long term relationship with them.  But I can say that Im satisfied with the manner that Wells Fargo handled the take over, and will stay a customer with them!

name: Jessie Brown
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for 8 years now. I opened my first bank account with Wells Fargo when I got my first job in high school. I’ve always appreciated the easy and helpful customer service offered. Representatives are always helpful in person, and the red tape involved in opening an account or processing other requests is always extremely minimal or non-existent. Online banking services are also great – the website is secure and easy to use, and you can do almost any transactions online. I also was pleased that Wells Fargo went above and beyond expectations when my debit card number was stolen while travelling, and my account emptied. I hadn’t even noticed there was a problem when Wells Fargo noticed suspicious charges. They investigated the matter and returned all the money that was lost to me quickly and with hardly any paperwork.

name: Dustin Albrecht
review: I have had the Wells Fargo Rewards credit card for four and a half years.  I was a undergraduate when I first obtained the card and I had a fairly low credit limit with the card.  My credit limit has been raised several times over the past 4.5 years.  I have been very happy using this card and Wells Fargo to help build my credit history.  Another aspect of this card that I really appreciate is the rewards feature.  One dollar spent using the card gives you one rewards point.  I use my points to obtain account credit.  It takes 650 rewards points to get a $5 account credit.  It used to only take 500 rewards points to get the $5 credit.  You also have the opportunity to obtain bonus points by using the Earn More Mall that is a part of the rewards program.  I have paid my card off in full each month and cannot comment on late fees.  Customer service has also been very helpful with this card.

name: Kim
review: I was originally a Wachovia customer before Wells Fargo bought them out.  I have mixed feelings about Wells Fargo. Their customer service has been good I must say, and they always are helpful when you call their toll free number for issues such as questionable charges or balance disputes.  I have also had excellent service when I went into the bank for document notarization, which was free, and the drive through experience has been positive and friendly as well. Despite all of this, I do not like the account maintenance fees they charge and the other miscellaneous charges they hit you with that really add up in the long run.    Overall, I guess they are as good as many regular banks in terms of service except unlike with many credit unions, you have too many fees.

name: Christian Ripke
review: This Wells Fargo Rewards card was incredible. I received it after talking with some staff members at the bank and expressed great interest in the potential rewards. I always pay on time so I never have to worry about any late fees. It's awesome! I'm a sucker for anything that involves getting reward points, even if it's not that much. I always make great use of obtaining all possible rewards. It's great timing too with the holidays right around the corner. I have never been let down by Wells Fargo. They provide great customer service and I have never been dissatisfied. Excellent rewards card!

name: Brandon Justice
review: I have been with Wachovia for many years. Wells Fargo took over Wachovia and as I didn't like the takeover originally, I have grown to like Wells Fargo. I joined Wachovia for their free checking account for students, and they have always taken care of me. Wachovia or Wells Fargo is known for their great customer service and it definitely shows. They have always been helpful and courteous. I have only done a checking account with them so I can’t verify how they are with their other services, but it doesn't seem hard to qualify. I highly recommend Wells Fargo to anyone who is looking for a good checking account.

name: Mark Bargas
review: When I first needed a banking account around eight years ago, my friend who worked at a different bank convinced me to go sign up at his bank. After a couple months of pulling out my hair with that bank I decided to close that account and go to Wells Fargo. Ever since then I've had only pleasant experiences with Wells Fargo. They have amazing customer service at Wells Fargo, a couple years ago I had my wallet stolen and before I had noticed they had made some fraudulent charges, they very quickly sorted it all out for me. I hope to be with Wells Fargo for a long long time.

name: Alex Showalter
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for over ten years and have had a great experience doing so. In the past I have had some issues involving overdraft fees, and excess activity fees on my savings and checking accounts. My local Wells Fargo branch was able to help me with getting the fees reversed, and was very apologetic when they realized how long I had been a customer. Overall Wells Fargo does not have the highest interest rates on their savings accounts, but they make your money easy to manage and access at any time. Their friendly knowledgeable staff in the branches, and their easy to use online services really makes it a bank that is simple to use, yet very effective. I would recommend anyone looking to open a bank account to consider Wells Fargo.

name: Daniel Salley
review: Wells Fargo is my primary local bank they are so many of them that its not hard to ever find them and i got one right down the street from my house. I have a checking account with them and a mortgage through them. The  checking account would have fees but since i have a mortgage with them they are waived which is really nice. They are a nice bank to have because you can do everything from the computer and you barely ever have to go  to the bank i use direct despot for my checks and i can transfer money through their website. Its a nice bank that has friendly people at it.

name: andrea
review: I've banked with Wells Fargo for 5 years. I signed up as a student because they were offering free accounts. The in-bank sign up was quick and took about an hour. When I opened an additional account online it took minutes. While I was a student the banking experience was good. In fact, I recommended the bank to others. I liked that they had fast billpay and deposits. My transfers are usually in my account in 1-2 days. If I called them there was not a long wait time. My idea of the bank has changed somewhat as I begin to use more of the services they offer. I begin to see some of their weaknesses.  The customer service is not awful, but once a representative on the phone made a joke about my age which I thought was poor taste and made me very uncomfortable. He was trying to sell me an additional service that I did want, but I ended up turning it down because I did not want such a person to possibly receive a commission from signing me up after he offended me. This was a one-time thing, and all the other representatives were respectful. However, sometimes I’d receive messages in my account that differed from what the representatives told me. These inconsistencies were sometimes frustrating. I would not recommend Wells Fargo to a friend unless they were in need of basic checking account services.

name: mike kaduce
review: I have both a checking and a savings account with Wells Fargo. I opened this when I was a student, and there are no fees to transfer money back and forth between accounts, nor any other fees that are imposed on me (save for overdraft fees, of course). I have my savings account linked to my checking account for purposes of overdraft protection. The day to day operations of my account is flawless - online and mobile banking via their app work great, and I love it. The only annoyances I have are the fact that they weren't really willing to work with me when I wanted to refinance my home - I ended up going with a mortgage through a whole other bank altogether. Also, their clerks when you go into a branch can be a little weird. Their customer service is friendly no doubt, but also arguably kind of nosy. They ask what I'm doing today, and things like that. It's just kind of a weird cultural element to this bank, but nothing that should make a decision for you.

name: jason buonomo
review: I opened a home mortgage account with Wells Fargo in 2005.  Things were fine until I was given military PCS orders in 2008 and I was forced to sell my home.  After the bottom dropped out fo the housing market, we were unable to sell our home, so i began having to work with their "liquidations" department.  Let me tell you, these people are an absolute nightmare!  Over the past 3 years (yes, this problem is still lingering!), i have gotten wrong information, wrong phone numbers, lost paperwork, wrong fax numbers, hung up on multiple times...I can go on and on.  And to date, my home is still not foreclosed on!!! I have asked, requested, even begged for them to complete the process for a deed-in-lieu, yet they still keep losing the paperwork, asking for more paperwork, giving me the wrong numbers.  UGH!!  Never again!

name: Mike de Water
review: My very brief affair with Wells Fargo lasted only a couple weeks, and left a bad taste in my mouth. Setting up the account was no problem, although they sprung a minimum deposit on me late in the process. Whatever, I can handle that. Well, I deposited my first paycheck on a Tuesday after work. I wrote a check that Friday. Imagine my dismay when my paycheck didn't clear until the NEXT Tuesday, conveniently right after my Friday check had gone through, costing me a overdraft fee. When I went to complain about it, the customer service staff was rude and condescending. I closed my account that day and have never looked back. I'm happy with my local credit union now, and feel sorry for anybody still dealing with Wells Fargo.

name: Monica Collazo
review: My Wells Fargo Rewards Card is the first credit card I qualified for. I didn't apply for it but received my offer for it when making a deposit at the bank one day. My limit is increased by quite a bit each year, which is very nice. The late fees can be high, so I always make sure to pay on time. Earning the reward points is a great feature, and I have yet to take advantage of that feature. I am tracking how many points I have and waiting until I find something I think sounds good.  I really like that I can pay online using my linked accounts, which keeps me from paying late and saves me the cost of a stamp and envelope.

name: Kevin
review: I have been using Wells Fargo since I have entered into college and I have never had any problems with it and have found it to be easy and convenient to use. They have a really good online banking system that closely tracks your spending and makes it easy to keep up with your purchases. They also allowed me to link my university ID easily with their system so I could use that for purchases as well. When I opened up a new account with them, they were incredibly friendly with me and made things easy to understand as they knew it was my first card. I have found this to be a great bank to get started with and recommend to anyone who is looking for a good one to get started with as well as just in general.

name: Charlie
review: My experience with Wells Fargo has been quite labored, but it was not their fault. I am the primary on an account for a relative who is currently living in a group home. My relative is mentally disabled and receives assistance from the state. Twice his identity has been compromised now. The first time is still unsolved, but the second time was as a result of a terrible care taker at his group home. At the time of the incidents, I was very upset and frustrated. The employees at Wells Fargo were more than helpful. They went very much out of their way to help me put this nightmare to an end. I am very thankful to the employees at Wells Fargo.

name: Ian Macfarland
review: Wells fargo is by far the best bank for customer service and problem resolving. They are straightforward, reasonable, and fair but they charge a monthly fee. In my opinion a monthly fee is a deal breaker. Other banks do not charge a monthly fee or have ways you can wave that fee. Any type of bank makes a lot of money just from you swiping your car or having money in your account, why do they have to charge a monthly fee? I don't have to pay a monthly fee to keep my money in a mattress so I should have to pay a monthly fee to store money at a bank. I suppose you could say that is unfair because they do you the service of letting you use a debit/credit card but as I mentioned they actually make money off you just having one from VISA, Mastercard, etc.

name: Dan
review: I've been with Wells Fargo bank for about 2 years since they took over Wachovia. At first, I was skeptical about what this transition would mean for me. However, I am happy to report that I have no complaints about doing business now with Wells Fargo. The biggest "success story" I can say about this company is this: when I go (in the near future) to purchase my first house, they are going to help me cover a lot of the closing costs! How many big banks would do that in today's times? On top of everything else, their customer service at my local branch has also always been outstanding since they came to town. Well done, Wells Fargo, well done!

name: Joe Miele
review: I was a Wachovia customer so technically I did not "choose" to be a Wells Fargo customer. I was really disappointed with the change initially, but have grown to like them. The online banking works smoothly and I use it on a daily basis. Sometimes my transfers will sit in pending for a long time which is kind of bothersome. It is usually my Friday-Monday deposits that just drag out and do not clear till Tuesday. Realistically, these transactions are electronic and there is no reason for them to be put on hold over the weekend. I receive constant online payments that are transferred to this account. If I can receive these payments on the weekends, I should be able to have the funds available almost immediately. That is really my biggest issue with Wells Fargo. Other than that, they have been very helpful and have always been available when I need them.

name: Paul Armstrong
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo since they acquired Wachovia.  I have to say that I am rather pleased with the performance that they have given.   There have been several times that there has been a simple banking area, or money did not deposit correctly, however, with a simple phone call to my local branch, I am met with people who are there to work with and for me to resolve any situation that might arise.   If not for Wells Fargo my home would have probably went into foreclosure, but with the help of their well-educated staff, I was able to refinance my home at a lower payment and keep my home.   Wells Fargo has gone far and beyond the call of duty when taking care of my assets and I would highly recommend them above any other banking institution out there.  Thank you Wells Fargo for being there for not only me, but for the entire community.

name: Josh May
review: I've been banking with Wells Fargo for a few years now, and have had very few issues.  The in-bank associates would be my only complaint, as they ALWAYS have something to offer me.  As it is how they make a living, it is pretty understandable.  I've only been charged with two fees, none of which were totally my fault, and both of which were removed and one was even compensated.  Their service is quick and helpful, and the customer assistants are often on your side.  The customizable debit and credit cards are cool too. A great choice for one looking to start an account!

name: Kim Daubon
review: Wells Fargo provided me and my husband with a credit card that helped up rebuild our credit.  We applied $300 to the card and had a limit of that same $300.  We paid an annual fee of $25 each.  My husband and I are so happy to have this card; it has given us some new found freedom.  We can use the card for reserving hotel rooms, use it at anywhere that MasterCard is accepted and the best part, no one know that the card has a deposit on it.  As long as we continue to use this card wisely, we will be able to upgrade to a non-secured card with the year!

name: Chris Allison
review: I took out a loan for my car through Wells Fargo. They offered me the best finance rate out of everyone else so that was nice. Their website is really easy to use and they do have online bill pay. However if your bank account is not with Wells Fargo then they do not allow you to set up automatic recurring payments online, which is kind of a hassle. However it is still a free service. I was also late for one payment but they waived the late fee. Customer service was very friendly and willing to help. I would definitely take out another loan with them, and consider banking with them.

name: Dawn Breidenbach
review: I've had my Wells Fargo Rewards Card for several months.  Initially when I applied for the card, I was unaware it was a rewards card.  After receiving an email from the company, I registered for the rewards.   At that point I had already accumulated enough points for a particular reward I've been looking forward to.  They'll certainly be helpful this Christmas.  Having the choice of online or paper statements is a huge plus, as I spend more time accessing my accounts online (paper statements tend to be cumbersome).  The fact I was given 12 months no interest is also an added plus.  It gives me the chance to pay it off without accumulating interest.  The minimum payment is very reasonable as well.

name: Mercy Raju
review: I have had nothing but positive experiences with my card.  I do my regular banking through Wells Fargo and maintain an auto-loan through them as well.  My contact with customer service is non-existant, being that I've had no real problems.  The one time I have spoken to them was in regard to receiving my card, and it was tracked fairly quickly.  I got my card and purchases were smooth.  My limit was actually higher than originally quoted.  The rewards program seems to be fairly standard and am accruing these rewards slowly, but surely.  I guess I really don't have much negative to say at all.  Usually people focus on customer service issues.  Since I've had no reason to contact them, I've had no reason to complain....

name: Charlyn Fralin
review: I had a hard time getting a credit card because I'd never had one before.  I couldn't even get a Target card!  I just wanted one to begin to establish credit.  I went into my Wells Fargo and they gave me this college card.  At first the limit was super super low, which made it a little difficult because I wanted to put as many of my regular expenses on it as possible to earn the cash back.  I basically wanted to use it like a debit card, just to build a credit history, and this has worked pretty well, especially because it's linked to my other accounts and easy to make payments.  They did regularly increase my limit too, which has helped make me feel better about using the card regularly and still having some credit available in case of emergencies.  Of course, when I did have an emergency and need to make a large charge, it got declined because they thought it was a "security breach."  A quick phone call did take care of that problem though.

name: Wendy Siu
review: Before I went to college, I needed to buy supplies online, and didn't want to use my debit card. So I was offered the Wells Fargo Cash Back College Card. It seemed perfect for my needs. It is a great card to start with, for one to build up credit history. The application process is easy, and my decision was instant. This card gives 1% on every purchase. It isn't a lot. I've only gotten 25 dollars in a year and a half of spending. It also is tied to my Wells Fargo account so it's easy to make payments, and you can also get alerts/emails sent to your phone every time your card is used at a gas station, the internet, or a foreign country. It's a good card to start with if you have no credit history.

name: Emerald Drahota
review: I have had my Wells Fargo Platinum card for six months and have enjoyed every second of it.. The card works at every location I have used it at, and the service has always been prompt. They are very good when it comes to fraud protection when it comes to unusual large purchases. Wells Fargo is also good at letting you know when you are close to getting over your credit limit. I opted in to receive email alerts letting me know when I'm within one hundred dollars of my limit. Overall, it is a very good card that I would recommend.

name: Marissa Hoskinson
review: I use this card as an emergency backup. My mother has her own banking account, and she wanted me to have a card in case something ever happened between either me or her. So, I have only used this in dire emergencies because this card is not connected to my personal account. However, it does get the job done. Didn't have to pay very much for the fee. When I tried to get a new card (because my old one had expired) it did not take very long to receive it in the mail. They were easy to contact and the person on the line was very helpful and didn't take up much of my time. Not only have I enjoyed the services of this card, but so has my mother.

name: Brent Larson
review: I opened a Wells Fargo checking account in the spring of 2012.  After moving from local bank to local bank a couple of times, I decided I needed a national bank that could move with me, so I didn't have to go through the process of switching banks if I moved again.  It was pretty easy to apply for a basic account, which can give you nearly free checking.  You have to meet a few requirements to get the monthly fee waived, just maintain a minimum balance, sign up for a direct deposit, etc.  Luckily for me, these weren't tough to do.  Also, a month or so later when I bought my town home, I used Wells Fargo Home Mortgage, which immediately qualified me for an upgrade to the 'quot;no-fee' higher level checking account.  Their online banking is simple; they have a convenient branch attached to my grocery store of choice, so getting my checking account (and savings) with Wells Fargo has worked out well for me.

name: Brent Larson
review: I closed on my Wells Fargo mortgage in April 2012.  Their rates were about the same as those of any other banks or mortgage companies in the area (Minneapolis, MN).  I had a good, thorough loan officer through Wells Fargo, so it made the process easier.  Some of the literature was confusing and way more than necessary, but I think that's just the nature of closing documents in general.  By having a mortgage through them, I get some upgrades on my Wells Fargo checking account.  Not a good enough reason to choose them on it's own, but a nice little perk if you bank with them anyways, or are planning on opening a checking account with them (as was my case).  Overall, I've been pleased so far.  I set up an automatic payment online for my credit cards and mortgage, super easy to do with Wells Fargo.  No major drawbacks for me so far.

name: Steve Burell
review: I've had my Wells Fargo Visa rewards card for quite awhile now. So far, we have been very happy with the service that we’ve been provided. I really like the online site that they have for viewing all of your activity. We did have a problem when they switched us over to online statements only, but that was more our fault than Wells Fargo. We really like the fact that there is no annual fee and that we get rewards from the card. Being able to get things like kids’ furniture for free simply by using the card is a huge bonus for us. The customer service center has always been staffed with very knowledgeable representatives that are easy to communicate with and are able to solve any issues that may arise.

name: Hayden Kneeskern
review: Though I have only had my Wells Fargo credit card for a few months now, it has been a great experience. I was really happy when I was able to customize the look of my card; it added a nice personal touch! It's extremely reliable and I've had no surprise fees or negative occurrences whatsoever. When I was in the process of getting the card, they were kind and patient with me and it was an overall simple, quick, and painless process. I wish there was some form of rewards program, but that's really the only criticism on my mind that I can think of for it.

name: Tim Culverhouse
review: I got this card as a student in college and have had it for the past 6 years or so.  The application process was incredibly simple, and as a college student I was a shoe-in for approval.  As with all of my Wells Fargo accounts, the website is very easy to use and paying my balance is a breeze.  The card shows up alongside all my other accounts, which is great.  This is my lowest APR card so if I am going to maintain a balance, I will use this card.  It isn’t my main card as it doesn’t offer rewards, however it is still my #2 card to use.

name: Jessica Culver
review: So far I have had my Wells Fargo rewards card for about six years, and have never had a late payment until this last month. I had forgotten to switch my automatic payment and was one day late when I finally noticed and ducked into a Wells Fargo to submit a check. To my dismay the next month's minimum payment had more than doubled. Luckily, after a quick chat with one of the bankers, the called up the credit part of the company and informed me that this was a one-time charge and would return to normal after this, since I had never been late before. So, that was great.About the card in particular, the rewards seem so minimal that I forget about them often. Once in a while if I'm checking my statements online I see the link to the rewards website, those are the only times I ever check it out and redeem points. As some one else said, cash back is quite a small return. I also typically use mine to receive gift cards. However the card has been reliable and every year or two my maximum gets raised.

name: Reynalda Galloway
review: I've applied for this WellsFargo credit card as soon as I opened up my first bank account (just before I went to college, when I was 18.)  I was pleased because I was instantly approved, so I could start building up my credit score.  It's been really convenient because my school has WellsFargo ATMS everywhere, and since it's a VISA card, it's widely accepted everywhere.  I've also received an increase to my credit line, which is very convenient.  I haven't run into any issues because I pay off my credit card's full balance every month.

name: Sheryll Wiechec
review: The only thing that I'm pretty disappointed in is the fact that there's a Cash Back Program.  I didn't get as much CashBack as I thought I would have, even though I've been using it for a few years..

name: Dan Isbell
review: I've had my Wells Fargo credit card since college.  It's been my primary credit card ever since for a few reasons.  First, I've regularly received increases to my credit line.  I think I started around $600 and now it's over $8,000, which is not bad for a graduate student.  Second, it's really easy to pay off.  I also have checking and savings with Wells Fargo, so it's really easy to use their online banking to pay your balance.  Third, I actually get some cashback rewards- whenever I hit a certain amount, Wells Fargo deposits $25 in my debit account.  Finally, I've never had an issue with the card, and I've spent significant time overseas.  They're also on top of potential fraud; I get prompt notices whenever I make a large purchase from overseas.  The only downside is that lower rates would be nice, but I never run much of a balance on the card.

name: Dorinda Norquist
review: I applied for this Wells Fargo card during one of my visits to my local branch back when I was 18 years old. It seemed every time I stepped foot in a branch they were asking me to open one, so eventually I caved and opened this card. The application and approval process was simple enough. The card worked well to build my credit. I had a low limit and just paid off the balance each month. The online access was simple and the payment from my checking account was even easier. However, I don't use the card at all anymore. Compared to the other cards I have this one still has a maxed out APR (24%) even though I've never been late on a payment. Also, there are NO rewards! Seriously? Every worthwhile card today has a rewards system. Without a way to get cash back, there is no reason for me to keep using the card. Even with those flaws I still feel it is a good card and easy to use. I highly recommend it for anyone just starting out.

name: Chris
review: Wells Fargo was my first experience with banking. I remember walking in to one of their local branches here in Arizona when I was 18 and feeling like I was finally going to be an adult. I had all of the hopes and aspirations a young person has and now I was really going to be somebody! I was going to have a checking account! The application was pretty straight forwards. I met with a banker and they asked for my information and I had an account within minutes. No problems, no struggles, it was simple. Unfortunately, that was about the only simple thing that came from this experience. Wells Fargo crushed those teenage dreams and aspirations quickly with their seemingly hidden fees and cash grabs. At this time, I was still learning how to budget and their (then) $25 NSF fees would seem to hit my account harder as they would clear the largest items first on my account while charging the smaller ones later, no matter what order I charged them. At the time I was making $6.25 an hour and couldn't afford the fees much longer. Within 6 months I had already paid at least $125 in NSF fees and decided it was enough before switching to Chase bank. Walking in to a branch made me feel as if I was nothing more than a bag of flesh with a big dollar sign on my forehead to the tellers and the service would decrease once they saw I was not signing up for another credit card or a loan. Unfortunately Wells Fargo didn't work for me at that time in my life and would recommend a more simple, smaller financial institution (credit union!) for anyone just starting out.

name: Randall Tubbs
review: I applied for my Wells Fargo Credit card when I was in college. It was one of the best decisions I could have made. I was able to start building a credit rating, balance my spending better, and did not have to carry as much cash since the ATM's were very accessible in my area. I had one experience with identity theft and Wells Fargo corrected the problem instantly. They put a freeze on that account and issued me a new card. They were very professional and I must admit this was a change from what I was expecting. Looking back, I am happy I chose this card and I would never change it for anything. I highly recommend it to anyone. Also Wells Fargo is a great bank if you need a banking account. I know I will be a life long customer!

name: Alex Alexson
review: I got this credit card when I signed up for a college checking account at Wells Fargo when I started to college 3 years ago. The good things about it are that there is no annual fees, which certainly is nice for a poor college student like myself. It also offers 1% cash back. That's not a lot, but hey a little extra cash just for using the card is nothing to complain about. The card is also linked with my checking account online so all I have to do is make a few clicks to pay my bill at the end of each month. I started with a $1000 spending limit, which I guess is low, but high spending limits with a college student is usually a dangerous combination. Overall I would reccomend this card to any college student!

name: Edmundo Loyed
review: I have had my Wells Fargo Credit Card since I was 18.  I had used it responsibly and practically not at all until I reached college age.  Even though I was working it was really hard to make ends meet.  Even so, even if I ran the balance up I was always able to pay it off. Overall, Ive had great experiences with my Wells Fargo Visa credit card and have never had any actual problems.  Every time an issue comes up as in double charging, they have always been swift to act.  Its also really convenient and has never been declined anywhere even traveling abroad.  ATMS are everywhere, especially in California so its super accessible wherever I am!

name: Susan Emory
review: I truly have had nothing but problems with this card. My credit is excellent, and because I have used Wells Fargo for other accounts and been happy with them, I thought it would be good to have my accounts all with one bank. The customer service is non-existent, and I have had trouble with my credit and debit card purchases being properly credited toward my Cash Back money. Whenever I have called to inquire about certain purchases not crediting correctly, I get a run-around and different answers from customer service, when I can get someone on the phone. I was actually placed on hold twice for over 15 minutes each time. The interest rate on these cards is not that great, but I pay in full each month so that does not affect me. There is no annual fee, which is good, but I think nowadays that should be standard, since they make so much money off of other fees. As long as it doesn't hurt my credit score, I'm seriously thinking about closing this account and changing to another cash-back card elsewhere.

name: Beula Call
review: I think I have been an owner of this credit card for probably five to six years now.  I have been a member of the Wells Fargo bank for probably twice as long when I opened my first account before joining the armed forces, so when Wells Fargo approached me to apply for this card I did not hesitate.  Since I’ve gotten the card the customer service has always been top notch, helping me out the one time I lost the card in getting it replaced very quickly.  Another good aspect of having this Wells Fargo card is that I can manage my card along side my normal bank accounts; so I can easily make payments, see transaction history, old statements, etc.  All in all I am pleased with this card and would recommend to anyone!

name: Austin Little
review: All I can say is WOW! This is an awesome card. I have had mine for about six months. I got it as my first credit card. Being a college student I was slightly apprehensive to open it but once I saw all of the wonderful benefits it had I was sold. Its great. It is accepted just about anywhere. I use it every once in awhile and I have had nothing but great experiences with it. It comes with the great customer service that Wells Fargo has to offer. If I ever have any questions I can go into the branch and speak face to face with someone or I can call their customer service hotline and get the same wonderful service.

name: Lanell Mcmeel
review: This visa card I have from Wells Fargo.  It is an ok beginner credit card.  It offers the flexibility you need to begin with if you have little to no credit.  However, the high interest rate is ridiculous.  Make sure you pay much over the minimum if you want to pay it off.  Also, they continually raise your max rate without your permission.  This may be all right if you are good at budgeting your money, but it may also be detrimental.  Overall, this is an all right card, but I would shop around a bit more for a card with more rewards if I were you.

name: Ryan Rubio
review: I've had this card for about two years now, and I've been very happy with it. The card is accepted everywhere which makes it very convenient. The rewards program they have is VERY rewarding and has made this credit card my go to card basically always. There are no hidden or silly fees, and it really helps that Wells Fargo is super nice, I love their customer service (which I can't say about some other banks...). Wells Fargo ATM's are also literally all over Miami, so if I need cash quickly I always know an ATM machine is close by. Overall, I highly recommend this card and Wells Fargo in general to everyone!

name: Alexander Insco
review: I was offered this credit card when I signed up for a checking account at Wells Fargo a few years ago. The application process was very easy, just a form or two, and the card was sent very quickly as well. It’s a great card for a college student, it has no annual fee, and the cash back option is a nice bonus (though it doesn’t really amount to much in the long run). There is also an option that enables you to quasi “link” with a bank account you might have with them online. All in all, it’s a good card to start building up a credit history.

name: Mendy Devoti
review: This is an awesome card.  First off, it's accepted everywhere and Wells Fargo ATMs are located everywhere.  I usually go to a local brance, my wife normally goes to a grocery store(Ralph's) to use hers.  Usually we are getting money from the ATM.  We have never had a problem with the card, or with Wells Fargo.  The rewards program was nice.  The terms are excellent when compared to other cards.  We've never had a problem with using it, and when there was a problem, Wells Fargo took care of it professionally and fast. Can't say the same with my CitiBank card.  We had someone use my wifes' card in India(identity theft) and they handled it with minimal inconvience to us.  Citibank was such a pain, and it was such an ordeal.  Customer support is excellent, rates are great, and this is the card we use all the time.  I highly recommend it, and also recommend Wells Fargo as a bank.

name: Bennett Kilpatrick
review: Great card, I use this 95% of time.  Both me and my wife are cardholders.  It's easy to access online.  I really like the mailings that tell us how many points we have, and also they feature the rewards, including new ones that come up all the time.  Lots of hotel and car rental deals on there.  Terms seem fair to me.  The rewards are ok as well, although we haven't used any of the big rewards.  Joining the rewards program is well worth it.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: I have had a Dillard's card for several years.  It is helpful when they are having sales and you save big when you make a purchase and sign up for the card.  You can special coupons and offers in the mail for being a cardholder too.  The fees and APR are in line with other department store credit cards so if you don't plan to carry a balance this is a good card to have.  I have never encountered anything but good customer service and like being able to pay in person as well as through the mail or online.

name: Kelsey Moore
review: I opened my Wells Fargo account in college, since it was the major bank located on our campus in North Carolina. They had very good incentives for students to open accounts, including debit cards with our university logo on them, which were also connected to our student spending money accounts. This was very convenient! Any time I had any issues, the customer service was excellent and very helpful in quickly resolving my problems. The ATMs were also very helpful since you could deposit checks into them, which I did frequently. They were also very responsive when I lost my ATM card a few times and immediately issued me a new one. Overall, it was a very positive banking experience!

name: Dan Bowne
review: I bank with Wells Fargo for my mortgage and in the couple of years that they have held my mortgage they have been very courteous and prompt in resolving any issues that my have come up with my account.  When you are in a situation that affects your payment of your mortgage they spend a thorough amount of time reviewing your account and looking over all the options that are available to you to help you make your payment and stay in good accord on your mortgage.  Every person I have spoken to through my calls to Wells Fargo's mortgage division has been excellent and really seen my problem or question through to the end to make sure I was satisfied with either the end result or the answer to my question.I highly encourage anyone looking to get a mortgage, especially in these turbulent economic times where there can be instances when you might be in a bind one month and other banks would turn their backs on you, to look at Wells Fargo for their mortgage lending needs.
