I didn't choose Wells Fargo, my mortgage broker did, so I didn't know what to expect when they became the holder of my mortgage, but I am glad that they are servicing my mortgage because I don't think I would get any better assistance when I reach out at any other bank.

name: Aaron Brown
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo seemingly forever up until recently. When I opened my account they were known as Wachovia and had several branches around my local area which persuaded me to open an account and bank with them. I opened my account with checking and savings in mind which was very misleading to say the least. When Wells Fargo was Wachovia, they were a really good bank that I could rely on and was very customer friendly but since they changed to Wells Fargo they have made a complete turn around for the worse.I was told that putting money from my checking to my savings would be a $5 fee, but depositing money straight into my savings account would prevent this which ended up not being the case at all. I was charged a $5 fee regardless of if I deposited my money into my checking or directly into savings. Any time I addressed this issue I was told that what happened was pretty much working as intended and offered no clear resolution to my problem.I ended up closing both my checking savings account due to constant $1 fee charges whenever I used my card; an obvious grab for money that hit my wallet pretty hard over time. Apparently Wells Fargo didn't approve of me closing my account and claimed they were dropping me before I called them to close my account, I just "have not received the notification yet". A $25 coverage fee was charged upon closing my account while also taking the rest of my money that was in the account as well (a whopping total of $21.75). I shutter to think how many people got hit by Wells Fargo over the years but I have asked around locally and apparently this is anything but a rare occasion. I highly advise anyone and everyone to rethink their choice of opening any banking account with Wells Fargo.

name: Luther Greene
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for several years.  I have a few bank accounts with different banks, and Wells Fargo is not my favorite, but it is fine.The people at the branch that I go to were not particularly helpful and were fairly slow, compared to the people at a BoA branch that I also frequent.Nevertheless, I have never had any major problems with them, except for a couple hidden fees that were mostly resolved quickly.  The interest rate for my savings account is comparable to the interest rates for a couple other savings accounts that I have at other banks.  With the economy the way it is right now, none of the rates are particularly good.Overall, I have had a positive experience at Wells Fargo.  While the branch that I have been at is not the best, I still think highly of them.  I can't say anything about their loans or mortgages, but for just opening and maintaining a savings account, Wells Fargo is good.

name: Jennifer Janzen
review: I recently moved to Arizona and had not yet established a bank account. I had a garage sale and received multiple checks drawn on different area banks. Most banks charged me a fee for cashing a check not drawn on their bank and made me jump through a million hoops. The teller at Wells Fargo was friendly, efficient and incredibly helpful. AND there was no fee to cash a check! Needless to say, I came back with my first paycheck and opened a checking and savings account. The customer service is outstanding and the programs and services they offer are the best.

name: mike wilson
review: I have to say that the customer service that I have at Wells Fargo is the best that I have ever encountered. A lot of people have told me that the fees that are associated with my bank are to high and I should look else where. I tell them that the fees are worth the exceptional help and the "go above and beyond" mentality of every employee at Wells Fargo. No matter what the issue is, a question, dispute, or concern I am met with courtesy and the employees are ALWAYS quick to answer my questions and rectify the situation. Where else would a banker call you at home after hours because the just received a message that you had left and didn't want you to worry over night? No where! I have banked at a number of institutions in my life and this is by far the best one.

name: Mat
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for over 20 years (Since I was a customer of CoreStates).  I have not had any issues with the Bank and have been a happy customer.  Most of the fees are comparable to other banks, but the ATM fees are a bit high, but the checking fees are waived as long as you have a qualifying amount of direct deposits, so I guess it evens out.I was also surprised that they will put a hold on your card if there is any suspicious activity on it. (I found this out when taking a trip to Florida and needed to visit Wal-Mart 3 times in one day), but they are happy to work with you to resolve the issue.  It was even easier since there was a branch right down the street from where we were staying.

name: Alexandria Chamberlain
review: I like they are friendly and easy to get straight answers out of since I had that issue with other places I had banked at previously. The only things I am not really liking is the fee they charge if you don't have direct deposit, which I don't since I work for a local company. If you cash your payroll check after 4pm on a Thursday, then you won't receive it until the following Monday. So that is very inconvenient for a struggling college student. Whenever I get my check I always cash it out so I'll have money for the weekend and to pay my bills. I wish when I deposited my check I could use it then.

name: Lisa
review: Wells Fargo has great customer service at my branch in my hometown in California.  I am very appreciative of all the tellers that work in my branch because they are always attentive and helpful.  I have never had any issues with my accounts there and once I the bank even graciously reversed some of my over-draft charges because I unknowingly and mistakenly cancelled my overdraft protection.  That is wonderful!  However, the customer service numbers for Wells Fargo are horrible.  I guess that is typical of â1-800â customer service telephone numbers, but I find this bankâs to be exceptionally bad.  I was put on hold last time I called to settle a dispute over some charges and overdraws and I was not only put on hold for 15 minutes, but the woman that was helping me was impatient and rude to me.

name: Jennifer Lundy
review: My main issue with Wells Fargo is that they have started adding all of these new "hidden fees" to their products and services.  However I did have some issues with fraudulent charges on my debit card.  They were super quick to resolve the issues and get my money back!  I was expecting it to take at least a week or two but within a couple of days it was finished.

name: shaina
review: I banked with Wells Fargo for a couple of years. I did not have too many problems with them but there were things that I think they could have done better. I had a bad experience with someone else getting into my account and even with reports and other things, Wells Fargo did not fix the problem for me. The customer service could be improved. The reps that I spoke too during these issues did not help me at all. Some were rather rude with me.Other than that, I did not have too many other complaints. Banking with them was fine unless you have a problem. Then you might as well just try to solve it on your own.

name: Remus Dutulescu
review: I have been a "client" of Wells Fargo for almost two years now and, honestly, I have nothing to complain about! They are serious, professional and highly recommended. For example, one of my past experiences with them was signing up for a car loan. Unlike many other banks, the application process took not less than two weeks, with a minimum of effort from my part. Then, their customer service is top notch - every time I called, no matter how trivial my question was, they answered promptly. Furthermore, probably the best thing about their services was the interest rates - by far, they are simply the cheapest and most reliable bank, at least from what I've found. If you are interested in taking a car loan, but you want small interest rates and professional customer service, Wells Fargo is probably your best choice.

name: alexander zhu
review: I opened an account in Wells Fargo when I had to move to Cali for a year... My original bank didn't have that many branches over in Bay Area. I was overall very satisfied with the experience. The application took just a few minutes and was done entirely online (I’ve heard that they removed this option since then and you have to make a call to complete the application process, but I’m not sure at all). I’ve had no problems at all with the bank ever since (and I still keep my account there, because I get some nice benefits). The service was pretty quick and very friendly, branches are abundant, fees are about the industry standard or lower…

name: Qing Lu
review: I got a car loan from Wells Fargo about five years ago. The car loan is for 60 months, so I am close to paying off the loan. Five years ago when I applied for car loans, I got rejected by several banks for unknown reasons (Maybe because I just began to work) or got absurdly high interest rates.  However, Wells Fargo gave me a pretty good deal through the car sales agent and I took it. I have been paying the monthly payment on time, and so far I haven't had any trouble with wells Fargo. Originally I sent check every month, but later I found out that I can pay it online, which is very convenient. I am pretty satisfied with the car and the car loan. The loan has helped me through the car in my daily life. The only thing I do not like about the loan is that I cannot pay off the loan earlier. When I tried to pay more principals, I got a less or zero bill the next month. I guess I was not clear about the terms when I got the loan. But this is OK, I just pay the fixed amount each month and now I am a couple months away from clearing the debt. Finally, I would recommend Wells Fargo, at least for its good car loan.

name: Dan
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for checking accounts for years.  I've been really pleased with the conditions; I've never been charged any fees for any checking related services.  I would say the best thing about Wells Fargo checking is the online service.  The website is extremely reliable and it's easy to move money around your Wells Fargo accounts and pay bills.  This was really valuable to me while I was working overseas.  The downside to Wells Fargo is the customer service.  On the internet and over the phone, it's quite good, but in person has been another story.  Perhaps it's just my local branch, but they constantly try to get me to start up additional accounts and enroll in services that I really don't think I need, and would just complicate my finances.  I stay with Wells Fargo for the online banking and lack of fees, but I do get a little annoyed when I have to talk to a banker about my account.

name: Zheng Duan
review: I opened my checking account with Wells Fargo about 15 years ago and have been with them ever since.They have always been helpful in terms of customer service. I'm a pretty disorganized individual, so I lose my ATM card all the time. I've never had any problems replacing my card or making general inquiries about my account.I haven't been too satisfied with their student loan rates (too high), and the obvious eagerness of the employee who was trying to "push the product". But I think this is probably true of all banks today.Overall, a great bank. No real complaints.

name: Jason
review: Wells Fargo has always been great to me. I've been a customer for nearly 10 years and I've never had a problem they couldn't resolve. I've only ever had a checking account through Wells Fargo, but I've never had any large issues. Usually a quick phone call answers any questions I might have or clear up any funny charges on my account, which I have had a few. It was also easy enough to alert them when I traveled overseas, which was definitely helpful while I was abroad. Overall I have been very happy with them. I've never used a saving account with Wells Fargo, but I would be open to trying.

name: Thomas Camack
review: I've been a Wells Fargo Customer for years. Always great service - warm, friendly, and eager to resolve issues if one has any. I recently had a tumor removed; I went in to our nearest branch for the first time since relocating; the staff, there - having already spoken with family members during my hospitalization - met with me, asked how I was doing, showed an incredible amount of neighborliness and concern for me as if I was a dear old friend - and I was just there to have some paperwork notarized! I love banking in person, I love Wells Fargo's online presence. I love how their ATMs process deposited checks on the spot - and emails the receipts to me. Always a great experience!

name: Andrew Main
review: I was originally a Wachovia customer, so when I saw that Wells Fargo had bought them out I was worried. I had heard horror stories from friends about all sorts of hiccups that happened when their bank ended up being bought or switching accounts. However, Wells Fargo's service has been nothing less than stellar. Every time I go to make a deposit I'm met with friendly faces. I had to get my account switched over to a student account and the process was extremely easy, no hang ups at all. The ATM's are incredibly convenient and consistent. Overall, I am completely satisfied with my bank.

name: Sarah Hill
review: I opened up a checking account with Wells Fargo the other day, and having never done it before, I was pretty nervous. But when I walked through the door I was cheerfully greeted and swiftly taken under their wing! They did not lose patience with me (I had a lot of questions) and explained everything very concisely and the overall process, although it took longer than expected, is something I can overlook due to the comfortable atmosphere they presented. They really have some good service there; the man who helped me was very polite and understanding. I got everything set up with no problems and they even gave me a nice folder with some more information before I left.

name: Daniel Brunner
review: Insanely high interest rate for a student credit card.  Increases in credit limit without prior notification so hard to limit spending.  Also checking accounts do not have very affordable pricing options for students.  Not enough ATM locations.

name: Alexander Insco
review: I ended up opening a checking account at Wells Fargo on the recommendation of my father, who has had his primary checking account through them for many years (15+). I’m happy to report that the bank has treated me just as well as he claims they did for almost 20 years. Their customer service has been very good, the few questions that I’ve had in regards to the account were answered quickly and cordially. The only niggling point against the account itself would be the application process – it’s a bit drawn out, with a fairly large number of forms (at least compared to other banks I’ve made accounts with).

name: mike Flisk
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for 8 years and I haven't had any problems. I have my checking, savings and mortgage account with them. I think the best thing about Wells Fargo is the online portion. I rarely have had to go the bank when I can do 95% of banking at home and even on my phone which is very convenient. The times I do go in the tellers are extremely helpful and personable. I can deposit money into family members accounts who are also with Wells Fargo at no additional fee which is very useful. It saves me money which I would spend at Western Union. The only problem I did have over the years was trying to get a mortgage with them and they weren't as helpful

name: Johnny
review: Wells Fargo is a friendly bank - but that is just about it. They have excellent customer service, but in this economy, nobody can really afford to prioritize customer service over benefits offered. There is just no way anyone in their right mind would sign up in this day and age. Well's Fargo has fees for everything; and they are pretty hefty. Want to do a small wire transfer? Fee. Want to use a check? Fee. Want to withdraw from an Automatic Teller Machine? Fee. Want to keep your money at Wells Fargo? Fee. All of these fees add up and you end up giving away your money in exchange for its safety. Your money should be making you money. I am thinking about pulling out of Wells Fargo and moving my account to Vanguard or some other investment credit union.

name: Joseph Parrotta
review: I have no idea why I bank with them, probably because I would have to change everything with other companies. The fees on checking and savings accounts are ridiculous. The fees from withdrawing at an ATM is gouging the customers. If you don't use an Wells Fargo ATM be prepared to pay the other ATM fee at the other location and an additional 2.50 charged from Wells Fargo. I overdrew my account on accident, so when I called support to let them know what happened they would not work with me. (I had money in my savings but 'apparently' I didn't have over draft protection, which I'm 100% positive I signed up for.) Customer Service is a joke, and so is this bank, and when I get ambitious I will be leaving, but need to figure out how I'm going to switch everything I pay online to a CREDIT UNION!

name: Christine M K
review: I've had a Wells Fargo account for 13 years and have had nothing but good experiences with this bank.  Any problems that I've had have been resolved quickly and professionally.  Wells Fargo’s online banking makes life so much easier, and their online customer service is also quick with a solution to any problems I have.Wells Fargo also has hours that are accessible for people who work 9:00 to 5:00 and branches within walking distance of my work and home.  I never have to go searching for a branch, or have to take time off of work to take care of my banking.

name: Brian Lim
review: I have been with Wells Fargo bank for several years now, as I have opened a checking account when I started college. I have not had many negative experiences with them, and when I managed to get myself into a problem with my money, customer service was always there to assist me. While my savings account rate could be a bit higher, I primarily use them for checking so I cannot make an honest judgement about that service. Depositing, withdrawing, and transferring money has always been quite simple, although it is difficult to locate ATMs or branch locations on the east coast of the US. Their website, while simple, is quite handy to utilize, and gets the job done for the most part.

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: I got my car loan through Wells Fargo and overall it was a positive experience.  We decided to go with them because they were able to give us the best interest rate out of all the banks in our area.  Everything went fairly smoothly, the application process took us a little over an hour, they did employment verification the same day, and the next business day we had the money for our car.  Can't ask for anything more, right?  We make payments on time through their website, and have made monthly payments on time and have not seen a change in the terms of the loan or anything like that.  I would recommend this bank, but advise you to always shop around for the best interest rates in your area.

name: John Rea
review: I used to have an account with Wachovia, and when the switch to Wells Fargo occurred I was a bit worried about what type of changes would be made to my checking account. Luckily it was completely fine, and the people at Wells Fargo were really nice when I called them up to see if I was going to be getting charged at a different after the takeover. I really would have liked to stay with them, but there mobile banking just wasn't up to the standards that other banks have set. I would always have problems with the website and app crashing, so I went to Citibank. I hear it's gotten a lot better recently though.

name: David Bach
review: Wells Fargo has top notch customer service.  Every teller I have interacted with has been helpful, polite, and quick with processing my transactions. Only a handful of times have I encountered long lines, both inside and in the drive-thru, but I never waited too long at all.   Just last week I walked in to open a savings account for my son.  I was greeted with a smile immediately upon entering, and then was directed to the proper person who could set up the account for me. Within ten minutes we had set up the account and made his first deposit!  My son loves the folder they gave him to help him learn about saving his money and setting goals for his account.

name: Jennifer Baca
review: When I first walked in, I should have known something was wrong. It was like the 'banker' was really a salesperson, who had to convince me to get an account. He was meeting objections, asking probing questions, and though I'd gone in looking to set up an account he acted like he was trying to get me to buy a car. I learned later that this level of 'service' is what you can expect with them. I think just because they know people will just stay with a bank, they aren't worried about treating them right. Trying to get a fee explained was a pain, and continued loyalty meant nothing.

name: Daniel Destefanis
review: The cost of college is no laughing matter. The rate of tuition has sky rocketed in the past year. As an individual with no outside contribution, even with Federal Aid there is a lot of ground left to cover. With plenty of financial institutions out there, I randomly chose Wells Fargo for my student loans. The application was fairly easy to complete, but I have had my fair share of problems. My private college takes payment very seriously. For some reason, Wells Fargo often distributes my payments late. After numerous complaints and attempts to fix this behavior, Iâve yet to see much of a resolution. When my payments werenât late, the remainder of the loan often took weeks to reach my checking account. This was money I needed to cover odds and ends. My advice, avoid Wells Fargo for student loans, there are plenty of other banks to choose from.

name: Melissa Chavis
review: I have had an account with Wells Fargo for about a year now since it changed from Wachovia. The tellers are very friendly, I even know some by name, as they do me when I come in. I do like the new way to save plan that is linked to your checking account. You have $1.00 for every debit card purchase deducted from your checking and put into your saving account. I have been pleased with management as for as keeping me informed of the new services they offer. I once over-drafted my account, and called the customer service number to inquire about the charge. The customer service rep took the charge off without me even asking! Great bank.

name: gordon gaskill
review: We recently went in to our local Wells Fargo to create savings accounts for our girls.  We were greeted by friendly staff who were incredibly personable and knowledgeable.  They were not only able to quickly and completely take care of our initial reason for coming in, but they were also able to talk to us about how we could set up our already existing accounts in a better way.  We are now making more money in interest, and we are saving money every month in fees.   We could not be happier with the our bank.  They always provide us with excellent service, and this recent encounter is really just par for the course.

name: Jessica Hammonds
review: The Wells Fargo Cash Back College Card was very easy to apply for. As a college student, this card is perfect for me. I have had my credit card for almost a year now, and have had a pleasant experience in building my credit. I can use it anywhere and I really like the rewards. You get a percentage from every purchase you make with the credit card! It was really handy when purchasing books for school. I also used it to cover the charge of my school supplies while I waited for my refund. Wells Fargo also has an easy to use website, and the option for paperless statements. I really love being able though view my statement on the computer, instead of letting statements pile up on my desk.

name: Mikaela Veith
review: I've had my Wells Fargo card for almost 6 years now, and for the last three I finally joined the rewards program. It costs me around $16/year but I generally earn three to four hundred dollars a year in cash credits to my account! I'm also happy with the general service because they have consistently raised my maximum every few years and make it easy to link to my other accounts.  My card information was recently stolen and used for a series of fraudulent purchases and before I even was aware of the situation, WF had my card locked down, refunded my money, and shipped me a new card. Great service and security!

name: Miriam Stein
review: I applied for this card over a decade ago now, just after moving to a new city and opening an account at Wells Fargo. I had been a loyal AMEX user for years, but the rewards program beat the offer on my AMEX. The rewards program is not excellent, I believe it averages about to 3% 'cash back' for me. Sadly the only rewards worth going for tend to be the gift cards. Typically I'll redeem the Amazon digital certificates. - I often shop on-line and find this one just as good as cash. Sadly the direct 'redeem for credit' to your account costs more points than the gift cards, so I've never used it. As far as customer service goes, I've had this card stolen twice now. Both times my case was efficiently handled and I got newly issued cards right away. - This said, I have had issues with the direct transfer features offered through their website.

name: Eric Dahl
review: Overall I would say Wells Fargo is an above average bank. I was looking for a bank to use after separating my fiances from my parents. Since Wells Fargo was prominent in my area I decided to give them a try. I was started with a no fee checking and a no fee saving account as longs as conditions are met. I have never had a huge problem with either of these accounts. Simple, and can easily view account information through their online portal. The biggest qualm that I have with Wells Fargo is the hidden fees. Make sure you ask when a fee can be applied to your account! It probably is easier than you think. But overall I would recommend Wells Fargo as a starter bank if they are in your area.

name: Dee Kardas
review: The application was fast and easy. No fee and 1% cash back on all purchases. Pretty basic card. There is an online banking app that you can use for free with Wells Fargo accounts, which makes it easy to track and monitor your spending. They started me off at $700 and have been slow to raise it despite not ever missing a payment. This would be a good card to those who are looking to establish credit for the eventual bigger purchases such as a car or house. Overall I would recommend this card as a starter card to those who have lower expenditures and need something with no annual fee.

name: Christie Tadesse
review: The application was fast and easy. No fee and 1% cash back on all purchases. Pretty basic card. There is an online banking app that you can use for free with Wells Fargo accounts, which makes it easy to track and monitor your spending. They started me off at $700 and have been slow to raise it despite not ever missing a payment. Overall I would recommend this card as a starter card to those who have lower expenditures and need something with no annual fee.

name: Mark
review: Bank of America is amazing! I believe that it is one of the easiest to use banks in the world. When I signed up, all one of their staff members kindly helped me to get started up. And lo and behold, around 2 weeks later I was already making online purchases with my new debit card! Also, more importantly, there is a Bank of America right down the street from me, so I will not have to worry about depositing or taking out money into the ATM machine, since it is so convenient for me. I recommend Bank of America to anyone who wants to get started up quickly.

name: Sam White
review: I made the switch to Wells Fargo about last October. I really could not be happier. They have serviced me better than Bank of America ever did. They also had a lot less hidden fees too. I can remember all the countless hours I spent trying to understand the fees they charged me that eventually caused me to quit the bank all together. They also have a lot better customer service. Every time I am there they treat me with a really nice attitude, and they never see me as another customer. There is nothing I would change about this bank.

name: Ashley
review: My husband and I have been banking with them for almost 3 years. While we've had no large issues we have had a few small complaints. They are very good about mailing out new debt cards and replacing any lost, stolen, broken cards. The customer service does leave alot to be desired. We went in one day to order new checks and the guy acted like we were nothing but trash. He flat out told us that it was a waste of his time to order us new checks and that we should just get them online or from someone else. You also really have to watch Wells Fargo as they like to add new charges to try and nickel and dime you to death.

name: Cora Bowman
review: I've had a Wells Fargo Checking account for a few years now, and its had its ups and downs. I was switched from a Teen checking account to a regular, but was 'upgraded' to a higher level account that I was told wouldn't cost me anything monthly, which was extremely frustrating to switch. I've also had some issues with the online and mobile banking system, and have been in countless times to get that issue resolved. I've always had great customer service and have never left in a bad mood, everyone is always upbeat and very helpful whenever I'm in. Another issue I had was the Identity Theft protection, which costs 13 dollars a month. Was impossible to set up and even more so to cancel. All in all, I've had a pretty average experience with Wells Fargo.

name: Janise Domingue
review: Wells Fargo is an alright bank in some areas, excellent in others. If I ever had a problem concerning my account I'd call my closest branch office and the problem would be sorted. A cashier entered the wrong amount in one time and overdrew my account by a great deal. I called Wells Fargo as soon as I got home and they assured me everything would be taken care of. Not only was I not charged overdraft fees on the three items that came in AFTER that pounding from the cashier they worked to ensure the company that employed the cashier was working their fastest to get my problem resolved. In this instance the bank and their employees were very helpful.One area they were not very good at was handling international money exchange, not on the local level at least. It took over two weeks to get a bank draft from the UK sorted, I was told several different fees by different employees and the rules and regulations seemed to change with each new person I talked to. What should have been a simple deposit, exchange, and withdrawal turned into a farce that had me seriously questioning whether to stay with the bank or not. Luckily one employee with some sense finally came along and got everything sorted. I'd recommend Wells Fargo for simply bank accounts but if you have anything that goes beyond the norm or their helpful little diagrams for employees I'd avoid them like they had the plague!

name: Karina
review: I used to have Wachovia before Wells Fargo bought the company out. I have not really had issues with the customer service of Wells Fargo. I always got quick, friendly service. They had no problems replacing lost debit cards, though I had to wait about a week for the new card to ship which was fairly inconvenient. My only complaint about the company, which is the reason I'm now switching banks, is the $5 charge they are starting this August. Each account that doesn't have at least $1500 or receives $500 each month by direct deposit will have a $5 charge taken from it each month. Being a broke college student, I do not qualify for either to not have to pay that extra $5. That's an extra $60 a year just because I do not have enough money in my account. I feel like they will be losing a lot of customers to this decision.

name: Belen Mata
review: When I was in college, I was one of those girls that was eating popcorn for dinner sometimes when my friends went out - so when Wells Fargo called me out of the blue to alert me that someone had hacked into my bank account using my credit card numbers and attempted to steal my money, I freaked out. Thankfully, a Wells Fargo team member had been tracking the hacker’s strange purchases and gave me a call to confirm the strange activity on my account. The Wells Fargo team member then cut off the credit card and saved my few hundred dollars in savings from being taken from me. To this day, I praise and recommend Wells Fargo to all prospective customers that are thinking of switching banks.

name: Charlie Alexa
review: Run away as fast as you can from Wells Fargo. It took them a MONTH to open a checking account. The customer service is completely horrible. They don't return many phone calls. The ones that are returned have rude customer service staff, but I have been lucky to talk to some who are extremely polite and nice. On top of bad customer service, the bank charges random unknown fees, and when I tried to see what was going on they brushed me off. When I finally got down to the bottom of things I found out that they were allowing unauthorized transactions! I will never bank with them again and I do not recommend this bank to anyone unless you like rude customer service and unauthorized transactions and random fees.

name: Tamera Snider
review: I must say banking with Wells Fargo has been great. The bank was originally Wachovia when I signed on to do banking with them a few years ago. The bank merged with Wells Fargo, and I am still pleased with the service. The customer service is superior, the bank offers timely direct deposits, and they have online banking. Wells Fargo offers excellent customer service. Anytime I call whether it is day or evening the representatives are always professional and caring. They patiently go through the account with me if I have any questions. Wells Fargo always accepts my paycheck deposits on time. I never once have had to call the bank to find out why my deposit has not been posted. The availability of online banking is also an added service that I enjoy. Being able to check my balance and transfer money any time of the day makes me feel comfortable and confident that my money is in a safe place.

name: Anthony Mole
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for just a little over year now. I do enjoy their in the bank customer service. No matter what branch I am in everyone is cheerful and more than willing to help me. My questions are answered precisely and quickly. Even when I have to call in, the service is just what I would want from Wells Fargo. Now, where I have my problems with Wells Fargo are in the area of getting things done and fixing problems. When I called in to request a new debit card I was told it would arrive around a specified date. Nearly a week passed after that date and I still had not received my card. I called back and the problem was handled and I got my card that week. But when it came there was a mistake with the information on the card. I have had other minor problems with services like the time period of when my funds and other account activity appeared online. I have learned to live with it, but it is a problem I never had with my previous bank. What really bothers me is how often I have to discuss the details of my account with Wells Fargo. Frequently I am re-negotiating previously discussed and agreed upon terms involving my accounts. Just when I think I understand I am getting charged a fee because I donâ€™t qualify for this or that. Maybe it is just me, like I said I have only been with them a year and I am still committed to working things out. It just feels like even though Wells Fargo is eager to help the problems never cease.

name: John
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for as long as I can remember. My experience with them has generally always been very positive. When I go there the people at the desk are always willing to answer my questions about my checking accounts, student loans, and any other problems that arise. In regards to online banking, I always feel that they have a very secure system that protects my money and keeps my assets safe. Wells Fargo definitely gives me peace of mind when it comes to my money. I wholly recommend this bank to all my friends and younger cousins and siblings who were looking for a bank and I would recommend it to a stranger any day. Wells Fargo goes above and beyond for me.

name: Mike Wallace
review: I am mostly satisfied with this bank. However, I think they could use some work in their customer relations department. There was a bank error in their favor once, and the customer service representative was very difficult. I had to speak with her manager, who was equally rude. They simply refused to accept that their bank made an error. I had dated receipts that proved the error, but of course I couldn’t show this to them since I was calling them. When I went down to the local branch, they told me I had to go through the customer support line.

name: Robert Saldana
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for over 10 years.  I have spoken with customer service numerous times about all kinds of issues.  They were very professional and resolved my problems with the best of their ability.  I really enjoy the features on their website which make managing my account really easy.  I am able to transfer funds to other accounts with no problems including accounts which are not my own.  I am familiar with other banks and I highly recommend Wells Fargo due to their web interface.  As long as Wells Fargo keeps up with technology, I donât see myself moving my money.

name: Aleesha Jensen
review: I've been with Wells Fargo most of my adult life. When I first started working, I set up an account first with a different bank. Because my mother's and my account were connected and I was too young to have my own, when my mother overdrew her account they took all my money. So, I canceled my account with them and set up at Wells Fargo. Ever since, I have yet to change my bank. Every time I have had a problem, they have resolved it quickly. When I have asked for an allowance for an over draw, they have worked with me on the issue. It has always been a pleasure banking with them. They talk to me respectfully and even just talk without just trying to get me off the phone or out of their face as quick as possible. I've had a decent conversation with them as the computers processed my request. They are always willing to work with me no matter the issue. All in all, I don't think I'll ever leave them.

name: Aaron Manikian
review: I have had a mortgage with Wells Fargo for a number of years now. I appreciate that the rate I obtained on the loan is good. However, sometimes when I call them up for customer support, I get bounced around a lot. It is extremely difficult to get a hold of someone who actually will listen to your problem. As a result, it can be extremely frustrating. However, when I do get in touch with someone who actually knows what is going on, I usually get my problem resolved. It took me weeks to find that one person though as it appears they hire a lot of silly people to handle the phone correspondence. Otherwise, I have not had any problems and it could be a lot worse.

name: Summer George
review: I have always used Wells Fargo and have been consistently happy with this bank. Any time I have an issue it is resolved quickly and efficiently. Whether it be an ATM error or money missing from my account, they have always taken immediate action to get my money back to me and to ensure that I receive my money as soon as possible. Their interest rates are also good and they have a variety of account options to fit your needs (my favorite is their college student savings account). I've heard stories from family and friends about their banks causing them issues, but I have never had any of these problems myself and look forward to being a Wells Fargo customer for a very long time.

name: Isaac
review: I signed up for Wells Fargo when I moved to college because my hometown bank did not have a branch in the town I moved to. Immediately I was weary about Wells Fargo because they wanted me to open a credit card and savings account along with my checking account. They also tried to push their auto transfer to savings program on me and insisted I use my savings account constantly. I explained I did not need this since I only needed this card to have a debit card I could transfer checks into. The final straw was when they changed my checking requirements and said I had to maintain $1500 a month or be charged a fee. Being charged to keep my money in their bank? That was enough and I have since switched to a local credit union. I would recommend avoiding Wells Fargo if given the option.

name: Ann
review: I have banked with Wells Fargo for over a decade. Although they are a large company, I do feel as if they try to give individualized attention to every one of their customers. When I forget something like a PIN, they are always ready to assist me in resolving the situation. Opening a checking account was an effortless process. Wells Fargo has many optional services available to a checking account holder, but they may not always disclose the full story when trying to sell a service to you. For instance, I was talked into opening a savings account by a teller at the bank one day while depositing a check, and she assured me it was completely free. In reality, regular deposits need to be made every month, or else a fee is incurred. I discovered this later when Wells Fargo started subtracting money from my savings account. Also, they really push their Bill Pay service which they always assure me is completely free. However, a quick look at the fine print says otherwise. I would recommend Wells Fargo to others, but with the caveat that not every representative is completely forthcoming about fees attached to special services.

name: Joe McCreery
review: It is a decent bank with good customer service. The people working there have always been very courteous to me whenever I'm in there. They are always willing to help out and setting up the account was very easy and I did not feel pressured by the employee who was helping me. Overall I really like the bank and will continue using it as my primary bank. I recently had an issue with some anomalies in my account, I went in to the bank and the man who helped me was very helpful and knowledgeable and I was able to resolve the problem with minimal stress and minimal time which is very important to me.

name: Greg Takeshima
review: I had a loan with Wells Fargo through a local furniture store called Homeworld.  The paperwork was pretty straight forward, they pulled my credit to make sure that I could pay and gave me a $3300 limit to spend in the store.  I only purchased about $1800 worth of furniture though.  The load was a revolving loan so that I could go back into the store and purchase more items if I needed to but luckily I didn't.  I got this loan so that I could receive the 0% interest for 12 months.  After that the interest would jump up to around 15% I believe.  In any case I had no real problems with Wells Fargo Loan Dept.

name: Vishwa Abhilash
review: I have an account with Wells Fargo since the 1st, one year. To be honest this is the best bank that I have ever transacted with. The best part is that there are no hidden charges and everything is crystal clear.The staff is also very customer friendly and you don't have to stand for hours . Everything happen in a jiffy with out much complications. A very good bank indeed.

name: Teresa
review: In particular I'd like to mention the Wells Fargo branch on the island in Venice, FL: exemplary and helpful tellers, managers and location. I am hesitant to admit to the fact that I overdrew my checking account; completely out-of-the-ordinary for me. Rather than deliver my bad news and send me out of the branch feeling badly, the teller offered me an option that would safeguard me from excessive overdraft fees. She offered me a bottle of water (hey, its hot!) and a seat at her desk so that we could iron out details about what I was signing up for. The employees at this branch are all just generally extremely gracious and I thoroughly enjoy banking here AND prefer to go to this particular branch!

name: Sarah
review: My experience with Wells Fargo has been nothing but truly excellent. From opening an account to speaking with customer service about a lost debit card, I have never encountered any problems or inconveniences. As a student, their Way2Save feature, which transfers $1 into savings every time I make a deposit, provides me with an ample amount when my checking runs short. Making deposits and withdrawing money has never been easier for me, with their quick and efficient desk service every time I walk in or drive up. All in all, I will most likely continue banking with Wells Fargo in the future because of their efficiency and overall easy banking.

name: Dave
review: Wells Fargo is a great place to open up an checking account. I've been with them for 7-8 years now. Never in my 8 years have I had a problem. Tellers always deposit cash and checks very fast, and usually they are friendly. Transactions do not take very long, usually it will take a day. Being able access it on my BlackBerry is great too, it makes things more convenient. Great to use when you're in a crunch and need to look something up. I had a problem earlier in the year so I quickly called Wells Fargo. The caller on the line helped me out and sent me a new credit card within 5 business days. Talk about great customer service!

name: Andrew Smith
review: I became a Wells Fargo customer when the bank took over Wachovia a few years ago. I was contacted by the change and given detail information about how the change was going to affect my account. I was pleasantly surprised but I only had a student checking account at the time so I felt it was little unnecessary to send a big folder filled with documents.My experience with Wells Fargo is only OK compared to the competition. My deposits from PayPal or Amazon are very fast and the money is in my account within a day or 2. I was contacted a few months ago that they are no longer offering free checking and will be charging a maintenance fee. Now I have to contact the bank and ask them to change my account to something different. I canât get too upset since none of the big banks offer free checking for accounts with low balances. Overall, Iâm satisfied with the situation until I move somewhere where Wells Fargo is not as popular.

name: Chris I
review: Where to start, where to start. Their customer care is absolutely top-notch. One time while making a deposit the machine somehow literally "ate" my money. It had accepted the deposit but for some reason didn't verify the amount was deposited. It's almost hard to explain the fact that the money got stuck or something when it was spinning to get verified. It wasn't a lot, I was trying to deposit just 40 dollars. I think just 10 of it read properly. The other 10 and 20 got jammed together or something and wouldn't be returned to me, nor would it go further in the machine and get deposited. The thing that really gets me is I go "Shoot, what do I do?", so I call the customer care hotline. I explain what is going on, which ATM I deposited at, etc., and the representative credits my account for the full amount at that instant.The thing is, I checked my balance that afternoon and everything was fine. But I think the next day or so I check my balance again and I'm credited the full amount of the deposit, listing that ATM location, and I'm really confused. Against my better judgment I call them up and explain what happened and what I should do, they apologize for inconveniencing me, and they tell me I didn't have to do anything. They just let me keep the extra 40 bucks! Needless to say the few other times I've had to call them up, they've resolved everything very courteously and professionally. I would highly recommend Wells Fargo to anyone interested in a checking account.

name: Patrick
review: I've been using Wells Fargo ever since I started going to my local community college, when they offered to sign me up for a student account with no monthly fees when I was applying for my student ID.  I wavered for a moment, but went for it, and ever since my experience with this bank has been top notch.  I've never had any trouble with their online banking, which I've used primarily for e-commerce, and the few times I have visited a bank in person the customer service has been excellent.  All that combined with the very good distribution of bank-specific ATMs in my area has made me a very happy customer overall.  The only thing that bothers me about this bank is probably the fact that their online banking insists on bombarding you with information about services they'd LOVE for you to try almost every time you log in, but in my opinion the good outweighs the bad.

name: Todd Landerson
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for over 6 years now and my primary credit card has been through them the whole time. I'm very happy with their service because they have consistently raised my maximum without me asking them, they make it easy to link to my other accounts, and they have a competitive rewards program on the card. I pay about $17/year for the program and usually earn several hundred dollars a year in cash credits to my account. On one occasion I accidentally took a cash advance on my card which I didn't want - one phone call and a representative quickly reversed it without charge. The online site is very easy to use and the ATMs make depositing money very easy too so I never wait in line. I'm very satisfied!

name: William Henderson
review: First I would like to say is that I was with Wells Fargo for three years and I had more problems with them than my current bank. I was only 15 when i started with Wells Fargo and all I really did was deposit my checks. So how do they mange to screw that up? Let me share. There were a couple of times that they wouldn't let me deposit it a check with out a parent even though the previous times a parent wasn't required, which amounts to that the workers either didn't want to deal with it or that they weren't trained properly. Secondly when I did withdraw money, (which I did once in like two months) they wouldn't let me with out three forms of I.D. I found that ridiculous. Needless to say when I turned 18 I closed my account and moved immediately. Although this was about three years ago so, they could be different now.

name: Blake
review: I recently switched to Wells Fargo from Bank of America and so far I'm pleased.  The one I go to is never crowded and always clean.  I’ve never had to wait in line and the tellers have always been extremely nice.  The interest rates on my checking account aren’t awful, but I am considering switching over to a credit union because they get better interest rates.  All-in-all, I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking to have a checking account through a bank rather than a credit union.  I’ve never had any issues at all and the service has been fantastic.

name: Shannon Scott Johnson
review: I have a car loan through Wells Fargo. The process was easy enough because I didn't have to do anything because the car dealership did it for me. I have been able to make my payments on time every month except one due to an unforeseen circumstance. I called the customer service department and we worked together to push my payment back a month. Whether this hurt my credit score or not I am not sure but at the time all I cared about was getting my payment handled. They are a great bank to go through when getting a new vehicle.

name: Jackson
review: I have been using Wells Fargo (Wachovia) for about 3 years now.  I really enjoy being able to do envelope-free check deposits at their ATMs.  I also have a credit card through them that was easy to sign up for.  I was in the local branch about 20 minutes from start to finish and got my card about 2 weeks later in the mail.  I've never had any trouble with the card or my account, and all new policies are sent to me via email and letter, so I'm able to stay up-to-date.  The only thing about my banking experience I don't particularly care for is Way2Save, but I suppose I could always drop that if I really wanted to.  Overall, I'm happy with most of my experiences at Wells Fargo.

name: Alanna
review: I first became a member of the bank Wells Fargo when I opened up an account at Wachovia years and years ago. Wells Fargo now owns them. I've never had a problem with this bank. I've always received well and above great service from their staff. I remember depositing large checks inside their bank and having the money available on the next business day when usually it could take up to a week. My mom also banks with them and has for at least ten years. Before I was 18, I had an account with her name on it so that I could save money.

name: Steph
review: The Wells Fargo bank in the Malibu Colony Plaza is clean and safe and the tellers are friendly and efficient.  There is abundant parking and the two exterior ATMs are easy and safe to use as the Plaza has security and is well lit.  Inside the bank the employees make you feel welcome and will spend the time reviewing your account to advise you on the best products for your position. I recently had an automatic payment create a negative balance in my account and the tellers worked with me to prevent a costly overdraft fee.  Their website is easy to use and will deliver my bank statements electronically, eliminating the waste of postage and paper.

name: ANNA
review: I have had a Wells Fargo account since 1999, when they were still Wachovia. I opened a joint checking account with my husband in 1999. We used this account to pay bills, and we had one direct deposit going into this account every week up until last Fall. I have always found the customer service to be decent, nothing exceptional but nothing horrendous.  I don't recall having any issues with them. Since they were acquired by Wells Fargo, we continued to bank with them. However, they recently imposed a fee for not having at least one direct deposit or minimum balance maintained. This fee is $5. I don't feel a basic checking account should have such fees associated with them, especially when there are other banks that don't require this. In these difficult economic times, every saved dollar helps. Charging fees such as this one does not provide me with any incentive to keep banking with Wells Fargo. We have since closed the account.

name: Heather
review: So far, I have had pretty great experiences with Wells Fargo. When I first signed up for an account with them, I was in college and it was still known as Wachovia. I was worried about the transition to Wells Fargo, but so far nothing has changed for the negative.I really like my Way 2 Save savings account, which moves $1 over to a special savings account with every purchase on my debit card. It forces me to save without even thinking about it, and I have accrued a lot more savings than I would have without it. I believe it also has a higher interest rate than other savings accounts.However, my most positive experiences with Wells Fargo have been the customer service offered in the branches. Tellers are always extremely friendly, helpful, and honest with me. When I came in with my boyfriend to create a joint account, the banker (I don't know the proper term but he was not a teller) was informative and friendly in helping us.

name: Brooke Rogers
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for approximately 7 months now. I have nothing but good things to say about the bank. The customer service staff has always been friendly. They make sure that they try to solve my problem or concern no matter how big it may be. For example, I had to have a fee reversed on my savings account, and the woman who assisted me made sure she did everything to try and get the fee off of my account. She was unable to do it that same day, but did call me the next day to let me know the problem had been taken care of. When I switched my direct deposit over from another bank, it was very quick and took effect much faster than the two weeks it said it would.

name: Tej
review: I originally became a Wells Fargo customer not by choice, but because I was an account holder at Wachovia. The transition over and all of my subsequent banking experiences have gone over without a hitch. I have found that the customer service there is very friendly and accommodating. The employees seem to have no qualms about going out of their way for you. The only problem I can foresee someone having with Wells Fargo is the minimum amount of money required to be in the account, which could be a problem for someone younger. I have been able to open and close accounts without delay, and all of my questions and inquiries are always answered immediately. Overall, I would say Wells Fargo is an outstanding bank and definitely merits consideration for someone looking to switch banks or open a new account.

name: Lisa Taylor
review: I absolutely love Wells Fargo.  My bank in Austin, off of South Congress has the best customer service.  They are very helpful with everything and make sure that whatever problems you may have, are taken care of completely.  A few months ago, I became very ill for about a month and did not check on my accounts.  When I got well, I realized that I had a negative $250 balance in my checking account.  I went to my bank and had my debit card blocked and paid off the balance in a couple of weeks, but the customer service was excellent and they always do everything they can to help.  I have had to call customer service before when I lost my debit card and had them block it and send me another card.  They are also very nice and helpful on the phone.  I know people that are having problems with other banks and I would definitely recommend Wells Fargo to anyone.

name: Randy
review: I've been a Wells Fargo customer for roughly 8 years now, since they took over my former brokerage company. Initially, I only used their brokerage services, which paid quite well from the standpoint of money market account interest rates. I always, at that time, found their service level to be very good, and eventually opened a standard account with their "normal" banking arm. I've been remarkably pleased. The service level is always top-notch, and their tellers and other representatives seem to always be on top of things, and able to answer questions quickly, and perhaps most importantly, accurately, no matter whom I'm dealing with. These are all important things to me, and they've yet to ever disappoint me.

name: Mike Kaduce
review: Got approved for this card as my first credit card, when everyone else was rejecting me because I had no credit. How do you build up credit unless you have a credit card? I didn't want to use a prepaid card to build up credit, and so my personal banker helped me apply for this one under the pretense of having no annual fee. They explained the rewards system to me too, but that wasn't a big selling point for me. In fact, I have yet to cash in any of my rewards. Interest rates are pretty run of the mill, from my understanding, compared to other intro-type cards. My credit is now 800+ where I used to have none at all, and I have nothing but on-time mortgage payments and this credit card to thank.

name: Janet Houck
review: When I got my first job after immigrating to the US, I opened a checking account with Wells Fargo. For the first few years, I didn't have much trouble with them; the people at my local branch were very nice and professional, and the service was always quick, accurate and friendly. However, then I started to receive monthly fees, and any services beyond basic deposits and withdrawals seemed to accrue yet another fee. Sometimes, I complained and got the fee reversed, but more often than not, I got a shrugged shoulder and "Sorry. I can't do anything about that". The fees are what made me close my account and move to a local, smaller bank. Good people, but man, the nickle and diming of fees!

name: Elliot Saks
review: This is the oldest credit card I have as I was approved for it at 19 years old.  The interest rate is decent and the credit limit is adequate, although I no longer use this card because the rewards program isn't very good, and the ones on my AMEX and Navy Federal credit cards are way better.  I would have closed it a long time ago if I didn't think my credit score was going to take a big dip, however.  When I was using the card, I did have fairly good experience with Wells Fargo customer service.  The online feature of being able to transfer money from your checking account directly to your credit card bill is very convenient, assuming you bank with Wells Fargo.  I also had several times where WF contacted me directly to ask me if I had been the one to make a recent purchase.  Slightly annoying, but a good service nowadays with all the fraud going around.  I at least wasn't worry that anyone was going to steal my identity when I was using this card.I would begin to use this card again if Wells Fargo would improve their rewards program to be more competitive and consistent with what else is available in the credit card market.  Until then, I'll continue using it to buy a pizza twice a year.

name: Jereme
review: I've been a with Wells Fargo (and Wachovia before them) for almost 10 years now.  I've really had nothing but positive experiences with this bank and its customer service...in fact, I've noticed an improvement since Walls Fargo took over.  The only downside for me has been the scarcity of branches around where I live, but that seems to be changing for the better.  It would be nice if there were more Wells Fargo ATMs in my area, though.  Their online banking is very well done, and I use the site almost every day.  Their customer service reps and tellers have always been polite and helpful.  I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone that lives in an area that has a few branches.

name: Char
review: I have a College Combo account with Wells Fargo which means I have a Wells Fargo College Checking Account and Wells Fargo Way2Save Savings Account. Unfortunately, I wish that I would have been a little more informed before allowing myself to be roped into this account. It is hard to get a hold of customer service representatives over the phone in a timely manner and the e-mail response time is very unreasonable. After trying both of these methods in order to contact customer service with questions that I had regarding my account because the account details (fees, etc.) were very unclear to me as some things became increasingly unclear to me as soon as I began receiving my statements. For instance, some rates were simply described as "variable". In order to get any sort of clarification, I realized that I had no choice other than to go in to a location in-person. On a more positive note, I must say that all the employees that I have encountered have been very friendly and polite and show genuine interest in college students having their accounts with Wells Fargo. The application is not complicated nor does it take a very long time. I like that there is at least an account type available specifically for college students, although I am not convinced that it is the best option out there. The main benefits of having a College Combo account with Wells Fargo is that I get free mobile alerts, mobile banking, and online banking which is very convenient for someone who is constantly on the go like me.

name: Joseph
review: Really nice, helpful staff. Itâs a big chain, but it feels very small and personal. When I lost my debit card, they immediately issued me a temporary one to use that worked everywhere I needed it. When some hackers managed to get a hold of my information and falsely charge my account, Wells Fargo managed to return it quickly and rectify my account back to being in good standing. The online service is easy to use, with a clean, simple-to-navigate interface that even my 75 year old grandmother can figure out. I enjoy all the great features and customer service here, and recommend switching banks to all my friends who donât already have accounts there!

name: Heather
review: Wells Fargo has always been very reliable for me. The people who work there are usually very kind and patient and have a sense of humor. I have lost my debit card quite a few times, and have been to various locations of Wells Fargo in Atlanta, Orange County, and San Francisco to address my carelessness. Every time is far from stressful..the only thing is, it takes a while for the new card to come. However, it was my mistake to lose my card to begin with so I can deal. They are very professional and welcoming - I have no issue with customer service and would recommend anyone to join the bank.

name: Danny
review: It was recommended to me by a customer service representative to open a savings account, as I had a lot of money in my checking account. After my savings account was created, however, there was an error within the system that caused an enormous overdraft fee in the savings account, where several thousands of dollars were supposed to be transferred. I had to go through a different location to get the problem resolved because the representative that made the savings account would not return my calls. I had the charges removed and the savings account deleted eventually, but it caused me a lot of stress. It would be too much of a hassle to switch banks so I stayed with Wells Fargo. I would, however, not recommend them to anyone looking to open a checking account.

name: zach smith
review: I have been using Wells Fargo for over 3 years. I switched to them because the credit union I was with was not in the part of the country I am currently. For the first year Wells Fargo was great. The tellers at the bank were really friendly and always went above and beyond to help me. I had fraudulent purchases on my account, and the manager at the branch was very helpful in shutting down my accounts and getting new ones set up. They were even able to refund the fraudulent purchase within a couple hours. However within the last year the service has really suffered. I had a checkbook stolen, and once again they set up new accounts. However this time, they started charging me a $5 fee per account. On top of that, they wanted to charge me $12 per month per account for statement. This would have cost me well over $200! I was however able to get them to come down to $4 per month per account. Wells Fargo also charged me a fee for just talking to someone in the branch. I feel like I get charged for everything I do with Wells Fargo now. I am considering going back to a credit union, even though it is not as convenient as Wells Fargo.

name: Mike A
review: I have been a customer with Wells Fargo since I first opened a checking account back in high school during 06’ and I will note that this was the only bank in my town at the time. While years ago I was rather pleased with the service, recently they really seem to be going downhill. Hidden fees, charges with no explanation (classified as “other” fees) constantly being tacked on to anything they can get away with. I have multiple times had money withdrawn from my account for personal loans on later date than specified causing a chain of overdrafts which ended up costing me 3 times the amount of the original bill. If there was any other bank near my home I would switch. Investors beware; if you bank with Wells Fargo expect to be giving them a cut of your earnings on a regular basis.

name: Mateo Louis
review: I have been with Wells Fargo with over five years so far.  Overall, their customer service is not terrible even though my experience with them thus far has been far less than ideal.  My main problems are with their policies and them disclosing new policies they are implementing.  Some of these include them having an additional charge for me to get out money from non-Wells Fargo ATMs on top of the fees I already pay at the ATM.  Also, they are starting to charge for not keeping a minimum amount in your checking account, which is essentially a tax for being poor.  They were also one of the offending banks that were running all your debits first and before your deposits, starting with the highest to try to ensure the most amount of overdraft fees they could collect.  Overall, I feel like they are trying to scam me and take as much money as possible from me, but not any more than any of the other bigger banks.  I would be happy to and might in the near future switch over to a credit union.

name: Yves
review: I have enjoyed being with Wells Fargo for the last four years. I enjoy how they have banks at very convenient locations. That makes finding an ATM or a bank easy. Every teller I have interacted with were also friendly and attentive to my needs. They were friendly and fulfilled every request I asked for and needed. Some of the tellers recognized me because I come in monthly to withdraw money for rent and they remember why I am there and have an idea of what I need. That is efficient because it makes my time in the bank faster than others. If there were long lines in the bank, one of the employees would often ask if we wanted to deposit or withdraw. If an individual was going to make a deposit, the employee would hand the individual an envelope in order to speed things up a bit. Wells Fargo tellers also alert me if something looks suspicious with my bank accounts. Overall, Wells Fargo is a great bank.

name: Michelle
review: This is my third year with Wells Fargo ever since I started as a freshman in college and I absolutely love it. Their customer service is impeccable. They are so friendly and sincere and willing to help no matter what the problem may be. Whether I have a problem and I walk into the bank or give them a call, there is always someone there to listen and assist me. I had questions about student loans and they were willing to sit down and make sure I knew what was happening and helping me get exactly what I wanted. They definitely go out of their way to make the customer happy and satisfied. They are not only friendly, but very professional and well mannered in their business as well.

name: Elizabeth Mitchell
review: I chose Wells Fargo Bank because I went to college in Minnesota and it was one of the more common banks in the area. I have been a pleased customer since. I like that they have branches in many places, including major cities across the country, and will happily do things like replace cards for free and answer questions when you walk in; no matter where I am, I get service pretty quickly when I go to Wells Fargo. I also have had good luck with their customer service on the phone. If I do have any complaint about them, it’s that I wish they had more affiliates and more branches in small town areas; I live in Northeast Ohio now and they are not as common here.

name: P Sheckler
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for about 3 years and I love it. The customer service is outstanding. There are times when I do not completely understand the tiny fine print and when I go to a Wells Fargo location they are very kind and willing to help me understand.  I have also called them by phone several times and they have always been a great help. Recently, I wanted to open a business account and I had no clue where to start. The customer service helped me set everything up and they even told me a way where I would not have to pay an extra fee to have another account opened. Overall Wells Fargo has been a great Bank. They go above and beyond to make sure I'm satisfied.

name: James Thornton
review: I was a Wachovia customer when Wells Fargo bought them. I absolutely loved Wachovia and Wells Fargo assured me that I would be just as happy with them. It worked for a while, everything seemed OK while Wachovia was still operating but when Wells Fargo did the switch over in South Carolina, I hated it. I am still with Wells Fargo and I will probably stay with them because I have had the same account for so long. However, I will be opening another account at another bank. The people who work at Wells Fargo are very polite, knowledgeable and helpful. Wells Fargo is sales based and you can definitely tell it when they make the big switch from one bank (Wachovia) to another (Wells Fargo). It seems like every time I use online banking or even go in the branch they are trying to sell me something, this is very bothersome, if I wanted to buy something I would seek a place to buy it. I even get loads of mail from Wells Fargo trying to sell me stuff. Overall, I am not happy with Wells Fargo.

name: Brittney DeBeer
review: I have my student loans here. Every time I walk in here I always get a friendly smile. They always are very prompt, well dressed, and very quick at handling my transactions. I recently did not receive a bank statement for my loan until about 2 weeks late. I could not afford to pay not only the original amount of the loan plus the extra $34 to pay the late fee. I talked to the customer support team and they were able to cancel the late fee. As I explained I am unemployed and unable to find work at this time and hardly had enough funds to pay the original loan amount.I walked into the closet bank to me and one of the managers talked to me and helped me set up my online student payment account. So I didn't have to walk in every month to pay the loan. It was great, I didn't even ask for it. He just asked me and set me up an appointment to come back in and my life just a tad easier.

name: Kaitlyn
review: I am one of the many people who became Wells Fargo customers as a result of the Wachovia buy-out.  My experience with Wells Fargo has been a bit unique because of this -- I never sought out or research Wells Fargo prior to becoming a customer.  However, so far I have been quite happy.  Wells Fargo has honored the programs which I signed up for with Wachovia and has allowed me to continue banking in the same way.  I have not had to change any of my accounts, account numbers, or experienced any fees.  Wells Fargo so far has been great.  As long as you are an active customer you really don't have to worry about fees for accounts and I have never had a problem with finding a Wells Fargo, in fact, I just traveled to the Mid-West from the South and had no problem finding a Wells Fargo to take care of my banking needs -- that would not have been possible with Wachovia.

name: Jonathan
review: I've banked with Wells Fargo for over 10 years and have never been happy with their service. There is always some kind of hidden fee or service charge, you have to examine your account very closely to make sure they aren't just stealing money from you every month. I've had multiple times where I would talk to someone saying that I would no longer be receiving a fee only to have another one hit the following month. It seems no one at the bank fully understands how to avoid getting charged service fees and everyone there is just as confused as we are. In the branch I don't mind as the tellers are usually friendly and courteous. Wells Fargo's online experience I also think is really good and at least comparable to other banks online services, they offer everything another bank would such as online bill pay. I would not however recommend this bank to friends or families and would suggest not banking with such a greedy bank that from my experience, doesn't actually care about its customers and only cares about its bottom line because that's what it feels like as a customer to me.

name: Jesse Upchurch
review: I began checking with Wachovia bank in high school, and was dismayed when my local branch turned into a Wells Fargo.  As it was one of the only banks in my small town, however, I made the switch and decided I would give it a chance.  Wachovia had great savings plans that withdrew from your checking account, with little penalty for not having excess money in the account to make the withdrawals.  When Wells Fargo took over, however, I noticed that the same programs I used to love about my old bank were being used to suck my bank account dry by the lovely Wells Fargo.  When I requested to be removed from the "way2save" program, I was informed that I could only do that if I closed  out my checking account as well.  Unfortunately, I can't actually cash checks in that account, because I am a "high risk" customer, from all of the overages that they have put on my account time and time again.Thank you, Wells Fargo, for making the paycheck-to-paycheck struggle a little bit harder.

name: RoyStar SoundSick
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for well over ten years now, and I must say theyâve always had great customer service. I opened my first student checking account with them when I was in college, and I have always received fair premiums, updated statements and excellent customer service. Being one of the bigger banks in the country, I always have access to my funds via an ATM or a strategically placed Wells Fargo location.  One of my biggest concerns before joining Wells Fargo was the ability to pile up unnecessary overdraft fees, but with overdraft protection, that concern is just a thing of the past. Wells Fargo rocks!

name: Casey Charvat
review: I am writing about my Wells Fargo checking account.  Which is a decent bank with good services and respectful employees .I personally liked using their services because of how well managed they are. If you call their customer service they go above and beyond to make sure the customer is happy  and make sure when you get off the phone you concern is resolved. But I feel that like some banks they do have some fees that can be rather high which is a deterrent if you tend to overdraft. Which has happened to me by accident but the first and only time it happened to me customer service helped me with the fees. I give Wells Fargo 5 out of 5 because of their superior service

name: BliaKong Lee
review: I was originally a Wachovia customer and loved my experience with Wachovia, so I was a little worried when Wells Fargo bought out Wachovia about three years ago.  However, I have had no issues with Wells Fargo and truly enjoy the benefits of being with a large bank that has branches throughout the United States.   My husband also has a business checking account with Wells Fargo, and I love it that we can connect all of our accounts together with just one login for online banking.
