I also like their new feature where you can send money out to anyone, or anyone can send money to you through text message or email.  Customer support is available via phone 24 hours a day, and I also like that I can go almost anywhere within the United States and still find a Wells Fargo.  With smaller banks, I always hated that I had to call them to increase the spending limits on my Visa/Mastercard debit cards because I could not go to a nearby bank to pull out additional money.  The only thing that is a little annoying is the fact that sometimes tellers will try to sell me a bank offer (such as life insurance or a new credit card).  They usually stop when I tell them I am not interested, but there have been a few stubborn ones who have tried calling me after I have left the bank location.  Other than that, I have no complaints with Wells Fargo.

name: Krayziie Foxx'
review: When I was 16 years old, I was able to open up a savings account with Wachovia. It was really all that I needed seeing as though I doubted I'd be writing many checks. Plus I wanted to save all of my hard earned money from my first job so that I could go to college. When I started my freshman year in college I was advised by a banker (at my then local branch) that I was eligible for a FREE student checking account. This was joy to my ears, to say the least. I have been banking with Wachovia, now Wells Fargo, for 6 years now and the experience as a customer has been anything but great. The customer service reps are always helpful when it comes to my financial needs! Whenever you need something done, you can bet on it that Wells Fargo will take care of you!

name: Seah Bankston
review: Applying for the Wells Fargo credit card was one of the best decisions I've ever made. The application process was fast and easy and I was notified of approval in a short amount of time. This card has been great for purchasing school supplies and used textbooks to making bigger purchases. Also the cash back incentive has really added up! Whenever I experience any problems, the support team is very helpful. This card has been a great way to begin establishing credit history and I've been able to better manage my spending and keep track of purchases. Plus there's no annual fees like a lot of credit card companies!

name: Laurie Menke
review: I have had the Wells Fargo Platinum Visa since 2006 and have generally been happy with it.  They have raised my limit several times over the years, which really helps in this difficult economy!  I do wish that cash advances were treated the same as purchases--no extra fees or increased interest rate.  I also wish that the interest would be charged on the same day that the monthly payment is due, so that there is never any issue with going over my credit limit.  I appreciate Wells Fargo for giving me this card, and feel that they have been very fair in their dealings regarding it.

name: WalletHub
review: Unfortunately, cash advances are going to be expensive no matter what card you use.  That’s why you should only take advantage of one in a true emergency.  If you want a low-cost way to access cash, check out the GreenDot Gold Prepaid Card.

name: Dany Anguiano
review: Its a decent card. Wells fargo has called me wondering what I was spending on which made me feel like I was protected. I had bought a laptop and my card was frozen because of how big the purchase was.the interest rate is pretty high but that's to be expected, its a credit card. rewards are nice but really not enough. The payments became higher than I was expecting, and being a college kid, that really takes a toll on my monthly income. Kinda regret getting this card but it has helped in some tough situations. Do your research before you apply.

name: Emma
review: I was an inherited customer when Wells Fargo bought Wachovia a few years back. That being said, it's always difficult to suddenly be working with an institution you didn't choose. I chose to bank with Wachovia...but my experiences with Wells Fargo have been largely good. The availability of ATMs is more with Wells Fargo, which is very convenient. I especially appreciate the ability to deposit checks at ATMs without envelopes and get the check image printed on the receipt for record keeping. This virtually eliminates my trips to the bank as I can direct deposit my paycheck and deposit anything I need at any ATM, without worrying that they will be out of envelopes. My only complaint is that I found out recently that Wells Fargo charges me when someone writes me a bad check. I always understood that if a person wrote a check and didn't have the money to cover it, they would be responsible for the fees involved (not the innocent check acceptor). But sure enough, the one time recently it happened I was charged a fee. That accounts for the minus one star because that just seems unfair. However, when I called the customer service line I was given a "courtesy" waive of half of the fee, which did show some effort to compromise and resolve the problem and in the end left me satisfied overall.

name: Ashley Walls
review: When I first moved away to go to college, I opened a checking account at a Wachovia Bank. My checking account had no minimum balance requirement, and my checking account-which had some nice features-was free. Then came Wells Fargo. Wells Fargo absorbed my Wachovia location, and then the issues began. I have had multiple issues with the money in my checking account taking a long time to be posted and available. I also opened a safe deposit box account with Wells Fargo. When I signed up, I was told the first year was free. Later that month, I received a bill for $40 for getting a box. Then, two months ago, I received a statement saying I would now be charged a monthly fee if my checking account were not filled up to a minimum balance, which is high for a college student. I should still have a student checking account, but for some reason they have switched me over. The people at my branch are extremely friendly, but the products have suffered since my Wachovia takeover, and I plan to pursue banking elsewhere in the near future.

name: yaremis
review: I opened my Wells Fargo account around 2008 when I had started college and I need a free account for my savings and school refunds. I was warmly greeted into the Wells Fargo family and did my transactions with ease and no trouble at all. What I love about this bank is that I needed no minimum to securely withdraw and deposit my money, there are no fees that I know of, however that is about change on August 7th according to the new policies. Overall, I donât have a complaint about them as I have been pretty satisfied with how the system works especially if you are a student.

name: hari sharma
review: I currently have my home mortgage with this bank and I must say that they are the best. I got transferred to them from old mortgage bank and this bank is best in everything. Their customer service is A+. I wanted to re-finance my home loan and I received a very good deal from them. They changed my interest rate from over 10% to 4% with no problem and their paperwork was minimum compare to my old lender. I would like open a saving account with this bank since their interest rate looks very eye catching. A+. I would definitely recommend this bank to my friends and anybody who wants mortgage.

name: Pedro Gonzalez
review: Recently our smaller bank was absorbed by Wells Fargo and at first I was quite satisfied with the level of service, products and ease of transition. However I recently received an email indicating that checking accounts without a monthly direct deposit of less than $500 will be subject to fees. As I am in a mainly cash business I am very troubled and disappointed by this development. We will be shopping for a new bank with TRULY free checking before the fees start in August. It's especially troubling cause at the time of change we were promised no new fees, no real change in the products we were so comfortable with for so long and it seems as if they are slowly, little by little, doing their best to undermine our trust and swindle us out of every penny they can.

name: Ruben
review: I have a secondary account here that I use mainly for me and my mother to swap money back and forth with when we need a little help. It isn't what I use to pay my bills or anything of that magnitude, but I've always appreciated how accommodating they've been regarding the use of the account. A lot of banks will give you a hard time for an account that doesn't have a lot of money in it and is frequently going up to something substantial only for it to be taken out at another location a few hours later. I received one e-mail a long time ago about "suspicious activity" but that's really been it, they've let us go as we please for years.

name: nick green
review: I took out an auto loan through Wells Fargo and also opened a checking account with them to simply use as a reservoir for my car payments. The reason I decided to use Wells Fargo was the fair interest rate that they provided me. I had shopped around and located a few low interest rates, but Wells Fargo was able to beat the other banks. I decided to work with them and the teller advised me to use a checking account with them as well, as this would make things easier when it came time to pay my monthly bill. I haven't experienced any problems with Wells Fargo to this point. It's very simple to transfer funds over and pay my bill. I haven't actually entered the bank in months because I can do all of my banking online and make deposits through the drive through. It's a very convenient service and I prefer the ease in which I can carry out transactions.

name: Gordon
review: I've been a Wachovia customer for about a year before the takeover by Wells Fargo. I figured I would remain with the bank and see what they had to offer. After having some bad experiences with other banks, I wasn't too keen on switching again. I must say that so far, I've had nothing but positive experiences with this bank. Other banks seemed to have unfair practices with disclosure issues and unreasonable fees, which luckily, I haven't yet experienced while being a Wells Fargo customer. Another important aspect of this bank that I like is top notch customer service; they have been nothing but helpful. I would recommend this bank highly to anyone looking for a good bank with great customer care practices.

name: Larissa Tyler
review: Well, I have moved all my accounts to Wells Fargo as of two weeks ago and it seems to be going well so far. I was getting nickel and dimed at my credit union, so I gradually started transferring all my accounts away from them.  I ended up refinancing my auto loan with Wells Fargo and got a lower rate than I was paying at my old credit union and now I transferred my checking account there as well. I really like the "Way To Save" account feature. It will automatically transfer $1.00 every time you use your debit card and I have it set up to pull $25 a week from my checking into this account. It is a great way to save some spare cash along with my standard savings account. So currently, I am very pleased with their Relationship Banking approach and will update my review in the future if needed.

name: Christian Greenup
review: My experience with Wells Fargo Bank was very interesting and exciting. When I first heard about Wells Fargo, I was told from a financial counselor that Wells Fargo had bad service for students loans. I didn't know what to believe, so I took my chances with choosing  Wells Fargo as one of my main college fund lenders. Within, the first 2 days of me completing my application they had already received my financial aid and sent me my disbursement. My classes were paid for on time and I was one happy college student. I even got my money for my books and living expenses on time and processed. I am very satisfied to be affiliated and a client of Wells Fargo Bank. I wouldn't trust many other banks with that much of my money ...

name: James Wright
review: I've been with Wachovia for a long time and was kind of scared when Wells Fargo took over. However the fear quickly went away after experiencing the kind tellers and above decent customer service which is saying a lot coming from me. The bank locations I’ve had the pleasure of going to are extremely clean and the employees are all so nice, always remembering me and my family. There are also enough locations in my area to keep me from having to back track, which definitely keeps the gas bill down. All in all, I think this is a great bank and even though I started with Wachovia. I'm here to stay with Wells Fargo.

name: Amanda House
review: I have had dealings with this bank in the past and unfortunately things did not go so well. The employees at this bank were seemingly always in a bad mood. Whenever I had any problem occur, it seemed as though they had no time to deal with me. I was always rushed and it felt like I was not a priority for them. The bank was also very nasty as well, every time I walked in the floor was obviously dirty and there was always an odor. It felt like nobody cleaned the building what so ever. These things combined together did not make for a very pleasant experience with this bank.

name: Ryan Wachter
review: Wells Fargo is an absolutely amazing bank. I was originally with Wachovia before Wells Fargo took over. Wachovia was an average bank, they had problems with customer service especially. Wells Fargo's customer service is the best I've ever experienced in the banking industry. They actually go out of their way to resolve your problem instead of just deflecting with useless statements. I had my card stolen about a month ago. I called up Wells Fargo and asked for them to cancel and replace it. This was done very quickly and efficiently by a very respectful customer service rep. I would highly recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a bank, best bank hands down.

name: Rachel Duncan
review: I was with Wachovia before they were taken over by Wells Fargo. Back then I had trouble with their customer service and issues with getting problems like overdue balances taken care of. It seems like they never wanted to give me a break, which is not something I was used to experiencing. However since they have switched I seem to notice a change. The customer service reps have been excellent with me and my checking account is doing better then ever. I never had a problem with the application process that was easy and when they switched to Wells Fargo there was little to no trouble with the change over.

name: wesley anderson
review: I banked with wells Fargo for just a few months before they hit me with hundreds of dollars worth of overdrafts.  I realize that it is a policy and in reality they are helping me out.  But they could have explained the process with while they gave me the account like U.S. bank does.  I was just 19 and hit with all these fees with no way to pay.  I have been in a few different branches and received varying customer service.  All in all I would tell people to stay away from this conglomerate.  Stay local, small business ethics are far superior to large business.   U.S bank all the way.  Far better at everything if you need to go big, otherwise go to a First National or something.

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: I have not needed to do any problem resolution yet, so my rating on that point doesn't mean much. But I expect it would be 5-star, just like everything else about this bank.Wells Fargo offers the best interests rates I can find for student loans... When you are borrowing 10-15K every year, a few percentage points can mean a lot! Student loans can feel overwhelming, but since I know I have found the best deal here, I can rest easy.And of course, whenever I walk into this bank I feel welcome. Someone is always waiting to help me, and they have good coffee too!

name: Joshua
review: I have had very few problems with this bank. The customer service is always helpful and willing to answer my questions when I have them. I wish they would do a little less pushing of their services when I am doing a simple transaction, especially after I decline initially. I also wish that the branch I visit had more convenient weekday hours or some hours on the weekend.  It is often difficult for me to get to the closest branch due to the limited hours. I have only used their checking services and have no complaints. Their online banking is great and easy to use. I use online payments for nearly everything and have never had an issue.

name: Cleta Brookstein
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo before Wells Fargo was bought out by my former bank.  I have found Wells Fargo to be very accommodating and always helpful, regardless of what my banking needs are.  I currently have a checking account, savings account and mortgage loan with Wells Fargo.  I shop at Randalls Supermarket where a Wells Fargo branch is conveniently located inside.  On-line banking is a benefit, as well as being able to check my statements on-line.  I've noticed just about anywhere I travel, there is a Wells Fargo bank, so ATM machines are also very conveniently located.

name: Brad H
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for about 8 years. I really have been pretty happy with them, I have two checking and two savings accounts and I feel pretty taken care of.  The couple times I've had issues, the customer service people have been quick to try and take care of me.  My only gripe is that since the new rules about overdraft fees have been put in place on banks, they've started adding monthly fees to most accounts.  Right now, I'm paying about $25 a month for my second checking and savings accounts and this seems pretty high.  The fees also didn't come with much forewarning or explanation, I kind of found them and figured them out after the fact. I did look at other banks but haven't found many that can give me the same benefits, other than a couple local credit unions. But the company I work for wouldn't be able to direct deposit to them so they're not an option for me.  I CAN say that I've never had any of the crazy issues my family has had with other banks, so I'm happy about that.

name: Amber Finch
review: Wells Fargo has a great reputation among banks, and for good reason. I love my bank, because they treat you like family rather than just like a 'customer'. Someone is always there to help assist me when I have a question or need something sorted. They have free and paid checking, both do what it says on the tin. Honestly, I even love the horse mascot. I've been banking with them for a very long time and I do not think there's another bank out there that can come close to the customer service and value that Wells Fargo offers.

name: Christopher Sato
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for the past couple of years.  I have both a checking and savings account. I initially joined Wells Fargo because I was informed that there was a promotional program available offering some cash as an incentive to start a business account. I went in and spoke with a personal banker who was extremely helpful.  I was able to set up the account quickly on my lunch break and have kept it every since.  I plan on keeping this account open. I do wish that there are more Wells Fargo ATM machines in the area.  I do use the website on a regular and find it easy to navigate and find the information I am searching for.

name: Seth Jones
review: What can I say about Wells Fargo that will pay them due justice? I began like many first home buyers with a poorly constructed mortgage by a no name broker. He ended up drafting what was referred to as a “no doc” loan. I later understood it as a “no document” loan. I contacted wells Fargo because I have always heard great things about their service. I was given a meeting with a new broker the very same day, and she even stayed after hours to get a new mortgage drafted. When I left I felt like I finally understood how a mortgage works and how to read my amortization schedule. They are truly about the customers.

name: Mary Scarlett
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for a number of years. I originally started banking with them when they were First Union. They changed to Wachovia shortly after I opened my account with them and most recently to Wells Fargo. My transition was relatively smooth.There were a few changes that I wouldn’t have been aware of had my lovely customer service representative not pointed them out.  The additional charges I was to incur as a result of the type of account I was using weren’t exactly clear. The customer service representative, however, made a point to explain them to me and then find a better account for me.I understand things aren’t always easy when change occurs, but Wells Fargo made me feel right at home.

name: Irene
review: I use Wells Fargo for three checking accounts: my personal, my joint with spouse, and my LLC. The benefits of using Wells Fargo is that you can see all of your accounts in one view.  Also, it is very easy to transfer money between the accounts online, and one is also able to specify a description for each transfer (although special characters, like a hyphen, are not permitted, which can be annoying.)When I have had issues, such as a late BillPay or a transaction that is in the wrong amount, or an incorrectly levied fee, Wells Fargo customer service personnel on the phone have been capable of correcting the problem. I do not like their phone tree, however, and would prefer to go into a branch to take care of the issue.We also receive on occasion checks from other denominations (such as in British pounds), and it is somewhat inconvenient that I have to go into a bank branch to deposit those, and it is subject to the exchange rates of the day.Because we have all of our accounts at Wells Fargo, plus our mortgage, we fall under their "Premium Customer" designation, which means we are able to avoid many fees. I do not think I would like to be a Wells Fargo customer if we did not have this designation -- I would probably go to a community bank or credit union.

name: Richie Charlette
review: I am particularly fond of this card largely because of its reliability. Perhaps from just a streak of bad luck, other cards I have used have presented numerous problems; namely, denied payments, or unwarranted cancellation by the card issuer. Carrying my Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card with me ensures that, provided I need to make an unexpected purchase, I can trust that it will be carried out without a hitch. Additionally, I bank primarily with Wells Fargo, making it extremely easy to make payments at any time using their website. Payments are fast and secure, and the interface on the website is very intuitive. I have had a very positive experience with this card and would recommend it to others who are looking for a good, reliable, "no frills" card.

name: Rebeca Rao
review: I got this as my first credit card in college. Wells Fargo’s customer service has always been helpful and I haven’t had any problems with all the years I’ve been with them. I think this credit card is a decent starter for those with low or no credit but I wouldn't recommend it for people with already established credit. There aren't any rewards that I'm aware of and the APR rate can get rather high once the introductory period is over. I would only recommend it for building credit but other than that, there isn't anything special it offers. It's just a basic credit card.

name: Xion Blargeg
review: I have not been using this card for long but I am greatly satisfied with it. When I first got this card I had no credit and now am slowly building up my credit score. This card is great if you have bad or no credit and has few benefits, most of which I don’t need. The APR rate is decent and they have great customer service. I have had to call a few times before and every time I was take care of properly and considerately. Paying this card is easy if you set up the automatic payments and overall I think this is a great card.

name: J Marley
review: I was with Wachovia when Wells Fargo purchased them. Overall, I would say  that I was pretty pleased with the services I have received as a result of the merger. I rated 3 stars mostly because of the service I have received at one of the local branches. The employees are extremely rude. Compared to BB&T and Bank of America who I have previously banked with, I like Wells Fargo the best by far! I love that the new ATMs accept cash and checks sans deposit slips and that the cash posts to your account immediately! I also get free checking and savings due to meeting the direct deposit guidelines. If you want a bank that wont push you around, Wells Fargo is the way to go!

name: Sandra D Goliver
review: My experience with Wells Fargo has not been good.  In November 2011, I received a check for $4500 that was suppose to be from a sweepstakes I won.  I had been completing surveys online and got entries to various sweepstakes for every survey I completed, so it was believable to me that I won this money.  I presented the check to Wells Fargo for cashing because I believed that this would verify that the check was indeed legitimate.  I thought in this day and age, with all of our available technology, that a bank would know immediately whether a check was good or not.  Apparently I was wrong.  The bank cashed the check, I used the money to pay my rent up several months, and a week or so later I am notified that the check was no good and I now owe $4500.  Unable to repay this money, I lost both my checking and savings accounts and cannot get an account with any bank period.  Now this is on my credit report.

name: Jason W
review: For full disclaimer I used to work for this bank. As a customer I am pretty happy. I have a good account, really enjoy their online banking and don't pay anything in fees. My experience is helped with the fact that I know I'm in the right account. Wells Fargo is really big into packaging accounts and if you play by the rules, it can be pretty inexpensive. I rarely go into a branch or call customer service so I canât say much about their service. I still have friends that work there so whenever I do need a little help they are there for me. I like the fact that I can go inside one of their branches and get foreign cash, a service Iâm not aware other banks offer. I have just about everything with them so moving banks would be tough. If they stay the same Iâll stick around.

name: kara linder
review: I have only had great experiences with this bank.  The customer service was always great, friendly smiles, and pretty-looking faces.  I always felt like I could trust the employees there, which is so important.   However, I didn't really use my account that much, since I was trying to save my money the best I could. I actually left money in there for over a year without touching it, but then, when it was time for me to take my money and go, no problems at all.  So thankful! I had a terrible experience with another bank when I tried to close my account once, so I was on the lookout.  Also, the debit card I used a couple times and never had a problem with it. I like this bank because it is in so many locations and is never hard to find.  Although it is nice to find one location to always go to, so that the tellers know me and how to help me.

name: nicole peterson
review: I have been completely satisfied with the services offered by my bank.  My husband and I switched to Wells Fargo approximately eight years ago and we have no desire to even look into other banks.  We feel that we get a lot of perks with our checking account that other banks either do not offer or they charge a crazy fee for the service.  They have been easy to work with when we have changed our residence and ordered new checks.  Anytime we have had to actually go in the bank, all of the employees have been nothing but pleasant towards us.  Wells Fargo also has ATMs across the United States so when traveling I can use my debit card everywhere instead of carrying large amounts of cash or travelers checks with me.  Overall I am satisfied with Wells Fargo and what they offer to their customers.

name: Kayla Robbins
review: Ugh. I wouldn't recommend this bank. Really, just stay away from them if you can help it. Wells Fargo is the epitome of corporate bureaucracy not caring about its customers. You’ll just have to jump through a lot of hoops and go through red tape that you wouldn’t have to face with a local credit union or something of the like. Yes, they’re available in many more locations, but expect to pay for that privilege in account fees. I’m sure this is a good bank for people who have a large sum of money, but for those who are starting out with less, it can really drain you.

name: latoya gaston
review: I live a rural area where the banking options are really non existent. So I am forced to do the majority of my  banking by mail. I love Wells Fargo on the whole. I did not have a hard time getting my account open. My internet was not working to well so I ended up having to call them on the phone and get the savings account open. They solved the problem.  The representative took all my information and then I did the verification questions over the phone. The thought of having to verify my identity made me feel a hundred percent more confident about having an account open with them. She told me that I would be receiving my welcome package in the mail and gave me a general overview of the disclosure statements that I would be receiving in the mail. I got my package exactly eight days later. I read over the disclosure they seemed simple enough.  I didn't feel worried and I've been banking with them ever since.

name: Tasha Stackhouse
review: I started a Wells Fargo account while I was living in California. At the time, I was very happy with everything my account had to offer. The customer service was great, there were plenty of locations in the San Francisco Bay Area, and last but not least, I was benefiting from great interest rates. Everything changed once I moved to New York City. There are no convenient locations anywhere in the city. Plus, the great customer service representatives that I grew to love now were my enemies that could never help me at all. I quickly dropped Wells Fargo after the constant hassles. Wells Fargo should stop proclaiming to be a national financial institution when it truly is nothing more than an over glorified regional bank.

name: Sarah
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for over 7 years and could not be happier with them. I deal with most of the big banks on a regular basis for work-related reasons and I always feel Wells Fargo has the friendliest staff. At my local branch I always receive a warm welcome and the Branch Manager who signed me up for my very first account 7 years ago still takes time to say hi to me and remembers my name. Over the years, I have not had a single problem with unexplained banking fees or strange charges. I now rely on Wells Fargo for all my checking, savings, and credit needs.

name: Dani Warner
review: I was formerly with Wachovia Bank and was changed over to Wells Fargo when Wachovia was acquired. Wells Fargo is an okay bank, better than other accounts I have had. Their fees are not too high. I travel overseas a lot and that can get to be expensive. I think Wells Fargo charges a reasonable amount for their transaction fees. I have only run into a few problems, and they have usually been solved pretty quickly. I am fairly satisfied with the service I receive from Wells Fargo and probably will not change banks anytime soon. The only thing is that their customer service is hit or miss. I have talked to some lovely phone operators and tellers -- but I have also talked with rude employees as well.

name: Jerardo
review: I have not been a Wells Fargo customer for long but I feel very valued as a customer already. When I applied for a card they were very helpful in the process and made it go easily. I was uncertain of which type of account to get but they explained every type clearly and I feel that I have made the right decision. I have been with them for about 3 years now and I have never had any problems with them. I recently needed to apply for a credit card and they were very helpful and approved me even though I had a nearly nonexistent credit rating. I now have good credit and am very thankful for that. Overall a pretty good bank.

name: ali strubo
review: I first started banking with Wells Fargo when I was in High School, as they have a good feature that allows a teen checking account through your parents account. This enables you to learn how to manage your money, make transfers etc. easily. Wells Fargo locations are very convenient and are always found in places when I am traveling, which makes it a very convenient bank to be part of. The customer service representatives are always very friendly and helpful. I have had a few problems with purchases going through that I did not make. Wells Fargo made it extremely simple to rectify these problems, a simple call or email complaint was filed and they addressed the problem between 7-14 business days. I also recently had a problem with being charged a service charge, and as a student I was appalled I was not notified of these changes being made to my bank. I contacted a local service branch and this issue was quickly adjusted in a polite and efficient manner.

name: amy
review: I was with Wachovia before it became part of Wells Fargo.  My free student savings account suddenly started costing me $5-10 a month for not maintaining a minimum balance, when there originally was no minimum.  On the plus side, they resolved my identity theft issues quickly, returned money with no hassles and sent me a new check card with no issues.

name: Shane
review: I've been overall very satisfied in my time with Wells Fargo. I switched to them from Citibank back in 2005 when Citi started adding some pretty exorbitant fees to their plans. Signing up for accounts on Wells Fargo's website is easy. I was able to set up Checking and Savings accounts completely online, and with Direct Deposit pay nothing for checking, and for a small auto-debit over to my savings, pay nothing for that either!During difficult times, they've also offered a Direct Deposit Advance feature, which allows you to advance yourself up to $500 from your next paycheck. Great if you have an unexpected expense, like car troubles. They charge a relatively nominal fee ($1.50 per every $20) and even allow you to pay it back over time so you don't find yourself penniless come next paycheck.I've never had to wait too long on the phone, though I rarely need to call them. Their website shows me pretty much everything I need to know.Any time I've gone into a branch to make a withdrawaldeposit, the banks are always clean, the staff is friendly, and the service is fast. I'm happy overall, and expect to remain a Wells Fargo customer for many more years.

name: Megan Simmons
review: My dad opened a bank account for me because he wanted to save some money for me to go to college. I have a way to save savings account with Wells Fargo, and so far, my experience has been nothing but pleasant. I can use their online banking and see the balance in my account and it's fast and secure. I like the speed of the transfers from bank accounts. I have not seen any fees that the other users were talking about in my bank account, so I don't know if that's going to occur to me or not. The application process was easy, my father and I just went into the branch and set it up in less than 20 minutes. All he had to do was put in a deposit in the savings account and we were ready to go. The customer service inside the branch was excellent, we were attended to right away and the banker answered all our questions. Wells Fargo is a good bank in my opinion.

name: jenny
review: Wells Fargo has changed my mind about all banks. I had two bank accounts before I decided to go with Wells Fargo. The other two banks were secretly screwing me over all the time. I was fed up and didn't get a bank account for about a year. Then I had to have one due to the job that I had, direct deposit was mandatory. I went into the Wells Fargo in Burnsville, MN by Burnsville Center. They were awesome. Dirk, my banker was extremely nice and VERY VERY honest. He was so helpful that still to this day (its been a little over a year since I got the account) I go in and talk to him and he helps me out and even remembers me by name. I have a checking and 2 savings accounts. Wells Fargo has a great system.

name: jammese
review: I started an account with Wells Fargo last year August, they gave me the opportunity to open an account with my credit rating under an account called second opportunity banking. I am glad that the bank gave me a chance to rebuild my credit. It is very important to have a bank account these days. The bank is very professional and even when you go inside in the branch they greet you promptly and friendly. Whenever I go inside to the bank all the workers are doing their jobs and go the extra mile in trying to help each other with perfection. I am glad that I am a customer with Wells Fargo and I hope that I can continue to grow with them and hopefully I will be able to buy my first home using help from Wells Fargo.

name: Shelly Chalace
review: I currently bank with Wells Fargo (but started out with Wachovia) and have done so for 2 years. I own a checking and savings account with them and I've really enjoyed banking with them up until recently. I have never been charged a fee once since I've been with them but I was just notified that they will now be charging monthly fees to have a checking account with them unless you meet certain standards, like always having a $1500 balance on the account. Why ruin such a good thing? I'm wondering if Wachovia changing over to Wells Fargo has anything to do with it because I started out as a Wachovia banker.  I guess now I will have to find a new bank!

name: Nikki Irene
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for two years now, but before they had became Wells Fargo They were Wachovia. I really liked when they were Wachovia more so than I like them now. When they were Wachovia they had real free checking. Now, that they are Wells Fargo there is no such thing as real free checking. My son who receives SSI also has a checking account with Wells Fargo and now they say in order for it to be free checking he must have $1,000 deposited every month or keep $2,000 in his Account at all time to have the $10.00 monthly fee waved. I feel that this is not right for people that are on a fixed income. I even went to Wells Fargo to try and have the problem resolved. That did not go as planed the employees there acted as if they did not know what they were doing at all told me that my son needed a savings account so the $10.00 would be waved. So, he has a savings and it did not wave the $10.00 dollars it only waves the $3.00 for the savings and not the $10.00. All in all I think we may be switching to a new bank so they bank will not be getting another poor person's money that he does not have to give to a bank.

name: RAENADA JOHNSON
review: Wells Fargo is very inaccurate. They once over drafted my account after they let another customer to withdraw from my account and did not even recognize their mistake. I noticed it one day when I checked my balance and when I contacted customer service about it, they TRIED to convince ME that I was the one who was wrong! She finally took the time and initiative to look into it further and found that it was a (huge) mistake on their behalf. She apologized but it really did not seem sincere. I will never bank with them again, nor will I recommend them to anyone!

name: Bryan Cubbins
review: If you are looking for a bank that is going to cater to all of your banking needs then you need to go with Wells Fargo. I've been with many banks and this is the best one by far. They take the time to make sure you feel good putting your money in their bank. They also have a great customer support staff that will help you with any questions you may have. This bank has never failed me and is always there for me. I had a problem with one of my deposits about a month ago and they took care of it no questions asked. What more could you ask for out of your bank?

name: Amanda Wallace
review: I first started with Wachovia back in 2008. Then I was transitioned over to Wells Fargo when they acquired Wachovia. It was a smooth transition and not much changed with my account. I also received my new debit card on time without any hassles. I only have a checking account with Wells Fargo. I used to have a Way To Save account with Wachovia, where everything you purchased with your debit card they would take $1 and transfer it to you Way To Save account. Wells Fargo has since done away with that. It's not such a big deal to me though, since I always used to transfer the money back into my checking account since I needed it. So far I guess I like Wells Fargo, much more than Bank of America. Their customer service is alright, but not as good as you would get with a local bank. Sometimes they take care of my problems right away and with little fuss and other times it takes the customer service a few days to get back to me. Besides that, I would say Wells Fargo is good for a basic checking account. When I get around to using more of their financial services I will update my review.

name: Melissa
review: I have been a customer at Wells Fargo for over five years now. Since I first opened my checking account I have had nothing but great experiences with the company.  There customer service is top notch and they are always there to help with whatever needs you may have. Whenever I walk into the local Wells Fargo they remember my name and are nothing but friendly and helpful.  In May I traveled to Europe and the customer service representative did everything in her power to make sure I had an easy transition; she even went as far as to send me an e-mail with tips with using my card when traveling to other countries.  These are just a few examples of the great customer service I have received. I would trust no one else with my banking needs!

name: zach
review: I have been a customer with Wells Fargo since it was First Union Bank, and then later changed to Wachovia.  I currently have a checking account, savings account, and a credit card through Wells Fargo and couldn't be happier.  The customer service is top notch and I have had nothing but positive experiences with them.  I was in another country for a few weeks a few years ago and had some issues with insufficient funds due to delayed transactions from the other country.  I called up and talked to a representative on the phone, explained my situation and without hesitation I was reimbursed the money I was charged as a fee for having insufficient funds.

name: Christine Saja
review: My student loan was taken over by Wells Fargo three years ago, and I have been quite pleased ever since. I have several payment options, whether over the phone, online linked with my checking account, or by mail. The payments are processed quickly, and they are very lenient with late fees, usually two to three weeks before they will charge you. I never have any problems with their customer service and am overall very happy to be doing all by banking business with the same company. I have a lot of experience with other student loan companies and have to say that this has been the best one by far.

name: John Updegraff
review: I was with Wachovia Bank before Wells Fargo took over them a few years ago. I can tell you that they have been nothing short of great with all their checking features and easy access to so many branches in my town. This makes it very easy for someone my age to get in the door to see someone face to face to answer my questions. I am just of the sorts that I trust someone that is in front of me, instead of automated help over the phone or online. They are a very traditional company and I have loved having them have my business. I would recommend them to others without any reservation.

name: Anthony
review: I recently applied for a student loan with Wells Fargo after researching other numerous private loans. After a recommendation from a fellow student I decided to go with Wells Fargo. Filling out the application online was very easy and the customer service representative whom I talked to was also very informative. She explained away any concerns that I still had at the time and was helpful to make sure which loan was best for me and the amount I actually needed. She walked me through step by step to make sure I filled everything out correctly and told me of the time frames I had to do things by. In the coming days after that, I got emails from her detailing my specific loan. Overall, it was a great experience, and I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a great, competitive student private loan.

name: Jessica Harper
review: Wells Fargo is definitely one of the better banks I have ever tried out. Every time I have a problem and have to call the customer service line, I get very prompt service and they usually take care of it right away. A little while ago my account was charged a returned check fee even though my account had plenty of money for the check to go through. I called the customer service line, ready to yell at whatever poor sucker happened to answer the line but as soon as I explained what happened, they typed a few keys on the keyboard and said the problem was fixed. I didn't believe they could fix it that quickly, but when I went to look at my online account, the money had been refunded already.

name: Elliot Saks
review: I've been banking with Wells Fargo for many years, and they've been great.  I regularly use a wide variety of their services to include direct deposit, online banking, online bill pay, and even getting cashier's checks from local branches to make payments occasionally.  My problems with Wells Fargo have been very minimal and I can't really complain about anything other than their abysmal interest rates for savings account.  Because interest rates are so low, I keep most of my savings with an online bank that has higher rates.  This method isn't shocking to anybody that's financially savvy, though.  What I like about Wells Fargo is how good they are about problem resolution and customer service.  Any time there has been any type of issue at all, no matter how minor, I know that I'll get a friendly, results-oriented response from Wells Fargo when I call.  Here's a great example.  A few weeks ago someone wrote me a bad check.  WF charged me a small fee for the check bouncing.  I was broke at the time.  I literally had less than $10 in my checking account and could not afford to pay even a $12 fee if I wanted to eat that day.  So I called WF and explained the situation, and they waived half of the fee.  I was eventually able to collect the rest from the party who had written the bad check in the first place, so it all worked out. Wells Fargo has always been more than satisfactory.  I wish their savings interest rates were higher, but I can't do much about that for the time being.  As a bank, I recommend them. Pros:  Excellent customer service, good online services, military friendlyCons:  Low interest rates on savings

name: Youngbear
review: Wells Fargo bank is not a friendly neighborhood bank. I only use Wells Fargo bank for my heavy-hitter financial needs; Wells Fargo bank has always handled my home mortgages and any other long term financial transactions. It has taken a number of years to build a comfortable working relationship with them. I do not find their personnel to be trained in personalized service. Rather, they are highly organized, knowledgeable number crunchers. I have yet, over a period of twenty years, to find a single error on any paperwork or statements of record that they generate to me. You won't get any bargains at Wells Fargo bank; you will get accountability, dependability, and organization.

name: Kevin O'Donnell
review: Overall Wells Fargo is a very suitable bank.  I feel as though they have never done anything great to foster loyalty, but they haven't done anything to drive me away.  My only complaint is regarding my checking account.  I had over drawn my account by a total of 4 dollars,  I ended up being assessed about 70 dollars in fees.  I felt this was a little much for an honest mistake.  I called and complained and they eventually reimbursed me for the fees.

name: Christine C
review: I opened my personal checking and savings account with Wells Fargo approximately one year ago after being assessed several unreasonable fees at my previous bank.  I can honestly say that I have no complaints about this establishment.  I have encountered a few employees who have been less than helpful, but any issue I've had to date has been quickly resolved either over the phone or by a branch manager.  I particularly like how they also break down my spending by category for me.  I have also started using Wells Fargo for my small business (both saving and checking) and have had a very pleasant experience with this service as well!

name: Christina
review: I opened an account with Wells Fargo and I thought they were really great. The process was really easy, and the accountant who opened the account was very friendly and helpful. She answered all of my questions with good answers. Although it took an hour or two to sign up, it didn't feel like it took that long at all. Over all, my experience with them was great. I gave them 5 stars for customer service because the accountant was good, 5 stars for application process because it was nice and easy, and 5 stars for problem resolution because she (the accountant) changed my contact info and phone number with no fuss. The only thing I didn't rate them great on was clear disclosures, because I'm still not sure the interest rate on my account. I asked the accountant, but now I've forgotten. I seem to remember it being reasonable though...

name: Wei
review: I've been with Wells Fargo for about 6 years now and I have to say that it has been the most pathetic banking experience I have ever (or will ever) have. I really cannot wait any longer to get my accounts out of there and into an institution that doesn't treat me like a bag or a number. They are truly pathetic.The first sign of their immediate decline was the fact that I went from a free checking to an account scheme that billed me $5.99 a month. When called about this, they stated that I had received all of the disclosure information in the mail and that my checking account had moved to a pay account system. The disclosure was of course (just like a credit card statement), it was 3 pages long and you needed a Finance degree to read through it. Why can't they just state crap like that in simple, easy to read terms? Pathetic.Anyway, Wells Fargo is now gone for me, I will never bank with them again. I wouldn't recommend them to anyone.

name: Tine
review: My experiences with Wells Fargo have been stable enough.  I have had a checking account there for a few years.  The major problem I've had is the attempt to switch what type of account I had to one with different interest rates.  Basically Wells Fargo has screwed me out a hundreds of dollars of interest because they refused to switch accounts without a very unnecessary process.  Another problem I had was all the double talk I got attempting to order some new checks.  The person who took my order ended up charging me nearly fifty bucks, just for plain new checks.  It was absurd.

name: Matthew Glantz
review: My experiences with Wells Fargo can be summed up in one word. BAD. The only reason I still stay with them is because they are everywhere on campus at my college. If they weren't, I would have closed my account a long time ago. I like going into a bank and knowing who works there and being on a first name basis. At Wells Fargo, I feel like I am just a 15 digit number. At my old bank (a small credit union) I was on first name basis with everyone  there and whenever I had any questions at all, they were answered in a friendly, detailed manner.

name: Lisa Drake
review: I recently opened up a simple business account with wells fargo. The setup is basic and easy to use. I have had no problems with being able to make withdrawals or view my transactions. Their mobile site seems to have a few glitches, so I opt to use their online service through my PC. Ease of use is simple, the only thing I can say negative about this particular bank is that it has a $12 per month maintenance fee. Kind of steep for basic needs but it gets the job done. If you are looking for the basics I would definitely suggest Wells Fargo.

name: stephen samuels
review: While Wells Fargo is not my primary bank I do have a mortgage with them.  After trying to use my primary bank I went to Wells Fargo to see if they could help with a mortgage and I was pleasantly surprised.  The service I received was prompt and courteous.  They walked me through each step and explained the process in detail.  There was no hidden disclosures, and they were able to get me a very competitive rate.  I would recommend Wells Fargo to any one looking for assistance, and may eventually move my main accounts over to them as well.

name: Katie Pitts
review: I opened an account with Wells Fargo when I got my first job and was in high school.  Initially they seemed like a really great bank, and they had excellent customer service. It was also especially convenient that you can transfer in between accounts (for example, my parents at the time also had a Wells Fargo account) and it is nice that they are nationwide.  However, when I moved away from my initial location to a different location, the people at the Wells Fargo where I had moved had terrible customer service, and I was charged fees that seemed excessive. They also had poor interest rates when it came time for me to search for a home loan and a car loan. Overall, I think it will greatly depend on your location and the customer service available.

name: Richard Thompson
review: I first opened a checking account with Wells Fargo when I started my first job, 14 years ago, and have since opened a savings account and bought several CD's from them. I've yet to be given any reason why I'd ever want to leave. I've had nothing but good experiences with both local branches and ones in other areas when I'm traveling. Their rates have always been reasonable and their staff friendly, going out of their way on several occasions to help me resolve issues that were honestly caused by my own errors. When my debit card number was stolen and used to make purchases, they were quick to shut it down and get the issue resolved so I recovered my money. I hope to continue being a customer for some time.

name: james culigan
review: WellsFargo has generally good customer service, but I've found the service to be better in store compared to talking with someone over the phone.  Their website has been vastly improved over the years, and it's now very easy to actually see all of your services in one place, transfer between accounts, checking your CD and Mutual Fund balances.  One of my big frustrations - and hence only a 4 star review - is that I wish their CD's yielded a higher return, and it's really frustrating that you can't renew a CD online, or even via telephone - you have to go into a branch and talk to someone.

name: Tim
review: My first bank was Wachovia (Wells Fargo). I see it having a high rating on Wallet Hub but I have to disagree. One thing that's important to me is customer service and I just didn't get it out of them. I was often on hold for over 25 minutes in an emergency situation, I wouldn't be given the option to talk to a supervisor, and was often never given the benefit of the doubt. I have an outstanding financial history but at times they treated me as if I was wrong from the start when it involved illegal use of my card. I know not everyone can have great customer service but this spun me the wrong way. I got out before the transition into Wells Fargo so I don't know if it has changed or stayed the same, but for the benefit of others I hope it has changed.

name: wing lee
review: At Wells Fargo, I have had a checking account for about a year now. It has been a fairly easy process to get the account set up, and working. As with all banks, one can expect a deal of trouble and annoyance when it comes to applying for certain services. With Wells Fargo, my level of annoyance was greatly decreased compared to other bank application processes. Over the months, I have not been late on payments, and they haven't charged me anything extra, as is usual. No rogue fees and charges came up on my account, which stands to the security and honesty of the bank. I like this very much. With other banks (unnamed here) random and very often downright wrong fees have come up on my statement many times, but not with Wells Fargo.

name: Joshua Quail
review: This has been a very reliable card for me. They have raised my credit limit twice in a year's time, and when I've called into their hotline for a mistaken overage, they cleared it up right away. Wells Fargo's Bill Pay is a really convenient way to keep my budgeting simple, and is also great because it doesn't count towards my monthly transfer limit as well. All of that, coupled with the convenience of seeing my bank account and credit card balances in the same place online, and having the convenience of the mobile app, has made the whole experience really great.

name: Alex Guerrera
review: Wells Fargo has never given me any reason to be dissatisfied with their service or their credit card. I've been keeping a zero balance with them for years now and they have regularly been upgrading my credit limit and sending me emails encouraging my good spending habits. My only complaint is that there doesn't seem to be much of a rewards system; they have a very basic rather limited cash back program that allows you to withdraw in amounts of 25$, but there doesn't seem to be much that counts towards the cash back program. Overall I'm very pleased and even the limited rewards are nice to earn every once in a while.

name: Megan Hughes
review: Don't have a reason to need to transfer money internationally and you're fine. But that may be more bank account than credit card :/

name: Dan Bowne
review: I currently have the Wells Fargo Home Rebate Credit Card as I also have a mortgage through Wells Fargo. They offer a competitive rate as an introduction period and as well after the introduction period. The fact that as I spend money on my credit card I can earn rebates that help reduce my mortgage by specific amounts, obviously small amounts but any reduction is a good reduction, is a big benefit in my eyes. The customer service I receive is also very good and I’ve had pleasant experiences when calling them. This card is also backed by Visa so it’s accepted at any location. A good card to have in my eyes if you have a mortgage through them.

name: Chris
review: I opened my first checking account with Wells Fargo ten years ago and have had a positive  experience  with this bank. When ever I have had questions or concerns about my checking account they have been addressed fairly and quick. There are many Wells Fargo ATMs around the city I live in for easy free withdraws and Ive never had a problem finding a Wells Fargo in other cities I've traveled to. This is very convenient if you travel as often as I do. However I have had a few minor issues with over draft fees that were inconvenient but resolved fairly.

name: Will
review: I have been at Wells Fargo for as long as I can remember. The employees at Wells Fargo are top notch and are always ready to help you whether it be via telephone or in person. My debit card had recently been stolen a few months ago without my immediate knowledge. My card had been charged somewhere out of state and a representative called me right away to confirm if those were my charges. After checking my activity online, I told them that my debit card was compromised. They assured me that I would not be responsible for those charges and the situation would be settled right away. Besides that incidence, there were other times when I came into Wells Fargo, looking for student loans, and just general questions. The employees were always ready to help and informed me of what they can offer. I always feel welcomed whenever I come in and the employees do take the time to make sure the customers are pleased before they walk out the door. I am very very happy with my decision with Wells Fargo and I would recommend other people do the same.

name: Roger
review: A few years ago, I was in need of a pretty standard secured credit card.  Wells Fargo happens to offer one of these and overall it was a great card that was fair, upfront, and easy to use.  I should preface this by saying that there is one large detractor to it, the fact that in order to apply, you need to be a customer of Wells Fargo.However, if you are a customer, you're pretty much set up to go.  You can apply online and have the security deposit debited directly from your Wells Fargo checking or savings account.  The interest rate is pretty low for a secured card, and the annual fee is also quite modest.  Your credit limit is equal to whatever you deposit into a collateral account, and they offer a full grace period.  I recommend checking it out if you are in need of a secured card.

name: Lorelli Eisenbrey
review: To sum it up Wells Fargo is a decent bank, but that's all, just decent. You can put your money in, get your money out, and they have a variety of different account options. Plus, it's a national chain so you can find one almost everywhere, which is very convenient. The application process is quick, and easy, and they are really good about actually depositing the sign up bonuses they advertise. When it comes to fee's they are not to clear in explaining them. Most of their accounts are free, if certain conditions are met. Accidentally miss one of the myriad of conditions and there's a $10 fee for you. If I could have a National bank with great customer service, I'd take it. Until then I'll settle for Wells Fargo, which as I said, is a decent bank.

name: Luigi
review: To say the least, I've never had a more pleasant experience with a company than I did with Wells Fargo (for context, I'm a college student). At the beginning of the school year, I was surprised to find that my checking account (consisting of roughly $1000) had been almost completely emptied without my doing. I immediately called Wells Fargo's customer support line to lock my account and file a claim. Their customer support was extremely kind and understanding when I explained my situation. They immediately closed my checking account and issued me a brand new debit card, free of charge. Within a week, I had that new debit card in my hands, along with a full reimbursement. They made an awful situation bearable, and thus had earned my loyalty as a customer. I highly recommend Wells Fargo for their customer support and general professionalism.

name: Michael Driscoll
review: I've been with Wells Fargo ever since they took over Wachovia and have overall been relatively pleased.  I recently studied abroad and they made it very easy to withdraw money from other countries and their overseas withdrawal was not bad at all. However, they are now about to start charging a fee each month to have a checking account which is utterly ridiculous.  As a student I want a checking account to have easy access to my money with a debit card. Overall I've been pleased with them, but after hearing that news I am going to be switching banks.  It is a decent bank but not if you want a checking account.

name: Randy Pachella
review: I have been with this bank since they took over all the Wachovia banks. I have been with them for 7 years and I never had any issues or anywhere near as many charges and fees as I have since they switched. Sad to say I'm leaving them now and switching to another bank. I've stayed with them as long as I could but I now feel like I'm losing more money with them than my savings account is making me. If I wrote this a year or so ago I would have given them a better review but their terrible service and unwillingness to resolve issues has pushed me away from their once great service.

name: Chelsey Frain
review: I have been with Wells Fargo since it was Wachovia. This bank is excellent, I have never had a problem with bank tellers, nor have I ever had problems with fraud or overdraft fees. I absolutely love this bank. Great savings program called way to save. Each time you make a purchase they will put an additional dollar into your savings account. Its a wonderful feature and quite handy. I love Wells Fargo! I have never been treated kinder than at Wells Fargo. Its truly a wonderful place to bank, very low fee's if any, they offer free check books for students. They also have a great first time credit card for students, interest on purchases made dining out are non existent. It is wonderful having a bank that actually cares about you and not just how much they can make off of you.

name: Sabrina Prentzler
review: First off, let me say that I am not the biggest Wells Fargo fan out there. I used them a few years ago, and was pretty disappointed in the whole system. It would take longer than expected for my deposits to show up, which caused me to overdraft a few times. Not only that, but they were uninterested in working with me on removing the charges, even though they had proof the deposits were sent to my account. In the end, I haven't been able to get a new bank account anywhere in the past 3 years because of almost $500 in overdraft fees that I have absolutely no intention of paying. The company is corrupt and frequently abuses their power, only interested in making money instead of being a good bank.

name: Connie
review: My local Wells Fargo used to be a Wachovia, and the transition couldn't have been smoother.  My husband's and my new checks and debit cards were all sent in a very timely fashion and there was no lag in services at all.  I've used my local Wells Fargo for everything from notary services to business startup to everyday checking and I've never had one problem with the staff or the service.  I love the ATM that allows me to deposit up until 8pm and still have access to my money the same day.  I wouldn't trade banks if you paid me.

name: B schultz
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for many years now. I have two mortgages with Wells Fargo.  I am completely satisfied with their customer service, rates, and their website. The website is easy to use and understand.  I am able to log in and apply extra money to my loan principle whenever I want. This makes it easy for me to log in and do my online banking and it saves me money and time. Over the life of the loan this should save me thousands of dollars. When I use the teller they are always helpful and professional. I will continue to use Wells Fargo for all my banking needs.

name: Elisabeth Hawkins
review: My husband and I have a Wells Fargo checking account and we love it.  Everyone that we have spoken to when we go into a Wells Fargo location is always nice to us and help us in any way that they can.  My husband and I recently ran into a problem where someone got a hold of my debit card number and was using it to make online purchases.  We had no idea that this was happening until a Wells Fargo representative called to notify me that this was happening.  Wells Fargo automatically blocked any further purchases made by that person or people and refunded us what they took.  The process of getting our money back did not take long at all and once again everyone from wells Fargo that was helping us with this situation were very friendly and understanding. Good job Wells Fargo !

name: Robert Craver
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo ever since I had my joint account with my parents when I turned sixteen. Even at such a young age Wells Fargo was easy to understand and always had close ATM locations. Since the days of my joint account I have separated paths from my parents financially by opening my own account. By making direct deposits straight from work keeping my money organized is an easy process. More recently I have started college and began taking out student loans through Wells Fargo. I know most of my friends and family didnât think this was a good choice but after talking to the professionals at Wells Fargo they made it an easy choice and I am still in school.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: So far my experience with Wells Fargo has been good.  Our mortgage was sold to Wells Fargo a few months ago.  Their bills are clear and contain important details of your loan.  I like that you can pay online or by mail.  The customer service people are pleasant and seem like they communicate within the company.  They have a lot of locations in our area and you can go their for answers to questions if you want to meet someone face to face.  I would recommend looking into a mortgage with Wells Fargo.  Our interaction with this bank has been positive thus far.

name: Jay Garza
review: I've been a Wells Fargo Customer for more than 8 years.  I love this bank.  They have great customer service, lots of branch locations, ATMs at every corner and lots of great account services.  I love the fact that I was able to customize my ATM with a picture of my son.  Every time I use my card, I get to see his face.  Also, a really neat feature is direct deposit advance where you are able to request a mini loan at times when you need money but don't have the funds available.  I believe itâs only a $1.50 for every $20 you borrow.  I can't tell you how many times this feature has saved my well-being!!!   Also, if you have a family member or friend with a Wells Fargo account, you can easily transfer money into their account or vice versa and have money transferred into your account and its usually available instantaneously and if not in 24 hrs.  Their website is great as is their app for the iPhone, I use it all the time to check my balances and to transfer money.

name: alex
review: Wells Fargo has been a great bank. I opened my first savings account with them a while back, and always felt very comfortable with their service. I never felt like I wasn't important, even though I relatively young at the time. I refrain from giving this bank a 5/5 mostly due to their rates as well as location relative to me, but I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone with easy access to one. Additionally, Wells Fargo had a number of useful resources aimed primarily at students about savings and investments, and truly appear to have the customers best interest at heart.

name: Aaron G.Pope
review: For years, I was very happy as a customer of Wachovia, so I had some anxiety when Wells Fargo bought out their operations. I can see now that I was worried over nothing. Since Wells Fargo took over my accounts, I have had no negative experiences. In fact, some of the services offered by Wells Fargo are improvements over what I had as a Wachovia customer. The online banking tools are excellent. The reports are easy to find and have a lot of information about how much money I have coming and going and where I am spending. Also, the ATM's that they have installed are a lot easier to use and offer a lot more convenience. I can deposit checks and cash a lot easier, and they can email me my receipt. This is the kind of functionality I need so I don't have to go in to the branch for anything.

name: Sean P
review: I've only been a member for a few years now, but my experiences have been largely positive. It was easy to sign up and the rep was friendly and helpful. The only complaint I have at this point is the turn around time on getting a new card. After losing mine, cancelling and requesting a new one it took nearly two weeks to receive the new card. It might be out of the ordinary, but it seemed like it took longer than necessary. In the future I would likely just sign up for a local credit union for ease of access. The local credit union is much closer than any of the Well's Fargo locations for me. My experiences are limited to just checking and savings, so I cannot comment on any of the mortgage or loan procedures.

name: Maya Thompson
review: After having a credit card (non-secured) with Wells Fargo for three years and very good credit, I was rejected from a car loan application with Wells Fargo.  This came as a shock to me, and I was told that I was not approved because I had not had any car or mortgage loans previously.  I then was offered an unsecured private loan which came at an interest of 11%.  I moved my loan application to a credit union which was happy to offer me a loan at 3.5%, after which I had the dealership match and lower it to 2.9%.  Even if you are a responsible person with great credit, even though they know you personally as a customer, these guys will still try and pull one on you.  Be aware.

name: Robin Evans
review: My overall experience with Wells Fargo so far has been mostly positive. When I have needed to speak with an account manager they have proved to be competent, professional, and able to handle my needs. The tellers are a different story though and have occasionally surprised me with their lack of knowledge and need for assistance in more complex transactions. One of the significant reasons I have stayed with this bank is the reasonable fees charged for insufficient funds. With the economy being what it is I have been struggling like everyone else and have found myself overdrawn on more than once in the past several years. The account managers are very understanding and helpful and have reversed more than one of my NSF fees to maintain our positive customer relationship. By far the most important reason I bank with Wells Fargo is each local branch ATM has a cash deposit feature. I am a self-employed person and often receive cash for my services and it is critical for me to be able to make quick deposits that do not take too much time out of my busy day. I am very pleased to be a Wells Fargo account holder.

name: Steve
review: I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for a long time now, close to 20 years, and have really enjoyed the services that they provide. My original account was started with them in California, and since then I have moved my account to Colorado. The transition was seamless. They have very friendly staff that work in the branches and have very accessible ATMs nationwide. One of the things that I really enjoy about banking with Wells Fargo is their online presence. They have great tools that allow you to access all of your accounts to check on history, including deposits and withdrawals. In addition, all the checks that you write are available for viewing as digital images directly from their site. This is extremely helpful when trying to remember what a particular check was written out for. Also, all the deposits that you make, can be viewed online as well so that you can see the checks that were deposited. I highly recommend Wells Fargo Bank and the services that they provide.

name: Kim
review: Four years ago my husband and I were in search of buying our first home.  Our first per-approval fell through and Wells came through for us and gave us the loan.  Since then we have had problems with Wells Fargo Home Mortgage to the point in which we almost lost our home.  We went through the home modification process and at the end they wanted the total amount of $2300 in a matter of three days.  We were denied three times for the modification, one denial was because we sent our payments during the probation period in early, another was denied because our debt monthly was too high, and third because we had $50 left over.  For a year we fought with Wells, filed bankruptcy and in the end dropped the bankruptcy, refinanced  with Wells and then I received a bill for $400 because of filing bankruptcy.  With the refinance we paid them $1400 to cover all fees.  When I question this additional $400 no one can tell me what it is for.  Now we missed a month's payment because of recent changes in our payrolls.  When I contacted Wells to make payment arrangements, they wanted $600 for three months.  I informed them that was not a good plan for us, we were told that is all they could do.  So now we are paying what we can all the while Wells Fargo is sending us letters stating the money is due in one day.  They do not seem to want to help us save our house or work with us in anyway.  If I could, I would get out of this loan with them, but because of all the issues with them, our credit is shot and we can't get a new loan right now.  The people I talk to are polite but of no help.  They have even sent over a person to take pictures of our home to verify we live there.  I have informed them several times and has been noted in my account that we are paying what we can, when we can on the past due amount that is only one month.  We also tried getting our due dates flipped around so that we can stop paying the late fee each month, but they were unwilling to that also.

name: Lisa Baer
review: Ever since Wachovia has switched over to Wells Fargo, I've noticed a steady decline with their policies. Their customer service is still great- people are always friendly and so polite...but Wells Fargo has started adding in little footnotes that add up to a lot of dollars out of my pocket. The most recent on has to do with my ATM card. If I use it outside of my branch, I get a 3.00 charge, per month! Not just a one time thing, but every month I'm dinged 3.00 out of my pocket. That doesn't seem like much, but then when you add it to the monthly balance I have to maintain or else I lose more money for not having enough money (wait, what?) then it starts to add up to a lot of money leaving my bank to go to a bank that is supposed to be there for me. I marked 5 stars on the application process (it's easy to get a checking account) but only a 2 star on the problem resolution, because I think they still have these policies in place. Oh, how I wish for the Wachovia days!

name: Ray
review: I opened a Wells Fargo checking account through my university around two years ago. The process was very simple and quick and I was able to start using my accounts almost immediately. Wells Fargo probably has the best ATM system of any bank that I've seen, which makes depositing or withdrawing extremely easy.All this makes Wells Fargo perfectly acceptable; however, what made them great for me was their customer service. My debit card information was stolen after an online purchase and around $200 of goods were purchased under my name. I called Wells Fargo as soon as I found out, or around a week after the purchases had been made. Customer service was courteous and helpful, and in no more than twenty minutes I was assured that payment would be stopped, my account wouldn't be charged, and I would be sent a new debit card. So, despite my somewhat late report, I ended up no worse off from the theft.In summation, my Wells Fargo was easy to set up, and Wells Fargo provided me with probably my best customer service interaction ever. Recommended

name: Leila Wall
