review: I started using Wells Fargo when they bought out Wachovia. I wasn't too worried about the transition, because I had never had any problems with the bank before. However, when my account switched, there were new fees that I wasn't informed about and weren't shown in my agreement. The terms of my account said that I would be charged if I exceeded a certain number of transfers each month, but even on months that I only used one transfer I would be charged for it. When I called to see why this happened, I was told that it was standard protocol and there was nothing they could do about it. Honestly, the only reason I keep this account open is for easy payment on my Wells Fargo credit card, which I have had no problems with.

name: Jon Macleod
review: I'm a new to Wells Fargo and the reason I switched to them is that they have ATMs all over the place! It's really nice to be able to not worry about being docked a few dollars because the ATM you were trying to use was the wrong "brand". The one thing that is bothering me is that on one of the statements I viewed online they said they need a minimum of 1500 dollars in the account or I'd be charged a small (something like 5 dollars) fee monthly! It's not a huge deal, but it is kind of weird to be charged for not having enough money. Other than that I love their paperless ATM receipts, and the customer service at my local branch has always been very courteous. It's also nice if you travel or go to college out of state because you'll be able to do your banking at home or at college and not worry about transfers taking a really long time! Setup was a breeze and I was done in under 30 minutes.

name: Paul
review: Before my bank was Wells Fargo it was Norwest, so my relationship with Wells Fargo goes all the way back to 1996.  Throughout all of these years I have not had a single complaint with Wells Fargo.  My accounts are always well serviced, and the one time I had a credit card fraud issue it was handled quickly and accurately with their customer support.  I have had checking accounts, savings accounts, mortgages, HELOCs, safe deposit boxes, and when they offered them I had my student loans with Wells Fargo as well.  All have been great experiences.  I only wish that they were able to continue being the holder of my student loan, as the new owner ACS leaves much to be desired.

name: David Weitzen
review: I have been banking with Wells Fargo for about 6 years now and the majority of my experiences have been great. The only time where I was treated unfairly was when I setup a college checking account. I was told I would not be charged for a monthly fee as I was being grandfathered in on their old rules, this was not the case and I was charged for a few months. Although that was a negative experience, on the plus side, customer service was great when dealing with this mishap and I was able to forgo paying any of the fees and everything was taken care of. Overall, I have never had a problem with Wells Fargo and I will continue to use them!

name: Samuel Stargel
review: First off, let me just say that I was originally a Wachovia member and decided to stay with Wells Fargo when they merged.  But, for the most part I have been very happy with Wells Fargo.Customer Service:Wells Fargo has very good customer service in my opinion.  Whenever I need to discuss something with my banker, he usually always finds time and can see me within 3 days.  On top of that if he can't see me, he always has someone who works at Wells Fargo that he can recommend.  They also have 24 hour phone support which I have used several times to dispute charges.Clear Disclosures:I really feel like that Wells Fargo did not let me know about everything I could be charged, and were incorrect on a few occasions.  They changed the minimum balances in my checking accounts with out telling me and then hit me with a 35 dollar fee.  On top of this, they hit me with an "Excessive Activity Fee" after a few online transfers, charging me a total of 45 dollars.  Again, they told me that I was allowed as many as I wanted.Applications Process:The process was very easy.  It was a while ago, so I'm not sure if there was a minimum balance, but it only took 15-30 minutes.Problem Resolution:This is where I feel they are the best bank.  Whenever I have a problem and I call their customer service, they always have a very easy solution for me.  Also, when I asked about the charges that I mention in my "Clear Disclosures" section, they immediately told why and then said they would reverse them for me.Over all 8/10; would bank again.

name: Chelsea Ray
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for a very long time, but only started using it for myself maybe five years ago. I'm very glad I did! What I really like about this bank is that they're nation-wide; for example, I'm based in Minnesota but lived in San Diego for a summer. They had them. They also had them in New York, where I visited and was able to deposit and take out money as I needed. Millions of people also have this bank, so I know I'm not alone. I like the thought of a national bank because I feel like I can trust it more. Also, their overdraft protection, bill-pay, and online services are phenomenal. They have an iPhone and Android app - I have used both, and they're simple and easy to use. Customer-service wise, I have never had any problems with them and they have always resolved my problems concisely. My credit card has been stolen twice - I guess I'm unlucky - but they took care of it quickly and nicely. The only problem I have with them is their recent switch to having fees. A small price to pay, in my opinion, for good services.

name: Lindsey
review: Wells Fargo is a good bank, especially for young individuals or college students.  They have several nice options for student checking and savings accounts.  Something I really appreciate about Wells Fargo is their online banking.  I usually don't like to "over complicate" the traditional, but I recently started online banking with them and it's so simple and easy to use!  They also offer an automatic bill pay service through which they will physically mail your money to your landlord, cable provider, etc. at the same time every month.  In the midst of other life chaos, it often slips my mind to pay bills so this service is extremely helpful.  It's a foolproof way to keep good credit!

name: Kraig Lasher
review: This card did the job for me.  It doesn't have all of the neat perks that other cards often have but it is very useful for what I need it for.  I had poor credit before I even got this card and this was my first card  (other debt was the cause of my poor credit).  I now have good credit and a lot of that is due to proper use of my Wells Fargo Secured Credit Card.  The annual fee is very low which is something I need as I am still climbing out of a financial hole and that is the only fee I have to worry about paying.  The interest rate when you buy something is high but it is to be expected when you get a card and have bad credit.   So I never bought anything major with the card but I made sure to pay the bill on time.  For these reasons I would recommend this card to anyone who has bad credit as long as they can use it properly and not put their self in a bigger hole.

name: Frank Avalos
review: My family and I use this card, as well as bank with Wells Fargo. The introductory rate of 0% was fantastic and exactly the sort of thing that most other card companies should offer. By in large, I have been extremely happy with my Wells Fargo Platinum credit card since receiving it over a year ago. One of the other major benefits was that their high credit line. Other than that, it is worth noting that the billing cycle is very good and a very gracious grace period of thirty days for amounts paid in full is also an added perk. All in all I have had nothing but positive experiences with this card.

name: Barb
review: I have to say I have been pleasantly surprised by the level of service I have received from Wells Fargo ever since they purchased our mortgage from a local lender. I knew it was wishful thinking that our little lender would keep the mortgage, but really dreaded seeing that we would then be dealing with Wells Fargo. I did not have previous experience with them, but knew Wells Fargo to be a huge institution and figured we would be hard-pressed to ever speak with a human being again. I couldn't have been more wrong. When I encountered issues setting up our account online, I called the technical support number and within five minutes had a friendly representative walk me through the process.  When our mortgage payment suddenly jumped up, I called to find out why. Being a new home owner, I appreciated the information readily available from Wells Fargo and that they never once treated me in anything but a respectful manner when I asked what I am sure were some very stupid questions. Wells Fargo makes paying our mortgage quick, easy and convenient and we've never been made to feel like just another account number to them.

name: Kristina Brooks
review: Wells Fargo Dealer Services purchased/acquired my car loan from WFS in the middle of my loan terms.  Although the terms of my loan remained the same, Wells Fargo was willing to work with me outside those terms when I went through my divorce and needed to lower my payment.  The customer service rep on the phone was able to get my loan extended to reduce my payments by approximately $50 per month!  She was able to instantly email me all forms/applications I needed to sign and return.  Knowing I may not have my own scanner, she gave me the option of mail, fax, and email to return them.  I have not had a single complaint with them.  They work with their customers during a time of need - and that speaks louder than words.

name: Jennifer Carlyle
review: My experience with Wells Fargo was not extremely great compared to other banks I have done business with. Although the checking account I had with them was okay and I had no issues with that, the process to apply for a mortgage was very frustrating. I had inquired about a mortgage, to prequalify. I was given several different phone numbers of people to contact in regards to prequalification. I tried calling each number at least four times, leaving messages and information on each call. I was never called back. This really does not make me want to do business with them any longer if they cannot even return a simple phone call, and this was with the three people I left messages for. Nobody called me back. I could probably recommend them for a simple checking account where you do not really have to deal with the people, but for something like a mortgage I would recommend going elsewhere.

name: Andrew Ventura
review: Wells Fargo has been a good bank to me. Their tellers are always courteous and helpful, and their bankers are very friendly. I once had several problems with my bank account (that arose from bad luck and accidents) and the employees of the bank worked very quickly to get the problems resolved. I was highly satisfied with what they provide for me as a customer. Going into the bank itself is very pleasant, and the rates for College Checking and Savings accounts are fantastic compared to other banks, and there are plenty of ATMs available in my area. Overall, Wells Fargo service has been fantastic and I recommend their bank to anyone in need of a solid checking account.

name: Bradley
review: Wells Fargo is a name that I've always heard people talk about for loans and banking. I never actually found myself being a part of their establishment until I found myself in need of a loan as well as a checking account. I signed up with Wells Fargo and it was the easiest thing in the world. The people who work there are so friendly and their banking system is so easy to use. I've had no problem since using their services. I could not recommend this bank more. Awesome customer service, easy application process and problem resolution. Awesome bank.

name: Kemal St.John
review: My experiences at Wells Fargo have been nothing but pleasant. One of the most memorable instances of their superb customer service was experienced during my time as a college student. There was fraudulent activity on my account and a large amount of my funds had been taken.  I was deeply in need of money to purchase necessary textbooks and student supplies to start my semester. Their standard policy in a case like this was to wait and give a provisional credit in a few days, but after explaining my dire need for immediate funds to one of the reps they made an exception and gave me an instant credit, allowing me to purchase my necessary goods for school the next day. Needless to say, this left a great customer service experience on my brain and I have been happy with them ever since.

name: Aubrey Jones
review: I signed up for Wells Fargo because a friend recommended it to me. My experiences with them have been less than stellar. Their application process is very easy; in fact they go to great lengths to help you through it and explain everything to you. Their Customer Service is not helpful because they it is hard to get in contact with a real person 85% of the time, but when it is they are very good. Overall, I would probably not recommend them to anyone who is just starting to bank, but if you are already very experienced with banking and need a new one, you would probably be fine going with Wells Fargo. There are definitely worse banks around, but there are better banks too, I would imagine.

name: Craig Billson
review: I've been with this bank for years now since I was 18 going through college and they've made the entire student loan process far less grueling than first expected. I've since finished college and have been able to pay off my student loans in their entirety thanks for Wells Fargo. Their interest rates are the best I've ever seen or experienced, allowing me to not be completely robbed off everything after adding the totals up. Besides being a great bank, and great at handling my claims, I also would like to take the moment to praise this company for having great customer service. They have some of the best bankers working the lines here in my city, and make you feel welcome each and every time. I've even managed to make friends with one of the tellers over the years they handled my loans.

name: George Koleszarik
review: The details are clear and understandable but heavy-handed. You can't turn off emails from them even though they are always about things I'm not interested in, and sorting them as spam would be a really bad idea because that could make you miss important information. Even logging into the account online is problematic because they constantly try to get you to sign up for different services like automatic bill pay. This causes an unwanted delay in getting to my information. Speaking of information, one of the emails you can't turn off is a monthly summary of account activity in PDF format, which is completely useless because it's actually easier to check account activity - whenever you want and not just once a month - by going to the website and logging in. But what gets me the most, after all that, is how right in the middle of my service, they went and stopped making the account free. No sir, now there's a $10 charge for holding the account, because there isn't enough money in it. (A classic, right? Pay us money if and only if you can't. If you can, we'll give you money instead.) Bank not recommended.

name: Rob
review: I had my car loan with this bank for an estimated 60 months.  I have had very few problems and would recommend them to anyone who is in need of financing a car.  My credit was good, but not great.  They were the only bank in my area who would assist me and they were great to work with.  I had a few questions from time to time and they were quick to respond both via e-mail and on the phone.  They allowed me to pay my loan off early, which I did.  I have no complaints!

name: Ashten Hamilton
review: I opened an account with Wells Fargo eight years ago. In this entire time I have had only one problem. About a year ago they disabled my checking account because it didn't contain a balance for a set amount of time. This required me to go into the bank and set up a new savings account which was very annoying. Otherwise they have been a good bank, with low fees, and good customer service. I have not had a problem with this bank since my last one. They send me my statement every month in the mail which is a nice addition. In the end I would recommend Wells Fargo to anyone looking for a bank.

name: Mandi
review: I switched over to Wells Fargo from Bank of America last year and I couldn't be happier with that decision.  Not long ago, my debit card was denied because, for some reason, a cash deposit didn't appear in my checking account right away & the staff was very courteous and quick to fix the problem.  Online banking is great with Wells Fargo and transferring funds from one account to another is quick and easy.  I do appreciate the free checking and would be very disappointed if they did enforce a monthly fee.   I like that they're open for most of the day on Saturdays.  Other banks are usually closed by noon.   I plan to stay with this bank for a long time.

name: Kirsten Donahue
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for about 3 years and haven't had any problems with them so far.  I love their customer service and the fact that there are so many locations.  No matter where I am, I can always find a Wells Fargo.  It makes it very easy and accessible to bank there.  They also have a great option if you have direct deposit through your work where if you need to, you can get a cash advance for a small percentage and then pay it back with your direct deposit.  It is so convenient and much cheaper than obtaining a payday loan or other loan when needed.  I have used it many times and am always so grateful that they offer this service when emergencies come up.  Their online banking is also great, and very easy to use.  I would definitely recommend Wells Fargo to anyone.

name: Katrina Erck
review: I used to avoid big banks, until my husband convinced me to open an account with Wells Fargo. His family has been doing business with them since 2001, and now I understand why. While their rates are not as high as they could be (but hey, what bank has decent rates these days), their customer service is the best I have seen. I can contact my personal banker with issues, and they are resolved within the hour. If she can't resolve them immediately, she gives me a clear idea of how long it will take.The most recent issue I had was when my husband and I went in to open a safety deposit box. Something in the system glitched, and his information ended up as my information (date of birth, social security number, everything). Unfortunately, this meant that I could not sign in to my accounts online, as Wells Fargo's online banking is driven by your social security number. I contacted my personal banker, and she told me that she would get it fixed ASAP and call me back within 24 hours. The next day, at EXACTLY 24 hours, she contact me, and the problem was fixed.I've had issues with other banks' online system that took days, even weeks to fix, and this issue made me promise to always stay with Wells Fargo. Their associates are attentive, caring, and always want to fix the problem ASAP.

name: Ryan Hannigan
review: We switched to Wells Fargo, because we like having a branch in the town we live.  For 2 years overall, we have had good service in store, but have had some occasions where we had to call in to get problems addressed, particularly when they recently switched requirements about free checking.  Calling in to get the clarification led to a lot of trying to get to a real person as we kept getting machine service.  As it was, we wound up having to go into the local branch anyways and talk to an account specialist.  It took 2 weeks to get the appointment, and once we got in we had no problems getting in and out and the guy helped us quickly and clearly.  Wells Fargo has had great in-branch service, while the automation leaves something to be desired, that is normal and to be expected.  If they switched to less automation, I would be far happier with the overall services they provide.

name: Sarah
review: Iâve been using Wells Fargo for about 3 years now.  I opened an account when I started college because my old bank doesnât have any branches in North Carolina.  Iâve had a pretty good experience with them so far.  The switch from Wachovia to Wells Fargo was very smooth, and I still use my Wachovia checks with no problems.  I had some trouble last summer with ATM fees when I was in Germany.  I was charged $5 per withdrawal from international ATMs AND an extra 3% fee on the money I withdrew.  I called to dispute it because I wasnât aware of the ATM fees, and they refunded half the money so it went down to the domestic non-Wells Fargo ATM withdrawal fees ($2.50 per withdrawal).  I also have their Way2Save account, which transfers $1 to a savings account every time I make a purchase with my debit card.  I like that because I donât have to think about it, it just does it automatically.  In August, they are starting to charge a $5 monthly service fee on checking accounts if you donât have a $1,500 daily balance or over $500 direct deposit each month.  Thatâs a little excessive for a college student, so Iâm considering switching to a credit union in the fall.

name: Heather Callahan
review: We've been banking at Wells Fargo for about a year now. We completely switched our checking account from BB&T after experiencing error after error and poor customer service. The people who greet us at the teller window are always friendly. They are prompt, always smiling, and eager to help us in any way possible. Any error we've ever encountered at Wells Fargo has quickly been corrected and they have a "the customer is always right" attitude.

name: William Smithers
review: I don't recall my reasoning when I took out my student loan that I would go with a bank other than the bank I usually do business with (Bank of America), but at the time it seemed like a good idea to get the loan through Wells Fargo.  I can't say I was disappointed with my choice as everything seemed to work out fine.I just recently finished paying off the loan and the process of closing things up couldn't have been easier.  The customer service people were helpful, even if the wait time was unreasonable when I called in to verify that everything was sorted--45 minutes on hold!!--but at least they spoke unaccented English.  For that I'm grateful.I never did figure out if I could get the monthly statments sent paperlessly, but I didn't really put that much effort into it.  What I did was set up an automatic payment at my usual bank to make the monthly payments so I wouldn't forget.  It worked out fine but I was worried the first time I didn't send in a check that something bad would happen, but it didn't and the customer service people at both banks were patient with my neurotic behavior when I called about the process the first time.

name: john saxman
review: I have had a savings account with Wells Fargo for many years. I was a member back when it was Wavchovia and overall I would say I am pretty satisfied. Despite the name change, I have not noticed a decrease in customer service and every time I visit a teller, they are very courteous and helpful. My only complaint would be the hours they are open, and the extremely low interest rates. I don't really expect a high interest rate so it isn't that big of an issue, and I plan on trying out their CD's in the future to see a larger return. The hours issue also is not a huge deal because the automated teller machine outside serves all my needs from withdrawals to deposits. Overall I am satisfied with Wells Fargo and do not see myself changing banks anytime soon.

name: Jackie
review: I have a secondary account with Wells Fargo. I enjoy banking here, but Wells Fargo does not have a branch close to where I work. I have a savings account with them. The savings account requires no minimum balance and has no monthly fees. I do not earn interest on the account. The account is very basic but they still treat me with respect when I do manage to go to one of their branches. The bank tellers and customer service representatives are always friendly and polite. I have never had any issues with this bank, and would gladly recommend it to anyone. If they had more locations nearby, I would do all of my banking with them.

name: Charles Johnson
review: Wells Fargo, one of the biggest banks in America. The home I currently live in is currently funded by one of their mortgages. Here is the problem. Despite that fact that the PMI was supposed to be off years ago we are still currently paying it. Every attempt at getting our mortgage re-modified or re-financed has been met with claims of lost forms or a strange case of amnesia. Then the insurance company that they had set us up with decided that we abandoned the property and dropped us from the policy; which ended up being a good thing.  The policy we had would have covered nothing had we had to use it. The new plan is cheaper and at least on paper will actually cover my home. The next time I build another house it will not be with Wells Fargo who has decided to overcharge the few people still paying their mortgages on time despite the economic crash America has faced.

name: Sujatha Swaminathan
review: I love this credit card.I enjoy using this credit card and as I have my savings and checking account also with WellsFargo, I was able to link with this credit card.The rewards program are the good features in this card.According to my opinion Wells fargo Platinum card is the good card to establish the credit history.They have relatively low annual fee compare to other secure cards. Their automated voice response is good.Overall I enjoy using this card.

name: Brodie Foster
review: the card this page & review about is not a "secured card" and its a business credit card.  if your going to write reviews it would be great if you wrote a review on the product the page is about.  SMH

name: Olivia Tams
review: After multiple Wells Fargo banking representatives mentioning that the card was being offered to me, I decided to give it a go. The application was approved, and I received the card in 5 business days. This card is linked to my checking account and serves as overdraft protection; I think is a wonderful feature, and it definitely helps to give me peace of mind. The first 6 months have a 0% APR, which was one of the items that drew me into applying for the card. I have yet to accrue enough reward points to redeem them, but it seems like a pretty straight forward program (1 point earned for each $1 charged to the card). I look forward to using the points and am excited about this incentive. I have banked with Wells Fargo for years and have always experienced knowledgeable, friendly employees and lots of nice features and perks.

name: Tia Bowden
review: I'm a college student and I don't always have cash or current money. Wells Fargo told me about this credit card and that all I needed to be approved was proof of college enrollment. They did all the work and approved everything. I also trust this credit card because it's from a bank, and not just any bank, my bank. This credit card has been a great way to pay for large purchases and build my credit at a time when I had none.  Since the provider of my credit card is also the provider of my checking and savings account, all my account information is linked together and easily tracked by my banker. It really helps keep things simple when I have a complicated life.

name: Crystal Berns
review: I became a Wells Fargo customer in 2000 when I bought my first home.  I got a great interest rate for what was being offered at the time and was very pleased with the service I received.  Then, about two years later, I decided to switch from my 30 year mortgage to a 15 year mortgage.  That was a very speedy, pleasant process as well.  My concern began when I was in need of assistance with my mortgage after being laid off and then changing occupations.  I would request the paperwork to be considered for assistance three times before receiving the information.  I then submitted my application, and was denied with the statement that the application was not complete, but nothing was noted as being wrong.  Even after speaking with a specialist I still did not have an answer.  I am currently going through the application process a second time.  This has been the only problem I have had with them yet, however, in 12 years.

name: Heather Ferguson
review: I have been using this credit card since I was a freshman in college. It's great - there are no annual fees, and the APR has stayed low. I bank with Wells Fargo so I can set up this card to prevent overdrafts from my checking account. I am disappointed that Wells Fargo is discontinuing the rewards program for this card - it was nice to know that while I was spending money, I was saving for a vacation. I like using the Online banking system to check my balance and transfer money from my checking account to the card. This has been helpful because the transfer is immediate - no more waiting for the money through a Bill Pay system. They just started a cool program where you can customize your card and put any picture you'd like to on the cover of the card. There are some requirements about size and dimensions that can make it difficult to find a picture that will work, but it's a fun feature.

name: Chelsea Ray
review: I really enjoy this credit card. It was my first one, and I like being able to have rewards and link to my Wells Fargo checking and savings account. Many friends of mine also have this card, and it's nice to be in the socially accepted "group." The rewards are very good, and the card has the Visa Pay Wave option which is a neat and fun way to do things. My credit card was stolen, and Wells Fargo was great at customer service and helped me without any questions asked. I also like the option to customize my card with different pictures and such - which I know a lot of credit cards have nowadays, but even without customizing the card, the horses and blue background make an aesthetically pleasing and classy card (of course, that's the most important part).

name: Elizabeth Mitchell
review: I’ve had a Wells Fargo credit card for a few years now. It’s the first credit card I got while in college, and I’ve kept it in the years since. The interest rates are reasonable, and the available balance has been more than I’ve ever needed. As far as I know it still has a rewards program; I have used it in the past to get gift cards for Amazon and other merchants. Like the Wells Fargo bank in general, the credit card customer service has usually responded quickly to emails and calls, even while I was living in Europe for awhile and still using this card for large purchases.

name: Mark Ornelas
review: I was very satisfied with the wells fargo secured credit card. For a very low annual fee I was able to take a significant step toward building my credit back up. It was easy to use and manage through my online account. I was also able to receive e-mail reminders when payments were near due. All that's required is a deposit of at least 300 (which is refunded after a period of time). I would definitely recommend this credit card for anyone looking to improve their credit or start building their credit or who want to better manage their finances without getting in more debt.

name: Eva Li
review: I've had my Wells Fargo Checking account and Savings account since I was 15 years old. I've been with Wells Fargo for 13 years now. I love the huge selection of available services and speedy service, but at some locations, the customer service reps often seem nosy. A normal service rep at any other bank would ask "how is your day?" or "did you have a good weekend?” etc. The few Oregon branches I visit, the staff asks endless questions, “Where do you work?” “What do you do for a living?” “Do you live with your parents?” These questions are borderline personal – I’m trying to make a transaction, not make a new friend. PLEASE do your job and let me get on with my day. I’m a loyal customer because of the services offered, but I avoid going into the branch unless don’t have a choice. I love online banking and using the ATM

name: Christopher Jarrett
review: Okay, so I started out with Bank of America and it was a okay bank really basic.  However, after I was a victim of identity theft, I was constantly receiving return check penalties in my checking account.  Countless times I notified Bank of America about this issue, and while they assured me my claim would be sent to the Fraud department, I heard nothing for months.  I continued to inquire on the status, the associates of the bank were really nonchalant about the situation and I was steadily accruing debt.  I finally decided to switch banks.  I signed up for Wells Fargo online banking, the process was really easy.  A few days later I received all the documents. I was ecstatic of how fast everything processed.  I made my initial deposit my at my home branch here in Los Angeles, CA.  The Associates greeted me. I've never had such a wonderful experience.  The tellers were very knowledgeable and friendly.  I enjoy going to the bank now, and I use to dread it.  Over all I would give Wells Fargo 5/5 stars.  After five months and a bunch of phone calls, Bank of America finally reconciled the issue.  But I am now a proud banker of Wells Fargo.

name: Sara Bokich
review: I have been a member of Wells Fargo since 1995 and have essentially enjoyed managing my funds with this bank. Recently. I opened a savings account in addition to my checking account. I would frequently do transfers from savings to checking when I needed to make purchases and pay bills, leaving the rest in savings for a rainy day. I noticed at the end of one month that over 10 fees of $2 had been assessed. I immediately contacted the bank, at which time they explained there is a limit on transfers and that I was therefore assessed a penalty for each transfer beyond the limit. As this was was not mentioned at the time I opened the account, Wells Fargo reversed the fees. I feel that this should have been explained prior to the incident; however, the friendly customer service representative took care of the issue quickly and without argument. Overall, I am happy with the bank, as long as there are not any other surprises! I feel that the availability of banking options is vast, and I am comfortable trusting Wells Fargo with my money.

name: Dani Mca
review: This is a great bank to be with! I have been with Wells Fargo for 3 years now and I have never had a problem big enough to make me want to go to another bank. I can deposit my checks through the ATM and they get cleared as fast as when I deposit them into the actual branch. Customer service is great and they are always able to answer my questions. I did have one problem, however. Someone hacked into my account and got me for $100. I was immediately sent a text that said my card number had been used in an unfamiliar place. I quickly called customer service to find out someone in Los Angeles, CA had used my card! (I live in Fresno, CA) After answering some questions and in a short amount of time my card was cancelled and a new one was ordered. The fraud department also put the $100 back into my account. I was offered a protective program but I figured getting a new card would be enough and it has! Plus I received my new card fairly fast. Overall this a great bank and I plan on being with them from here on.

name: Summer Johnson
review: I will never bank with Wells Fargo again. Their checking account fees are ridiculous and continue to rise. The tellers I encountered at every branch have been rude, inattentive and snobby. Whenever I had a problem, I could call five different people and get five different answers. I finally closed my account with them and went with a local bank - Wells Fargo wasn't worth the hassle.

name: tanya smith
review: I have been a Wells Fargo customer for 10 years. I have a mortgage through them as well as revolving credit. I have always had nothing but excellent customer service. We were pleasantly surprised when our mortgage loan went through much faster than expected. We were able to move into our home 15 days sooner than we thought we would. Everyone I have spoken with at this institution has been very friendly and more than willing to help. Phone calls to customer service are also very quick. I have never been placed on hold for a long period of time or transferred all over the place.

name: Mike de Water
review: I had a Wells Fargo checking account for a little while, and was pretty underwhelmed by their service. It wasn't often that I had a problem that needed to be resolved, but when I did it took an unacceptable amount of time and effort to finally get it resolved. Simple things like check deposits would take a long time to clear, and they would always try to get any type of fee or charge from me that they could. I canceled my account fairly quickly, and have never been upset with that decision. This was a couple years ago, so it's possible that they have changed their policies lately, but I would look long and hard at the fine print before trusting your money to Wells Fargo.

name: William
review: Wells Fargo has been a great banking experience for me for several years. I only have checking but the website is easy to understand and browse. Customer service is also very friendly. They make me feel very important at times and listen to my problems and do their best to solve them. They also have many locations which makes depositing money fairly easy. The only thing I dislike about them is the NSF charges. They do not tend to be lenient with these but most banks are not. Every time you talk to them though they are very friendly towards you, even when your account is negative or you are trying to get a charge taken off. I have never been ignored and this is the best banking experience I have ever had.

name: Latisha
review: Before I decided to open up an account with Wells Fargo I had looked around at numerous banks and none of them didnât add up to this bank. Wells Fargo had given me one of the best experiences any adult could and would want from any bank. Wells Fargo services are the best. Iâm always treated with nothing less than friendly, customer servce is always the great. Iâm so glad that my dad put me on to this bank. With them I feel so safe, security is a big deal for me and I can honestly tell you that I trust them totally.

name: Stephanie
review: We have been using Wells Fargo for about three years now. We love their online banking website and use it often. I know others have mentioned unexpected fees. We haven't had any of those; I don't know if it's because we haven't done anything to be charged fees, or not. In all I am satisfied with Wells Fargo. We plan to stick with them, if only because of the online banking, but if we started getting a bunch of fees charged to us for them to use our money every month ... that would be upsetting and would make me want to switch. But so far, so good.

name: Reese
review: Wells Fargo was my first and only bank. I opened my account when I was 17 years old, and I am now 24. When I first opened this account, I did not know anything about overdraft fees, so when I receive an overdraft fee I called them and they were able to reimburse the fee for my first time. Anytime I lose my card, they are always willing to help me. I do not plan on changing banks anytime soon, because I am very satisfied with the way that they handle business. I will recommend this bank to anyone who enjoys great customer service.

name: Nick
review: I used to be a Wells Fargo customer but decided to leave after I saw that the bank wasnât keeping up with technology.  I am very pro-technology and want my bank to be the same and adopt new technology as it comes.  I just felt like Wells Fargo was behind on the times when it came to their ATMs, online bill pay and account website, and their iPhone/iPad apps.  Wells Fargo is just about average to me and did OK, but I would rather bank with a company that is more technology savvy because thatâs more in tune with my lifestyle.

name: King Rome
review: My experience with Wells Fargo has been exceptional. Transactions have always gone through in a timely manner. As a matter of fact, when a deposit from my work is said to take 5-7 days to process, it actually takes only 2 at Wells Fargo. This makes it very convenient since I can get my money faster than average. Furthermore, being able to log in and check my funds at any time whether it be on my laptop or my smart phone is very convenient. Knowing you can just pull out your phone while being out and about and check your balance and transactions is simply awesome. In addition, they offer direct deposit advance options with fees that are lower than other places. It's great to know you have that option in case you need a short term loan. Overall, Wells Fargo receives 5 stars from me!

name: Kraig Lasher
review: I recently had an issue with my debit card/checking account that took several tries to fix.  I had not used my bank (Wells Fargo) since it was known as Wachovia so it had been a while.  I received a new debit card but had forgotten my pin # it had been so long.  I went in to make a new one and a few days later when I tried it it did not work.   I had taken a train to visit my friend and could not access my account because my new pin # was not working.  So, I was stuck with no money and had to borrow, which I hate to do.All this being said, it was a hassle, however I did get to a branch again and was able to change my pin # with a courteous associate who was more than willing to help.  I also asked about what I could do to waive checking fees and she set me up with a new type of checking account with a save as you go savings account which transfers a dollar from my checking to my savings account every time I use my debit card.  It is a good way to keep my finances in check.  Although I did have a technical issue it was resolved in a very professional manner and I was given extra help and all of that only took about ten minutes!

name: crystal
review: My experience with Wells Fargo have been a pleasant one. I enjoy the convenience of paying my bills online and having access to my funds 24 hours a day. Even-though I opted out for Bill Pay I do think its a great alternative for paying your bills. I choose to pay my bills over the phone, which I use my checking account for and never had a problem thus far. The Wells Fargo where I live have a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere, which goes with excellent customer service. One thing I which would change about Wells Fargo is the long lines at the locations available to me. I guess that proves that this is an exceptional bank, but I prefer to use online banking to avoid those long lines. One day this summer I plan to open a savings account to prepare for Christmas. I'm very glad I chose to bank with Wells Fargo.

name: Aquillia Alowonle
review: I really liked the car loan that I got from Wells Fargo. I went to the branch and I was able to talk to someone right away. The person was very helpful, and she was able to get me a great car loan with a low interest rate. I was trying to get my loan paid off early and I did some payments ahead of time, so that I would be able to shave off a few months, but they would not let me do that, and they took money out of my savings account without telling me, and I was very upset about that. Even though I did not think that was fair, I still got a good loan.

name: Justin Irwin
review: I've had a checking account with Wells Fargo for awhile, and overall I like how they are. From the moment I first went into the bank to set up a checking account I got a very friendly feeling. And since that day I've gone into the bank a lot and each time it's been a nice experience. The customer service over the phone is also very nice, and a pleasure to speak with; always assisting me in the best way possible. The reason I don't rate 5 stars is because of how the bank works with new applicants, being young there were a lot of issues I had when trying to get my account set up but now I am pleased overall with the bank. As with most banks the disclosures and terms are a bit daunting to look through but seems to be okay for the most part, nothing amazing to me.

name: Harleigh Brooks
review: This bank is horrible. I was a customer of Wachovia and was forced to switch over to Wells Fargo. Their online banking is ridiculous, some purchases don't show up for weeks later causing you to overdraw your bank account. When I have gone to the bank with this problem the employees talk to me like I am stupid. One employee is especially rude not sure what his name is. But even the bank manager treated me like I was dumb. At one point the employee went to speak with the bank manager and left me in the room without closing the door all the way. I could hear them in the other room talking about how Wachovia users expect everything to be the same as it was before and how they cannot let us get away with it. It really seems like they are trying to drive old Wachovia users away. I will never use this bank again and I will talk badly of them for as long as they are in existence.

name: christina gilkey
review: Wells Fargo is a wonderful bank! I have banked with them for over five years now, and I have never had a single problem with them whatsoever. Customer service is great, and everyone is so nice. I had a few mistakes and my account went negative, they were able to wipe out the fees that got charged to my account without any problem! I also have my student loan through Wells Fargo. I would have to say that Wells Fargo is the best bank to do any type of loan through. Their interest rates are good. I highly recommend Wells Fargo Bank for all financial purposes.

name: Shana Spencer
review: Wells Fargo has been my savings and investment bank since I lived out in California (some 15 years now). I've always trusted the advice my financial experts have given me and, in my case, listening to that advice has paid off. One of the best aspects of investing through Wells Fargo has been the customer service. I'm never left hanging when I want advice or just need to understand the sometimes complicated world of CD's and finance. I'd have given them 5 stars, but the disclosures are just too difficult to understand. All in all, I'd recommend Wells Fargo for savings and CD investments. They're a great firm that really does take the time to help customers with whatever problems or questions they may have.

name: Kristi Anglen
review: I decided to open a checking account at Wells Fargo Bank when we decided to buy a house in Florida and move south. Wells Fargo has many bank branches in the Daytona Beach area making it an excellent and convenient choice. The application process was quick and done online. On top of that the products and services they offer are second to none and fit what we were looking for perfectly. The customer service has been outstanding including disclosures having to do with our account and when I've been into the bank as well. I have been very happy and satisfied with the customer service and overall responsiveness of Wells Fargo Bank and I intend to be a customer for a long time.

name: Derek Timm
review: I am very pleased with having become a member of Wells Fargo Bank. I am glad I went through them for my student loan. It was easy and quick to apply for my student loan. One of the best parts I thought was that I did not have to make any payments while I was in school! The interest rate on my student loan was also quite impressive. Wells Fargo made it easy to go through them and not a headache like most banks. I now use them for all my banking needs.

name: Kraig
review: Recently, my mortgage was sold to Wells Fargo Mortgage division. Now I dislike when banks sell mortgages but I didn't have much of a choice. Wells Fargo had new payment coupons out to me within two weeks. When my payment arrived a few days after the 1st due to a paycheck snafu I was having, they totally understood and didn't even charge me a late fee or anything. Plus the people on the phone were outstanding and didn't dump me into a holding pattern for 3 days. They were quick to access my account info and note on my account that my payment was on it's way. The employees understood and were very professional and never made me feel stupid. If you have a choice in your next mortgage loan, I would definitely look into Wells Fargo as a great option. They also post the newest interest rates throughout the day.

name: Pedro
review: Wells Fargo bought the small bank I was using about a year ago, and at first I was unsure whether I was pleased or not with the change. After a year now I can say without reservation that this is a fine bank to work with offering outstanding customer service at all three branches I frequent.

name: Mark Ornelas
review: I have heard negative comments about Wells Fargo but, personally, they have done a great job. A couple times someone had stolen my debit card and made unauthorized purchases. They reimbursed all money with no questions asked. I have been banking with Wells since I was a child. They have always been kind and courteous with me. That is why they have my loyalty. My experience has always been great. They have also done well with overdraft fees. They were willing to reimburse me for some overdraft fees as a courtesy. I'm now more careful to make sure I know how much money is in my account. But they were very kind to refund some or even all the money from overdrafts!

name: Sarah
review: My biggest problem with Wells Fargo was the surcharge for having checking and savings accounts. As a college student, I don't have much extra money to allow the bank to constantly take money from my account like that. There have been a few times where I've accidentally over drafted because I am charged the monthly fee after I make necessary purchases for the month. I plan to switch to a bank with free checking here soon.On the upside, I have always received wonderful service from the people there. They seem very friendly and eager to help. Sometimes it is difficult to come to a solution, or else it takes a long time to resolve problems, which can be frustrating. But such is the business sometimes. I also really like their envelope free deposits at ATMs. It makes life so much easier!

name: Von Warner
review: I started a checking account with Wells Fargo because I have several friends/family who absolutely swear by them.  This review isn't meant to discourage anyone from using this bank; rather, it's to stress that you read all provided documentation completely and thoroughly.  I signed up for a checking account with the promise that the only fee I'd incur would be the initial starting fee.  Maintaining the account would be of no extra charge.  I asked if this could change in the future, and the gentlemen who was servicing me insisted it wouldn't.  Figuring his answer was good enough, I admittedly neglected to go over every detail of the fine print that was handed to me.  Several months later, I was surprised to receive a charge for merely having an account with the bank.  The charge wasn't astronomical, but I was annoyed considering the information I was given.  I returned to the bank to question the charge, and was told that the paperwork I was given stated that charges could basically be assigned at random.  This turned out to be true, but it didn't erase the fact that I was told by a representative of theirs that this wouldn't be the case.  Ultimately, it's my fault for not looking at the writing more closely, and getting the reps words in writing.  Even so, the bank could have more clear and forward with me regarding policy.

name: Skylar
review: I really enjoy banking with Wells Fargo! My boyfriend and I both bank there and have had very positive results. The local branch here I primarily use in my hometown is awesome-- the tellers are friendly and very efficient. The only problem I have ever really had is with using my debit card in many different places, they tend to freeze your account for security reasons. I was a competitive debater in college, and traveled a lot throughout the country, and sometimes I would get my debit card shut off because there was spending "outside of my region" and I would have to call into customer service to get everything worked out. Otherwise, I highly enjoy banking through Wells Fargo.

name: Kim
review: I've had a Wells Fargo checking account for the last 7 years, and it's been just fine! For everyday use including depositing checks, direct deposits, using my debit card, withdrawing cash, and paying the bills, it's been perfect. As long as you only use it for the basic needs of a checking account, it can be pretty much totally free, which is a huge perk. Customer service in all of the locations I've been to has always been great and fairly quick. One of my complaints would be that if you DO need any other services (cashier's check, money wire transfer, using your card or withdrawing money in a foreign country, etc.) the fees associated with them are often extremely high in comparison with some other banks I've had experience with in the past. That being said, I use these services so rarely and because Wells Fargo locations are so plentiful and convenient, I continue to use them. On the plus side, we've received phone warnings of fishy transactions using our account, they've never lost or messed up a deposit (which has happened to me with other banks and was a nightmare!), and the new ATM's make deposits totally a breeze (they just scan your check or cash in and print off a picture even on your receipt).

name: Leah Smith
review: My husband and I have been with Wells Fargo now for just over 2 years. We have two separate checking accounts as well as two savings accounts. That is a big plus for us because it allows us to have different accounts used for bills then "play" money and other things. We have been overall satisfied with Well Fargo bank. Our only real complaint is the fact that you cannot transfer or withdraw money more than 6 times in a cycle date period from the savings accounts. That makes it a little difficult seeing as we designate one of those accounts for all gas money, then as we need it we transfer it into the checking account to spend at the gas pump. So we do wish there was no limit on how many times we could transfer or withdraw money each month. We were charged ten dollars against both accounts for going over the limit, I think a courtesy call since it was the first time that happened would have been more appropriate than charging us twenty dollars.

name: Michelle Marpole
review: I have to say, I was a little worried when Wells Fargo bought out Wachovia since I had banked with them for awhile. I was pleasantly surprised at how great of a bank Wells Fargo is though. I have never had any problems, and the customer service is always great! I definitely always recommend them to my friends and family. They have such great programs like the check card rewards (though that is about to end) and Way2Save program, which takes a dollar out of your account and puts it into a savings account with interest every time you swipe your debit card. It's a great way to see your savings add up fast! I have honestly never had a problem with any employees, and they are always so helpful and polite.

name: Mary Emory
review: I was at first sort of thrilled when my bank, Wachovia, was bought out by Wells Fargo. I thought this would help me to invest my money more efficiently, and I would have access to different kinds of checking and savings accounts for my children. Unfortunately, this has not been the case at all. I was recently notified that my previously free checking, is now going to be charged a minimum of $12.00 per month. Not a great deal in the overall budget, but this was a free checking account I signed up for, and now they are "changing the rules" midstream, so-to-speak. When I recently had a few questions regarding a large deposit I made to a High Value Money Market Account, I called the branch I normally go to in Rocky Mount, NC. The phone rang for at LEAST 10 minutes, without any answer or voicemail. I called back several times, and still received no answer AT ALL. They call this good service?? I cannot believe that a company, in the customer service industry, would not answer their phones. I even called the other branch in Rocky Mount, with the same results. In my honest opinion, it is deplorable that a company would act this way. I had to actually take a 1/2 day out of my time to go into the branch, then wait for over 2 hours, while they only had one person in customer service.I really look forward to changing my accounts, and telling them why I am doing so.

name: Kelley Alowonle
review: I have always had good experiences with this bank. Every time I have had a question or concern I have always had good customer service. I also appreciate that I can get in touch with them whenever I need to with any question or concern about my bank account, interest rates, fees, etc.A while ago I was traveling internationally and had my card information stolen. My bank account was completely wiped out. As soon as I realized what happened I called Wellsfargo and they were very helpful with this situation. Within just a couple of hours I had all of my money returned to me and the fees that were charged to the account were also taken away. I was very happy with the way this situation was handled and I was happy to get my money back. They were very friendly and helpful when this happened and have been any other time I have contacted them.

name: beth cantrell
review: We have had our home mortgage with Wells Fargo now for 6.5 years and have had no problems whatsoever with them. They have always been extremely professional, prompt with customer service calls and happily answered any and all questions we've ever had. They have very competitive mortgage rates and we know this because ours is extremely low and very competitive. They offer automatic payment which is another complete bonus because now we do not have to waste a stamp every month as our payment is deducted automatically. In a day and age where many people do not even trust their banks to keep their best interest in mind, we not only trust Wells Fargo, but we are extremely satisfied with them.

name: Chris
review: I've banked with Wells Fargo for a few months now and the two things that has always aggravated me is the constant doublespeak and the employees being too pushy with their products. Before I banked with them I just wanted to deposit a check, but they always tried to talk me into setting up a checking account. Even after adamantly refusing they would still hound me. But after I did finally set up an account, I noticed that they were a decent bank. I can call their hotline and have almost any dispute resolved, they really do care about you once you've become a member.

name: Traci
review: I have been banking at Wells Fargo for 2 years and use them for my personal checking account. The main reason why I love this bank, especially my branch in Huntsville, AL is because they make everything simple and easy to understand. Plus, my branch isn't a huge building wise as other competing banks are. It's small with fewer employees which in my opinion makes for the best customer service. The tellers know you by name at a small location and ask about the family. I have business account with another bank and though I like the other bank, I'm tied between it and Wells Fargo. I love the simplicity that the employees bring to the atmosphere of a small branch like mine. The customer service over the phone is wonderful as well with representatives that are superb in doing their job efficiently and effectively. I would recommend this bank to anyone wanting a smaller, more well known business that can still be trusted by many with their financial problems. I have yet to find anything that I have been majorly disappointed with and I hope that stays the same!

name: Peter Smith
review: My banking with Wells Fargo over the last 8 years has been fantastic! Online transfers, ACH payments, and other payments go through in a day or two at the most compared to a lot of banks where its 5-7 business days. They have decent interest rates and their fees are reasonable compared to other banks. Another thing I like about Wells Fargo is they have good, long hours so you can stop in mostly any time. The number one thing what I think separates Wells Fargo from other banks is the knowledgeable, friendly staff that is always willing to help you! I have never had a bad experience with Wells Fargo as long as I've been with them!

name: Julia Samz
review: Wells Fargo has a great credit card that they offer.  This credit card is a Visa card that can be used anywhere for anything.  It is great for emergencies or for every day purchases.  You are able to earn reward points using this card.  I have been able to cash in my reward points for gift cards to where I want to shop.  They have many different options.  The APR is good and the fees are low.  Their customer service is good and is opened twenty-four hours a day, including holidays.  Wells Fargo allows automatic payment from your Wells Fargo account for the minimum amount or you can schedule a payment for however much you want to pay.  Overall, it is a great card to have in your wallet.

name: Julia Samz
review: This is the one.  I just double checked. We have had it for three years.

name: Marc Wood
review: Just recently I received a claim check as compensation for being in a wreck. I could have deposited the check at my bank, but they would have held the funds for several days until the check cleared. So I took the check to the bank that issued it, Wells Fargo. The few minute experience I had with Wells Fargo was great. The customer care representatives were nice and helpful. The teller processed my check quickly with no questions asked. Best of all, I received an envelope full of cash I could take to my bank and deposit effortlessly. If I ever need a new bank then I will probably send my business to Wells Fargo.

name: Shannon Cutts
review: I have been with Wells Fargo since I graduated from college in 1994 - back when it was First Interstate Bancorp. At first, the transition was rocky, and over the years I have had ups and downs in my relationship with my bank. But today those bumps seem to have smoothed out and I am happy that I am with Wells Fargo, a company which consistently makes the "best of" list in the financial services industry and is growing and expanding the number of its branches at a record rate. I do both my personal and business banking with Wells Fargo and they have been quick to spot fraud the few times my account number has been used inappropriately, and equally quick to warn me and credit me back the money. They were very helpful in getting my non-profit checking and savings business accounts set up, and no matter which branch I go to (and there are branches everywhere in Houston so I am always in luck when I need to bank!) they are super friendly and nice. Overall I am a satisfied customer and plan to stay with Wells Fargo for the foreseeable future.

name: Andrew
review: I have had an account with Wells Fargo ever since I was a young teenager. They have always provided quick, convenient and friendly service. They have been great at adapting to my needs as I moved from high school into college and needed to start using the money that I had saved up. They were always ready to help if I had any questions or needed something explained to me. There are also many convenient branches so I feel like I am never far away from my bank when I need it. I will definitely be continuing to give Wells Fargo my business as I continue on to the next stages of my life.

name: Nicholas
review: Wells Fargo is a bank with bad lending practices. Unfortunately, when I signed up with them some of my money got tied into some strange market account which I was not informed of. I have a joint account with my wife and many times I have had problems withdrawing cash even though we are both equal account holders.  The one thing that I must say is that even if I didn't agree with what they were doing, they have always been nice to me. Wells Fargo facilities are always accommodating with nice furniture. The most trouble that I have had with them is that they were not up front about certain fees, and even signed me up for a type of savings account that I didn't want! Overall, I would not recommend this bank.

name: DAV
review: I bank with Wells Fargo Bank. This is a national bank that I have been with for the better of 5 years. The bank has an expanding customer base in my local area, as attested to by the number of locations they have opened up in the last few years, making banking in this area more convenient. As to the service, the tellers are very amiable, and the loan officers are very informative and supportive. The rates are comparable to most other financial institutions in this area, and the fees are reasonable to nonexistent. I would recommend this bank to any of my friends and family.

name: Roger Brooks
review: My Bank was formally Wachovia until Wells Fargo acquired it.   I had free checking with no strings attached with Wachovia and when  Well Fargo became my bank they continued with the free checking.   I recently got a notice that my free checking will only continue if I maintain a minimum balance.   I don’t have much experience with customer service at Wells Fargo since I mainly use their ATM's.  I like the envelope-free deposit option on their ATM's.  I mostly do my banking online and get my monthly statements delivered online.  I am considering dropping Wells Fargo as my bank since they are going to start charging a fee to use their checking account.

name: Matthew Steen
review: My experience with Wells Fargo personal banking has been decidedly average.  I’m a student, and they require me to open a savings account in addition to a checking account to ensure it stays free, and this requires a minimum deposit every month which I deposit back into checking (kind of roundabout), but it’s a minor inconvenience for free banking.  Their overdraft policy was just re-worked to eliminate some of the more confusing fees should that be an issue, though it does seem like the odd fee pops up from time to time.  Also, a five dollar fee every time I withdraw from a non-Wells Fargo ATM is quite annoying.  However, customer service, both in-branch and on the phone, has always been top notch.  As I said, a very average banking experience.

name: Chris Jackson
review: Overall, I would have to say that I am very pleased with my Wells Fargo account. They have great customer service that not only is friendly but they are also great at solving problems. Any time I have ever had the slightest problem with my account, no matter how small, they are always more than willing to help. The only thing that is not very satisfying with wells fargo is the interest rates. I currently have a checking and saving account with them, and the checking account accrues no interest while the savings only .25% APY. Even though I am pleased with them overall, I have also been notified that they are about to start charging for having a debit card through them, which I don't think is a very good idea or deal, since many other banks offer that service completely free of charge. But, overall, a very good, warm and friendly bank.

name: ryan muir
review: This is the best experience I have ever had with a bank. I've had quite a few banks in my life and none of them compare. They were very easy and quick to sign up with to open my checking account. The customer service has been superb the rare times I've had to use it. I recently had an accidental overdraft fee charged to my account. I emailed my branch and within a half hour I got a response. They apologized for the inconvinence and promptly solved the situation. I was recredited with the fee and assured it would not happen again. This is honestly the only small problem I have had with this bank. I have reccomended to several of my friends, that they should consider changing their banks to be with Wells Fargo. I don't see myself changing banks anytime soon.

name: Naomi Kovar
review: Wells Fargo has provided me with the best customer service I've experiencedwith any bank. I have a checking acount and a savings account with them. I usea debit card linked to my checking account. They are very reliable as faras reporting all transactions accurately. When my wallet got stolen and I hadto cancel my debit card and order a new one, there was no hassle. I just called their 800 number reported it, and I got a new one in the mail within fivebusiness days. I would recommend Wells Fargo for anyone who just wants to use basic checking and savings services.

name: Paul Prince
review: I have been a loyal member of Wells Fargo for almost a decade now, and I have absolutely nothing bad to say about them.  I have always been approved for every loan I applied for, and given very competitive interest rates.  I am also a big fan of their Checking Account.  You get free checks, ATM rebates every month, and you get paid a day early if you have direct deposit!  I can't see myself leaving this bank anytime in the future, and I highly recommend it to everyone!  They have branches in very convenient locations, and I can always find one in a time of need!

name: Yurel Cooke
review: I was a Wells Fargo during my college years when I lived in California. I'm very fortunate that I am no longer a customer. Wells Fargo is one of the most difficult banks to do business with. It was always a major hassle to get my parents in New York to deposit money into my account because of the lack of branches in the tri-state area. I became so irritated every month when I would receive my statement and see all of the charges that were both hidden and unexplained. The customer service is very kind but the representatives suffer from lack of knowledge and answers. Wells Fargo is second to none when it comes to mortgages but that was not the reason I became a customer.

name: Melissa Chiafoo
review: I have been with Wells Fargo for over a year and so far it has been a great experience. The customer service is superb. They are well trained professionals and quite helpful. I take advantage of their direct deposit in order not to pay a monthly fee. They give meaningful advice on how to avoid overdraft fees. I like the fact that if you don't have enough money in the bank to make a payment on a bill, with the bank's discretion they could do an overdraft for you and charge you an overdraft fee. That somehow saves you embarrassment just in case one forgets to put enough money in the bank. The application process was simple. I would recommend anyone to Wells Fargo it's a great bank.

name: Sderet Seasr
review: I have been with Wells Fargo (WF) for over 10 years now. Although their checking and savings account fees can be a little on the high side, I still find them very reasonable. The most important service WF provides is excellent customer service. No matter what town I'm in (and I have visited WF branches in several different states, and most of California), the staff is always so helpful and friendly. In an effort to be prepared when I get to the teller window, I usually head over to the supply counter first so I can fill out my own slips. However, the staff never lets me get too far before calling me over and offering to fill everything out for me. So refreshing! And almost every employee (even if they have a customer sitting in front of them) will look up whenever a customer walks into the branch, smile, and say "hi". I have had many pleasant dealings with the telephone bankers as well. I have had several issues where I was charged a fee on an account that I was not expecting. They always reverse it without question, and make sure I am well informed as to how to avoid further fees. They also do not charge an annual fee for IRA's (which most banks do). I have tried out several other banks and always end up closing my account and bringing the business back to WF. All in all, I am very satisfied.

name: lucas davenport
review: When we moved to North Carolina in '07 we chose Wachovia because it had the most locations and ATMs in the area. We were never all that satisfied with the service there and their "free" checking ended up having a number of hidden costs. When they were bought up by Wells Fargo I was a little nervous about another Big Bank taking over and trying to take advantage of us. I am happy to say that the service we have received since the takeover has been outstanding! We are very happy with Wells Fargo and particularly pleased with the level of personal and friendly service we are receiving at the two or three branches we most frequently use.

name: Jameson
review: I really enjoy Wells Fargo for their simplicity.  Everything I need is available online which makes really easy for me.  If I do need to go to a branch location, the staff really cares about my account and well being in general.  I highly recommend Wells Fargo.

name: Steve
review: I have had Wells Fargo as my mortgage company since I purchased my house back in 1997. I have refinanced twice, and in both cases I found the process to be very simple, fast and easy to complete. We didn't even have to go into an office to close on the new loan - the first time they sent a person to the house while we signed the documents, and the second time we received everything via courier, signed it and returned it the same way. We made a few mistakes in the signing but they were super-fast to help us resolve them at no cost or delay. We were able to get a very competitive rate, and by using the bi-weekly payment plan are watching our principal go down rather quickly. I would recommend their mortgage services to anyone.

name: Brooke Bjerke
review: I opened a checking account with Wells Fargo about 2 years ago. When I was first signing up for my account, they tricked me into signing up for their rewards program, which they claimed would "pay itself off" after using my check card for purchases regularly. Of course, that was untrue, which they should have known because I was a student with barely enough to get by. To pay itself off, I would need to spend thousands of dollars on my check card each year. Other than this deception, which I'm guessing is something they try to sell to everyone, the customer service has always been good at Wells Fargo. I have never had any problems with my account, and the bank has always been more than willing to answer my doubts and questions. As I have never banked with anyone else, I can't accurately say where they stand in comparison with others. Overall, they have been a good, stable bank for me and my family, supporting all our banking needs with good service and quick replies. They have also been pretty flexible for our individual needs. For instance, they let my parents cash checks that were written out to me when I didn't have an account.

name: Dennis Brenes
review: As a college student, I use this card a lot, especially to take advantage of the money back benefits. It's cool knowing that your bank preapproves you for this credit card as long as you provide verification of enrollment in a college. It's awesome that now I feel more respected in the Wells Fargo branch I visit, because now I have a credit card and monthly payments to make. The APR is a non-negotiable 23%, however. If you fall behind in payments, expect Wells Fargo to call you many times a day, and don't expect to be sent to collections easily - ultimately Wells Fargo would like to keep your business.

name: natalie
review: My first checking account was with Wells Fargo. The associate who helped me in person was very nice and informative. I had no complaints until fraudulent charges started appearing on my acccount. I called customer service and explained the situation. They told me it would be resolved and my money would be back in my account shortly. Several days later the charges were still there and my money had not been given back. This turned into a week long fiasco. Wells Fargo seems to bee very hit and miss.

name: Becky Dillman
review: I have been a long time customer of Wells Fargo, since 1995, and have always been able to correct what I thought was wrong with my account. Recently I had to switch accounts to avoid the fees associated with my checking account. The banker I worked with over the phone was very help and informative as to which service would suit my needs. The process was fast and was updated on my account immediately. She also fixed it so the fees were reversed on my account.

name: Trisha
review: I opened an account with Wells Fargo just over a year ago because I moved from my small town to the suburbs when I bought a house.  I was reluctant to exchange my nice small town bank for a branch of a very large national bank, but I thought I'd give it a shot.  So far I don't have any complaints with the personnel.  They have always been professional and friendly and I have always gotten good customer service.  What I do not like is the obvious influnce of a large national corporation and their policies.  Just a couple weeks ago I went and asked to speak with a representative because I wanted to avoid some fees that would be applied to my account because of some changes that were obviously directed by somebody far above.  And while the person was friendly enough and did a very good job at helping me with what I needed, she also tried to sell me a bunch of stuff.  While good products are good products, it did feel very much like she was trying to sell me stuff just to sell me stuff, rather than because it was in my best interest.  The certificates of achievement issued by some higher ups in the company for her selling accomplishments backed up these suspicions.  So overall, the employees are great, but I don't appreciate the giant corporation policies and rules that are in the best interest of some big wig somewhere, but tend to hurt the customer.

name: Juan Fredmania
review: I was ushered over to Wells Fargo at the time that Wachovia was bought out.  At first, I was displeased with the bank, but for superficial reasons such as the horse and buggy on the sign.  More recently, I discovered that Wells Fargo is quite a good bank.  Transactions occur quickly - sometimes in as quick as 12 to 24 hours during the week (from PayPal and other services).  They are also kind and even sometimes forgiving if you overdraft your account.  They make bill pay and automatic withdrawals very very simple.  Their customer service is mostly solid, but at my particular branch, the people are often overly helpful and it can become annoying.  Overall, my experiences with this bank have been solid, and I hope that they continue to be excellent for my finances and in terms of convenience.  Overall, it's a solid bank that I would rate 4 stars or a B+.
